<div class="pages">
<div id="page-1061993">
<h3><a name="page-1061993">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 001)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>1</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Commonwealth of Massachusetts'>Commonwealth of Massachusetts</span></p>
<p>In the year of our Lord, One thousand eight hundred and thirty-five</p>
<p>An Act to incorporate the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn.</p>
<p><b>Section 1<sup>st</sup>.</b> Be it enacted by the <a href='/pages/subjects/53209' title='Massachusetts Senate'>Senate</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/56337' title='Massachusetts House of Representitives'>House of Representatives</a><span class='line-break'> </span>in General Court assembled and by the authority of the same, That<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/56332' title='Davis, John'>John Davis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>George Bond</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P Curtis</a>, together with such other persons as are Proprietors of<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots in the Cemetery at Mount Auburn in the towns of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a> and <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a> in the County of Middlesex, and who shall in writing signify<span class='line-break'> </span>their assent to this Act, their successors and assigns be, and they hereby<span class='line-break'> </span>are created a Corporation by the name of the Proprietors of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn, and they shall have all the powers and privileges con<span class='line-break'></span>tained in the Statute of the year One thousand eight hundred and<span class='line-break'> </span>thirty three. Chapter Eighty three.</p>
<p><b>Section 2<sup>nd</sup>.</b>  Be it further enacted, That the said Corporation may<span class='line-break'> </span>take and hold in fee simple the Garden and Cemetery at Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn, now held by the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Massachusetts Horticultural Society</a>, and<span class='line-break'> </span>any other lands adjacent thereto, not exceeding fifty acres in addition to said<span class='line-break'> </span>Garden and Cemetery upon the same trusts and for the same purposes<span class='line-break'> </span>and with the same powers and privileges as the said <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Massachusetts<span class='line-break'> </span>Horticultural Society</a> now hold the same by virtue of the Statute of the<span class='line-break'> </span>year One thousand eight hundred and thirty one, Chapter Sixty nine;<span class='line-break'> </span>and may also take and hold any personal estate not exceeding in value,<span class='line-break'> </span>Fifty thousand Dollars to be applied to purposes connected with and<span class='line-break'> </span>appropriate to the objects of said establishment.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1061994">
<h3><a name="page-1061994">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 002)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>2</p>
<p><b>Section 3<sup>rd</sup>.</b> Be it further enacted, That all persons who shall hereafter<span class='line-break'> </span>become Proprietors of Lots in said Cemetery of a size not less, each, than<span class='line-break'> </span>three hundred square feet, shall thereby become members of the said<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation.</p>
<p><b>Section 4<sup>th</sup>.</b> Be it further enacted, That the Officers of the said<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation shall consist of not less than seven nor more than<span class='line-break'> </span>Twelve Trustees, a Treasurer, Secretary, and such other Officers as<span class='line-break'> </span>they may direct. The Trustees shall be elected annually at the annual<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting, and shall hold their offices until others are chosen, And<span class='line-break'> </span>they shall choose one of their number to be President, who shall be<span class='line-break'> </span>also President of the Corporation, and they shall also choose the<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary and Treasurer either from their own body or at large.<span class='line-break'> </span>And the said Trustees shall have the general management, sup<span class='line-break'></span>erintendence and care of the property, expenditures, business and<span class='line-break'> </span>prudential concerns of the Corporation, and of the sales of lots in the<span class='line-break'> </span>said Cemetery, and they shall make a report of their doings to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation at their annual meeting. The Treasurer shall give bonds<span class='line-break'> </span>for the faithful discharge of the duties of his office, and shall have the<span class='line-break'> </span>superintendence, and management of the fiscal concerns of the Corpo<span class='line-break'></span>ration, subject to the revision and control of the Trustees, to whom he<span class='line-break'> </span>shall make an Annual Report, which shall be laid before the Corpo<span class='line-break'></span>ration at their annual meeting, And the Secretary shall be under<span class='line-break'> </span>oath for the faithful performance of the duties of his office, and shall<span class='line-break'> </span>record the doings at all meetings of the Corporation and of the Trustees.</p>
<p><b>Section 5<sup>th</sup>.</b> Be it further enacted, That the annual meetings of said<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation shall be holden at such time and place as the Bye Laws<span class='line-break'> </span>shall direct, and the Secretary shall give notice thereof in one or more<span class='line-break'> </span>newspapers, printed in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> seven days at least before the time of meeting,</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1061995">
<h3><a name="page-1061995">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 003)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>3</p>
<p>And special meetings may be called by the Trustees in the same<span class='line-break'> </span>manner unless otherwise directed by the Bye Laws; or by the Secretary,<span class='line-break'> </span>in the same manner upon the written request of twenty members of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation. At all meetings a quorum for business shall consist of not <span class='line-break'> </span>less than seven members; and any business may be transacted of which<span class='line-break'> </span>notice shall be given in the advertisements for the meeting and all<span class='line-break'> </span>questions shall be decided by a majority of the members present, and voting<span class='line-break'> </span>either in person or by proxy.</p>
<p><b>Section 6<sup>th</sup>.</b> Be it further enacted, That as soon as the said Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>shall have received from the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Massachusetts Horticultural Society</a> a legal<span class='line-break'> </span>conveyance of the said Garden and Cemetery at Mount Auburn, the<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Massachusetts Horticultural Society</a> shall cease to have any rights,<span class='line-break'> </span>powers and authorities, ^<small>over the same, and all the rights, powers and authorities,</small> trusts, immunities, and privileges conferred upon<span class='line-break'> </span>the said <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'><!--Mass Hort-->Society</a>, and upon the Proprietors of Lots in the said Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>in and by virtue of the first section of the Statute of the year One<span class='line-break'> </span>thousand eight hundred and thirty one, Chapter Sixty nine, shall be<span class='line-break'> </span>transferred to and exercised by the Corporation created by this Act, and<span class='line-break'> </span>the same shall to all intents and purposes apply to the said Corporation,<span class='line-break'> </span>and all Proprietors of Lots in the said Cemetery with the same force<span class='line-break'> </span>and effect as if the same were herein specially enacted, and the said<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation substituted for the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Massachusetts Horticultural Society</a> hereby.</p>
<p><b>Section 7<sup>th</sup>.</b> Be it further enacted, That any person who shall wilfully<span class='line-break'> </span>destroy, mutilate, deface, injure or remove any tomb, monument, grave<span class='line-break'></span>stone or other structure placed in the Cemetery aforesaid, or any fence,<span class='line-break'> </span>railing or other work for the protection or ornament of any tomb, monument,<span class='line-break'> </span>grave-stone or other structure aforesaid, or of any Cemetery lot, within the<span class='line-break'> </span>limits of the Garden &amp; Cemetery aforesaid, or shall wilfully destroy, remove,<span class='line-break'> </span>cut, break or injure any tree, shrub, or plant within the limits of the said</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1061996">
<h3><a name="page-1061996">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 004)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>4</p>
<p>Garden and Cemetery, or shall shoot or discharge any gun or<span class='line-break'> </span>other fire-arm within the said limits, shall be deemed guilty of<span class='line-break'> </span>a misdemeanor, and shall, upon conviction thereof before any<span class='line-break'> </span>Justice of the Peace or other Court of competent jurisdiction within<span class='line-break'> </span>the County of Middlesex, be punished by a fine not less than<span class='line-break'> </span>five dollars nor more than fifty dollars, according to the nature<span class='line-break'> </span>and aggravation of the offence; and such offender shall also be<span class='line-break'> </span>liable, in an action of trespass to be brought against him in any<span class='line-break'> </span>Count of competent jurisdiction in the name of the Proprietors of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery of Mount Auburn, to pay all such damages as <span class='line-break'> </span>shall have been occasioned by his unlawful act or acts, which<span class='line-break'> </span>money when recovered shall be applied by the said Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>under the direction of the Board of Trustees to the reparation and<span class='line-break'> </span>restoration of the property destroyed or injured as above, and members<span class='line-break'> </span>of the said Corporation shall be competent witnesses in such suits.</p>
<p><b>Section 8<sup>th</sup>.</b> Be it further enacted, That the Lots in said<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery shall be indivisible, and upon the death of any Proprietor of<span class='line-break'> </span>any Lot in the said Cemetery, containing not less than three hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>square feet, the devisee of such Lot, or the heir at law, as the case<span class='line-break'> </span>may be, shall be entitled to all the privileges of membership as aforesaid,<span class='line-break'> </span>and if there be more than one devisee or heir at law of each Lot, the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board of Trustees for the time being shall designate, which of the<span class='line-break'> </span>said devisees or heirs at Law shall represent the said Lot, and vote<span class='line-break'> </span>in the meetings of the Corporation, which designation shall continue<span class='line-break'> </span>in force, until by death, removal or other sufficient cause, another<span class='line-break'> </span>designation shall become necessary, and in making such designation<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees shall, as far as they conveniently may, give the preference to <span class='line-break'> </span>males over females, and to proximity of blood and priority of age having<span class='line-break'> </span>due regard, however, to proximity of residence.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1061997">
<h3><a name="page-1061997">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 005)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>5</p>
<p><b>Section 9<sup>th</sup>.</b> Be it further enacted, That it shall be lawful<span class='line-break'> </span>for the said Corporation to take and hold any grant, donation or<span class='line-break'> </span>bequest of property upon trust to apply the income thereof under the<span class='line-break'> </span>direction of the Board of Trustees for the improvement or embellishment<span class='line-break'> </span>of the said Cemetery or of the Garden adjacent thereto, or of any<span class='line-break'> </span>buildings, structures or fences erected or to be erected upon the lands<span class='line-break'> </span>of the said Corporation or of any individual Proprietor of a Lot in<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery, or for the repair, preservation, or renewal of any tomb,<span class='line-break'> </span>monument, grave-stone, fence or railing or other erection in or around<span class='line-break'> </span>any Cemetery Lot, or for the planting and cultivation of trees, shrubs,<span class='line-break'> </span>flowers or plants in or around any Cemetery Lot. according to the terms<span class='line-break'> </span>of such grant, donation or bequest, and the Supreme Judicial Court in<span class='line-break'> </span>this Commonwealth, or any other court therein having equity jurisdiction,<span class='line-break'> </span>shall have full power and jurisdiction, to compel the due performance<span class='line-break'> </span>of the said trusts or any of them, upon a bill filed by a Proprietor of<span class='line-break'> </span>any lot in the said Cemetery for that purpose.</p>
<p><b>Section 10<sup>th</sup>.</b> Be it further enacted as follows, <ins>First</ins>, That the<span class='line-break'> </span>present Proprietors of Lots in the said Cemetery, who shall become<span class='line-break'> </span>members of the Corporation created by this Act, shall thenceforth cease<span class='line-break'> </span>to be members of the said <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a>, so far as their member<span class='line-break'></span>ship therein depends on their being Proprietors of Lots in the said<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery; <ins>Secondly</ins>, That the sales of the Cemetery Lots shall continue<span class='line-break'> </span>to be made as fast as it is practicable by the Corporation created by this Act<span class='line-break'> </span>at a price not less than the sum of Sixty dollars for every Lot containing<span class='line-break'> </span>three hundred square feet, and so in proportion for any greater or less quantity<span class='line-break'> </span>unless the said <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a> and the Corporation created by this<span class='line-break'> </span>Act, shall mutually ^<sup>agree</sup> to sell the same at a less price; <ins>Thirdly</ins>, That<span class='line-break'> </span>the proceeds of the first sales of such Lots after deducting the annual<span class='line-break'> </span>expenses of the Cemetery establishment, shall be applied to the extinguishment<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1061998">
<h3><a name="page-1061998">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 006)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>6</p>
<p>of the present debts due by the said <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a> on<span class='line-break'> </span>account of the said Garden and Cemetery, and after the estinguis<span class='line-break'></span>hment of the said debts, the balance of the said proceeds and the proceeds<span class='line-break'> </span>of all future sales shall annually, on the first Monday in every year, be<span class='line-break'> </span>divided between the said <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a> and the Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>created by this Act in manner following, namely, fourteen hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars shall be first deducted from the gross proceeds of the sales of<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots during the preceding year for the purpose of defraying the Super<span class='line-break'></span>intendent's salary and other incidental expenses of the Cemetery estab<span class='line-break'></span>lishment, and the residue of the said gross proceeds shall be divided<span class='line-break'> </span>between the said <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a>, and the Corporation created<span class='line-break'> </span>by this act, as follows, namely, one fourth part thereof shall be received<span class='line-break'> </span>by and paid over to the said <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a> on the first<span class='line-break'> </span>Monday of January of every year, and the remaining three fourth<span class='line-break'> </span>parts shall be retained and held by the Corporation created by<span class='line-break'> </span>this Act, to their own use forever. And if the sales of any year shall<span class='line-break'> </span>be less that fourteen hundred dollars, then the deficiency shall be a<span class='line-break'> </span>charge on the sales of the succeeding year or years; <ins>Fourthly</ins>, the money<span class='line-break'> </span>so received by the said <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a> shall be forever devoted<span class='line-break'> </span>and applied by the said <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'><!--Mass Hort-->Society</a> to the purposes of an experimental<span class='line-break'> </span>garden and to promote the art and science of Horticulture and for no<span class='line-break'> </span>other purpose. And the money so retained by the Corporation created<span class='line-break'> </span>by this act, shall be forever devoted and applied to the reservation,<span class='line-break'> </span>improvement, embellishment and enlargement of the said Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>and Garden, and the incidental expenses thereof, and for no other<span class='line-break'> </span>purpose whatsoever; <ins>Fifthly</ins>, a Committee of the said <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticul<span class='line-break'></span>tural Society</a>, duly appointed for this purpose shall on the first<span class='line-break'> </span>Monday of January of every year, shall have a right to inspect and exam<span class='line-break'></span>ine the books and accounts of the Treasurer or other officer acting as<span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer of the Corporation created by this Act, as far as may be necessary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1061999">
<h3><a name="page-1061999">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 007)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>7</p>
<p>to ascertain the sales of Lots of the preceding year.</p>
<p><b>Section 11<sup>th</sup>.</b> Be it further enacted, that any three or more<span class='line-break'> </span>of the persons named in this Act shall have authority to call the first<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the said Corporation by an advertisement in one or more<span class='line-break'> </span>newspapers, printed in the <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>City of Boston</a>, seven days at least before<span class='line-break'> </span>the time of holding such meeting, and specifying the time and place<span class='line-break'> </span>thereof. And all Proprietors of Lots, who shall before, at or during the<span class='line-break'> </span>time of holding such meeting, by writing assent to this act shall be<span class='line-break'> </span>entitled to vote in person or by proxy at the said first meeting. And at<span class='line-break'> </span>such meeting or any adjournment thereof, any elections maybe had, and<span class='line-break'> </span>any business done, which are herein authorized to be had and done at an<span class='line-break'> </span>annual meeting, although the same may not be specified in the notice<span class='line-break'> </span>for the said meeting. And the first Board of Trustees, chosen at the<span class='line-break'> </span>said meeting shall continue in Office until the annual meeting of<span class='line-break'> </span>the said Corporation next ensuring their choice, and until another<span class='line-break'> </span>Board are chosen in the their stead in pursuance of this Act.</p>
<p><b>Section 12<sup>th</sup>.</b> Be it further enacted, That the said Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>shall be and hereby is declared exempted from all public taxes,<span class='line-break'> </span>so long as the same shall remain dedicated to the purposes of a Cemetery.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/56337' title='Massachusetts House of Representitives'>House of Rep<sup>s</sup></a> <date when='1835-03-27'>March 27. 1835</date><span class='line-break'> </span>Passed to be enacted<span class='line-break'> </span>(signed) <a href='/pages/subjects/56338' title='Rockwell, Julius'>Julius Rockwell</a> Speaker</p>
<p><date when='1835-03-31'>March 31 1835</date><span class='line-break'> </span>Approved<span class='line-break'> </span>(signed) <a href='/pages/subjects/58485' title='Armstrong, Samuel T.'>Samuel T Armstrong</a>.</p>
<p>In <a href='/pages/subjects/53209' title='Massachusetts Senate'>Senate</a> <date when='1835-03-28'>March 28 1835</date><span class='line-break'> </span>Passed to be enacted<span class='line-break'> </span>(signed) <a href='/pages/subjects/56339' title='Bliss, George'>George Bliss</a> President</p>
<p>A copy att (signed) <a href='/pages/subjects/56341' title='Bangs, Edward D.'>Edw D  Rangs</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary of the Commonwealth<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062000">
<h3><a name="page-1062000">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 008)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>8</p>
<p>The subscribers, being Proprietors of lots in the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn, hereby signify<span class='line-break'> </span>their assent to the Act of the Legislature pas<span class='line-break'></span>sed the <date when='1835-03-31'>thirty first day of March AD. eighteen<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred &amp; thirty five</date>, entitled an Act to<span class='line-break'> </span>incorporated the Proprietors of the Cemetery of<span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn.â€” Dated <date when='1835-04-21'>April 21 1835</date>.</p>

Curtis</a> and made oath that he would faithfully<span class='line-break'> </span>discharge the duties of Secretary of the Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>called the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/87561' title='Pickering, James'>Ja<sup>s</sup> Pickering</a> Justice of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Peace,</p>

<div id="page-1062004">
<h3><a name="page-1062004">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 012)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>12</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Corporation Meeting 21st April 1835'> Corporation Meeting <date when='1835-04-21'>21<sup>st</sup> April 1835</date></span></p>
<p>A Meeting of the Proprietors of Lots in <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery of Mount Auburn was held this<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1835-04-21'>twenty first day of April AD. eighteen hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; thirty five</date> pursuant to a Motification in<span class='line-break'> </span>the words &amp; figures following; vis.</p>
<p>Mount Auburn Cemetery</p>
<p>Notice is hereby given to the Proprietors of the Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>in the Cemetery of Mount Auburn that a meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>will be held on Tuesday <date when='1835-04-21T16:00:00'>April 21<sup>st</sup> at 4 <sup>o</sup>Clock <span class='line-break'> </span>P.M.</date> at the Horticultural Room, N<sup>o</sup> 79 Cornhill<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> to see if they will accept the Charter<span class='line-break'> </span>granted by the Legislature for incorporating the<span class='line-break'> </span>said Proprietors, and if accepted, to organize<span class='line-break'> </span>the said Corporation and transact all other<span class='line-break'> </span>business that may be legally brought before<span class='line-break'> </span>them._  Proprietors who shall before at or<span class='line-break'> </span>during the said meeting, by writing assent to<span class='line-break'> </span>becoming members of the Corporation will be<span class='line-break'> </span>entitled to vote by proxy._ <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>. <date when='1835-04-14'>April 14, 1835</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/56332' title='Davis, John'>John Davis</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>J. Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>George Bond</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a>;___</p>
<p>which notification was published in a news<span class='line-break'></span>paper printed in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, called <a href='/pages/subjects/58535' title='Boston Daily Advertiser &amp; Patriot'>Boston Daily<span class='line-break'> </span>Advertiser and Patriot</a>, seven days a least<span class='line-break'> </span>before the day appointed for the said meeting</p>
<p>The <a href='/pages/subjects/56332' title='Davis, John'>Hon<sup>ble</sup> John Davis</a> was elected Moderator</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062005">
<h3><a name="page-1062005">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 013)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>13</p>
<p>of the Meeting and <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a> was chosen<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary, and was duly qualified.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Act of Incorporation accepted'>Act of Incorporation accepted</span></p>
<p>The Act of the Legislature passed <date when='1835-03-31'>March 31, 1835</date><span class='line-break'> </span>entitled an Act to incorporate the Proprietors of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery of Mount Auburn was read by<span class='line-break'> </span>the Secretary, and it was unanimouslyâ€”<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted to accept the same and to proceed to<span class='line-break'> </span>organize the said Corporation;</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees chosen'>Trustees chosen</span></p>
<p>It was then voted to proceed to the choice of<span class='line-break'> </span>nine Trustees, to be chosen by ballot, and<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58334' title='Whitwell, Samuel'>Samuel Whitwell Esq</a>. was appointed a Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee to receive sort &amp; count the votes for<span class='line-break'> </span>trustees, and on his report it appeared that<span class='line-break'> </span>Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54995' title='Appleton, Samuel'>Samuel Appleton</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>George<span class='line-break'> </span>Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Benjamin A. Gould</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/57673' title='Brown, Charles'>Charles Brown</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/57597' title='Bradlee, Joseph P.'>Joseph P.<span class='line-break'> </span>Bradlee</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a> were unanimously<span class='line-break'> </span>chosen Trustees of the said Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>It was then voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a> Esq. be a committee<span class='line-break'> </span>to prepare such By laws as he should deem neces<span class='line-break'></span>sary, who reported the followings; â€“</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='By Law_ Annual Meeting. '>By Law_ Annual Meeting. </span></p>
<p>The annual Meeting of the Corporation shall<span class='line-break'> </span>be held on the twenty fourth day of September in<span class='line-break'> </span>each year ^being the day on which Mount Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>was consecrated to the purposes of a Cemetary,<span class='line-break'> </span>unless the same day shall happen on a Sunday,<span class='line-break'> </span>in which case it shall be held on the day next<span class='line-break'> </span>succeeding; and the annual meeting shall ^<sup>be</sup> held<span class='line-break'> </span>in the <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>City of Boston</a> at such place and time of<span class='line-break'> </span>the day as the Trustees shall appoint; â€“</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062006">
<h3><a name="page-1062006">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 014)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>14</p>
<p>the first annual meeting shall be held on<span class='line-break'> </span>the <date when='1836-09-24'>twenty fourth day of September next</date>; -<span class='line-break'> </span>It was voted to adopt &amp; pass the same as one of<span class='line-break'> </span>The By Laws of the Corporation. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees to procure Conveyance'> Trustees to procure Conveyance</span></p>
<p>It was then voted that the Trustees be author<span class='line-break'></span>ized to procure &amp; accept a conveyance from<span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Massachusetts Horticultural Society</a>, of<span class='line-break'> </span>all the lands &amp; tenements &amp; personal estate<span class='line-break'> </span>held by them in <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a> or elsewhere<span class='line-break'> </span>appertaining to the Garden &amp; Cemetery of Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn</p>
<p>This meeting was then adjourned to Tuesday<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1835-05-19T16:00:00'>May 19, 1835 at 4 <sup>o</sup>clock P.M.</date> at the Horticultur<span class='line-break'></span>al Room, in Cornhill, <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>.</p>
<p>Attest<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a>, Secretary</p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts<span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk SS. On the <date when='1835-04-23'>twenty third day of April A.D. 1835</date>,<span class='line-break'> </span>personally appeared <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>Benjamin R. Curtis</a> and made<span class='line-break'> </span>oath that he would faithfully discharge the duties <span class='line-break'> </span>of Secretary of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn --  Before me</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Justice of the Peace</p>
</div>
</div>

<div class="page-content">
<p>15</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees 23 Ap. 1835'>Trustees <date when='1835-04-23'>23 Ap. 1835</date></span></p>
<p>A meeting of the Trustees of the Proprietors of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn was held at the <span class='line-break'> </span>office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a> in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> on Thursday the<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1835-04-23T16:00:00'>23<sup>d</sup> day of April 1835 at 4 o'clock P.M.</date> __ Present<span class='line-break'> </span>Mess<sup>rs</sup>. <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54995' title='Appleton, Samuel'>Samuel Appleton</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob<span class='line-break'> </span>Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Benj<sup>m</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>A. Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/57673' title='Brown, Charles'>Charles Brown</a>.</p>
<p>The meeting was called to order by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr. Chas.<span class='line-break'> </span>P. Curtis</a>, the Secretary chosen at the Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>Meeting, &amp; thereupon <a href='/pages/subjects/54995' title='Appleton, Samuel'>Mr. Samuel Appleton</a><span class='line-break'> </span>was chosen chairman.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='President Chosen.'>President Chosen.</span></p>
<p>The Trustees then voted to proceed to the<span class='line-break'> </span>choice of a President by ballot, when the <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Hon.<span class='line-break'> </span>Joseph Story</a> was unanimously chosen President.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer.'>Treasurer.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Mr. George Bond</a> was then chosen Treasurer in<span class='line-break'> </span>the same manner.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salary of Sec.'>Salary of Sec.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr C. P. Curtis</a> then resigned the office of secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span>It was voted that the salary of the Secretary be<span class='line-break'> </span>one hundred dollars per annum.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary'>Secretary</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>Mr Benjamin R. Curtis</a> was unanimously chosen<span class='line-break'> </span>by ballot to be the Secretary of the Corporation &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>was duly qualified</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee to procure Deed.'>Com<sup>ee</sup> to procure Deed.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis</a> be a committee<span class='line-break'> </span>to apply for &amp; obtain a conveyance from the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Massa<span class='line-break'></span>chusetts Horticultural Society</a> of the land &amp; other<span class='line-break'> </span>property appertaining to the Cemetery &amp; Garden<span class='line-break'> </span>pursuant to the act passed <date when='1835-03-31'>March 31, 1835</date></p>
</div>

That Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis</a> by a com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee on laying out &amp; discontinuing lots in the said<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery, with power to employ as many hands as<span class='line-break'> </span>they shall see fit.</p>

<p>Voted that Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> be a committee to<span class='line-break'> </span>Prepare Rules &amp; Regulations concerning visitors &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>Interments at Mt. Auburn.â€”</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Do on Seal.'>Do on Seal.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story</a> be a committee<span class='line-break'> </span>to devise a Seal for the Corporation &amp; to report to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees at a future meeting.â€”</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Rules as to Visitors.â€”'>Rules as to Visitors.â€”</span></p>
<p>Voted. That until further ordered, the Rules &amp; Regulations<span class='line-break'> </span>adopted by the Garden &amp; Cemetery Committee of the<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass<sup>tts</sup> Horticultural Society</a>, concerning visitors &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>interments at Mount Auburn be in full force.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent'>Superintendent</span></p>
<p>Voted. That M<sup>r</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/54346' title='Russell, James W.'>John W. Russell</a> be continued as<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendant of the Mount Auburn Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>with all the powers &amp; authorities heretofore<span class='line-break'> </span>conferred on him by the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass<sup>tts</sup> Horticultural <span class='line-break'> </span>Society</a>, or the Garden &amp; Cemetery Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>thereof.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Register of Interments '> Register of Interments </span></p>
<p>Voted. that <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>M<sup>r</sup> Gould</a> be a committee to pro<span class='line-break'></span>cure a book suitable for registering interments<span class='line-break'> </span>at Mount Auburn.</p>
<p>Voted. That Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/57597' title='Bradlee, Joseph P.'>Bradlee</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a></p>

<p><date when='1835-05-19T16:00:00'>Tuesday May 19, 1835</date>. This being the time to which the <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn stood adjourned the secretary attended<span class='line-break'> </span>at the Rooms of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass. Hor. So<sup>y</sup></a>. at 4 o clock P.M.<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; a quorum for business not being present the<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting was further adjourned to Tuesday<span class='line-break'> </span>the <date when='1835-06-02'>2<sup>d</sup> day of June next</date>.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> Secy</p>

This being the time to which<span class='line-break'> </span>the meeting of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn stood adjourned, the Secretary attended<span class='line-break'> </span>at the Rooms of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass. Hor. Society</a> at 4 o clock <span class='line-break'> </span>P.M. &amp; a quorum for business not being present<span class='line-break'> </span>the meeting was further adjourned to <date when='1835-06-09'>Tuesday<span class='line-break'> </span>the ninth day of June current</date></p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> Secy.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors dissolved.'>Proprietors dissolved.</span></p>
<p><date when='1835-06-09'>Tuesday June 9, 1835</date>. This was the day to which<span class='line-break'> </span>the meeting of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn stood adjourned, but no<span class='line-break'> </span>member of the Corporation have attended<span class='line-break'> </span>the meeting was thereby dissolved</p>

<div id="page-1062010">
<h3><a name="page-1062010">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 018)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>18</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees 10. July 1835'>Trustees <date when='1835-07-10'>10. July 1835</date></span></p>
<p>A meeting of the Trustees of the Proprietors of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn, was held at the Rooms of the <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass<sup>tt</sup> Horticultural Society</a> on <date when='1835-07-10T15:30:00'>Friday the 10<sup>th</sup> day of<span class='line-break'> </span>July 1835 at half past three o clock P.M.</date> Present Mess<sup>rs</sup><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53238' title='Story, William W.'>Story</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54995' title='Appleton, Samuel'>Appleton</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/57597' title='Bradlee, Joseph P.'>Bradlee</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/57673' title='Brown, Charles'>Brown</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Seal.'>Seal.</span></p>
<p>The com<sup>ee</sup> to devise a seal for the corporation made a<span class='line-break'> </span>report, whereupon it was voted that the seal which<span class='line-break'> </span>had been devised should be committed to <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; that he be authorised to make such alterations<span class='line-break'> </span>therein as he shall deem expedient.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Laying out Lots.-'>Laying out Lots.-</span></p>
<p>Voted. That the com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots shall be a com<sup>ee</sup> <span class='line-break'> </span>to consider the expediency of laying out the whole<span class='line-break'> </span>of the grounds in Lots, &amp; to report thereon at a <span class='line-break'> </span>future meeting.</p>
<p>Voted That this meeting be now dissolved.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> Secy.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors Meeting July 10, 1835'>Proprietors Meeting <date when='1835-07-10'>July 10, 1835</date></span></p>
<p>To <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>Benjamin R Curtis</a>, Secretary of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn.</p>
<p>You are hereby requested to give notice of<span class='line-break'> </span>a special Meeting of the Proprietors of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn, to be held at the Horticultu<span class='line-break'></span>ral rooms in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> on <date when='1835-07-10T16:00:00'>Friday the 10<sup>th</sup> day of<span class='line-break'> </span>July next of 4 o'clock P.M.</date> by publishing the same<span class='line-break'> </span>in one or more newspapers printed in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a><span class='line-break'> </span>seven days at least before the time of meeting<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1835-06-30'>June 30, 1835</date>.</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Signed <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/54995' title='Appleton, Samuel'>Sam <sup>e</sup> Appleton</a>}</th> <th>} Jus<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a></td> <td>} of the</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Geo. Bond</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B. A. Gould</a></td> <td>} Pea<sup>s</sup></td> </tr> </tbody> </table></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062011">
<h3><a name="page-1062011">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 019)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>19</p>
<p>By virtue of the above requisition I caused to<span class='line-break'> </span>be published in the <a href='/pages/subjects/58535' title='Boston Daily Advertiser &amp; Patriot'>Boston Daily Advertiser &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>Patriot</a>, a newspaper printed in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>more than seven days before the said time<span class='line-break'> </span>of meeting, the following notice, vis:<span class='line-break'> </span>"Mount Auburn Cemetery.â€” The Proprietors of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn are hereby notified<span class='line-break'> </span>that a Special Meeting of that Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>will be held at the Horticultural Rooms in<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, on <date when='1835-07-10T16:00:00'> Friday the 10th day of July next at<span class='line-break'> </span>4 o'clock P.M.</date> to hear the reports of the Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittees on the bye laws, &amp; on a common seal,<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; to determine upon the acceptance of a con<span class='line-break'></span>veyance from the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Massachusetts Horticultural<span class='line-break'> </span>Society</a>, &amp; to transact any other business which<span class='line-break'> </span>may legally come before the Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1835-06-30'>June 30th 1835</date>. By order of the Trustees.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> Secy."<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> Secy.</p>
<p>Pursuant to the above notice the Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn met at<span class='line-break'> </span>the Horticultural Rooms in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> on friday<span class='line-break'> </span>the 10<sup>th</sup> day of July 1835 at 4 oclock P.M.<span class='line-break'> </span>The Meeting was called to order by the President.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story Esq</a>, who was appointed at the last<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting a committee to prepare such bye laws<span class='line-break'> </span>as he should deem necessary reported the<span class='line-break'> </span>following.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062012">
<h3><a name="page-1062012">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 020)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>20</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Bye Laws.'>Bye Laws.</span><span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. Seal.'>Com. Seal.</span></p>
<p>First. The Trustees shall have authority to provide a common<span class='line-break'> </span>seal for the Corporation, which shall remain the com<span class='line-break'></span>mon seal until otherwise ordered by the Corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Vacancies'>Vacancies</span></p>
<p>Second. The Trustees shall have power to fill all<span class='line-break'> </span>vacancies in their own body which may occur<span class='line-break'> </span>between one annual meeting &amp; another.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Bye Laws to Regulate Business'> Bye Laws to Regulate Business</span></p>
<p>Third. The Trustees shall have authority to make<span class='line-break'> </span>any bye laws for the due regulation &amp; manage<span class='line-break'></span>ment of the property business &amp; presidential concerns<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation not otherwise provided for by the<span class='line-break'> </span>act of incorporation, which shall be in force <span class='line-break'> </span>till otherwise ordered by the corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Meeting if not held'>Annual Meeting if not held</span></p>
<p>Fourth. If the annual meeting, or any adjourn<span class='line-break'></span>ment thereof shall not be duly held according<span class='line-break'> </span>to law, it shall be the duty of the Trustees for the<span class='line-break'> </span>time being to call another annual meeting, at<span class='line-break'> </span>which any business may be transacted, which<span class='line-break'> </span>could be done at the annual meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Deeds of Lots'>Deeds of Lots</span></p>
<p>Fifth. All conveyances of lots, or lands of the Corpo<span class='line-break'></span>ration &amp; all other deeds of the Corporation, shall<span class='line-break'> </span>be under the common seal &amp; signed by the President<span class='line-break'> </span>or Treasurer &amp; countersigned by the Secretary, &amp; recor<span class='line-break'></span>ded in the books of the Corporation. The forms of<span class='line-break'> </span>conveyances &amp; other deeds shall be prescribed by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees, until the Corporation shall otherwise<span class='line-break'> </span>direct.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062013">
<h3><a name="page-1062013">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 021)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>21</p>
<p>Voted. To adopt &amp; pass the same as bye laws of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Meeting Time of ___'>Annual Meeting Time of ___</span></p>
<p>Voted. That a committee of three be appointed to<span class='line-break'> </span>consider the propriety of changing the time<span class='line-break'> </span>of the annual meeting. Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54995' title='Appleton, Samuel'>Appleton</a><span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a> were then chosen to constitute this com<sup>ee</sup>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Conveyance from Mass. Hor. Society'>Conveyance from <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass. Hor. Society</a></span></p>
<p>Voted. That the com<sup>ee</sup> appointed to apply for &amp; obtain<span class='line-break'> </span>a conveyance from the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass. Hor. Society</a>, of the land,<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; other property appertaining to the cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; garden of Mount Auburn be authorised<span class='line-break'> </span>to accept the deed which has been prepared<span class='line-break'> </span>when signed by the Com<sup>ee</sup> of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass<sup>tts</sup> Hor<sup>e</sup> Society</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>that the deed be recorded in the records of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation, &amp; in the Registry of deeds of the <span class='line-break'> </span>County of Middlesex.</p>
<p>Voted. To dissolve this meeting.<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> Secy.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Deed from Mass. Hor. Soy.'>Deed from <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass. Hor. So<sup>y</sup></a>.</span></p>
<p>To all persons to whom these present, shall come<span class='line-break'> </span>Greeting. Know ye that the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Massachusetts Horticultural <span class='line-break'> </span>Society</a> in consideration of ten dollars paid to them<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn,<span class='line-break'> </span>the receipt of which is hereby acknowledged, &amp; for diverse<span class='line-break'> </span>other good &amp; valuable considerations, do ^<sup>hereby</sup> grant, sell &amp; convey<span class='line-break'> </span>unto the said Proprietors their Successors &amp; Assigns,<span class='line-break'> </span>all their property &amp; estate in &amp; to the lands in the</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062014">
<h3><a name="page-1062014">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 022)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>22</p>
<p>Towns of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a>, in the County of Middlesex, <span class='line-break'> </span>heretofore known as the Cemetery &amp; Experimental Garden<span class='line-break'> </span>at Mount Auburn, together with all Lands appurtenant<span class='line-break'> </span>to the same in which the Grantors have any interest, property or<span class='line-break'> </span>estate; - The said premises being estimated to contain in the <span class='line-break'> </span>whole about one hundred &amp; ten acres, &amp; for a more partic<span class='line-break'></span>ular description of which reference is made to the Deeds<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/58537' title='Crafts, Rhoda'>Rhoda Crafts</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/56695' title='Brimmer, George W.'>George W. Brimmer</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58539' title='Stone, Joel'>Joel Stone</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58540' title='Stone, David'>David<span class='line-break'> </span>Stone</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58540' title='Stone, David'>David Stone</a> Guardian <a href='/pages/subjects/58541' title='Stone, Columbus J.'>Columbus J. Stone</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58542' title='Stone, Melinda'>Melinda<span class='line-break'> </span>Stone</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58543' title='Poweroy, William M.'>William M. Poweroy</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/87566' title='Poweroy, William M., Mrs.'><!--Poweroy-->wife</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58544' title='Cutter, Ann'>Ann Cutter</a>, generally<span class='line-break'> </span>to the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Massachusetts Horticultural Society</a>, recorded <span class='line-break'> </span>in the Registry of Deed for the County of Middlesex.</p>
<p>To have &amp; to hold the afore granted Premises <span class='line-break'> </span>unto the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; to their successors &amp; assigned forever, upon the trusts,<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; for the uses &amp; purposes mentioned &amp; expressed in the<span class='line-break'> </span>Act of the Legislature entitled, "An Act to incorporate<span class='line-break'> </span>the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn."<span class='line-break'> </span>And it is hereby understood &amp; agreed between the par<span class='line-break'> </span>ties that conveyance is made expressly upon the <span class='line-break'> </span>following fundamental stipulations, which are to<span class='line-break'> </span>be mutually obligatory &amp; binding upon the parties, as <span class='line-break'> </span>contained in the tenth section of the said Act incor<span class='line-break'></span>porating the said Proprietors of the Cemetery of<span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn. First, that the present Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>of Lots in the said Cemetery, who shall become <span class='line-break'> </span>members of the Corporation created by the <span class='line-break'> </span>said act, shall thenceforth cease to be mem<span class='line-break'></span>bers of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a> aforesaid, </p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062015">
<h3><a name="page-1062015">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 023)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>23</p>
<p>so far as their membership depends upon their<span class='line-break'> </span>being Proprietors of Lots in the said Cemetery;<span class='line-break'></span>Secondly, that the sales of the Cemetery Lots shall<span class='line-break'> </span>continue to be made as fast as is practicable,<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Corporation created by the said Act,<span class='line-break'> </span>at a price not less than the sum of Sixty<span class='line-break'> </span>Dollars for every Lot containing three hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>square feet &amp; so in proportion for any greater<span class='line-break'> </span>or less quantity, unless the said <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural <span class='line-break'> </span>Society</a> &amp; the Corporation created by the said<span class='line-break'> </span>act shall mutually agree to sell the same<span class='line-break'> </span>at a less price.; Thirdly, that the proceeds of <span class='line-break'> </span>the first sales of <del>the said</del> <sup>such</sup> Lots, after deduc<span class='line-break'></span>ting the annual expenses of the of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>Establishment, shall be applied to the<span class='line-break'> </span>extinguishment of the present debts, due by<span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a> on account of the <span class='line-break'> </span>said Garden &amp; Cemetery, &amp; after the extinguish<span class='line-break'></span>ment of the said debts, the balance of the <span class='line-break'> </span>said proceeds, &amp; the proceeds of all future<span class='line-break'> </span>sales, shall annually, on the first Monday <span class='line-break'> </span>of every year be divided between the <span class='line-break'> </span>said <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a> &amp; the Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>created by the said Act in manner follow,<span class='line-break'> </span>ing vis: fourteen hundred dollars<span class='line-break'> </span>shall be first deducted from the gross<span class='line-break'> </span>proceeds of the Sales of Lots of the preceding <span class='line-break'> </span>year, for the purpose of defraying the superin<span class='line-break'> </span>-tendents salary &amp; other incidental expenses </p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062016">
<h3><a name="page-1062016">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 024)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>24</p>
<p>of the Cemetery Establishment, &amp; the residue of the said<span class='line-break'> </span>gross proceeds, shall be divided between the said<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a> &amp; the Corporation created by the said<span class='line-break'> </span>Act, as follows vis: one fourth part thereof shall be <span class='line-break'> </span>received by &amp; paid over to the said <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a><span class='line-break'> </span>on the first Monday of January of every year, &amp; the<span class='line-break'> </span>remaining three fourth parts shall be retained &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>held by the Corporation created by the said Act<span class='line-break'> </span>forever to their own use. And if the sales of any<span class='line-break'> </span>year shall be less than fourteen hundred dollars, <span class='line-break'> </span>then the deficiency shall be a charge on the sales <span class='line-break'> </span>of the succeeding year or years. Fourthly, that the<span class='line-break'> </span>money so received by the said <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a><span class='line-break'> </span>shall be forever devoted &amp; applied by the said <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'><!--Mass Hort-->Society</a> to <span class='line-break'> </span>the purposes of an experimental garden, &amp; to promote the<span class='line-break'> </span>Art &amp; Science of Horitculture, &amp; for no other purpose; &amp; the <span class='line-break'> </span>money so retained by the Corporation created by this<span class='line-break'> </span>Act, shall be forever devoted &amp; applied to the preser<span class='line-break'></span>vation, improvement, embellishment &amp; enlargement<span class='line-break'> </span>of the said Cemetery &amp; Garden &amp; the incidental expenses <span class='line-break'> </span>thereof, &amp; for no other purpose whatsover.<span class='line-break'> </span>Fifthly, that a committee of the said <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultu<span class='line-break'></span>ral Society</a> duly appointed for this purpose,<span class='line-break'> </span>Shall on the first Monday of January of <span class='line-break'> </span>every year have a right to inspect &amp; examine<span class='line-break'> </span>the Books &amp; Accounts of the Treasurer, or other <span class='line-break'> </span>officer acting as Treasurer of the Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>created by this Act, as for as may be necessary<span class='line-break'> </span>to ascertain the Sales of Lots of the preceeding</p>
</div>
</div>

<p>year, In testimony whereof, the said <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Massa<span class='line-break'> </span>chusetts Horticultural Society</a> have caused their<span class='line-break'> </span>common seal to be hereto affixed &amp; this<span class='line-break'> </span>deed to be signed &amp; delivered by <a href='/pages/subjects/57596' title='Vose, Elijah'>Elijah<span class='line-break'> </span>Vose</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58545' title='Winship, Jonathan, III'>Jonathan Winship</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58465' title='Paine, Robert Treat'>Robert T. <p>Signed <a href='/pages/subjects/57596' title='Vose, Elijah'>Elijah Vose</a>  <a href='/pages/subjects/58545' title='Winship, Jonathan, III'>Jon<sup>a</sup> Winship</a><span class='line-break'> </span>(L.S.) <a href='/pages/subjects/58465' title='Paine, Robert Treat'>Robert Treat Paine</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53210' title='Wilder, Marshall P.'>Marshal P.
