<div id="page-1062018">
<h3><a name="page-1062018">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 026)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>26</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. No Quorum.'>Trustees. No Quorum.</span></p>
<p>A meeting of the Trustees of the Proprietors of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn, was holden at the office of the</p>
<p>Secretary in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> on <date when='1835-08-07T16:00:00'>Friday August 7<sup>th</sup> 1835 at 4<span class='line-break'> </span>oclock P.M.</date> Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/57673' title='Brown, Charles'>Brown</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>, Reed &amp;</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, &amp; a quorum of the board not being present <span class='line-break'> </span>it was voted to adjourn the meeting to Monday next<span class='line-break'> </span>at 4 oclock P.M. at the same place.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'> B.R. Curtis</a> Sec<sup>y</sup>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Notice - annual meeting. 1835.'> Notice - annual meeting. 1835.</span></p>
<p>Mount Auburn Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>The annual meeting of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of<span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn, will be held on <date when='1835-09-24T16:00:00'>Thursday the 24<sup>th</sup> day<span class='line-break'> </span>of September instant, at 4 oclock P.M.</date> at the Rooms of the<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a>,  in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, to hear the report<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Treasurer, to determine whether the bye-law<span class='line-break'> </span>fixing the time of the annual meeting shall be<span class='line-break'> </span>altered &amp; to act on any other business to which may <span class='line-break'> </span>legally come before the said Proprietors at the annu<span class='line-break'></span>al meeting.   Signed <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>Benj. R. Curtis</a> Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1835-09-12'>Sept<sup>r</sup>. 12. 1835</date>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors.'>Proprietors.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to the above notice, which was published<span class='line-break'> </span>more than seven days before the time of meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>in the <a href='/pages/subjects/58551' title='Boston Daily Advertiser'>Boston Daily Advertiser</a>, &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/58552' title='Boston Atlas'>Boston Atlas</a>, two<span class='line-break'> </span>newspapers printed in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, the Proprietors of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery of Mount Auburn met at the <span class='line-break'> </span>time &amp; place therein designated, &amp; the meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>was called to order by <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'><!--Story-->the President</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062019">
<h3><a name="page-1062019">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 027)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>27</p>
<p>It was thereupon:</p>
<p>Voted. That when this meeting adjourns, it shall <span class='line-break'> </span>be adjourned to this place on the <date when='1836-01-04'>first Monday <span class='line-break'> </span>of January next at eleven o clock A.M.</date><span class='line-break'> </span>Voted. That the Secretary cause a notice of the time <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; place of the adjourned meeting to be published <span class='line-break'> </span>in three daily papers at least one week before <span class='line-break'> </span>the meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Adjournment.'>Adjournment.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That this meeting be now adjourned.<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a> Sec<sup>y</sup>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Pros. Meeting'>Pro<sup>s</sup>. Meeting</span></p>
<p>Monday <date when='1836-01-04T11:00:00'>January 4<sup>th</sup> 1836</date>.</p>
<p>Pursuant to the vote passed<span class='line-break'> </span>at the last meeting the Prop<sup>s</sup> of the Cemetery of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn met this day at eleven oclock<span class='line-break'> </span>A.M. at the Rooms of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a><span class='line-break'> </span>in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>. The President of the Corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>being absent, the meeting was called to <span class='line-break'> </span>order by <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'><!--B.R. Curtis-->the Secretary</a>, &amp; thereupon it was<span class='line-break'> </span>voted. To choose a chairman pro tem.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chairman.'>Chairman.</span></p>
<p>Voted That the chairman be chosen by being<span class='line-break'> </span>nominated by any member present &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>Confirmed by the meeting.<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted. That <a href='/pages/subjects/58405' title='Adams, Z. B.'>Dr. Z. B. Adams</a> (who was so<span class='line-break'> </span>nominated) be chairman.<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted. That this meeting be now adjourned <span class='line-break'> </span>to the first Monday in February next, &amp; that<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'><!--B.R. Curtis-->the Secretary</a> give notice of the time &amp; place of<span class='line-break'> </span>Meeting by publishing the same at least<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062020">
<h3><a name="page-1062020">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 028)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>28</p>
<p>one week in three newspapers printed in <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a></p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a> Sec<sup>y</sup>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'><ins>Trustees</ins></span></p>
<p><date when='1836-01-27T19:00:00'>Wednesday January 27<sup>th</sup>. 1836</date>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Pursuant to notice the Trustees of the Proprietors of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn met at the house of <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>George<span class='line-break'> </span>Bond Esq<sup>r</sup></a>, the Treasurer, at 7 oclock P.M.; Present<span class='line-break'> </span>Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>, Read,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/57673' title='Brown, Charles'>Brown</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a>, &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chairman.'>Chairman.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> was chosen chairman, the President being <span class='line-break'> </span>absent.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurers Report'>Treasurers Report</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'><!--Bond-->The Treasurer</a> then submitted to the Trustees his<span class='line-break'> </span>annual report, which being read by the Secre<span class='line-break'></span>tary it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mass. Hort. Society'><a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass. Hort. Society</a></span></p>
<p>Voted To accept the same &amp; that he be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to settle with the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass. Hor. Society</a> in accordance<span class='line-break'> </span>therewith.</p>
<p>Voted. That when this meeting adjourns, it shall <span class='line-break'> </span>be adjourned to Monday next at half past ten<span class='line-break'> </span>o clock at the office of the Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Price of Lots.'>Price of Lots.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That from &amp; after the <date when='1836-04-01'>first day of April next</date> ^<sup>&amp; until further notice</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>the price of Lots shall be eighty dollars for three hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>square feet &amp; after the same rate for any greater or less<span class='line-break'> </span>quantity; and that the Secretary give notice of the<span class='line-break'> </span>above change in the price of Lots in the Cemetery by<span class='line-break'> </span>publishing this note in three newspapers printed in<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, as often as he shall think expedient.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a> Sec<sup>y</sup>.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062021">
<h3><a name="page-1062021">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 029)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>29</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors'>Proprietors</span></p>
<p><date when='1836-02-01T11:00:00'>Monday February 1<sup>st</sup> 1836. 11 oclock A.M.</date> Horticultural Rooms.</p>
<p>Pursuant to adjournment the Proprietors met at the <span class='line-break'> </span>abovenamed time &amp; place, were called to order by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B.A. Gould Esq<sup>e</sup></a> was chosen chairman to <span class='line-break'> </span>preside at this meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1836 Treasurers Report '>1836 Treasurers Report </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'><!--B.R. Curtis-->The Secretary</a> then read the report of the Treasurer<span class='line-break'> </span>which is as follows.</p>
<p>"The Treasurer begs leave to report, that since the annual<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass. Horticultural Society</a> in <date when='1834-09'>September<span class='line-break'> </span>1834</date>, when his last report was made, every debt due<span class='line-break'> </span>from the Garden &amp; Cemetery Committee has been<span class='line-break'> </span>paid, &amp; there remains in the Treasury, per certificate<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Auditor <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B.A. Gould Esq<sup>e</sup></a> the sum of $1,210.74<span class='line-break'> </span>He further reports that the payments for the Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn Estate &amp; improvements thereon, up to the <span class='line-break'> </span>30<sup>th</sup> of June last, when the account <del>for</del> <sup>of</sup> the Garden<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; Cemetery Com<sup>ee</sup> were closed, amount to the sum <span class='line-break'> </span>of $27,006.25; that the total number of Lots sold<span class='line-break'> </span>to the same date is 390 producing the sum <span class='line-break'> </span>of $26776.44, leaving a balance due from the<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass Horticultural Society</a> to the Proprietors of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn of $1029.81. To this<span class='line-break'> </span>must be added some bills against the Garden <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; Cemetery Committee not yet <del>received</del> rendered,<span class='line-break'> </span>particularly one for an iron waggon, designed to <span class='line-break'> </span>transport stone within the grounds), which may<span class='line-break'> </span>amount together to $300, &amp; of which a considerable <span class='line-break'> </span>portion is expected to be paid in Lots. Since the<span class='line-break'> </span>30<sup>th</sup> of June 36 Lots have been sold, producing $2951.20<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062022">
<h3><a name="page-1062022">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 030)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>30</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1836 Treasurer&apos;s  Report'>1836 Treasurer's  Report</span></p>
<p>If therefore a settlement be made with the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural <span class='line-break'> </span>Society</a> at this time, they will be entitled to receive $305.34<span class='line-break'> </span>per the following statement vis:<span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Balance of debts pays out of proceeds of sales per agreement</th> <th>1029.81<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>Allowance for 6 mo. expenses</td> <td>700.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>1/4 Balance pay<sup>d</sup> to <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>M.H.So.</a></td> <td>305.34</td> </tr> <tr><td>3/4 Balance to be retained by Proprietors</td> <td><ins>916.05</ins></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>2951.20</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> The current expenses of the Proprietors for the six months<span class='line-break'> </span>ending 31<sup>st</sup> December exceed the amount allowed<span class='line-break'> </span>them by the sum of ten dollars 65/100($10.65).</p>
<p>Referring to the annexed trial balance of his<span class='line-break'> </span>Books the Treasurer asks the orders of the board<span class='line-break'> </span>in relation to a settlement with the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass. Hor. So<sup>y</sup></a>.<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1836-01-027'>January 27<sup>th</sup> 1836</date>. Signed <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Geo. Bond</a></p>
<p>Trial balance of Treasurer's Books <date when='1836-12-31'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 31, 1835</date><span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Cemetery (including</th> <th>___</th> <th>Sales by <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass. Hor. So<sup>y</sup></a>.</th> <th>26776.44<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>found in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>)</td> <td>27806.25</td> <td>Old debt fund</td> <td>1029.81</td> </tr> <tr><td>Expenses</td> <td>710.65</td> <td>Expense fund</td> <td>700.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>Cash</td> <td><ins>1210.74</ins></td> <td>Pro<sup>s</sup> fund</td> <td>916. 05</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>29727.64</td> <td>Treas. <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>M.H.S.</a></td> <td><ins>305.34</ins></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___</td> <td>___</td> <td><ins>29727.64</ins></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Meeting Time of.'>Annual Meeting Time of.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> To accept the Treasurers above report.<span class='line-break'> </span>The following report was then made<span class='line-break'> </span>"The Com. appointed to consider the propriety <span class='line-break'> </span>of changing the time of the annual meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>report, that many circumstances combine to render<span class='line-break'> </span>it most convenient to make up the accounts <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Superintendent of the Cemetery, to the 31<sup>st</sup> of  </p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062023">
<h3><a name="page-1062023">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 031)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>31</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors'><ins>Proprietors</ins></span></p>
<p>of December, &amp; that four weeks are indispensable<span class='line-break'> </span>to make up the Treasurers account &amp; report.<span class='line-break'> </span>They therefore recommend that the annual<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Proprietors be herafter held<span class='line-break'> </span>on the first Monday in February.<span class='line-break'> </span>Signed <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Geo. Bond</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Meeting.'>Annual Meeting.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That in conformity to the above report<span class='line-break'> </span>the Byelaw fixing the time of the annual<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting be &amp; it hereby is altered, &amp; that the <span class='line-break'> </span>said meeting shall in future be holden <span class='line-break'> </span>on the first Monday in February instead of<span class='line-break'> </span>the 24<sup>th</sup> September.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Chosen--'>Trustees Chosen--</span></p>
<p>Voted &amp; chose ^<sup> by ballot</sup> the following named persons<span class='line-break'> </span>as Trustees for the ensuing year. Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph<span class='line-break'> </span>Story</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54995' title='Appleton, Samuel'>Samuel Appleton</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>George Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob<span class='line-break'> </span>Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Benjamin A. Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/57673' title='Brown, Charles'>Charles Brown</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/57597' title='Bradlee, Joseph P.'>Joseph P. Bradlee</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James <span class='line-break'> </span>Read</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Treasurers Report. '> Treasurers Report. </span></p>
<p>Voted. That the Trustees be requested to publish<span class='line-break'> </span>the report of the Treasurer in such newspapers<span class='line-break'> </span>as they shall think proper, accompanied with<span class='line-break'> </span>such remarks as to the objects, &amp; state of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation as shall seem to them expedient.<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted. That this meeting be now dissolved.<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> Sec<sup>y</sup>. -</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062024">
<h3><a name="page-1062024">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 032)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>32</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'><ins>Trustees</ins></span></p>
<p>The Trustees of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>met at the house of <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>George Bond Esq.</a> in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> on <date when='1836-02-27T19:30:00'>Saturday <span class='line-break'> </span>the 27<sup>th</sup> day of Feby 1836 at half past seven o clock PM</date>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/57673' title='Brown, Charles'>Brown</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>&amp; Read.</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> was chosen chairman, the Pres. being absent.<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted. To proceed to choose by ballot a President, Treasurer<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='President'><ins>President</ins></span></p>
<p>The <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Hon. Joseph Story</a> was chosen <ins>President</ins></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer'><ins>Treasurer</ins></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>George Bond Esq.</a> was chosen <ins>Treasurer</ins></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary'><ins>Secretary</ins></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>Benj<sup>m</sup> R. Curtis</a> was chosen <ins>Secretary </ins></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on Garden etc'><ins>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Garden etc</ins></span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/57597' title='Bradlee, Joseph P.'>Bradlee</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> be a comm<sup>ee</sup> to consid<span class='line-break'></span>er &amp; report a plan for improving the ground formerly  inten<span class='line-break'></span>ded for a Garden, &amp; also the Lawn on the Eastern side of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Commee on Lots'><ins>Comm<sup>ee</sup> on Lots</ins></span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> be a Comm<sup>ee</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>on laying out &amp; distcontinuing Lots in the said cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>with power to employ as many hands as they shall <span class='line-break'> </span>see fit -Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> Secy.-</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'><ins>Trustees</ins></span></p>
<p>The Trustees of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn, met at the house of <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> on the <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1836-04-14T19:30:00'>14<sup>th</sup> day of April at half past seven oclock P.M.</date><span class='line-break'> </span>Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>&amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>Read.</a></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> was chosen chairman, the President<span class='line-break'> </span>being absent.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062025">
<h3><a name="page-1062025">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 033)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>33</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees to lay out new Lots. - '><ins>Trustees</ins> to lay out new Lots. - </span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That the Comm<sup>ee</sup> on Lots be authorised to <span class='line-break'> </span>lay out such number of new Lots as they <span class='line-break'> </span>shall think fit, &amp; to dispose of the choice of <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots by auction at such time as they shall <span class='line-break'> </span>think proper.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Planting Trees'>Planting Trees</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> be a <span class='line-break'> </span>Comm<sup>ee</sup> to give instructions as to the laying <span class='line-break'> </span>out of the garden, &amp; setting out trees on the <span class='line-break'> </span>border of the Lawn on the South side of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Laying out Garden'>Laying out Garden</span></p>
<p><ins>The Com<sup>ee</sup></ins> chosen at the last meeting for that <span class='line-break'> </span>purpose, reported that they recommend that <span class='line-break'> </span>the garden be forthwith laid out into<span class='line-break'> </span>avenues &amp; paths, with reference to the most <span class='line-break'> </span>economical appropriation of land for <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots hereafter.  And this report was<span class='line-break'> </span>accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mass. Hor. So.'><a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass. Hor. So.</a></span></p>
<p>A communication from the Sec<sup>y</sup> of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass.<span class='line-break'> </span>Hor. Society</a> was then read to the Trustees by <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'><!--B.R. Curtis-->the Secretary</a>.  It related to the use of a <span class='line-break'> </span>part of their Library by the Pres. of the Cem<sup>y</sup>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Thereupon it was voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'><!--B.R. Curtis-->the Sec<sup>y</sup></a><span class='line-break'> </span>return the thanks of the Trustees to the <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass. Hor. So.</a> for their permission to use <span class='line-break'> </span>a part of their Library.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Investment'>Investment</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> be instructed <span class='line-break'> </span>to invest from five to four thousand<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars of the funds of the Corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>in some safe &amp; profitable security.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> Se<sup>y</sup>.-</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062026">
<h3><a name="page-1062026">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 034)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>34</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notice issued by the Secretary, the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees of the Pro<sup>s</sup> of the Cem<sup>y</sup> of Mount Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>met at the house of <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>M<sup>r</sup> Bond</a>, the Treasurer, on <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1836-05-25T15:00:00'>the 25<sup>th</sup> day of May 1836 at 3 oclock P.M.</date><span class='line-break'> </span>Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/57597' title='Bradlee, Joseph P.'>Bradlee</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/57673' title='Brown, Charles'>Brown</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>, Read &amp;</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story.</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Laying out Lots._'>Laying out Lots._</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That hereafter, in laying out Lots, the <span class='line-break'> </span>Comm<sup>ee</sup> on Lots shall allow only such space<span class='line-break'> </span>between Lots contiguous to each other, as the <span class='line-break'> </span>Comm<sup>ee</sup> shall deem expedient, having references<span class='line-break'> </span>to the nature of the ground.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='$750 to House of Supert'>$750 to <a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>House of Super<sup>t</sup></a></span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That the sum of seven hundred &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>fifty dollars be appropriated to build an <span class='line-break'> </span>addition to the <a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>House of the Superintendant</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>to be expended under the direction of Mess<sup>rs</sup><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>&amp; Read.</a></p>
<p>The following votes were then passed with the <span class='line-break'> </span>preamble as here given.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Choice &amp; Exchange of Lots.'>Choice &amp; Exchange of Lots.</span></p>
<p>Whereas it is found by experience that <span class='line-break'> </span>the laying out of single lots on the application <span class='line-break'> </span>of Proprietors, is not only troublesome &amp; expensive<span class='line-break'> </span>but is highly detrimental to the interests <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation from the unavoidable <span class='line-break'> </span>waste of ground which is thereby occasioned,<span class='line-break'> </span>therefore -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots when specially laid out.'>Lots when specially laid out.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That present Proprietors who shall <span class='line-break'> </span>not avail themselves of the privilege of <span class='line-break'> </span>having Lots especially laid out for them <span class='line-break'> </span>on payment of ten dollars, &amp; with the <span class='line-break'> </span>approbation of the Comm<sup>ee</sup> on Lots, or on</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062027">
<h3><a name="page-1062027">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 035)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>35</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>before the <date when='1836-12-31'>31<sup>st</sup> day of December next</date>, shall <span class='line-break'> </span>be charged Twenty Dollars for that privilege;</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots.'>Lots.</span></p>
<p>&amp; all who shall hereafter become Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>shall be charged the sum of Twenty Dollars <span class='line-break'> </span>for such privilege until the further<span class='line-break'> </span>order of this board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Right of Choice.'>Right of Choice.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins>  That if the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots shall <span class='line-break'> </span>not deem it expedient to offer the <span class='line-break'> </span>choice of Lots laid out during the<span class='line-break'> </span>present season, or which may hereafter<span class='line-break'> </span>be laid out, at auction, the sum of <span class='line-break'> </span>ten dollars shall be charged for the <span class='line-break'> </span>right of choice in the said new <span class='line-break'> </span>lots, till the further order of this <span class='line-break'> </span>board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Exchange of Lots.'>Exchange of Lots.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That in all exchanges of lots<span class='line-break'> </span>the amount then charged by the <span class='line-break'> </span>rules of the board for a choice, shall<span class='line-break'> </span>be paid by the Proprietor so exchanging,<span class='line-break'> </span>provided however that in no case<span class='line-break'> </span>shall such proprietor pay a less<span class='line-break'> </span>sum than ten dollars.</p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> To adjourn sine die.</p>
<p>A true record</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary-</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062028">
<h3><a name="page-1062028">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 036)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>36</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notice issued by the Secretary, the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees of the Pros. of the Cemy. of Mount Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>met at the house of <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Mr Bond</a> the Treasurer<span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1837-01-28T19:30:00'>Saturday the 28<sup>th</sup> day of January 1837, <del>at</del><span class='line-break'> </span>at half past seven oclock P.M.</date><span class='line-break'> </span>Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/57673' title='Brown, Charles'>Brown</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>&amp; Read.</a></p>
<p>In the absence of the President <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span>was chosen chairman of the meeting.-</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurers Report._'>Treasurers Report._</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'><!--Bond-->The Treasurer</a> then made his report, accom<span class='line-break'></span>panied by a statement of <a href='/pages/subjects/54346' title='Russell, James W.'>Mr. Russell</a>, the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent.</p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> To accept the Treasurers Report<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; that the Secretary lay the same before<span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation at their next annual<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting,-</p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> To adjourn sine die.-</p>
<p>A true record<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a> Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors 1837.'><ins>Proprietors</ins> 1837.</span></p>
<p>Mount Auburn Cemetery</p>
<p>The annual meeting of the Pros. of the Cemetery of Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn will be held on <date when='1837-02-06T11:00:00'>Monday the 6<sup>th</sup> day of<span class='line-break'> </span>February 1837 at 11 o clock A.M.</date> at the Rooms of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Horticultural Society in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> to choose Trus<span class='line-break'></span>tees for the ensuing year, to hear the report<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Treasurer, &amp; to act on any other business <span class='line-break'> </span>which may come before the said meeting</p>
<p><date when='1837-01-30'>Jan. 30<sup>th</sup></date> <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec. Pro<sup>m</sup> Cem. Mt. Au<sup>n</sup></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062029">
<h3><a name="page-1062029">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 037)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>37</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors 1837'>Proprietors 1837</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to the above notice, which was <span class='line-break'> </span>published in <a href='/pages/subjects/58777' title='Evening Transcript'>Evening Transcript</a>, a news.<span class='line-break'> </span>paper printed in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, seven days before<span class='line-break'> </span>the said time of meeting, the Pros. of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cem<sup>y</sup> of Mount Auburn meet at the <span class='line-break'> </span>time &amp; place therein designated.<span class='line-break'> </span>In the absence of the President the <a href='/pages/subjects/56332' title='Davis, John'>Hon. John<span class='line-break'> </span>Davis</a> was chosen President pro tem.<sup>[?]</sup></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees chosen.'>Trustees chosen.</span></p>
<p>The following gentlemen were then chosen<span class='line-break'> </span>by ballot Trustees for the ensuing year.<span class='line-break'> </span>Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>George Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Benj<sup>m</sup> A. Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/57673' title='Brown, Charles'>Charles Brown</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. <span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/57597' title='Bradlee, Joseph P.'>Joseph P. Bradlee</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>Benj<sup>m</sup> R. Curtis</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurers Report.'>Treasurers Report.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'><!--B.R. Curtis-->The Secretary</a> then submitted the Treasurers <span class='line-break'> </span>report which was as follows.-</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'><!--Bond-->The Treasuerer</a> begs leave to present the following <span class='line-break'> </span>statement of receipts &amp; payments for the year <span class='line-break'> </span>ending this day.</p>
<p>There remained in his hands on 1 Jan. last  1210.74<span class='line-break'> </span>sales of 119 Lots &amp; additions to other Lots 10594.83<span class='line-break'> </span>Deduct debts incurred previous to June 30 1835  97.63<span class='line-break'> </span>Also allowed for current expenses <ins>1400.00</ins> 1497.63 -  9097.20<span class='line-break'> </span>Dividends on $2700 Bank Stock 93.00<span class='line-break'> </span>Rec.<sup>d</sup> on old debts, &amp; to credit T. <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mas. Hor. So<sup>y</sup></a>. <ins>45.40</ins> <span class='line-break'> </span>_______________________________________ |10446.34</p>
<p>He has paid<span class='line-break'> </span>To the Treas. <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mas. Hor. So<sup>y</sup></a> for the 6 mos.<span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>ending 31 Dec.</th> <th>1835</th> <th>305.34 <span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>1 yr. -- --</td> <td>1836</td> <td><ins>2274.30</ins></td> <td>2577.64</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> Note - not a transcription of the page.  The math is not laid out well. For the explanation that follows, consider line ending in "1210.74" as line 1<span class='line-break'> </span>a) 2nd number on Line 4 is the sum of line 3 and the 1st number on Line 4<span class='line-break'> </span>b) 3rd number on Line 4 is Line 2 minus the 2nd number on Line 3. What appears to be a minus sign is a delimiter between the 2nd and 3rd numbers on the line. 9097.20 is a positive number<span class='line-break'> </span>c) Line 7 (10446.34) is the sum of Line 1, the 3rd # on Line 4, Lines 5 and 6.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>

<h3><a name="page-1062030">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 038)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>38</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors 1837 '>Proprietors 1837 </span></p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>For addition to <a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>Super<sup>s</sup> House</a> &amp; repairs</th> <th>1037.71</th> <th>___<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td> "  [For] bal. labor &amp; board a/c</td> <td>833.75</td> <td>___</td> </tr> <tr><td>"   [For]   " [bal.] expense " [a/c]</td> <td><ins>1215.54</ins></td> <td>___</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>3087</td> <td>___</td> </tr> <tr><td>Deduct allowed for current expenses</td> <td><ins>1400</ins></td> <td>1687.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>For p<sup>o</sup> 12 shares <a href='/pages/subjects/58780' title='New England Bank'>N.E. Bank</a></td> <td>1257</td> <td>___</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [for] " [p<sup>o</sup>] 15 " [shares] <a href='/pages/subjects/58781' title='Hamilton Bank'> Hamilton "</a> [Bank]</td> <td>1552.50</td> <td>___</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [for] " [p<sup>o</sup>] 25 " [shares] <a href='/pages/subjects/58782' title='Warren Bank'>Warren "</a> [Bank]</td> <td><ins>2500.</ins></td> <td>5309.50</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [for] cash on hand carried to w/a</td> <td>___</td> <td><ins> 670.20</ins></td> </tr> <tr><td>___________________</td> <td>10446.34</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1836-12-31'>31. Dec 1836</date>.</p>
<p>Errors Excepted / Signed / <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Geo. Bond</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Returns by Supdt'>Returns by Sup<sup>dt</sup></span></p>
<p>Voted. To accept the above report of the Treasurer.<span class='line-break'> </span>A communication was also submitted by the Sec<sup>y</sup>.<span class='line-break'> </span>being the abstract of certain returns made by <span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent &amp; showing that during the<span class='line-break'> </span>fifth year ending 31 Dec 1836 there were <span class='line-break'> </span>175 interments<span class='line-break'> </span>19 Tombs built<span class='line-break'> </span>17 Monuments erected<span class='line-break'> </span>43 Lots turfed &amp; otherwise ornamented<span class='line-break'> </span>Whole number of interments to <date when='1836-12-31'>31 Dec 1836</date>. 465. _<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted. To adjourn -</p>
<p>A true record <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a> Sec<sup>y</sup>. Attest. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'>Trustees</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to the notice, issued by the Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees of the Pros. of the Cemy. of Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn met at the office of the Sec<sup>y</sup>. in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a><span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1837-03-27T15:30:00'>Wednesday the twenty second day of March<span class='line-break'> </span>1837 at half past three oclock P.M.</date><span class='line-break'> </span>Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/57673' title='Brown, Charles'>Brown</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/57597' title='Bradlee, Joseph P.'>Bradlee</a>,</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062031">
<h3><a name="page-1062031">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 039)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>39</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'>Trustees</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story</a>, who all signified<span class='line-break'> </span>their acceptance of the office of trustee,<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>Voted.</ins> To proceed to the choice of officers<span class='line-break'> </span>for the ensuing year &amp; that they be chosen<span class='line-break'> </span>at the same time on one ballot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Officers elected.'>Officers elected.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Mr Bond</a> having collected the votes, it <span class='line-break'> </span>appeared that The <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Hon. Joseph Story</a> had<span class='line-break'> </span>eight votes for President &amp; he was declared<span class='line-break'> </span>to be elected: that <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Geo Bond Esq<sup>r</sup></a> had the<span class='line-break'> </span>same number of votes for Treasurer &amp; he was<span class='line-break'> </span>declared to elected; that <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>Benj<sup>m</sup> R. Curtis<span class='line-break'> </span>Esq<sup>r</sup>.</a> had the same number of votes for<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary &amp; he was declared to be elected.</p>

<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Geo Bond</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles<span class='line-break'> </span>P. Curtis</a> be the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots, with the same</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on Lots see below.'><ins>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots</ins> see below.</span></p>
<p>powers as were proposed by the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>of the last year, &amp; with authority to lay out<span class='line-break'> </span>in paths, avenues &amp; lots any unoccupied<span class='line-break'> </span>portion of the grounds.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sale of Lots limited - '><ins>Sale of Lots</ins> limited - </span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That no lots shall be sold in that <span class='line-break'> </span>part of the ^<sup>grounds of the</sup> Cemetery North of <a href='/pages/subjects/57864' title='Halcyon Lake'>Garden Pond</a><span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; East of <a href='/pages/subjects/58791' title='Central Avenue'>Central Avenue</a> until the further <span class='line-break'> </span>order of the board.</p>

<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That the Treasurer be authorized to pay <span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/58793' title='Humphrey, C. R.'>C. R. Humphrey</a> twenty dollars in full for <span class='line-break'> </span>his services in the case of the care of the <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58792' title='East Gate'>Eastern Gate</a> to this date.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='S. R. Newell Lot offered to him'><a href='/pages/subjects/58794' title='Newell, Samuel R.'>S. R. Newell</a> Lot offered to him</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That a Lot in the Cemetery be offered <span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/58794' title='Newell, Samuel R.'>Mr S. R. Newell</a> for his services to the <span class='line-break'> </span>present time in auditing accounts &amp; to be <span class='line-break'> </span>selected by him from the Lots now laid <span class='line-break'> </span>out.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trespassers to be notified- '>Trespassers to be notified- </span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'><!--B.R. Curtis-->the Secretary</a> give notice to <span class='line-break'> </span>all persons who have trespassed on the <span class='line-break'> </span>lands of the Proprietors by enclosing <span class='line-break'> </span>more land in their Lots in the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>than belong to them,  to pay for the same <span class='line-break'> </span>or reduce their enclosures, &amp; that the</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Committee on Lots'>Committee on Lots</span></p>
<p>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots have power to arrange<span class='line-break'> </span>individual cases as they shall think <span class='line-break'> </span>just.</p>
<p>Voted to adjourn.</p>
<p>A true record attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B<sup>m</sup> R. Curtis</a>, Sec<sup>y</sup></p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'><ins>Trustees.</ins></span></p>
<p>The Trustees of the Proprietors of the Cem<sup>y</sup>.<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn met, pursuant to <span class='line-break'> </span>notice from the Secretary at the <a href='/pages/subjects/58795' title='Porters Lodge'>Porters<span class='line-break'> </span>Lodge</a> in the Cem<sup>y</sup>. on <date when='1838-04-12'>Thursday the <span class='line-break'> </span>the 12<sup>th</sup> day of April 1838</date>.  Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P Curtis</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>, Read &amp;</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Premium'><ins>Premium</ins></span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins>  That <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to offer a premium of Fifty Dollars <span class='line-break'> </span>for the best design of a monument.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trees not  to be exposed'><ins>Trees not  to be exposed</ins></span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins>  That <a href='/pages/subjects/54346' title='Russell, James W.'><!--Russell-->the Superintendent</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/56692' title='Wadsworth, Alexander'><!--Wadsworth-->the <span class='line-break'> </span>Surveyor</a> of the Cem<sup>y</sup>. be instructed not <span class='line-break'> </span>to lay out any Lot in such a situation <span class='line-break'> </span>that the digging of graves &amp; the erecting <span class='line-break'> </span>of a Tomb thereon would be injurious<span class='line-break'> </span>to any valuable tree _</p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> To adjourn to the Treasurers office<span class='line-break'> </span>at <date when='1836-04-16T15:00:00'>three oclock P.M. on Monday the 16<sup>th</sup> <span class='line-break'> </span>instant</date>.</p>
<p>The Trustees met pursuant to the above <span class='line-break'> </span>mentioned adjournment.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Irregular Lots.'><ins>Irregular Lots.</ins></span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That the Comm<sup>ee</sup> on Lots be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to sell such irregular peices of ground <span class='line-break'> </span>as cannot be laid out in Lots of 300 feet<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; as it may not be expendient to reserve for <span class='line-break'> </span>public monuments, at their discretion <span class='line-break'> </span>provided however that the charge per <span class='line-break'> </span>foot shall not be less than  26 2/3 cents <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; the sum of 20 dollars for the <span class='line-break'> </span>right of selection.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062038">
<h3><a name="page-1062038">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 046)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>46</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Receiving Tomb.'><a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Receiving Tomb</a>.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>make such arrangements in regard to <span class='line-break'> </span>the removal of bodies from the <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Receiving <span class='line-break'> </span>Tomb</a> as he shall think best.</p>
<p>Present at this adjourned meeting Mess<sup>rs</sup><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Reed</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story</a>.</p>
<p>A True Record attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B<sup>n</sup> R. Curtis</a> Secy.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'>Trustees</span></p>
<p>The Trustees of the Proprietors of the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>met pursuant to notice, at the house <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Benj<sup>n</sup> A. Gould Esqr</a> on the <date when='1838-06-07T20:00:00'>thursday the seventh <span class='line-break'> </span>day of June 1838 at 8 oclock P.M.</date></p>
<p>Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Rev. Mr. Stearns'><a href='/pages/subjects/58796' title='Stearns, Rev. Mr.'>Rev. Mr. Stearns</a></span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That the Trustees do not feel at <span class='line-break'> </span>liberty to comply with the request of <span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/58796' title='Stearns, Rev. Mr.'>Rev<sup>d</sup> Mr Stearns</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/64864' title='Cambridgeport, MA'>Cambridge Port</a> to <span class='line-break'> </span>give a Lot in the Cem<sup>y</sup>. for the purpose <span class='line-break'> </span>by him designated</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprs of small lots.'>Prop<sup>rs</sup> of small lots.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That the Pros. of Lots of less than three<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred feet in the  Cemetery may <span class='line-break'> </span>have the privilege of admission to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery on the same terms as <span class='line-break'> </span>other proprietors.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trees.'>Trees.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins>  That Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a><span class='line-break'> </span>be a com<sup>ee</sup> to enquire  &amp; report whether <span class='line-break'> </span>any trees have been improperly removed<span class='line-break'> </span>from the Cemetery by any person.</p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> To adjourn.  A True record<span class='line-break'> </span>attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B<sup>n</sup> R. Curtis</a> Secy.</p>

<p>47</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'>Trustees</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to the notice issued by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary the Trustees of the Pros. of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cem<sup>y</sup> of Mount Auburn met <span class='line-break'> </span>at the House of <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Geo. Bond Esq<sup>r</sup></a> on <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1838-12-13T19:00:00'>Thursday the 13<sup>th</sup> day of December <span class='line-break'> </span>1838 at 7 oclock P. M.</date>  Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer.'>Treasurer.</span></p>
<p>Whereas in <date when='1837-04'>April 1837</date> <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'><!--Bond-->the treasurer</a> trans<span class='line-break'></span>ferred to himself as Treasurer three<span class='line-break'> </span>shares in the <a href='/pages/subjects/58798' title='Amoskeag Manufacturing Co.'>Amoskeag Manufactur<sup>g</sup> <span class='line-break'> </span>Co.</a> as collateral security for a sum <span class='line-break'> </span>of money then due from him to <span class='line-break'> </span>the said Proprietor, of the Cem<sup>y</sup> of Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn, &amp; being in the hands of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Mercantile firm of <a href='/pages/subjects/58799' title='Whitwell, Bond, &amp; Co.'>Whitwell Bond <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; Company</a> which sum of money has <span class='line-break'> </span>now been paid</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> That the retransfer by <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>of the said shares be &amp; the same is <span class='line-break'> </span>hereby confirmed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monument to Thos G. Fessenden'>Monument to <a href='/pages/subjects/58800' title='Fessenden, Thomas Green'>Thos G. Fessenden</a></span></p>
<p>Whereas certain members of the <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass<sup>tts</sup> Hor<sup>l</sup> Society</a> &amp; others are desirious to <span class='line-break'> </span>erect a monument in the Cemetery to<span class='line-break'> </span>the memory of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/58800' title='Fessenden, Thomas Green'>Thomas G. Fessenden</a><span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; whereas the Members of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass. Hor<span class='line-break'> </span>Society</a> are understood to be desirous <span class='line-break'> </span>that a Lot in the Cem<sup>y</sup> should be <span class='line-break'> </span>granted for that purpose,</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>  That the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots be authorized</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062040">
<h3><a name="page-1062040">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 048)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>48</p>
<p>to assign a Lot for the erection of such <span class='line-break'> </span>a monument</p>
<p>The following motion was made<span class='line-break'> </span>by <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Mr Parker</a> -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gifts of Lots prohibited - see next page'>Gifts of Lots prohibited - see next page</span></p>
<p>Whereas the condition of the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>is now such as to render it inexpedi<span class='line-break'></span>ent to make gifts of any lands to <span class='line-break'> </span>induce persons to erect monuments <span class='line-break'> </span>thereon to public or distinguished<span class='line-break'> </span>individuals, therefore voted that <span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation will make no further <span class='line-break'> </span>gifts of land for such purposes.<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>Voted.</ins> To lay this motion on the <span class='line-break'> </span>Table.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Brattle Square Society.'><a href='/pages/subjects/58801' title='Brattle Square Society'>Brattle Square Society</a>.</span></p>
<p>An application of <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Mr Bond</a> in behalf <span class='line-break'> </span>of a committee of the <a href='/pages/subjects/58801' title='Brattle Square Society'>Society in Brattle <span class='line-break'> </span>Square</a> was also laid on the table.</p>
<p>A true record</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B<sup>m</sup> R Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec<sup>y</sup></p>
<p>Pursuant to notice issued by the Secretary <span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees of the Pro<sup>s</sup> of the Cem<sup>y</sup> of Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn met at the office of the Secre<span class='line-break'> </span>tary on <del>Friday</del> <date when='1838-12-22'>^<sup>Saturday</sup> the 22<sup>nd</sup> day of December <span class='line-break'> </span>1838.</date>  Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>, &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Reed</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>The following preamble &amp; vote were <span class='line-break'> </span>passed.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1062041">
<h3><a name="page-1062041">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 049)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>49</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monuments To Dr. Bowditch and Noah Worcester'>Monuments To <a href='/pages/subjects/58802' title='Bowditch Statue'>Dr. Bowditch</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/58803' title='Worcester, Noah'>Noah Worcester</a></span></p>
<p>Whereas at a meeting of the Trustees held <span class='line-break'> </span>at the <a href='/pages/subjects/58795' title='Porters Lodge'>Porters Lodge</a> in the Cem<sup>y</sup>. on the <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1838-04-12'>12<sup>th</sup> day of April 1838</date> the assent of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was obtained to the appropria<span class='line-break'></span>tion of a Lot in the Cem<sup>y</sup>. for the erection <span class='line-break'> </span>of a <a href='/pages/subjects/58802' title='Bowditch Statue'>monument to Dr. Bowditch</a> &amp; of<span class='line-break'> </span>another Lot to the erection of a Monu<span class='line-break'></span>ment to the <a href='/pages/subjects/58803' title='Worcester, Noah'>Rev.<sup>d</sup> Noah Worcester</a></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That the Comm<sup>ee</sup> on Lots are<span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to assign Lots for those<span class='line-break'> </span>purposes.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Grants of Lots. none gratuitous'>Grants of Lots. none gratuitous</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> To take up <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Mr Parkers</a> motion <span class='line-break'> </span>made &amp; laid on the table at the <span class='line-break'> </span>last meeting</p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> To amend the said motion  by <span class='line-break'> </span>striking out the word "gifts" &amp; inserting <span class='line-break'> </span>"gratuitous appropriations."_<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>Voted.</ins> To pass the motion.<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>Voted.</ins> To take up <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Mr Bond's</a> application <span class='line-break'> </span>made at the last meeting which <span class='line-break'> </span>was as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monument to J.S. Buckminster'>Monument to <a href='/pages/subjects/58804' title='Buckminster, Joseph S.'>J.S. Buckminster</a></span></p>
<p>To the Trustees of the Pros. of Mt. Aub<sup>rn</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>Gentlemen.  The undersigned in <span class='line-break'> </span>behalf of a Comm<sup>ee</sup> appointed by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Standing Com<sup>ee</sup> of the <a href='/pages/subjects/58801' title='Brattle Square Society'>Society in Brattle <span class='line-break'> </span>Square</a> propose to erect a monument <span class='line-break'> </span>or Cenotaph at Mount Auburn to the <span class='line-break'> </span>memory of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/58804' title='Buckminster, Joseph S.'>Joseph S. Buckminster</a><span class='line-break'> </span>The funds will be raised by subscrip<span class='line-break'></span>tion among the Parishioners &amp; other friends<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>

<p>of Mr B &amp; the com<sup>ee</sup> ask your aid so far as <span class='line-break'> </span>to grant a suitable Lot, provided a structure <span class='line-break'> </span>will be raised that will be an ornament <span class='line-break'> </span>to the grounds &amp; the com<sup>ee</sup> agree to execute<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trust committed to them in a manner<span class='line-break'> </span>satisfactory to your Board<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1838-12-12'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 12. 1838</date>     Signed Yr Obt Servt<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Geo Bond</a></p>

Curtis</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Reed</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> was chosen President Pro tem<sup>e</sup>.</p>

<p>expenditure for labor on the grounds, and added to the "<span class='line-break'> </span>"Proprietors Fund" the gross amount of sales of lots (after<span class='line-break'> </span>deducting the payment made to the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a>)<span class='line-break'> </span>and the income arising from investments. -</p>
<p>It in consequence appears that this fund is increased the <span class='line-break'> </span>last year by the sum of $4088.98, while only $2527.20 are<span class='line-break'> </span>added to the available means of the Corporation.</p>
<p>The amount in the Treasury with the collection of the <span class='line-break'> </span>present month will be adequate to meet the remaining<span class='line-break'> </span>assessments payable on the four shares in the <a href='/pages/subjects/58891' title='Stark Mills'>Stark Mills</a>.</p>
<p>The sum invested when these ass'ts are paid, will amount <span class='line-break'> </span>to Twelve thousand two hundred dollars. -</p>
<p>The number of lots sold during the year is forty six<span class='line-break'> </span>and the whole number sold is Six hundred thirty four.<span class='line-break'> </span>The following statement reported by the Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>shows the number of Interments &amp; the improvements <span class='line-break'> </span>made during the year &amp; also in the seven years since<span class='line-break'> </span>the consecration of the Cemetery, to wit.</p>

<p><date when='1839-01-17'>January 17, 1839</date></p>

M.</date> at the Room of the Horticultural Society <span class='line-break'> </span>in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> to make choice of a board of Trustees to act<span class='line-break'> </span>on the report of the Treasurer, and to transact any other <span class='line-break'> </span>business which may legally come before the said meeting.</p>

<p>Pursuant to the above notice the Proprietors of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cem<sup>y</sup>. of Mount Auburn met at the time &amp; place<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; place mentioned in the said notice, which <span class='line-break'> </span>was published in one or more newspapers <span class='line-break'> </span>printed in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> seven days before the <span class='line-break'> </span>time of meeting.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notice to that effect issued<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Secretary, the Trustees of the Pros.<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>met at the Secretary's office on <date when='1839-05-22T15:30:00'>Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>the 22<sup>d</sup> day of May 1839 at half past three<span class='line-break'> </span>oclock P.M.</date>  Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>, &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Pres &amp;c chosen'>Pres &amp;c chosen</span></p>
<p>The Trustees proceeded to choose by <span class='line-break'> </span>ballot a President, Treasurer &amp; Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='President'>President</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Hon. Joseph Story</a> was chosen President <span class='line-break'> </span>having received a unanimous vote for <span class='line-break'> </span>that office.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer.'>Treasurer.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Geo. Bond Esq<sup>r</sup></a> was chosen Treasurer<span class='line-break'> </span>having rec<sup>d</sup> a unanimous vote for <span class='line-break'> </span>that office</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary_'>Secretary_</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> was chosen Secretary <span class='line-break'> </span>having rec<sup>d</sup> a unanimous vote for <span class='line-break'> </span>that office</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on Lots.'>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That the same Gentlemen with the <span class='line-break'> </span>same authority as during the last <span class='line-break'> </span>year be a Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gate Keeper &amp; Admission to Grounds _'>Gate Keeper &amp; Admission to Grounds _</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> that said Com<sup>ee</sup> be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to give certain notices in regards <span class='line-break'> </span>to the admission to the grounds &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>removal of Trees &amp; that they be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to employ a Gate Keeper</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Hedge to be removed.'>Hedge to be removed.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> that the Secretary be directed <span class='line-break'> </span>to address to <a href='/pages/subjects/58545' title='Winship, Jonathan, III'>Mr Winship</a> a Letter</p>
</div>
</div>

<p>At a meeting of the Trustees of the Pros. <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cem<sup>y</sup> of Mount Auburn held <span class='line-break'> </span>at the office of the Secretary on thurs<span class='line-break'> </span>day the <date when='1839-05-30T15:30:00'>30<sup>th</sup> day of May 1839 at 1/2 past <span class='line-break'> </span>3 oclock P.M.</date> pursuant to notice <span class='line-break'> </span>to that that effect issued by him _<span class='line-break'> </span>Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a>  <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. <span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B R Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. <p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Condition in Deeds.'>Condition in Deeds.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> That the following condition <span class='line-break'> </span>be hereafter inserted in the <span class='line-break'> </span>deeds of Lots in the Cemetery.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fences'>Fences</span></p>
<p>"That no fence shall from time <span class='line-break'> </span>to time or at any time be placed <span class='line-break'> </span>or erected in or around the said <span class='line-break'> </span>Lot, the materials &amp; design of <span class='line-break'> </span>which shall not first have been <span class='line-break'> </span>approved of by the Trustees or a <span class='line-break'> </span>committee of them.</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>  That the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots be <span class='line-break'> </span>the Com<sup>ee</sup> to approve of the materials<span class='line-break'> </span>and design of fences.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gate. Keeper. '>Gate. Keeper. </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>M<sup>r</sup> C. P. Curtis</a>, in behalf of the Com<sup>ee</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots reported: That the Com<sup>ee</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>had employed <a href='/pages/subjects/58903' title='Hyde, Jonathan'>Jonathan Hyde</a> as <span class='line-break'> </span>a Gatekeeper &amp; that they recommend<span class='line-break'> </span>that a grant of fifty dollars be made</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mr. Shane grant to _ '><a href='/pages/subjects/58904' title='Shane, Mr.'>Mr. Shane</a> grant to _ </span></p>

<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That this report be accepted &amp; the<span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer authorized to pay to <a href='/pages/subjects/58904' title='Shane, Mr.'>M<sup>r</sup> Shane</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>the sum of fifty dollars.</p>

<p>Pursuant to a notice issued by the Secretary <span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees of the Proprietors of the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn met at the office of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Secretary in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> on the <date when='1840-02-03'>first Mon<span class='line-break'></span>day, being the third day of February<span class='line-break'> </span>in the year eighteen hundred &amp; forty</date><span class='line-break'> </span>Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/58485' title='Armstrong, Samuel T.'>Armstrong</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. <p>Pursuant to notice published by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary in the <a href='/pages/subjects/58551' title='Boston Daily Advertiser'>Boston Daily Adver<span class='line-break'></span>tiser</a> &amp; other newspapers printed<span class='line-break'> </span>in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> more than five days <span class='line-break'> </span>before the time of meeting, the Pro<span class='line-break'></span>prietors of the Cemetery of Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn met at the Secretarys office<span class='line-break'> </span>in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> on <date when='1840-02-03'>Monday the third<span class='line-break'> </span>day of February A. D. 1840</date>.<span class='line-break'> </span>The President being absent <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> -<span class='line-break'> </span>was chosen Chairman.<span class='line-break'> </span>The Secretary being absent <a href='/pages/subjects/54842' title='Curtis, George T.'>George T. <span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a> was chosen Secretary pro<span class='line-break'> </span>tempore.</p>
<p>The report of the Treasurer which<span class='line-break'> </span>is recorded above was read <span class='line-break'> </span>accepted &amp; ordered to be recorded</p>

<p>Pursuant to notice issued by the Secretary <span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees of the Proprietors of the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn met at the office of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Secretary on <date when='1840-05-26T10:00:00'>Saturday the 23<sup>d</sup> day of <span class='line-break'> </span>May 1840 at 10 oclock A.
