<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a> President<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>George Bond</a> Treasurer<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a> Secretary</p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That the same gentlemen with <span class='line-break'> </span>the same authority as during the last <span class='line-break'> </span>year, be the Comm<sup>ee</sup> on Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tickets'>Tickets</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'><!--B.R. Curtis-->the Secretary</a> be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to give tickets to those who have not<span class='line-break'> </span>received them or have lost them on a <span class='line-break'> </span>written application stating the fact<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; promising to return the other tickets <span class='line-break'> </span>if found or received.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Special Tickets'>Special Tickets</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins>  That the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots be authori<span class='line-break'></span>zed to act on all special applications <span class='line-break'> </span>for tickets</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tombs'>Tombs</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots be charged <span class='line-break'> </span>with the duty of preventing the Construction <span class='line-break'> </span>of any tomb without its being so secured <span class='line-break'> </span>as to prevent the escape of effluvia from <span class='line-break'> </span>within &amp; that those already built be so <span class='line-break'> </span>secured if necessary.  Voted to adjourn</p>

<p>Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. <p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gate way.'><a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>Gate way</a>.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> _  That the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots be authorized to cause <span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>Gate_way</a> to be repainted in such manner as they <span class='line-break'> </span>may deem expedient.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='New Lots.'>New Lots.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> That the subject of a new survey &amp; the laying <span class='line-break'> </span>out of all the Lots be referred to the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>to report to a future meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ponds'>Ponds</span></p>

<p>Voted to adjourn</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors 1841'>Proprietors 1841</span></p>
<p>Whereas by accident &amp; mistake, the annual meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>can not be held on the first Monday of Febuary <span class='line-break'> </span>pursuant to the bye law of the Corporation. _</p>
<p>And whereas the Trustees are in such case autho<span class='line-break'></span>rized to call another annual meeting;</p>
<p>Now we the <span class='line-break'> </span>subscribers Trustees of the said Corporation, do hereby<span class='line-break'> </span>call such annual meeting on the <ins>second</ins> Monday <span class='line-break'> </span>of Febuary next, at the office of the Secretary at<span class='line-break'> </span>four oclock PM. &amp; we direct <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'><!--B.R. Curtis-->the Secretary</a> to give<span class='line-break'> </span></p>

<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1841-01-28'>Jan<sup>y</sup> 28. 1841</date>. <span class='line-break'> </span>signed <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B<sup>m</sup> R Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>BA Gould</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>George Bond</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58485' title='Armstrong, Samuel T.'>Sam T. Armstrong</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a></p>
<p>Pursuant to the above requisition the Secretary of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn pub<span class='line-break'></span>lished, in the <a href='/pages/subjects/58551' title='Boston Daily Advertiser'>Boston Daily Advertizer</a> &amp; other news<span class='line-break'></span>papers more than 7 days before the <date when='1841-02-08'>8<sup>th</sup> of Febuary (sic)<span class='line-break'> </span>1841</date>, the following notice.</p>
<p>Mount Auburn Cemetery</p>
<p>The Annual Meeting of the Proprietors of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn, will be held at the office of <span class='line-break'> </span>the subscriber N<sup>o</sup> 16 Court Street, <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, on <date when='1841-02-08T16:00:00'>Monday<span class='line-break'> </span>the eighth day of Febuary (sic) next at 4 oclk P.M.</date> to <span class='line-break'> </span>make choice of a Board of Trustees, to act on the <span class='line-break'> </span>report of the Treasurer, and to transact any other<span class='line-break'> </span>business which may legally come before said<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting. _</p>
<p><date when='1841-01-27'>Jan<sup>y</sup> 27./ 41 [1841]</date> signed  <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>BR. Curtis</a>. Sec<sup>y</sup></p>
<p>Pursuant to the above notice the Proprietors of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery of Mount Auburn met at the time &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>place therein designated &amp; the President being absent<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Mr George Bond</a> was chosen chairman of the meeting</p>
<p>The report of the Treasuerer was then read<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>Voted</ins> to accept the same &amp; that it be recorded, &amp;</p>
</div>
</div>

<p>68</p>
<p>&amp; that <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> be requested to publish in the <span class='line-break'> </span>newspapers such portions thereof as he thinks fit</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustess [N]umber of.'>Trustess [N]umber of.</span></p>

<p>The following named gentlemen were then<span class='line-break'> </span>chosen by ballot Trustees for the year ensuing, vis<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>George Bond</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Martin<span class='line-break'> </span>Brimmer</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. <p><ins>Voted</ins> To adjourn</p>
<p>A true record</p>
<p>attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a> Secretary</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Feby. 22. 1841_'>Trustees. <date when='1841-02-22'>Feby. 22. 1841</date>_</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notice issued by the Secretary the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn met at the office of the Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1841-02-22T16:00:00'>the twenty second day of Febuary in the year<span class='line-break'> </span>eighteen hundred &amp; forty one at 4 oclock P.M.</date></p>
<p>Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. <p><a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Hon Joseph Story</a> - Pres.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>George Bond</a> - Treas.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a> - Secy -</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> That Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> be a commi<span class='line-break'></span>tee  to consider whether any plan can be adopted </p>

<div class="page-content">
<p>69</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendents accounts _ '>Superintendents accounts _ </span></p>
<p>more effectually to protect the interests of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Pros. in the matter of the adjustment<span class='line-break'> </span>of the superintendants accounts. _</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. To adjourn to Tuesday next at 4 oclk.</p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts<span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk ss <date when='1841-02-23'>Feby 23, 1841</date>. Then personally appeared <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a> above named &amp; made oath<span class='line-break'> </span>that he would faithfully perform the<span class='line-break'> </span>duties of Secretary of the Proprietors of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn</p>
<p>Before me, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a>, Jus peace<span class='line-break'> </span>a true record attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>BR. Curtis</a> Sec<sup>y</sup>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'>Trustees</span></p>
<p>The Trustees of the Proprietors of Mount Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery met pursuant to the adjournment, on<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1841-03-02T16:00:00'>Tuesday March 2<sup>d</sup> 1841 at 4 oclk P.M.</date> at the office<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Secretary.-</p>
<p>Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>&amp; Read.â€”</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent.'>Superintendent.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> That whereas, the entire compensation of <span class='line-break'> </span>the superintendant is designed to be a salary of<span class='line-break'> </span>$600 per ann<sup>m</sup> &amp; the occupancy of the <a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>Cottage</a> together<span class='line-break'> </span>with sufficient ground to cultivate garden vegeta<span class='line-break'></span>bles for the use of his family. And whereas it <span class='line-break'> </span>is needful that the laborers on the Cemetary should<span class='line-break'> </span>be boarded in his family therefore</p>
<p>Voted, that in<span class='line-break'> </span>future such rate of board only shall be charged _</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062062">
<h3><a name="page-1062062">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 070)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>70</p>
<p>ble as the trustees shall from time to time direct. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Laborers board.'>Laborers board.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. That the price of board of the laborers <span class='line-break'> </span>shall be two dollars &amp; fifty cents per week, until <span class='line-break'> </span>the further order of the board.</p>
<p>The Trustees then <span class='line-break'> </span>proceeded to the choice of a Superintendant by <span class='line-break'> </span>ballot &amp; it appeared that the whole number of<span class='line-break'> </span>ballots was five, all of which were for <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Rufus<span class='line-break'> </span>Howe</a>. _ . _</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a> having retired</p>
<p>Voted that <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Mr. Bond</a> be a Com<sup>ee</sup> to prepare regulations for <span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendant. _</p>
<p>Voted. To adjourn to Tuesday next<span class='line-break'> </span>at 4 ock P.M.</p>
<p>A true record</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a> Sec<sup>y</sup>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>The Trustees of the Proprietors of the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn met pursuant to the adjourn<span class='line-break'></span>ment, at the office of the Secretary on <date when='1841-03-09T16:00:00'>Tuesday<span class='line-break'> </span>March 9<sup>th</sup> 1841, at 4 oclock P.M.</date></p>
<p>Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Committee on Lots.'>Committee on Lots.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. That the same gentlemen with the same<span class='line-break'> </span>powers as during the last year be the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Mr Bond</a> made the following report which was <span class='line-break'> </span>accepted. _</p>
</div>

<div id="page-1062063">
<h3><a name="page-1062063">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 071)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>71</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent&apos;s duties'>Superintendent's duties</span></p>
<p>The Committee appointed for the purpose begs<span class='line-break'> </span>leave to report the following abstract of the <span class='line-break'> </span>duties of the Superintendent.</p>
<p>He is expected to <span class='line-break'> </span>devote his whole time to the duties of his office<span class='line-break'> </span>He is charged with the whole care of the grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>is to suffer no waste or strip to be made to see<span class='line-break'> </span>that all persons in the employ of the Proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>faithfully perform their duties -- that good order is <span class='line-break'> </span>preserved throughout the Cemetery by Visitors &amp; <span class='line-break'> </span>others &amp; to report to the Trustees all violations of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Rules &amp; Regulations,  [He is personally responsi<span class='line-break'></span>ble for the preservation of the trees &amp; is to allow none <span class='line-break'> </span>to be cut down or removed but with the approba<span class='line-break'></span>tion of the Committee on lots, and the wood from <span class='line-break'> </span>all which may be cut down or trimmed shall be <span class='line-break'> </span>accounted for to the Treasurer.]  He is to keep regular <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; accurate records of all Interments, of Monuments<span class='line-break'> </span>erected &amp; lots improved by being inclosed, sodded<span class='line-break'> </span>or otherwise; and also of all moneys disbursed <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; of all moneys received by him, whether for fees <span class='line-break'> </span>improvement of lots, sales of brush or wood, for <span class='line-break'> </span>plants or other articles furnished, or services rendered<span class='line-break'> </span>said accounts to be kept in the books provided <span class='line-break'> </span>for the purpose.  He is on the first day of Jan<sup>y</sup>, <span class='line-break'> </span>April, July &amp; October, or oftner [sic] if thereto required<span class='line-break'> </span>to render to the Treasurer copies of Said accounts <span class='line-break'> </span>and pay over to him all moneys remaining in <span class='line-break'> </span>his hands,  He is to lodge &amp; board in his family<span class='line-break'> </span>such numbers of laborers as may be employed<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062064">
<h3><a name="page-1062064">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 072)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>72</p>
<p>in the Cemetery &amp; at such rate of board as the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees may from time to time fix &amp; determine<span class='line-break'> </span>He is also to perform such other acts &amp; things <span class='line-break'> </span>as the Trustees may from time to time direct <span class='line-break'> </span>without ^<sup>other</sup> compensation than his Salary of $600<span class='line-break'> </span>per annum an (sic) the use of the <a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>Cottage</a>, with <span class='line-break'> </span>sufficient ground for raising garden vegetables<span class='line-break'> </span>for his family.</p>
<p>(Signed)  <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Geo Bond</a><span class='line-break'> </span>A true record attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> Secy.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'>Trustees</span></p>
<p>A Meeting of the Trustees of the Cemetery of Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn was held on <date when='1841-06-05'>5 June 1841</date>, at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. <span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a> in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>; present <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>George Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob <span class='line-break'> </span>Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Benj A. Gould</a>  &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a>, notice having <span class='line-break'> </span>been sent to all the Trustees, in the usual manner;<span class='line-break'> </span>The Secretary being absent <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a> was <span class='line-break'> </span>chosen Secretary pro tempore.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tombs.'>Tombs.</span></p>
<p>It was voted &amp; ordered <span class='line-break'> </span>that in all the deeds of lots which shall hereafter <span class='line-break'> </span>be granted by the Corporation it shall be provided as <span class='line-break'> </span>a condition of the grant, that no Tomb shall be construc<span class='line-break'></span>ted within the bounds of the Cemetery except in  or <span class='line-break'> </span>upon the lots situated, in such parts of the grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>as shall be designated, by the Trustees for that purpose,<span class='line-break'> </span>and no Proprietor shall suffer the remains of any<span class='line-break'> </span>person to be deposited in a Tomb so authorized, <span class='line-break'> </span>for hire.</p>
<p>It was voted &amp; ordered that in all the </p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062065">
<h3><a name="page-1062065">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 073)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>73</p>
<p>deeds of lots which shall hereafter be granted, by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation in lieu of the fourth condition contained<span class='line-break'> </span>in the present form of Deeds, the following shall<span class='line-break'> </span>be inserted as a condition of the grant; --</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Landmarks.'>Landmarks.</span></p>
<p>That the <span class='line-break'> </span>Propr<sup>r</sup> of the said lot of land shall erect at his or <span class='line-break'> </span>her own expense, suitable land marks of stones <span class='line-break'> </span>or iron at the corners thereof, and shall also cause <span class='line-break'> </span>the number thereof to be legibly &amp; permanently marked<span class='line-break'> </span>on the premises, and if the Prop<sup>rs</sup> shall omit for <span class='line-break'> </span>thirty days after the notice, to erect such landmarks <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; mark the number, the Trustees shall have authority <span class='line-break'> </span>to cause the same to be done, at the expense of <span class='line-break'> </span>said Proprietor.  --  .</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Deeds.'>Deeds.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That the Secretary cause deeds <span class='line-break'> </span>to be prepared &amp; printed in conformity with the <span class='line-break'> </span>preceding votes.  --</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Watchman.'>Watchman.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins>  That the Committee on Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>cause a suitable person to be employed to watch <span class='line-break'> </span>the conduct of visitors &amp; prevent &amp; suppress nuisances<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; improper practices within the grounds of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation. --</p>

<div id="page-1062066">
<h3><a name="page-1062066">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 074)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>74</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'>Trustees</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to the notice issued by the Secy, the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn, met at the Office of the Secretary on <date when='1841-12-24T16:00:00'>Friday <span class='line-break'> </span>the 24<sup>th</sup> day of December 1841. at 4 oclock P.M.</date></p>
<p>Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>George Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. <span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>.</p>
<p>In the absence of the <span class='line-break'> </span>President, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Mr Parker</a> was chosen to preside at <span class='line-break'> </span>this meeting.</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> That <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Mr. Bond</a> have autho<span class='line-break'></span>rity to allow <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Howe</a> for board of laborers at <span class='line-break'> </span>the rate of $2.75 per week if he shall see fit so <span class='line-break'> </span>to do.  _</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> To adjourn</p>
<p>A true record</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a>, Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062067">
<h3><a name="page-1062067">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 075)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>75</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors 1842.'>Proprietors 1842.</span></p>
<p>Mount Auburn Cemetery.   The annual <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn will be held on <date when='1842-02-07T11:00:00'>Monday<span class='line-break'> </span>the 7<sup>th</sup> day of February, 1842 at 11 oclock A. M. </date><span class='line-break'> </span>at the office of the Subscriber to choose Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>for the ensuing year, to hear the Report of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Treasurer, and to act upon any other <span class='line-break'> </span>business which may come before the Said <span class='line-break'> </span>Meeting. _      Signed <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> Sec<sup>y</sup></p>
<p>Pursuant to the above notice a meeting of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn was held at the time &amp;  place therein<span class='line-break'> </span>designated.</p>
<p>In the absence of the President<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59105' title='Rollins, William'>W<sup>m</sup> Rollins Esq<sup>r</sup></a> was chosen chairman.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees chosen _'>Trustees chosen _</span></p>
<p>The following named gentlemen <span class='line-break'> </span>were then chosen by ballot, Trustees of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Prop<sup>rs</sup> of the Cem<sup>y</sup> of Mount Auburn</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Storey</a>.- <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>George Bond</a>. - <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob<span class='line-break'> </span>Bigelow</a>  <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Martin Brimmer</a>,  <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R.  Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B. A. Gould</a>, _ <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a>.</p>
<p>The Report of the Treasurer <span class='line-break'> </span>having been read it was</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. That <span class='line-break'> </span>the same be accepted &amp; that <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'><!--B.R. Curtis-->the Secretary</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>cause the same to be recorded.  _</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> To adjourn</p>
<p>A true record attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> Sec<sup>y</sup>.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p>78</p>
<p>This certifies that I have examined the Treasurers Ac<del>cou</del><span class='line-break'> </span>counts for the year past &amp; find them well vouched &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>correctly cast, that the balance in his hands is <span class='line-break'> </span>Two thousand twenty four dollars 74/100 &amp; that he exhibited<span class='line-break'> </span>to me the evidence of stocks belonging to the Corora<span class='line-break'></span>tion as appears by the preceeding Trial Balance of <span class='line-break'> </span>his Books.</p>
<p>Signed  <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B. A. Gould</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Aud<sup>r</sup> of acct<sup>s</sup> to Prop<sup>s</sup> of M<sup>t</sup> Auburn</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1842-01-10'>10 January 1842</date><span class='line-break'> </span>A true record attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> Secy.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'><ins>Trustees</ins></span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notice issued by the Secre<span class='line-break'></span>tary the Trustees of the Proprietors of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn met at <span class='line-break'> </span>the office of the Secretary on <date when='1842-06-06T09:00:00'>Monday <span class='line-break'> </span>the 6<sup>th</sup> day of June 1842 at 9 oclock<span class='line-break'> </span>A. M.</date> <span class='line-break'> </span>Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. <span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B. A. Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Issac Parker</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>, <span class='line-break'> </span>Read  &amp;</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Officers chosen.'>Officers chosen.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> &amp; chose by ballot <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a><span class='line-break'> </span>President, <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>George W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a> Treasurer,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk ss  Jun 6<sup>th</sup> 1842  Personally appeared <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. <span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a> &amp; made oath that he would faithfully <span class='line-break'> </span>perform the duties of Sec<sup>y</sup>. of the Pros. of the Cem<sup>y</sup> of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn  Before me  <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. <div id="page-1062071">
<h3><a name="page-1062071">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 079)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>79</p>
<p><span class='depth2' depth='2' title='Trustees'>Trustees</span></p>
<p><ins> Voted. </ins> That the compensation of the Treasurer<span class='line-break'> </span>be a commission of two &amp; one half per cent on<span class='line-break'> </span>the sales of lots, to commence on the <date when='1842-06-01'>first<span class='line-break'> </span>day of June current</date></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurers Duties'>Treasurers Duties</span></p>
<p><ins> Voted. </ins> That the treasurer keep the funds<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation deposited in some<span class='line-break'> </span>proper Bank to the credit of the corpora<span class='line-break'> </span>tion &amp; that he be authorized to draw<span class='line-break'> </span>checks as Treasurer against it until<span class='line-break'> </span>the further order of the board</p>
<p><ins> Voted. </ins> That the Treasurer give bond <span class='line-break'> </span>with surety in the sum of three thousand<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars to be approved by the board</p>
<p><ins> Voted. </ins>  That <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Mr Gould</a> be a comm<sup>ee</sup> <span class='line-break'> </span>to settle the accounts of <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'><!--Bond-->the late<span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer</a></p>
<p><ins> Voted. </ins> That Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> be a<span class='line-break'> </span>comm<sup>ee</sup> of finance to direct the Treasurer<span class='line-break'> </span>as to all investments &amp; reinvestments &amp; the<span class='line-break'> </span>management of the funds -- provided <span class='line-break'> </span>that no change shall be made in <span class='line-break'> </span>any investment without the consent<span class='line-break'> </span>of the board</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Col. Bigelow'><a href='/pages/subjects/59178' title='Bigelow, Col.'>Col. Bigelow</a></span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That the request of <a href='/pages/subjects/59178' title='Bigelow, Col.'>Col. Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span>be granted with the understanding<span class='line-break'> </span>that a proper guard be kept so as<span class='line-break'> </span>to exclude all vehicles except those<span class='line-break'> </span>belonging to the escort.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on Lots'>Comee on Lots</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span>be the committee on lots with the<span class='line-break'> </span>usual power<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062072">
<h3><a name="page-1062072">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 080)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>80</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'><ins>Trustees</ins></span> <span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='D. L. Ware'><a href='/pages/subjects/64304' title='Ware, Daniel L.'>D. L. Ware</a></span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>  That the application of <a href='/pages/subjects/64304' title='Ware, Daniel L.'>Mr D. L. <span class='line-break'> </span>Ware</a>  be referred to the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>with power to act thereon.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Swedenborgian Society'><a href='/pages/subjects/59177' title='Swedenborgian Society'>Swedenborgian Society</a></span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> That the application on behalf<span class='line-break'> </span>of the <a href='/pages/subjects/59177' title='Swedenborgian Society'>Swedenborgian Society</a> be referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='(C)om. on Gate (r)ebuilding'>(C)om. on <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->Gate</a> (r)ebuilding</span><span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='[E]nlarging Grounds &amp; [Pl]anting Trees'>[E]nlarging Grounds &amp; [Pl]anting Trees</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>; That a com<sup>ee</sup> of three be appoin<span class='line-break'></span>ted to report on the subject of rebuilding <span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>gate of stone</a>, constructing a new <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->fence</a><span class='line-break'> </span>enlarging the grounds of the Cem<sup>y</sup> &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>planting trees.</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> That this com<sup>ee</sup> consist of the <span class='line-break'> </span>President, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Mr Parker</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Geo. Bond Esqr'><a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>Geo. Bond Esqr</a></span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> That the Pres. be requested to <span class='line-break'> </span>communicate to the family of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>George<span class='line-break'> </span>Bond Esq<sup>r</sup></a>, the assurance of the sincere sym<span class='line-break'></span>path of the Trustees in their recent bereavement<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; to express their grateful acknowledgment<span class='line-break'> </span>on behalf of the Pros. of the Cemetery of the <span class='line-break'> </span>faithful &amp; valuable services of their friend<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; associate, as one of the founders &amp; Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery &amp; as the Treasurer of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation since its establishment</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> To adjourn<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record<span class='line-break'> </span>attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> Sec<sup>y</sup></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062073">
<h3><a name="page-1062073">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 081)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>81</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'><ins>Trustees</ins></span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notice issued by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> in <span class='line-break'> </span>behalf of the Secretary the Trustees of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Pros. of the Cem<sup>y</sup> of Mount Auburn met<span class='line-break'> </span>at the office of the Secretary <date when='1842-07-16T10:00:00'>at 10 oclock<span class='line-break'> </span>A. M on the 16<sup>th</sup> day of July A D 1842</date>.</p>
<p>Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>  <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R.<span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>Voted</ins>. To approve the bond of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer with Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/59179' title='Weld &amp; May'>Weld &amp; May</a><span class='line-break'> </span>as surities &amp; that the Secretary file <span class='line-break'> </span>the same.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gate Report on Rebuilding Gate &amp;c'><a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->Gate</a> Report on Rebuilding <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->Gate</a> &amp;c</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. That the Com<sup>ee</sup> on lots be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to make a contract to carry into effect <span class='line-break'> </span>the first resolution of the report of the Com<sup>ee</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>as to the building of a <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->gate</a> &amp; also that <span class='line-break'> </span>they  have authority to carry into effect <span class='line-break'> </span>the other resolutions contained in the <span class='line-break'> </span>said report.</p>
<p>The said report is as follows:</p>
<p>The Com<sup>ee</sup> appointed to report on the <span class='line-break'> </span>subject of rebuilding the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>gate of stone</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>constructing a new <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->fence</a>, enlarging <span class='line-break'> </span>the grounds of the cemetery &amp; planting <span class='line-break'> </span>trees respectfully report, that they have <span class='line-break'> </span>had the subjects committed to them <span class='line-break'> </span>under consideration &amp; have come to <span class='line-break'> </span>the following resolutions</p>
<p>First. That it is expedient to construct<span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>entrance gate of Mount Auburn</a><span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062074">
<h3><a name="page-1062074">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 082)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>82</p>
<p>with the adjacent <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>Porters Lodges</a> of ham<span class='line-break'></span>mered granite, of substantially the <span class='line-break'> </span>same form made &amp; dimensions as the <span class='line-break'> </span>present <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>gate &amp; lodges</a>.  That this object can <span class='line-break'> </span>be accomplished within  a reasonable <span class='line-break'> </span>time without breaking in upon what <span class='line-break'> </span>they deem a desirable object, the retaining<span class='line-break'> </span>of a fund in the hands of the corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>which shall be adequate to all the <span class='line-break'> </span>expenses of the Corporation.  They think that <span class='line-break'> </span>contracts may be made for the furnishing <span class='line-break'> </span>the granite &amp; erecting the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>gate &amp; lodges</a> within <span class='line-break'> </span>a period of two years from the time the <span class='line-break'> </span>contracts are made; &amp; that in this manner<span class='line-break'> </span>the prolonged time will enable the <span class='line-break'> </span>work to be done in a cheaper &amp; in a <span class='line-break'> </span>more perfect style.  If this course is adop<span class='line-break'></span>ted, the sum of Twenty five thousand <span class='line-break'> </span>dollars which is the present fund<span class='line-break'> </span>may be kept whole for the purposes of the <span class='line-break'> </span>institution &amp; the monies received from the <span class='line-break'> </span>sales of the lots &amp; interest upon the accummu<span class='line-break'></span>lation &amp; the surplus will be found at <span class='line-break'> </span>the end of the <del>time</del> two years adequate<span class='line-break'> </span>to the accomplishment of the object</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Iron Fences'><a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->Iron Fences</a></span></p>
<p><ins>Second</ins>. The com<sup>ee</sup> also suggest that it <span class='line-break'> </span>will be desireable as soon as the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>gate<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; lodges</a>  are completed to begin to erect <span class='line-break'> </span>an <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>iron fence on the whole front line</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>of the grounds at Mount Auburn &amp; to</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062075">
<h3><a name="page-1062075">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 083)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>83</p>
<p>proceed with the erection from year to <span class='line-break'> </span>year until the whole is completed accor<span class='line-break'> </span>ding to the state of the funds.  They also <span class='line-break'> </span>suggest that on the three other sides it is</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Hedge'>Hedge</span></p>
<p>expedient to plant a ^<sup>living</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>hedge fence</a><span class='line-break'> </span>of buckthorn or some other suitable <span class='line-break'> </span>shrub on the inside of the present <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->fence</a>;<span class='line-break'> </span>believing that in a few years in this <span class='line-break'> </span>way a very handsome &amp; permanent <span class='line-break'> </span>hedge may be thus obtained at a <span class='line-break'> </span>comparitively trifling expense.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Purchase of Land'>Purchase of Land</span></p>
<p><ins>Third</ins>.  The com<sup>ee</sup> also recommend<span class='line-break'> </span>the purchase, if it can be obtained<span class='line-break'> </span>upon reasonable terms of ten or twelve<span class='line-break'> </span>acres of land upon the western and <span class='line-break'> </span>southern side of the grounds at <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn continguous to the<span class='line-break'> </span>present <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->fence</a> as a suitable enlarge<span class='line-break'></span>ment of the premises &amp; also as giving a <span class='line-break'> </span>better permanent boundary.  Upon<span class='line-break'> </span>traversing the land they found it <span class='line-break'> </span>well suited to the purposes of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='New Lots.'>New Lots.</span></p>
<p><ins>Fourth</ins>. The com<sup>ee</sup> also recommended <span class='line-break'> </span>the adoption of the recent plan of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59288' title='Higginson, Waldo'>Waldo Higginson</a> laying out the lots<span class='line-break'> </span>at the South Eastern part of Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn &amp; to have a suitable number <span class='line-break'> </span>of trees planted &amp; seeds sown there<span class='line-break'> </span>to insure a good growth of ^<sup>forest</sup> trees in the</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062076">
<h3><a name="page-1062076">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 084)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>84</p>
<p>[compass?] of a moderate number of years</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Forest Trees'>Forest Trees</span></p>
<p><ins>Fifthly</ins> the Com<sup>ee</sup> also recommended that <span class='line-break'> </span>the sum of two hundred dollars be <span class='line-break'> </span>placed under the control of the com<sup>ee</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>on lots to be by them expended in the <span class='line-break'> </span>planting of forest trees of different kinds<span class='line-break'> </span>in those parts of the grounds where they <span class='line-break'> </span>are wanted &amp; that they have authority<span class='line-break'> </span>to import the forest trees from abroad</p>
<p>Signed in behalf of the Com<sup>ee</sup><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a> chairman</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. To accept the above report - all<span class='line-break'> </span>present voting in the affirmative.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Regulations'>Regulations</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. That <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'><!--Story-->the President</a> be a com<sup>ee</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>to prepare additional regulations, <span class='line-break'> </span>for the better protection of ^<sup>the</sup> Cemetery.</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. to adjourn to <date when='1842-07-23T10:00:00'>Saturday next<span class='line-break'> </span>at ten oclock A. M.</date> at the office of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
<p>A true record<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> Sec<sup>y</sup></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees .'><ins>Trustees </ins>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to the above adjournment <span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees met at the time &amp; place <span class='line-break'> </span>above designated.<span class='line-break'> </span>Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Regulations'>Regulations</span></p>
<p>The President as a com<sup>ee</sup> to prepare addi<span class='line-break'></span>tional regulations for the better protection</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062077">
<h3><a name="page-1062077">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 085)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>85</p>
<p>of the Cemetery submitted the following.<span class='line-break'> </span>It having been brought to the knowledge <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees that various depredations <span class='line-break'> </span>have been of late committed upon the<span class='line-break'> </span>flowers &amp; shrubs at Mount Auburn;<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; that large parties have assembled<span class='line-break'> </span>within the grounds with refreshments, <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; for purposes utterly incompatible with <span class='line-break'> </span>those to which the grounds are devoted<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees have been obliged to adopt<span class='line-break'> </span>the following additional regulations <span class='line-break'> </span>which will be rigidly enforced -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Regulations'>Regulations</span></p>
<p>(1) No refreshments &amp; no  party carrying <span class='line-break'> </span>refreshments will hereafter be admitted<span class='line-break'> </span>to come within the grounds at Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn</p>
<p>(2) All persons who shall be found within <span class='line-break'> </span>the grounds making unseemly noises <span class='line-break'> </span>or otherwise conducting themselves <span class='line-break'> </span>unsuitably to  the purposes to which the <span class='line-break'> </span>grounds are devoted, will be required <span class='line-break'> </span>instantly to leave the grounds &amp; upon <span class='line-break'> </span>refusal will be compelled to do so; &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>will be prosecuted accordingly. _</p>
<p>(3) Any person who shall be found in <span class='line-break'> </span>posession of flowers, or shrubs, while in <span class='line-break'> </span>the grounds, or before leaving them, shall <span class='line-break'> </span>be deemed to have intentionally taken them<span class='line-break'> </span>in the grounds &amp; will be prosecuted <span class='line-break'> </span>accordingly.  A suitable reward will be <span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062078">
<h3><a name="page-1062078">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 086)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>86</p>
<p>given to any person who shall give informa<span class='line-break'></span>tion to the Trustees of any such offence which <span class='line-break'> </span>shall lead to the detection of the offender.</p>
<p>(4) The Superintendent of the grounds, the <span class='line-break'> </span>gate keeper &amp; any other person acting under<span class='line-break'> </span>them, shall have a right to require his or <span class='line-break'> </span>her names from any person other than a <span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor or a member of his family <span class='line-break'> </span>who shall visit the grounds, &amp; upon his or her<span class='line-break'> </span>refusal or giving a false name it shall <span class='line-break'> </span>be his duty to exclude them from the <span class='line-break'> </span>grounds.</p>
<p>(5) The superintendent the gatekeeper<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; all other persons acting under them<span class='line-break'> </span>shall have full authority to carry these<span class='line-break'> </span>regulations into effect &amp; shall give <span class='line-break'> </span>notice of any violations thereof to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees</p>
<p>(6) The Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots shall have authority <span class='line-break'> </span>to set up a <del>gate</del> board near the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>gate<span class='line-break'> </span>at Mount Auburn</a> offering a reward <span class='line-break'> </span>not exceeding twenty dollars to  any <span class='line-break'> </span>person who shall give <del>notice</del> informa<span class='line-break'></span>tion to the Trustees which shall lead to a <span class='line-break'> </span>conviction of the offence of any trespass<span class='line-break'> </span>done by taking or plucking any flowers<span class='line-break'> </span>shrubs or trees within the grounds, or<span class='line-break'> </span>otherwise injuring the grounds, or of any <span class='line-break'> </span>other offence against the laws &amp; regula<span class='line-break'></span>tions  provided for the protection of the </p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062079">
<h3><a name="page-1062079">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 087)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>87</p>
<p>Cemetery &amp; the monuments &amp; erections<span class='line-break'> </span>therein.</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> To accept the above report &amp; to <span class='line-break'> </span>adopt the regulations therein proposed</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perpetual repair of lots.'>Perpetual repair of lots.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> That the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots have <span class='line-break'> </span>power to contract with any proprietor to <span class='line-break'> </span>keep his lot in perpetual repair.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Removal of  remains'>Removal of  remains</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That the President be a com<sup>ee</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>to report on the subject of adopting some <span class='line-break'> </span>measures to prevent the removal of <span class='line-break'> </span>remains from the Cemetery.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Strangers admitted.'>Strangers admitted.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> That the Trustees be [socially?]<span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to prevent strangers to enter<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery with a carriage</p>
<p>Voted to adjourn<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record Attest<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R Curtis</a> Sec<sup>y</sup>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Gate.'>Trustees <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->Gate</a>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notice issued by the Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees of the Proprietors of the Cem<sup>y</sup>. of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn met at the office of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary on <date when='1842-09-27T16:00:00'>Tuesday Sep<sup>r</sup> 27<sup>th</sup> at 4.<span class='line-break'> </span>o'clock P.M.</date></p>
<p>Present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That the committee on lot viz <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a> be empowered to contract<span class='line-break'> </span>with <a href='/pages/subjects/59289' title='Rodgers, Octavious T.'>Octavious T. Rogers</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/66737' title='Quincy, MA'>Quincy</a> on some other<span class='line-break'> </span>suitable person for the building of a <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>granite<span class='line-break'> </span>gateway</a> at Mount Auburn &amp; to pay for the</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062080">
<h3><a name="page-1062080">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 088)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when=''/>88</p>
<p>same nine thousand five hundred dollars.<span class='line-break'> </span>(9,500<sup>$</sup>) one half on the completion of the work <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; the residue on the <date when='1844-01-01'>first day of January 1844</date><span class='line-break'> </span>if the work should be completed by the <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1843-10-01'>first day of October 1843</date>; if not, in three months <span class='line-break'> </span>after the same shall be completed.</p>
<p>A true record<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a>, Sec<sup>y</sup>. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'><ins>Trustees</ins></span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notice issued by the Secretary <span class='line-break'> </span>the ^<sup>Trustees of the</sup> Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>met at the office of the Secretary on <date when='1843-02-03T17:00:00'>friday <span class='line-break'> </span>the 3<sup>d</sup> day of February 1843 at 5 oclock. P.M.</date></p>
<p>Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>&amp; Read.</a><span class='line-break'> </span>In the absence of the President <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>was chosen chairman</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer Report'>Treasurer Report</span></p>
<p>The Treasurers report having been read<span class='line-break'> </span>it was thereupon<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>Voted.</ins> That the same be accepted &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>that the Secretary lay the same before <span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation at its next annual <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting -<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted to adjourn<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record<span class='line-break'> </span>attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a>, Sec<sup>y</sup>_</p>

<div id="page-1062081">
<h3><a name="page-1062081">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 089)</a></h3>

<p>89</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors 1843.'>Proprietors 1843.</span></p>
<p>Mount Auburn Cemetery</p>
<p>The annual meeting of the Proprietors of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn will be held <span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1843-02-06T16:00:00'>Monday the 6<sup>th</sup> day of February 1843<span class='line-break'> </span>at 4 oclock P.M.</date> at the office of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Subscriber, to choose Trustees for the <span class='line-break'> </span>ensuring year, to hear the report of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Treasurer, &amp; to act on any other <span class='line-break'> </span>business which may come before <span class='line-break'> </span>the said meeting -</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a>, Sec<sup>y</sup>.</p>
<p>Pursuant to the above notice which <span class='line-break'> </span>was published in several newspapers<span class='line-break'> </span>printed in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> more than seven days <span class='line-break'> </span>before the said time of meeting, the <span class='line-break'> </span>said Proprietors met at the time &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>place therein designated<span class='line-break'> </span>In the absence of the President <a href='/pages/subjects/59290' title='Buckingham, Joseph T.'>Joseph <span class='line-break'> </span>T. Buckingham</a> was chose chairman.<span class='line-break'> </span>The report of the Treasurer having been <span class='line-break'> </span>read it was.<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>Voted</ins> That the same be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; recorded</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees chosen.'>Trustees chosen.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> &amp; chose by ballot the following <span class='line-break'> </span>named gentlemen as Trustees for <span class='line-break'> </span>the year ensuing.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Martin Brimmer</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. <p>It will be seen by the annexed reports that there was <del>on</del> <span class='line-break'> </span>on the 30<sup>th</sup> ult a balance against the Treasurey (sic) of <span class='line-break'> </span>$375.06. This is more apparent than real for some of<span class='line-break'> </span>these payments though brought into the Dec<sup>r</sup> account<span class='line-break'> </span>were not absolutely made until after the dividends due<span class='line-break'> </span>in the early part of this month were collected. There<span class='line-break'> </span>is still however a small deficit which be made up<span class='line-break'> </span>from collection in the of a few days. There<span class='line-break'> </span>is also a balance of $319.14 due to <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Howe</a> which <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> has been unable to pay him but for<span class='line-break'> </span>which he is not urgent &amp; can collect shortly from <span class='line-break'> </span>accounts due him for labor &amp;c. The Treasurer would <span class='line-break'> </span>not have invested so closely had he supposed that <span class='line-break'> </span>the difficulties of the times would have rendered it<span class='line-break'> </span>so difficult for him to make collections. He<span class='line-break'> </span>presents with this a list of unsettled sales amount<span class='line-break'></span>ing to $1359-- which if collected leave a respect<span class='line-break'></span>able balance in the Treaury (sic)</p>
<p>The amount of funds invested for annexed Trial<span class='line-break'> </span>balance is $30580.-- from which deduct balance <span class='line-break'> </span>[of?] Treasury 375.06 leaves $30204.94, showing an in<span class='line-break'></span>crease this year of 4800.20 arising from Sales of <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots &amp; income on Investments</p>

<p>Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.
