<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Form of Trust'>Form of Trust</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. That all sums received from <span class='line-break'> </span>grants or bequests for the purpose <span class='line-break'> </span>of keeping lots in repair shall form <span class='line-break'> </span>one fund, to be designated "the fund <span class='line-break'> </span>for repairs," &amp; the amount to be credited<span class='line-break'> </span>to each lot shall be ascertained by<span class='line-break'> </span>taking the whole income of the whole <span class='line-break'> </span>fund &amp; dividing it among the <span class='line-break'> </span>several lots entitled thereto in pro<span class='line-break'></span>portion to the  principal sum granted<span class='line-break'> </span>or bequeathed to the Corporation by <span class='line-break'> </span>the proprietor of such lot.</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. To adopt the form of a <span class='line-break'> </span>declaration of trust reported <span class='line-break'> </span>by the President &amp; that the Sec<sup>y</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>cause the same to be printed<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; copies thereof to be distributed <span class='line-break'> </span>to such of the Proprietors as may call<span class='line-break'> </span>for the same, &amp; that public notice <span class='line-break'> </span>thereof be given in the newspapers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Bequests limited'>Bequests limited</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. That no gift or bequest of a<span class='line-break'> </span>less amount than one hundred <span class='line-break'> </span>dollars will be received.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062088">
<h3><a name="page-1062088">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 096)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>96</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'><ins>Trustees</ins></span><span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Repairs'>Repairs</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> That the Treasurer perform the <span class='line-break'> </span>necessary duties in regard to the custody<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; services  trust of the said "fund for repairs",<span class='line-break'> </span>under the superintendence of the com<sup>ee</sup> on<span class='line-break'> </span>investments &amp; under the same regulations<span class='line-break'> </span>as apply to his other duties.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Location of Tombs'>Location of Tombs</span></p>
<p>The com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots reported that tombs<span class='line-break'> </span>may be built within twenty six feet <span class='line-break'> </span>of the westerly &amp; southerly fences of the <span class='line-break'> </span>cemetery, with the consent of the Com<sup>ee</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>on lots, &amp; not elsewhere.<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>Voted</ins>. To accept the above report -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Water'>Water</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. That the com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots be author<span class='line-break'></span>ized to employ an engineer to ascertain <span class='line-break'> </span>the practicability of bringing water from <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59566' title='Fresh Pond'>Fresh Pond</a> to Mount Auburn.<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>Voted</ins>.   To adjourn -</p>
<p>A true record<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> Sec<sup>y</sup>. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'><ins>Trustees</ins></span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notice issued by the Secretary <span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees of the Proprietors of the Cem<sup>y</sup> of Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn met at the office of the Secretary at <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1843-09-16T11:00:00'>eleven oclock A. M. of saturday Sep<sup>r</sup> 16 1843</date><span class='line-break'> </span>Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crocket</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. <span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gateway'><a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>Gateway</a></span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. That the Trustees  not accept <span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>stone gateway</a> lately erected by <a href='/pages/subjects/59289' title='Rodgers, Octavious T.'>Mr. <span class='line-break'> </span>Octavious T. Rogers</a> until the upper stories</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062089">
<h3><a name="page-1062089">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 097)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>97</p>
<p>shall have been such so as to be conforma<span class='line-break'></span>ble to the contract &amp; to the satisfaction<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees.</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>.  That the following notice be <span class='line-break'> </span>posted by the gate Keeper outside the <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->gate</a></p>
<p>Admittance to Mount Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>for<span class='line-break'> </span>Carriages containing proprietors or any of <span class='line-break'> </span>their household with a ticket <span class='line-break'> </span>Carriages containing strangers with a <span class='line-break'> </span>permit from a Trustee<span class='line-break'> </span>Pedestrians on all days excepting<span class='line-break'> </span>Sundays &amp; holy-days <span class='line-break'> </span>Omnibusses &amp; stage coaches not admitted</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Water.'>Water.</span></p>
<p>The Com<sup>ee</sup> appointed at a former meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>in reference to introducing water into <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery made a report</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. That this report be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>a com<sup>ee</sup> of five persons who are to <span class='line-break'> </span>take into consideration the various <span class='line-break'> </span>improvements which it may see <span class='line-break'> </span>desired expedient to make <span class='line-break'> </span>upon the grounds of the Cemetery &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>to report thereon as soon as practica<span class='line-break'></span>ble.</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> That <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'><!--Story-->the President</a> &amp; Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crocket</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis</a> be that <span class='line-break'> </span>Com<sup>ee</sup>.        <span class='line-break'> </span>A true record attest<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> Sec<sup>y</sup><span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062090">
<h3><a name="page-1062090">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 098)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>98</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notice issued by the Secretary  the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>met at the office of the Sec<sup>y</sup> on <date when='1843-09-29T11:00:00'>friday Sep<sup>r</sup> 29,1843<span class='line-break'> </span>at eleven oclock</date><span class='line-break'> </span>Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. <span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>, Read &amp;</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story</a> -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Improvements.'>Improvements.</span></p>
<p>The com<sup>ee</sup> appointed at the last meeting to take <span class='line-break'> </span>into consideration the contemplated improvements <span class='line-break'> </span>at the Cemetary (sic) made a report which is as follows.</p>
<p>The Committee to whom was referred the report <span class='line-break'> </span>of a committee on the subject of introducing fresh <span class='line-break'> </span>water into the grounds at Mount Auburn with <span class='line-break'> </span>directions to take into consideration the various im<span class='line-break'></span>provements which it may be deemed expedient to <span class='line-break'> </span>make there have had the same under their con<span class='line-break'></span>sideration  &amp; respectfully report that by the Act of <span class='line-break'> </span>Incorporation of the Proprietors of the Cemetary (sic) of<span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn the Monies  which shall arise from the <span class='line-break'> </span>Sale of the Lots, &amp; belong to the Corporation are required <span class='line-break'> </span>to be forever devoted &amp; applied to the Preservation, Im<span class='line-break'></span>provement embellishment &amp; enlargement of the Said <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetary (sic) &amp; the incidental expenses thereof - that <span class='line-break'> </span>hitherto these purposes have been faithfully adhered<span class='line-break'> </span>to - the Grounds have been laid out, &amp; paths &amp; avenues <span class='line-break'> </span>have been established, a house with  Suitable ap<span class='line-break'></span>pendages built, a <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>temporary gate way</a> erected, &amp; a <span class='line-break'> </span>Suitable <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>temporary fence</a> <del>embracing</del> enclosing the whole<span class='line-break'> </span>grounds - During the present year a permanant (sic) <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>gran<span class='line-break'></span>-ite gateway</a> has been Substituted for the former wooden</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062091">
<h3><a name="page-1062091">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 099)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>99</p>
<p>one.  After deducting all the expenses hitherto in<span class='line-break'></span>curred, including the expense of the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>granite gateway</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>there will remain at the end of the present year<span class='line-break'> </span>in the Treasury, according to a statement made to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee by <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> the sum of about <span class='line-break'> </span>Twenty Six thousand Dollars applicable to the general <span class='line-break'> </span>objects contemplated in the Act of Incorporation -</p>
<p>It is well known that among these objects <span class='line-break'> </span>there are some, which have always from the beginning<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetary [sic] been deemed of primary importance<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; to which the funds of the Corporation were designed <span class='line-break'> </span>to be applied - as soon as any adequate Surplus  shld<span class='line-break'> </span>exist.  Indeed these objects were held out to the  orig=<span class='line-break'> </span>inal Subscribers as the main inducements for their <span class='line-break'> </span>patronage &amp; encouragement of the Enterprize; &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>without them little or no success could have been <span class='line-break'> </span>hoped for - The Committee therefore deem it their <span class='line-break'> </span>sacred duty to recommend that these objects should <span class='line-break'> </span>be put in a Train to ensure their entire accomplishment <span class='line-break'> </span>as early as the funds of the Corporation shall enable <span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees to do so - The Committee beg leave to <span class='line-break'> </span>state that the objects to whih they have allowed, are</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fence'><a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->Fence</a></span></p>
<p>(1) The erection of a permanent <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>Stone or Iron fence</a><span class='line-break'> </span>upon the front grounds of the Cemetary [sic] &amp; a <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>hedge <span class='line-break'> </span>fence</a> on the remaining three sides thereof for their</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Draining water.'>Draining water.</span></p>
<p>due protection &amp; security. (2) The draining of the low <span class='line-break'> </span>grounds &amp; the introduction of pure water which should <span class='line-break'> </span>run into the grounds &amp; through the ponds within the <span class='line-break'> </span>same, into <a href='/pages/subjects/59567' title='Charles River'>Charles River</a> --</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chapel.'><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>.</span></p>
<p>(3) The Erection of a suitable <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'>Granite Chapel</a> ^<sup>where</sup> the religious services for the Dead may  be</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062092">
<h3><a name="page-1062092">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 100)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>100</p>
<p>Suitably performed, &amp; which also in the interior sides <span class='line-break'> </span>may become the repository of Marble Busts &amp; Statues<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; other Sepule<del>cure</del><sup>chral</sup> monuments which may from time <span class='line-break'> </span>to time be placed there by liberal Benefactors &amp; Friends <span class='line-break'> </span>in memory of the Dead, &amp; which would not bear  the</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Observatory'><a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>Observatory</a></span></p>
<p>exposure of the open air in our climate  (4) the erec=<span class='line-break'> </span>tion of a <a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>Granite Tower or Observatory</a> on the Summit<span class='line-break'> </span>of mount Auburn from which the entire grounds of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemet<del>a</del><sup>e</sup>ry and the whole range of the adjacent <span class='line-break'> </span>country may be distinctly seen - These objects in the<span class='line-break'> </span>opinion of the Committee may all be attained within <span class='line-break'> </span>a few years by devoting the present funds of the Cor=<span class='line-break'> </span>poration to them &amp; such additional funds as from <span class='line-break'> </span>past experience the Committee are justified in <span class='line-break'> </span>believing will be unquestionably come into the Treasury <span class='line-break'> </span>within the same period of years - Which of these <span class='line-break'> </span>objects Should have a priority, or whether all of them <span class='line-break'> </span>Should be Simultaneously undertaken, &amp; a proportion <span class='line-break'> </span>of the present funds applied pro rata toe each is a matter<span class='line-break'> </span>for the ultimate decision of the Trustees - And it is <span class='line-break'> </span>not improbably that for Some of these objects private <span class='line-break'> </span>Subscriptions may be obtained from munificent Individ=<span class='line-break'> </span>uals in aid of such funds as the Trustees may devote <span class='line-break'> </span>to the purpose -</p>
<p>The Committee ask leave to suggest some <span class='line-break'> </span>considerations for the deliberations  of the Trustees which <span class='line-break'> </span>have occurred to them, &amp; which may confirm some of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Statements already suggested -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fence.'><a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->Fence</a>.</span></p>
<p>(1) As to a <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>permanent fence</a> - It is believed by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee that a <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>permanent Iron fence</a> with a<span class='line-break'> </span>suitable</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062093">
<h3><a name="page-1062093">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 101)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>101</p>
<p>Suitable granite foundation can be erected  of a suit<span class='line-break'></span>able heighth on the whole length of the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>fronting on the <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a> public <span class='line-break'> </span>Highway for an expense not exceeding 17000 $ -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Hedge.'>Hedge.</span></p>
<p>The other three Sides of the Cemetery the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee propose should be enlosed by a <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>hedge<span class='line-break'> </span>fence</a> of Buck Thorn or some other Shrub thickly <span class='line-break'> </span>planted within &amp; near^<sup>to</sup> the present <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>wooden fence</a><span class='line-break'> </span>This would in a few years with suitable care consti<span class='line-break'></span>tute  ______  a substantial &amp; beautiful enclosure; &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>might be done an an expense not exceeding 1000$</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Draining'>Draining</span></p>
<p>(2)  As to draining the grounds &amp; obtaining a Supply <span class='line-break'> </span>of pure water - the various ponds may be made to com<span class='line-break'></span>municate with each other, &amp; the stagnant water be <span class='line-break'> </span>drawn off the same by Suitable ditches, so as ultimately <span class='line-break'> </span>to pass through the low grounds into <a href='/pages/subjects/59567' title='Charles River'>Charles River</a> - <span class='line-break'> </span>The ponds can then be excavated &amp; the materials ob<span class='line-break'></span>tained therefrom applied to fertilize the grounds on the <span class='line-break'> </span>borders of the Cemetery, &amp; good gravel bottoms be sub<span class='line-break'></span>stituted in the ponds, or if deemed necessary or ex<span class='line-break'></span>pedient, the ponds can be partially filled up or <span class='line-break'> </span>narrowed in their area - The committee estimate <span class='line-break'> </span>the expense of accomplishing this part of the plan as <span class='line-break'> </span>not exceeding 3000$</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Water'>Water</span></p>
<p>In respect to the conveying of pure water <span class='line-break'> </span>into the grounds, the committee are aware of some<span class='line-break'> </span>difficulty - the most probably Source of Supply is from <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59566' title='Fresh Pond'>Fresh Pond</a> by means of an Apparatus to raise the <span class='line-break'> </span>water above the level of the Ponds in the Cemetery &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>then to conduct it through the intermediate lands</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062094">
<h3><a name="page-1062094">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 102)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>102</p>
<p>into the Cemetery &amp; thence to <a href='/pages/subjects/59567' title='Charles River'>Charles River</a> -- To accom<span class='line-break'></span>plish this object some Legislative Action will probably be nec<span class='line-break'></span>cessary as well as the consent of the proprietors, through <span class='line-break'> </span>whose land the water must pass - A survey of the ponds <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; of these lands has been already made, &amp; an estimate of <span class='line-break'> </span>the probable expense will be found in the Report of the <span class='line-break'> </span>former Committee which has been recommitted to this <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee &amp; to which reference is to be had for a more <span class='line-break'> </span>full understanding of the project &amp; other incidental <span class='line-break'> </span>matters -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chapel.'><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>.</span></p>
<p>(3)  the Erection of a <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> - The commit<span class='line-break'></span>tee deem this is a very desireable object  - The <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> ought<span class='line-break'> </span>in their opinion to be built in a chaste style &amp; taste &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>of the most durable materials, &amp; upon a plan which <span class='line-break'> </span>will admit of great additions &amp; enlargements at a future<span class='line-break'> </span>period, without injury to the symetry &amp; proportions of <span class='line-break'> </span>the original building when the religious services &amp; the <span class='line-break'> </span>erection of monuments therein Shall require Such additions<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; enlargements - If the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->chapel</a> Should be now erected <span class='line-break'> </span>of a Suitable heighth of Ashlar Granite it may be lighted<span class='line-break'> </span>by a dome or Lantern or Skylight on the Top, &amp; the four <span class='line-break'> </span>sides be reserved for Busts &amp; Statues &amp; Monuments -<span class='line-break'> </span>The accommodations for the religious Services may be by <span class='line-break'> </span>a moveable pulpit &amp; movable Seats, to be placed <span class='line-break'> </span>in Such prositions as the occasion may require -<span class='line-break'> </span>The <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'>Chapel</a> when built, may if it is thought best,<span class='line-break'> </span>constitute the Nave or part of the Nave of a future <span class='line-break'> </span>Church which Shall become with its future transepts<span class='line-break'> </span>a Latin or Greek cross - - as had been already suggested<span class='line-break'> </span>private subscriptions may probably be obtained to aid <span class='line-break'> </span>in the accomplishment of this object - Probably the </p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062095">
<h3><a name="page-1062095">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 103)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>103</p>
<p>whole expense of such a <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> for the present purposes <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery would not exceed 5000$</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Observatory'><a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>Observatory</a></span></p>
<p>(4)  the Erection of a <a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>Tower or Observatory</a> - It is <span class='line-break'> </span>believed by the Committee that this may be accom<span class='line-break'></span>plished at a very moderate expense &amp; yet be built<span class='line-break'> </span>of the most permanent materials, &amp; it will be at <span class='line-break'> </span>once a great convenience &amp; an Ornament to the grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>A round <a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>Tower</a> of Ashlar Granite may be built <span class='line-break'> </span>fifty feet high &amp; of a proper diameter suitable for <span class='line-break'> </span>an eas<del>e</del>y ascent &amp; decent [sic] at an expense not exceed<span class='line-break'></span>ing  -  7000$</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Incidental Expenses.'>Incidental Expenses.</span></p>
<p>The Committee are also of opinion that it is <span class='line-break'> </span>wholly unnecessary to reserve out of the present funds<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation a sum exceeding 3000$ to meet<span class='line-break'> </span>any incidental expenditures of the Cemetery before <span class='line-break'> </span>new funds will accrue - ; &amp; it is but a just compliance<span class='line-break'> </span>with the known Intention of the Proprietors to apppro<span class='line-break'></span>priate the residue to one or more or all the objects<span class='line-break'> </span>already indicated -</p>
<p>The Committee beg leave to add that in making <span class='line-break'> </span>the appropriation of the funds of the Corporation for <span class='line-break'> </span>the purposes aforesaid, they have not lost sight of <span class='line-break'> </span>their duty to reserve out of the funds which may <span class='line-break'> </span>arise from the sales of the Lots a sum sufficient to <span class='line-break'> </span>insure in perpetuity the due Improvement &amp; Pres<span class='line-break'></span>ervation &amp; Ornament of the Cemetery &amp; the payment <span class='line-break'> </span>of the incidental expenses thereof - They are aware <span class='line-break'> </span>that the number of Lots which will remain on <span class='line-break'> </span>hand will be every year diminishing &amp; therefore that <span class='line-break'> </span>it will be necessary to make suitable provision to<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062096">
<h3><a name="page-1062096">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 104)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>104</p>
<p>meet the time when they can no longer expect to realize<span class='line-break'> </span>any new funds - That time however must be distant;<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; the Lots now on hand are more than Sufficient to meet<span class='line-break'> </span>all the future expenditures which may be required<span class='line-break'> </span>for any of the purposes to which they have referred.</p>
<p>All which is respectfully  Submitted by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Commitee</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Chairman</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. To accept the above report</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gateway.'><a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>Gateway</a>.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. To accept the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>gateway</a> provided it shall be <span class='line-break'> </span>satisfactory to the Com<sup>ee</sup> on lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sale of Stocks'>Sale of Stocks</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> That the Com<sup>ee</sup> on finance be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to make such sales of stocks as they may deem <span class='line-break'> </span>necessary to pay for the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>gateway</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->fence</a> belonging thereto</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fence.'><a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->Fence</a>.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. That the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots - be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>contract for the erection of a <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>fence on the line <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn</a>, on the highway <span class='line-break'> </span>between <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a> of Iron with Stone <span class='line-break'> </span>curb or base, of Similar construction &amp; character <span class='line-break'> </span>with that portion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->fence</a> now erected,  vary in such <span class='line-break'> </span>particulars as the com<sup>ee</sup> see fit - provided the same <span class='line-break'> </span>can be done at an expense not exceeding $1500 - &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>to be completed within three years from the time of <span class='line-break'> </span>making the contract. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Draining.'>Draining.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. That the Com<sup>ee</sup> on lots be authorized to expend<span class='line-break'> </span>a sum not exceeding three thousand dollars to <span class='line-break'> </span>drain</p>

</div>

<div class="page-content">

<p>drain the grounds of the Cem<sup>y</sup> &amp; to make con<span class='line-break'></span>tracts accordingly.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chapel'><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'>Chapel</a></span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. That the Trustees agree to appropriate <span class='line-break'> </span>the  sum of 5000$ toward the erection of a suit<span class='line-break'></span>able <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'>chapel</a> on the grounds provided the same <span class='line-break'> </span>sum shall be raised by subscription for the same <span class='line-break'> </span>purpose within one year</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Hedge. Trees'>Hedge. Trees</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. That the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to cause a Hedge to be planted on the East, South<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; West lines of the Cemetery &amp; trees to be planted on<span class='line-break'> </span>the vacant lands according to the recommendation <span class='line-break'> </span>of a Com<sup>ee</sup> accepted <date when='1842-07-16'>16<sup>th</sup> July 1842</date></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Observatory'><a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>Observatory</a></span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> that the consideration of the two subjects of <span class='line-break'> </span>of an <a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>observatory</a> &amp; the introduction of pure</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Water'>Water</span></p>
<p>water into the Cem<sup>y</sup>. be postponed to a future meet<span class='line-break'></span>ing of the board.</p>

<p><ins>Voted</ins>. That the committee on Lots have the power<span class='line-break'> </span>to dispose by exchange or ^<sup>otherwise of</sup> the land called <a href='/pages/subjects/59572' title='Haymer Meadow'>Hay<span class='line-break'></span>mer Meadow</a> &amp; that <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'><!--Story-->the President of the Corpora<span class='line-break'></span>tion</a> be authorized to execute the deed - the disposal <span class='line-break'> </span>to be made either for money, or any other compensa<span class='line-break'></span>tion which they may deem proper -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='New Lots.'>New Lots.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. That the Committee on lots cause to be <span class='line-break'> </span>laid out 100 lots in the Cemetery &amp; give pub<span class='line-break'></span>lic notice that either of them may be taken at 80$<span class='line-break'> </span>before the 1<sup>st</sup> of June next &amp; after that day the <span class='line-break'> </span>price of all lots should be not less than 100.$</p>

<h3><a name="page-1062099">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 107)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors 1844.'>Proprietors 1844.</span></p>
<p>Mount Auburn Cemetery.</p>
<p>The  annual meeting of the Proprietors of the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn, will be held at the office of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Subscriber, in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, <date when='1844-02-05T16:00:00'>on Monday, the fifth day of <span class='line-break'> </span>February, 1844, at 4 o'clock, P.M.</date>  to choose trustees for <span class='line-break'> </span>the ensuing year, to hear the report of the Treasurer, <span class='line-break'> </span>and act on any other business which may legally come <span class='line-break'> </span>before the said meeting.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a> Sect<sup>y</sup><span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1844-01-13'>Jan<sup>y</sup> 13th, 1844</date>.</p>
<p>Pursuant to the above notice which was published <span class='line-break'> </span>in several newspapers printed in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> more than <span class='line-break'> </span>seven days before the said time of meeting the <span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn met at <span class='line-break'> </span>the time &amp; place therein designat<sup>e</sup>d.</p>
<p>In the absence of the President, <a href='/pages/subjects/57673' title='Brown, Charles'>Charles Brown</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>was chosen Chairman.</p>
<p>The Treasurers report<del>s</del> having been laid before the <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting it was</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> To accept the same &amp; that it be recorded</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees chosen.'>Trustees chosen.</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> That nine trustees be ^<sup>now</sup> chosen by ballot<span class='line-break'> </span>The following named persons were then <span class='line-break'> </span>elected by ballot -</p>

<div id="page-1062103">
<h3><a name="page-1062103">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 111)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>111</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>At a meeting of the Proprie<span class='line-break'></span>tors of the Cemetery held pursuant to <span class='line-break'> </span>notice <date when='1844-04-13'>April 13<sup>th</sup> 1844</date>. Present <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Martin Brimmer</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>George W. <span class='line-break'> </span>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a>. <span class='line-break'> </span>The Secretary being absent <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>was chosen Secretary pro tem<sup>e</sup></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Officers chosen.'>Officers chosen.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a> was chosen President<span class='line-break'> </span>by ballot.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>George W. Bond</a> was chosen Treasurer<span class='line-break'> </span>by ballot</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>Benj<sup>m</sup> R. Curtis</a> was chosen Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span>by ballot</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on Lots'>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted </ins> That Mss<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a> be the<span class='line-break'> </span>Comm<sup>ee</sup> on lots with all the powers<span class='line-break'> </span>heretofore conferred on the said Comm<sup>ee</sup></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on Finance'>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Finance</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted </ins> That Mss<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B.A. <span class='line-break'> </span>Gould</a> be a com<sup>ee</sup> on finance with<span class='line-break'> </span>all the powers conferred on them<span class='line-break'> </span>by vote <date when='1842-0606'>June 6, 1842</date></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Plan of Chapel'>Plan of <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'>Chapel</a></span></p>
<p><ins>Voted </ins>. That Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story</a> be a com<sup>ee</sup> on obtaining plans<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; for a <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->chapel</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fence'><a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->Fence</a></span></p>
<p>The Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots having reported<span class='line-break'> </span>that they had made a contract<span class='line-break'> </span>with Mss <a href='/pages/subjects/59579' title='Adams, Mr.'>Adams</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/59580' title='Wittredge, Mr.'>Wittredge</a> &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59581' title='Cummings, Mr.'>Cummings</a>, &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/59289' title='Rodgers, Octavious T.'>O.T. Rogers</a> for erecting<span class='line-break'> </span>a <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>fence of stone &amp; iron</a> at the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>for $12,400 to be paid for by instalments<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sale of Stocks'>Sale of Stocks</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted.</ins> That <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> with the <span class='line-break'> </span>approbation of the com<sup>ee</sup> on finance<span class='line-break'> </span>be authorized to sell any of the stocks<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation from time to time<span class='line-break'> </span>for the purpose of paying said instalments</p>
<p>Vote to adjourn<span class='line-break'></span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>a true record</th> <th>a true record ex<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>attest</td> <td>relatione  <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. Curtis</a> Sec<sup>y</sup></td> <td>___</td> </tr> <tr><td> pro tem</td> <td>attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a></td> </tr> <tr><td> ___</td> <td>Sec<sup>y</sup> _</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> Commonwealth of Massachusetts <span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk ss. <date when='1844-04-14'>April 14. 1844</date>. Then personally <span class='line-break'> </span>appeared <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>Benj<sup>n</sup> R. Curtis</a> &amp; made oath that <span class='line-break'> </span>he would &amp; faithfully discharge the duties <span class='line-break'> </span>of Secretary of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn</p>
<p>Before me <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> {Jus of the <span class='line-break'> </span>{Peace</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'>Trustees</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notice issued by the Secretary the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn met at the house of <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. <span class='line-break'> </span>Bigelow</a> on <date when='1844-04-19T15:00:00'>friday April 19<sup>th</sup> 1844 at 3<span class='line-break'> </span>oclock P.M.</date></p>
<p>Present Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. <span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a>  <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'> &amp; Read.</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chapel'><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a></span></p>
<p>The Trustees examined the plans &amp; models <span class='line-break'> </span>for a <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'>chapel at Mount Auburn</a> which <span class='line-break'> </span>had been presented.</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins> <ins>Unanimously </ins>. that a model offered <span class='line-break'> </span>by <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> to the Trustees this day</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062105">
<h3><a name="page-1062105">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 113)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>113</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'>Trustees</span></p>
<p>with such modifications as the com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee for obtaining plans for a <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->chapel</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>may make, be accepted as the model <span class='line-break'> </span>for a <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->chapel</a> in the grounds.</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>. That the Com<sup>ee</sup> on plans be <span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to have plans &amp; drawing, to <span class='line-break'> </span>obtain proposals &amp; estimates for building <span class='line-break'> </span>a <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->chapel</a> in the grounds</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary. chosen.'>Secretary. chosen.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> having tendered his <span class='line-break'> </span>resignation of the office of Secretary <span class='line-break'> </span><ins>Voted</ins>. and chose by ballot <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry <span class='line-break'> </span>M. Parker Esquire</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> as Secretary <span class='line-break'> </span><ins>Voted</ins> To adjourn to meet at Mt Auburn at such time<span class='line-break'> </span>as <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> may indicate.  A true record attest <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> Sec<sup>y</sup></p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts <span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk ss. <date when='1844-04-22'>April 22<sup>d</sup> 1844</date></p>
<p>then personally appeared <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry <span class='line-break'> </span>M. Parker</a> &amp; made oath that he <span class='line-break'> </span>would faithfully perform the<span class='line-break'> </span>duties of Secretary of the Proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>Before me <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> Jus. of Peace</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1062106">
<h3><a name="page-1062106">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 114)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>114</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>At a meeting of the Trustees of Mount Auburn holden<span class='line-break'> </span>at the Cemetery <date when='1844-04-24'>April 24. 1844</date>.  Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Reed</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crocket</a> it was voted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Site of Chapel'>Site of <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a></span></p>
<p>That the site of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> about to be built should<span class='line-break'> </span>be on a spot surveyed by <a href='/pages/subjects/59288' title='Higginson, Waldo'>Mr Higginson</a> for that purpose,<span class='line-break'> </span>near <a href='/pages/subjects/59584' title='Cypress Avenue'>Cypress<!--Ave--></a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/59585' title='Pine Avenue'>Pine Avenues</a>.</p>
<p>That the Trustees will purchase if they can obtain</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Purchase of Lots.'>Purchase of Lots.</span></p>
<p>them on reasonable terms one or more of the lots num<span class='line-break'></span>bered <a href='/pages/subjects/59586' title='Lot 88'><!--lot-->88</a> - <a href='/pages/subjects/59587' title='Lot 699'><!--lot-->699</a> - <a href='/pages/subjects/59588' title='Lot 700'><!--lot-->700</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/59589' title='Lot 446'><!--lot-->446</a> for an entrance way to the <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Price of Lots.'>Price of Lots.</span></p>
<p>That the term during which the new lots may <span class='line-break'> </span>be sold for $80 be extended to the first day of Au<span class='line-break'></span>-gust next.<span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>A true record</th> <th>a true record ex relatione<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>attest <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a> attest</td> </tr> <tr><td> Sec<sup>y</sup> pro tem.</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Sec<sup>y</sup>.</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to a notice issued by the Secretary, a meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees of Mount Auburn was holden at the office of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis</a> on <date when='1844-05-21T09:00:00'>May 21. 1844 at nine o'clock</date> in the morning.<span class='line-break'> </span>Presents Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R Curtis</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Reed</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Grading the Town Road.'>Grading the Town Road.</span></p>
<p>Voted.  That the committee who have in charge the <span class='line-break'> </span>erection of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->iron fence</a>, be authorized to apply to the proper<span class='line-break'> </span>town authorities in <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a> for leave to <span class='line-break'> </span>grade the main road in front of the Cemetery at a Section <span class='line-break'> </span>where it interfered with the construction of said <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->fence</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on building'>Com<sup>ee</sup> on building</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Mr Brimmer</a> was excused from serving on the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on building and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Reed</a> was chosen to serve in his place.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062107">
<h3><a name="page-1062107">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 115)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>115</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Relatives of those interred in the Public Lot.'>Relatives of those interred in the <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>Public Lot</a>.</span></p>
<p>Voted.  That any person who has a relative interred in the<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>Public Lot</a> at the Cemetery may on application to any trustee<span class='line-break'> </span>receive a special pass into the Cemetery on Sundays and that<span class='line-break'> </span>the rules and regulations be qualified accordingly</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary may issue tickets on special occasions'>Secretary may issue tickets on special occasions</span></p>
<p>Voted. That the Secretary as well as the Trustees may<span class='line-break'> </span>issue tickets of admission to the Cemetery to stangers &amp;c..</p>
<p>Voted. To adjourn.<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record  attest<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to a notice issued by the Secretary a meeting of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was holden on <date when='1844-07-29'>the twenty ninth day of July A.D 1844</date><span class='line-break'> </span>at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a> at 11 o'clock. A.M.  Present<span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>, Read, </a><a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>^<sup>B. A. </sup> Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a> ^<sup>[?] </sup> and <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>. The Treasurer <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Mr Bond</a> also present.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Scots Charitbl. Society.'><a href='/pages/subjects/59590' title='Scots&apos; Charitable Society'>Scots Charit<sup>bl.</sup> Society</a>.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That the <a href='/pages/subjects/59590' title='Scots&apos; Charitable Society'>Scots Charitable Society</a> be allowed three<span class='line-break'> </span>tickets of admission to the Cemetery according to their written<span class='line-break'> </span>application for the same, under date <date when='1844-01-20'>January 20, 1844</date>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='S. Newell.'><a href='/pages/subjects/58794' title='Newell, Samuel R.'>S. Newell</a>.</span></p>
<p>Voted. To refer <a href='/pages/subjects/58794' title='Newell, Samuel R.'>Samuels Newells</a> application date <date when='1844-02-05'>Feby 5, '44</date> =<span class='line-break'> </span>asking the grant of a lot in payment for services, to the standing<span class='line-break'> </span>committee on finance, with instructions to consider the applica-</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accounts.'>Accounts.</span></p>
<p>tion and report thereon to this Board, and to take measures in<span class='line-break'> </span>relation to the future auditing of accounts.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 61. E. Hurlbert.'><a href='/pages/subjects/59592' title='Lot 61'>Lot 61</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/59720' title='Hurlburt, Elisha'>E. Hurlbert</a>.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That for the time being, <a href='/pages/subjects/59594' title='Noble, Sarah'>Sarah Noble</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> wife<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/59595' title='Noble, John H.'>John H. Noble</a>, be designated to represent the lot in the Ceme<span class='line-break'></span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062108">
<h3><a name="page-1062108">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 116)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>116</p>
<p>-tery late of <a href='/pages/subjects/59720' title='Hurlburt, Elisha'>Elisha Hurlburt</a> and to vote in the meetings of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation. according to the written assent and application<span class='line-break'> </span>of all divisees. dated. <date when='1844-04-19'>April 19. 1844</date>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 584. S. French.'><a href='/pages/subjects/59721' title='Lot 584'>Lot 584</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/59722' title='French, Samuel'>S. French</a>.</span></p>
<p>Voted.  That in accordance with the application of the <span class='line-break'> </span>heirs. of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/59722' title='French, Samuel'>Samuel French</a> dated <date when='1842-07-26'>July 26<sup>th</sup> 1842</date>, the eldest <span class='line-break'> </span>daughter, <a href='/pages/subjects/59723' title='French, Hannah'>Hannah French</a>, be designated for the time being to repre<span class='line-break'></span>sent the lot in the Cemetery late of said Samuel, and to vote <span class='line-break'> </span>in the meetings of the Corporation</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mass. Hort. Society'><a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass. Hort. Society</a></span></p>
<p>Voted. To refer the letter of a committee of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Massa<span class='line-break'></span>chusetts Horticultural Society</a> dated <date when='1843-12-23'>Dec 23. 1843</date> in relation<span class='line-break'> </span>to the sale of rights of burial. and the accounting for the<span class='line-break'> </span>proceeds thereof to a Committee consisting of the President<span class='line-break'> </span>and Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P.</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>, with instructions to commu<span class='line-break'></span>nicate with the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a> in relation to the <span class='line-break'> </span>same, and to consider the whole subject of the connec<span class='line-break'></span>tion of this Corporation with said <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'><!--Mass Hort-->Society</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Price of Lots'>Price of Lots</span></p>
<p>Voted. That the term during which the lots may<span class='line-break'> </span>be sold for eighty dollars be further extended to <date when='1844-11-01'>Novem<span class='line-break'></span>ber 1<sup>st</sup></date> in the present year.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 156 G. Bond.'><a href='/pages/subjects/59724' title='Lot 156'>Lot 156</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>G. Bond</a>.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That on application in writing of such of the<span class='line-break'> </span>heirs of <a href='/pages/subjects/59725' title='Bond, George'>George Bond's</a> lot as are not minors, the Secre<span class='line-break'></span>tary issue a ticket of admission to the Cemetery to<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59726' title='Bond, George, Mrs.'>Mrs George Bond</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 65 W. Pelby'><a href='/pages/subjects/59727' title='Lot 65'>Lot 65</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/64871' title='Pelby, William'>W. Pelby</a></span></p>
<p>Voted. That <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Mr Isaac Parker</a> be a committee to <del>compel</del> order<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/64871' title='Pelby, William'>Mr Pelby</a> to close his tomb.  Voted.  To adjourn.</p>
<p>A true record. attest <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>  Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062109">
<h3><a name="page-1062109">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 117)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>117</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to a notice issued by the Secretary a meeting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was holden at the house of <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Jacob Bigelow</a> at <date when='1844-09-14T10:00:00'>10 o'clock<span class='line-break'> </span>A.M. on the fourteenth day of September A.D. 1844</date>. Present Messrs<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendants Assistant.'>Superintendants Assistant.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That the Superintendant  <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Howe</a> be authorized to em<span class='line-break'> </span>-ploy an assistant in all cases where his health requires it.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Purchase of Lands'>Purchase of Lands</span></p>
<p>Voted. That the committee on finance be authorized to make<span class='line-break'> </span>the purchase of the <a href='/pages/subjects/58907' title='Pomroy, Mrs.'>Pomeroy</a> place and any other lands adjoin<span class='line-break'> </span>ing the Cemetery grounds as they may see fit to be added<span class='line-break'> </span>thereto.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chapel.'><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> when erected shall be built of granite.</p>
<p>Voted. To adjourn to meet again at this place, at <date when='1844-10-11T10:00:00'>the same <span class='line-break'> </span>hour on Friday. October 11</date>.</p>
<p>a true record. Attest: <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'>Trustees</span></p>
<p>No meeting having convened agreeably to the adjournment<span class='line-break'> </span>as next above recorded, the usual notice having been is<span class='line-break'> </span>sued by the Secretary for another meeting of the trustees at<span class='line-break'> </span>the house of <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a>, at <date when='1844-10-15T15:15:00'>a quarter after three o'clock<span class='line-break'> </span>P.M. on the fifteenth day of October A.D. 1844</date>, there were<span class='line-break'> </span>then and there present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>. Read.</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Par<span class='line-break'> </span>-ker</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and also the Treasurer <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Mr. Bond</a>. After some discussion<span class='line-break'> </span>in relation to the proposed <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'>Chapel at Mount Auburn</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Judge Story</a> having formally stated his own opinion<span class='line-break'> </span>to be in favor of the immediate erection of a <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062110">
<h3><a name="page-1062110">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 118)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>118</p>
<p>retired from the meeting and Mr <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> was called<span class='line-break'> </span>to the chair. It was then.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chapel'><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a></span></p>
<p>Voted. That this Corporation proceed to the erection<span class='line-break'> </span>of a <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>.</p>
<p>Voted. That the building be erected in fine hammered<span class='line-break'> </span>granite.</p>
<p>Voted. To amend the last vote by inserting the word <span class='line-break'> </span>"Quincy" before the word "Granite".</p>
<p>Voted. That the building Committee consist of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Jacob Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a><span class='line-break'> </span>with power to sign the contracts on behalf of this<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation for erecting the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> at an expense<span class='line-break'> </span>not exceeding twenty five thousand dollars.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Mr Brimmer</a> having withdrawn it was.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stone estate'>Stone estate</span></p>
<p>Voted. That <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis Esquire</a>, and the <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Sec<span class='line-break'></span>retary<!--Parker--></a> be a committee with power to complete the<span class='line-break'> </span>purchase from the heirs of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/59733' title='Stone, Moses'>Moses Stone</a>, and<span class='line-break'> </span>^ p 190 [er seq?] with power to execute any such deeds in relation<span class='line-break'> </span>to the present interests of the Corporation in the<span class='line-break'> </span>dower estate of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/58907' title='Pomroy, Mrs.'>Mrs Pomeroy</a> as they<span class='line-break'> </span>shall deem proper.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perpetual repair of Lots.'>Perpetual repair of Lots.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That in every case in which any person<span class='line-break'> </span>shall execute an instrument of trust in the form<span class='line-break'> </span>hitherto prescribed, and thereby transfer to this Corpo<span class='line-break'></span>ration such sum as the Committee on lots may<span class='line-break'> </span>in each case approve (not less than one hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars) in trust for the good ordering and care<span class='line-break'> </span>of any special lot and for other purpose as therein</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062111">
<h3><a name="page-1062111">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 119)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>119</p>
<p>specified, this Corporation will guarantee to the <span class='line-break'> </span>person so transferring said sum of money his<span class='line-break'> </span>heirs and assigns, and those representing said<span class='line-break'> </span>lot, that said lot shall forever be kept in good<span class='line-break'> </span>order and repair.</p>
<p>Voted. That all such agreements and bequests<span class='line-break'> </span>be recorded in a book to be prepared for that<span class='line-break'> </span>purpose.</p>
<p>Voted. That Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P.</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a> be a committee<span class='line-break'> </span>to prepare such book.</p>
<p>Voted. To adjourn.  A true record<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>A meeting of the Trustees having been called on notices<span class='line-break'> </span>from the Secretary at the house of <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> on <date when='1844-12-23T19:15:00'>Mon<span class='line-break'></span>day evening December twenty third, at a quarter after<span class='line-break'> </span>seven o'clock</date> Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>, Read &amp;</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a><span class='line-break'> </span>were accordingly in attendance, also <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Mr Bond</a> the Treasu<span class='line-break'></span>rer, but no quorum of the trustees being present the<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting dissolved without taking any action.</p>
<p>A true record,  Attest<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> Secretary</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'>Trustees</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issues in the usual manner by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary a meeting of the trustees was holden at the office<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> Esquire, at <date when='1844-12-28T11:00:00'>11 o'clock A.M. on Saturday the twen<span class='line-break'></span>ty eighth day of December A.D. 1844</date>. Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>,  The Presi-</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062112">
<h3><a name="page-1062112">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 120)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>120</p>
<p>dent being absent <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> was chosen to preside pro <span class='line-break'> </span>tem.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Geo. C. Shattuck&apos;s Lot.'><a href='/pages/subjects/55020' title='Shattuck, George C.'>Geo. C. Shattuck</a>'s Lot.</span></p>
<p>The following vote, was then passed.</p>
<p>Whereas <a href='/pages/subjects/55020' title='Shattuck, George C.'>George C. Shattuck</a> of the <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>City of Boston</a> Phys<span class='line-break'></span>ician has agreed to pay to the Trustees of the Proprie<span class='line-break'></span>tors of ^<sup>the Cemetery of</sup> Mount Auburn the sum of one thousand dol<span class='line-break'></span>lars to be expended in fencing draining and otherwise <span class='line-break'> </span>improving the grounds of ^<sup>the</sup> said Cemetery, in consideration<span class='line-break'> </span>of the said Proprietors agreeing forever to keep in repair<span class='line-break'> </span>the Lot, fence and monument of the said Shattuck <span class='line-break'> </span>in the said Cemetery - therefore -</p>
<p>Voted. That for the con<span class='line-break'></span>sideration aforesaid the Proprietors of the Cemetery of<span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn do hereby agree forever to keep in repair<span class='line-break'> </span>the said lot fence and monument free of all charge to<span class='line-break'> </span>the said Shattuck or his heirs.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Record of bequests &amp;c'>Record of bequests &amp;c</span></p>
<p>The Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> presented the following report which<span class='line-break'> </span>was therefore accepted by the meeting.</p>
<p>"The subscribers, being a committee to whom it was<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to prepare a book in which should be recorded<span class='line-break'> </span>the grants and bequests made to the Proprietors of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn for the purpose of keeping<span class='line-break'> </span>in order particular lots in the Cemetery, beg leave to <span class='line-break'> </span>report, that they have procured a book for that purpose<span class='line-break'> </span>which they herewith present; and they further report<span class='line-break'> </span>that the Secretary be directed to enter at the beginning<span class='line-break'> </span>of ^<sup>the</sup> said book an attested copy of the votes heretofore<span class='line-break'> </span>passed, and of this report and the vote of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees  thereon which is hereto subjoined, all of which is<span class='line-break'> </span>respectfully submitted.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062113">
<h3><a name="page-1062113">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 121)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>121</p>
<p>" Voted. That the above report be accepted and that<span class='line-break'> </span>the recording of the instrument of grant or bequest  in<span class='line-break'> </span>this book shall be deemed and amount to a contract<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Proprietors of the Cemetery with the person repre<span class='line-break'></span>senting the particular lot that such lot shall forever<span class='line-break'> </span>be kept in good order and repair according to the<span class='line-break'> </span>terms and conditions of such contract.</p>
<p>(Signed) <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a> "</p>
<p>Which report having been accepted and the<span class='line-break'> </span>said vote passed, the meeting adjourned.</p>
<p>A true record.  Attest<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>  Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner by the Secre<span class='line-break'></span>tary a meeting of the Trustees was holden at the office of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> Esquire at<date when='1845-02-01T11:00:00'> 11 o'clock A.M. on Saturday the first day <span class='line-break'> </span>of February A.D. 1845</date>.  Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>George W. Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Martin Brimmer</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B. A. Gould</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> and the <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Treasurer<!--Bond--></a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> was chosen Chairman.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer&apos;s Annual Report.'>Treasurer's Annual Report.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->The Treasurer</a> submitted his annual report - which was<span class='line-break'> </span>read, and by a vote of the Trustees accepted and ordered to be<span class='line-break'> </span>presented to the Proprietors at their annual meeting on Mon<span class='line-break'></span>day next.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mass. Hort. Soc&apos;y.'><a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass. Hort. Soc'y.</a></span></p>
<p>A letter for the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Massachusetts Horticultural Society</a> in re<span class='line-break'></span>lation to the proceeds of the sales of rights of burial, dated<span class='line-break'> </span>having been read. <ins>Voted.</ins>  To refer the same to the com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee (appointed <date when='1844-07-29'>July 29, 1844</date>) already having the same sub<span class='line-break'></span>ject in charge.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062114">
<h3><a name="page-1062114">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 122)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>122</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lawrence&apos;s Lots.'>Lawrence's Lots.</span></p>
<p>A letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/55022' title='Lawrence, William (1783-1848)'>Mr William Lawrence</a> dated <date when='1842-01-31'>Jan 31. 1845</date><span class='line-break'> </span>in relation to the perpetual repair of certain lots was referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to the standing committee on lots.</p>
<p>Voted. To Adjourn.<span class='line-break'> </span>A  true record. Attest<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors 1845'>Proprietors 1845</span></p>
<p>Mount Auburn Cemetery.</p>
<p>The Annual Meeting of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of<span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn will be held at the office of the subscriber<span class='line-break'> </span>in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> at No. 27 State Street on <date when='1845-02-03T17:00:00'>Monday the third day <span class='line-break'> </span>of February 1845. at 5 o'clock P.M.</date> to choose Trustees for<span class='line-break'> </span>the ensuing year, to hear the report of the Treasurer, and<span class='line-break'> </span>to act on any other business which may legally come<span class='line-break'> </span>before the said meeting.<span class='line-break'> </span>(Signed) <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1845-01-11'>January 11, 1845</date>. Secretary.</p>
<p>Pursuant to the above notice which was published in<span class='line-break'> </span>several newspapers printed in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> more than seven<span class='line-break'> </span>days before the said time of meeting, the Proprietors of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery of Mount Auburn met at the time and<span class='line-break'> </span>place therein designated.</p>
<p>In the absence of the President, the meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>was called to order by <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->the Secretary</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/55022' title='Lawrence, William (1783-1848)'>William<span class='line-break'> </span>Lawrence Esquire</a> was chosen Chairman.</p>
<p>The Treasurer's annual report was then presented<span class='line-break'> </span>read and ordered to be recorded.</p>
</div>
</div>
