<h3><a name="page-1062118">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 126)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>126.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner by the Sec<span class='line-break'></span>retary, a meeting of the Trustees was holden at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.<span class='line-break'> </span>P. Curtis Esqr</a> at <date when='1854-04-01T15:30:00'>3 1/2 o'clock in the afternoon of April 1<sup>st</sup>.<span class='line-break'> </span>A.D. 1845</date>. Present <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P.<span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Benj. A. Gould</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Geo. W. Crockett</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Officers chosen.'>Officers chosen.</span></p>
<p>The Trustees then proceeded to the election of a President<span class='line-break'> </span>by ballot, and <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a> was thereupon elected.</p>
<p>In like manner <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> was elected Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>George W. Bond</a> Treasurer, severally by ballot.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Martin Brimmer</a> and the Treasurer <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Mr Bond</a> now<span class='line-break'> </span>appeared and attended the rest of the meeting</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on Finance.'>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Finance.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That the same gentlemen as last year viz: Messrs<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B.A. Gould</a>. constitute the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Finance for the ensuing year.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on Lots'>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots</span></p>
<p>Voted. That the Committee on Lots for the ensuing<span class='line-break'> </span>year consist of the same gentlemen who constituted that<span class='line-break'> </span>committee the past year. vis. Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Catalogue'>Catalogue</span></p>
<p>Voted. To refer the subject of publishing a Catalogue and <span class='line-break'> </span>Map of the grounds the present year to the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on lots with authority to publish the same under <span class='line-break'> </span>such arrangements as may be made by them.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Purchase of Land.'>Purchase of Land.</span></p>
<p>Voted. To appoint a Committee of one to ascertain<span class='line-break'> </span>for what any land adjoining the Cemetery at Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn can be purchased. and to report to the board.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr J. Bigelow</a> was accordingly appointed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Suptds House painted.'><a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>Sup<sup>tds</sup> House</a> painted.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That the Committee on lots be authorized to<span class='line-break'> </span>cause the <a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>house of the Superintendent</a> to be painted<span class='line-break'> </span>if they shall see fit, and in such style as they<span class='line-break'> </span>shall think proper.</p>
</div>
</div>

<p>In the absence of the Secretary <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a> was chosen Secre<span class='line-break'></span>tary pro tem.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chapel windows.'><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> windows.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> presented and read two letters from Scotland <span class='line-break'> </span>respecting stained glass windows for the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>. <p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. <p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Joseph Story memorial of.'><a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a> memorial of.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> offered the following resolutions which <span class='line-break'> </span>having been read was unanimously adopted: -</p>
<p>The Trustees of Mount Auburn Cemetery deeply affected <span class='line-break'> </span>by the event which has taken from them their presiding<span class='line-break'> </span>head, and from society one of its most beloved and <span class='line-break'> </span>distinguished ornaments are anxious that some suitable <span class='line-break'> </span>memorial should be placed in remembrance of his <span class='line-break'> </span>worth upon a spot which was <del>be</del>loved and frequented <span class='line-break'> </span>by him in life, and to the improvement of which he <span class='line-break'> </span>devoted much of his time and ardent interest.</p>
<p>Therefore voted. That the Trustees offer to the friends <span class='line-break'> </span>and fellow citizens of the deceased a place in the new <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> now in the progress of erection at Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn for the reception of a <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>marble statue of the <span class='line-break'> </span>late Joseph Story</a>, when such a work, worthy of the</p>

<p>129.</p>
<p>character of <del>the</del>its original shall have been completed <span class='line-break'> </span>through the contributions of the public.</p>
<p>Voted.  That the Secretary be requested to call a <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Trustees on <date when='1845-09-19T09:00:00'>Friday the 19<sup>th</sup> inst at <span class='line-break'> </span>9 o'clock A.M.</date></p>
<p>Voted.  That this notice (as to <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>Judge Story's statue</a>)<span class='line-break'> </span>be published in the newspapers.</p>

That a committee of three be appointed to <span class='line-break'> </span>take order as to the <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>Statue of Judge Story</a>; - Messrs <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis</a> ---- were accordingly<span class='line-break'> </span>appointed to constitute said committee.</p>
<p>Voted. To adjourn.<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a> on the <date when='1845-09-19'>19<sup>th</sup> day of <span class='line-break'> </span>September. 1845</date>. <p>Voted, and chose by ballot <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Doctor Jacob Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span>President of the Corporation.</p>

<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner by <span class='line-break'> </span>the Secretary a meeting of the Trustees was holden on <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1845-11-15T13:00:00'>Saturday November 15<sup>th</sup> 1845 at one o' clock P. M</date> at the <span class='line-break'> </span>office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a>.  Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. <span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Joseph Story bequest from.'><a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a> bequest from.</span></p>
<p>The President read certain <del>letters</del> ^<sup>papers</sup> concerning a bequest<span class='line-break'> </span>to this Corporation from the late <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Judge Story</a>, after <span class='line-break'> </span>some conversation Voted. That we accept the bequest - <span class='line-break'> </span>from the late <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a> and that <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a><span class='line-break'> </span>be authorized to receive the same and give <span class='line-break'> </span>the necessary receipts.   And further - - -</p>
<p>Voted.  To refer the whole subject of the said bequest <span class='line-break'> </span>to a committee of two to report at an adjourned meet<span class='line-break'></span>ing.  The Committee chosen for this purpose are <span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Story memorial.'><a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>Story memorial</a>.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Mr Brimmer</a> presented the subscription papers in <span class='line-break'> </span>relation to the <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>statue of the late Judge Story</a>, thereupon <span class='line-break'> </span>(in conformity with the terms of said subscriptions) - -</p>
<p>Voted.  That a meeting of the subscribers to said statue<span class='line-break'> </span>be called at the office of the Secretary of this Corporation on <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1845-11-25T16:00:00'>Tuesday the 25<sup>th</sup> inst at 4 o'clock P.M.</date> by individual <span class='line-break'> </span>notification from the Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='A.B. Young.'><a href='/pages/subjects/59751' title='Young, Ammi B.'>A.B. Young</a>.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Mr Brimmer</a> submitted to the meeting a letter<span class='line-break'> </span>from <a href='/pages/subjects/59751' title='Young, Ammi B.'>Ammi B. Young</a> in relation to a design <span class='line-break'> </span>and plans furnished by  him for a <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'>Chapel at Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn</a>, which having been read it was <span class='line-break'> </span>unanimously Voted.  That a vote of thanks be pre<span class='line-break'></span>sented to <a href='/pages/subjects/59751' title='Young, Ammi B.'>Mr Young</a> for the donation of his bill for <span class='line-break'> </span>a valuable design for a <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'>Chapel at Mount Auburn</a>.</p>

That <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->Secretary</a> execute and<span class='line-break'> </span>deliver to <a href='/pages/subjects/59752' title='Brasee, Morton P.'>M.P. Brazee</a> or his assigns a deed of the land<span class='line-break'> </span>heretofore conveyed to him by ^<sup>a</sup> deed bearing date on the<span class='line-break'> </span>_____ day of _____, with a general<span class='line-break'> </span>warranty against all claims.<span class='line-break'> </span>and the vote so presented was thereupon accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and passed by the Trustees.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Story J. bequest from'><a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Story J.</a> bequest from</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>Mr B.R. Curtis</a> presented the following Report.<span class='line-break'> </span>The Committee to whom was refered the subject of the<span class='line-break'> </span>bequest of the last <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Mr Justice Story</a>, beg leave respect<span class='line-break'></span>fully to report that the nature of the trusts upon<span class='line-break'> </span>which the bequest was made, in their opinion requires<span class='line-break'> </span>a separate account to be kept of the income and<span class='line-break'> </span>expenditures of this fund, but pursuant to a regula<span class='line-break'></span>tion made by the Trustees on the <date when='1843-07-15'>15<sup>th</sup> day of July<span class='line-break'> </span>1843</date>. there can be no separate investment of it;<span class='line-break'> </span>that regulation was as follows. (See vote on page 95.)<span class='line-break'> </span>We do not perceive any good reason why it should be de<span class='line-break'></span>parted from it this instance. The donor was himself<span class='line-break'> </span>one of the persons by whom the regulation was made,<span class='line-break'> </span>and having made a bequest which comes within its<span class='line-break'> </span>terms &amp; spirit must be taken to have made the be<span class='line-break'></span>quest subject to the regulation. At the same time<span class='line-break'> </span>we should think it proper to give notice to the Execu<span class='line-break'></span>tors of <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Mr Justice Story</a> of the regulation and how<span class='line-break'> </span>the income of the fund will be ascertained.  We<span class='line-break'> </span>have subjoined certain votes which we think <span class='line-break'> </span>should be passed.</p>
<p>Voted. That <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> open an account on his<span class='line-break'> </span></p>

<p>books with "The Story Fund," crediting that account from<span class='line-break'> </span>time to time with all sums receivable from the income<span class='line-break'> </span>of the money bequeathed by <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Mr Justice Story</a> to the Cor<span class='line-break'></span>poration in trust and invested pursuant to the regu<span class='line-break'></span>lations passed by the Trustees on the <date when='1843-07-15'>15<sup>th</sup> day of July<span class='line-break'> </span>1843</date>. and charging that account with the amounts<span class='line-break'> </span>reported by <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'><!--Howe-->the Superintendent</a> as expenses of the care of<span class='line-break'> </span>the lot &amp;c. pursuant to the vote next following; and that<span class='line-break'> </span>any surplus of such income be added to the principal<span class='line-break'> </span>and kept invested.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Joseph Story&apos;s lot. No. 313.'><a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a>'s <a href='/pages/subjects/56311' title='Lot 313'>lot. No. 313</a>.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'><!--Howe-->the Superintendent</a> be directed to keep<span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/56311' title='Lot 313'>lot (No. 313)</a> which belonged to the late <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Mr Justice Story</a><span class='line-break'> </span>in good condition and repair, and to keep the said mon<span class='line-break'></span>ument and the iron fence about the same in good con<span class='line-break'></span>dition and repair, and to keep the said lot suitably turfed<span class='line-break'> </span>with suitable shrubs and flowers and trees in and about<span class='line-break'> </span>the same, until the further order of the board, and that <span class='line-break'> </span>he report the expense thereof annually to the Treasurer</p>
<p>Voted. That <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->the Secretary</a> communicate to the Ex<span class='line-break'></span>ecutors of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Mr Justice Story</a>, a copy of the above<span class='line-break'> </span>report and votes and a copy of the regulation re<span class='line-break'></span>fered to therin.</p>
<p>All which was respectfully submitted by<span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a></th> <th>} Com<sup>ee</sup><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R Curtis</a></td> <td>}</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> The above report having been considered was accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and the votes thereto annexed were passed.</p>

<div id="page-1062126">
<h3><a name="page-1062126">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 133)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>133.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Story, Joseph Memorial '> <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>Story, Joseph Memorial</a> </span></p>
<p>"for the purpose of procuring a <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>marble statue of the late <span class='line-break'> </span>Joseph Story</a> to be placed in <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'>Mount Auburn Chapel</a>"<span class='line-break'> </span>notified and holden agreeably to the vote of the Trus<span class='line-break'></span>tees passed in relation thereto at the last meeting viz</p>
<p>"Voted. That the Trustees of the Proprietors of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>"of Mount Auburn be &amp; hereby are appointed a committee<span class='line-break'> </span>"to carry out the view of the subscribers in this matter, and<span class='line-break'> </span>" in case of any exigency to call another meeting of the <span class='line-break'> </span>"subscribers as they shall see fit." - Thereupon it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' STORY Statue.'> <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>STORY Statue</a>.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That the Trustees will accept the commission<span class='line-break'> </span>so intrusted to them by the subscribers to the fund<span class='line-break'> </span>for the erection of a <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>marble statue of the last Joseph<span class='line-break'> </span>Story</a>, and act under the same accordingly</p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> proceed to collect the money<span class='line-break'> </span>so subscribed and cause the same to be invested<span class='line-break'> </span>under the direction of the Committee of Finance.</p>
<p>Voted. That the <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>President<!--Bigelow--></a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Mr Brimmer</a> be<span class='line-break'> </span>a committee to enquire and report a suitable artist<span class='line-break'> </span>to execute the purposes of the subscribers to the <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>statue<span class='line-break'> </span>of Joseph Story</a> and the manner in which the same<span class='line-break'> </span>shall be executed.</p>
<p>The Trustees then adjourned <ins>without day.</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>A true record. Attest<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. '> Trustees. </span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary the Trustees met a the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a><span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1845-12-06T13:00:00'>Saturday, December 6<sup>th</sup>. 1845. at one o'clock P.M.</date> Present<span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062127">
<h3><a name="page-1062127">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 134)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>134.</p>
<p>and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Lot 939. William Gridley-- '> <a href='/pages/subjects/59754' title='Lot 939'>Lot 939</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/59755' title='Gridley, William'>William Gridley</a>-- </span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That in accordance with the application of the <span class='line-break'> </span>heirs of the late William Gridley dated <date when='1845-12-28'>Nov. 28. 1845</date>. <a href='/pages/subjects/59756' title='Gridley, George A.'>George<span class='line-break'> </span>A. Gridley</a> be designated for the time being to represent the<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59754' title='Lot 939'>lot (number 939)</a> late of said <a href='/pages/subjects/59755' title='Gridley, William'>Willaim Gridley</a> and to<span class='line-break'> </span>vote in meetings of the Corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' John C Gray. chosen Trustee. '> <a href='/pages/subjects/54916' title='Gray, John C.'>John C Gray</a>. chosen Trustee. </span></p>
<p>The Trustees then proceeded to the election of  one to<span class='line-break'> </span>fill the vacancy in the Board (caused by the death of<span class='line-break'> </span>the late President, <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a>) until the next annual<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting.  Said Election was had by ballot. The votes<span class='line-break'> </span>having all be given in and counted it appeared that<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54916' title='Gray, John C.'>John C. Gray, Esquire</a>, was unanimously elected to fill<span class='line-break'> </span>said vacancy and the same having been formally<span class='line-break'> </span>announced by the President, the Secretary was instruc<span class='line-break'></span>ted to communicate the fact of said election to <a href='/pages/subjects/54916' title='Gray, John C.'>Mr Gray</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and request his acceptance of the office.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Plan. of the grounds. '>Plan. of the grounds. </span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>H.M. Parker</a>, the Secretary be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>dispose of the plate on which the plan of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>has been engraved, after the next edition, of the Cata<span class='line-break'></span>logue shall have been completed, or to sell or allow<span class='line-break'> </span>any number of copies to be struck from it at such time<span class='line-break'> </span>to be published in a magazine, on such terms as<span class='line-break'> </span>he shall see fit.</p>
<p>No further business coming before the Trustees the<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting was adjourned.</p>
<p>A true record Attest<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062128">
<h3><a name="page-1062128">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 135)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>135.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary, the Trustees met on <date when='1846-01-17T12:00:00'>the seventeenth day of Janu<span class='line-break'></span>ary. 1846. at twelve o'clock</date> in the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Martin Brimmer</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Geo. W. <span class='line-break'> </span>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B.A. Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54916' title='Gray, John C.'>John C. <span class='line-break'> </span>Gray</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a>.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> from the committee on the <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>Story<span class='line-break'> </span>memorial</a>  submitted the following report.</p>
<p>"<a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>. <date when='1846-01-13'>Jan 13. 1846</date><span class='line-break'> </span>"the committee appointed at the last meeting of <span class='line-break'> </span>"the Trustees of Mount Auburn Cemetery, to make inquir<span class='line-break'></span>"ies respecting a suitable artist to execute a <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>Statue of the <span class='line-break'> </span>"late Jude Story</a> - report,</p>
<p>"That they have ascertained that <a href='/pages/subjects/53238' title='Story, William W.'>Mr William <span class='line-break'> </span>"W. Story</a> of this <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'><!--Boston-->city</a> has designed a bust of his father,<span class='line-break'> </span>"and also a small model of a full length statue,<span class='line-break'> </span>"both of which bid fair to convey a more just im<span class='line-break'></span>"pression of the character, expression, and likeness<span class='line-break'> </span>"of the deceased than, in the opinion of the Commit<span class='line-break'></span>"tee, the Trustees would be likely to obtain from <span class='line-break'> </span>"any other source.</p>
<p>"They therefore recommend the passage of <span class='line-break'> </span>"the following vote</p>
<p>"Voted. that a committee be appointed with full <span class='line-break'> </span>"power to contract with <a href='/pages/subjects/53238' title='Story, William W.'>Mr W<sup>m</sup> W. Story</a> for a mar<span class='line-break'></span>"ble <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>statue of the late Mr Justice Story</a> to be placed<span class='line-break'> </span>"by him in <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'>Mount Auburn chapel</a> for a sum <span class='line-break'> </span>"not exceeding the amount which is or may be <span class='line-break'> </span>"subscribed for that object and in the hands of <span class='line-break'> </span>"the Trustees (Signed) <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>}<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>M. Brimmer</a>}  Committee"<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062129">
<h3><a name="page-1062129">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 136)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>136</p>
<p>After some discussion the above report was accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and the vote as thereto annexed passed without a <span class='line-break'> </span>dissenting voice.</p>
<p>Voted, that the same gentlemen (Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a> -<span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a>) serve on said committee, which <span class='line-break'> </span>committee was filled by the addition of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>.</p>
<p>Voted. That the Treasurer complete the collection of <span class='line-break'> </span>the monies subscribed for <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>Judge Story's statue</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Rail Road.'>Rail Road.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That the interests of Mount Auburn in relation<span class='line-break'> </span>to a Rail Road to pass near the Cemetery be referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to a Committee of two with instructions to look after<span class='line-break'> </span>the interests of this Corporation in the matter.</p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a> were appointed <span class='line-break'> </span>said committee</p>
<p>Voted.  That the annual meeting of the Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>on the first Monday in February next be holden at <span class='line-break'> </span>the Secretary's office at 4 o ' clock P.M.</p>
<p>The meeting then adjourned.<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record.  Attest.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees met on the <date when='1845-01-31T12:00:00'>31<sup>st</sup> day of January A. D. 1846 at twelve <span class='line-break'> </span>o'clock</date>, at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> Esquire.  Present Messrs<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Geo. W. Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac<span class='line-break'> </span>Parker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a>, and the <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Treasurer<!--Bond--></a>.</p>
<p>The proceedings of the last meeting having been<span class='line-break'> </span>read, the Treasurer submitted his report, which <span class='line-break'> </span>being in an incomplete state, he asked for further time</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062130">
<h3><a name="page-1062130">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 137)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>137.</p>
<p>and it was Voted.  That when we adjourn, it be to meet<span class='line-break'> </span>at the office of the Secretary on Monday next at 3 1/2 <span class='line-break'> </span>o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>After some general discussion. Voted To adjourn.<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record  Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to adjournment the Trustees met at the office <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Secretary on <date when='1846-02-02T15:30:00'>Monday February 2<sup>nd</sup>, at half after <span class='line-break'> </span>three o'clock. P. M.</date>  Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>, also the <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Treasurer<!--Bond--></a>.</p>
<p>The report of the Treasurer was now submitted<span class='line-break'> </span>in a complete form.  Voted.  To accept this report<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Treasurer, and that it be laid before the<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors at their meeting</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chapel'><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> submitted to the meeting an <span class='line-break'> </span>anonymous letter in relation to an inscription <span class='line-break'> </span>in the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'>Chapel at Mount Auburn</a>, which letter<span class='line-break'> </span>was on motion referred to the building Committee.</p>
<p>Adjourned. A true record.  Attest<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors. 1846.'>Proprietors. 1846.</span></p>
<p>Mount Auburn Cemetery.</p>
<p>The annual meeting of the Proprietors of the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn, will be held at the office of the sub<span class='line-break'></span>scriber, in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, at No. 27 State street, on <date when='1846-02-02T16:00:00'>Monday the <span class='line-break'> </span>second day of February. 1846, at 4 o'clock. P.M.</date> to choose<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees for the ensuing year, to hear the report of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer, and to act on any other business which may<span class='line-break'> </span>legally come before the said meeting.</p>
<p><date when='1846-01-20'>January 20. 1846.</date>  <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062131">
<h3><a name="page-1062131">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 138)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>138.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors.'>Proprietors.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to the foregoing notice which was published <span class='line-break'> </span>in several daily newspapers printed in the  <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>City of Boston</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>more than seven days in succession before the said <span class='line-break'> </span>time of meeting, the Proprietors of the Cemetery of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn, met at the time and place therein<span class='line-break'> </span>designated.  A quorum having assembled. the Presi<span class='line-break'></span>dent <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a>. took the chair</p>
<p>The treasurer's annual report was then read &amp; accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='CATALOGUE'>CATALOGUE</span></p>
<p>Voted.  That the report of the Treasurer be appended to <span class='line-break'> </span>the next edition of the Society's catalogue, and distributed<span class='line-break'> </span>to the members of this corporation, one copy to each<span class='line-break'> </span>member gratuitously.  It being understood that when<span class='line-break'> </span>the catalogues are ready the Secretary shall advertise <span class='line-break'> </span>in the newspapers signifying the time and place<span class='line-break'> </span>when and where Proprietors may obtain their copies</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Chosen'>Trustees Chosen</span></p>
<p>The meeting then proceeded to the election of nine Trustees, <span class='line-break'> </span>by ballot.  It appeared that twenty three votes were <span class='line-break'> </span>thrown all of which were for<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Martin Brimmer</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>George W. Crockett</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>Benjamin R. Curtis</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Benjamin A. Gould</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54916' title='Gray, John C.'>John C. Gray</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a>, and <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a>.  Which nine gentlemen were<span class='line-break'> </span>accordingly declared elected Trustees for the ensuing <span class='line-break'> </span>year.  The meeting then dissolved -</p>
<p>A true record.  Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062132">
<h3><a name="page-1062132">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 139)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>139</p>

<div id="page-1062133">
<h3><a name="page-1062133">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 140)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>140.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer&apos;s Report. 1845'>Treasurer's Report. 1845</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'><!--Howe-->The Superintendant</a> reports the Interments and Im<span class='line-break'></span>provements to be as follows, to wit;<span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Interments this year</th> <th>323</th> <th>whole number</th> <th>2452<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>Tombs built " [this] " [year]</td> <td>7</td> <td>" [whole] " [number]</td> <td>215</td> </tr> <tr><td>Monuments erected  " [this] " [year]</td> <td>25</td> <td>" [whole] " [number]</td> <td>274</td> </tr> <tr><td>Lots improved by being</td> <td>___</td> </tr> <tr><td>Sodded &amp;c.</td> <td>140</td> </tr> <tr><td>Enclosed with railings, Chains &amp;c.</td> <td>45.</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> The number of lots sold within the last year is 100.</p>
<p>It will be seen by the annexed Trial Balance there is in<span class='line-break'></span>vested &amp; in the Treasury $27357.67 of which $2612 are for<span class='line-break'> </span>special trusts, leaving $24745.67 which after paying all the<span class='line-break'> </span>liabilities contracted for the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> now being erected will <span class='line-break'> </span>leave a balance of about $10.000 in the Treasury. </p>

<div id="page-1062135">
<h3><a name="page-1062135">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 142)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>142.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner by the Sec<span class='line-break'></span>retary, the Trustees met on <date when='1846-02-25T12:00:00'>the 25<sup>th</sup> day of February A. D. 1846</date>.<span class='line-break'> </span>at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esquire</a> at 12 o'clock. Noon<span class='line-break'></span>Present. Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Geo. W. Crockett</a>  <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>, and the Treasurer <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a> appeared before the adjournment.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Officers elected.'>Officers elected.</span></p>
<p>The meeting proceeded to the election of officers <span class='line-break'> </span>for the current year.  <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a> was unanimously <span class='line-break'> </span>rÃ«elected President by ballot.  In like manner<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> was elected Secretary and <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>George <span class='line-break'> </span>W. Bond</a>, Treasurer severally by ballot.</p>
<p>Voted, that the Committee on Lots for the ensuing <span class='line-break'> </span>year consist of the same gentlemen who constituted that <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee the past year. to wit. Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a>.</p>
<p>Voted. That <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Mr George W. Crockett</a> act as auditor <span class='line-break'> </span>of accounts to the Corporation.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Mr Isaac Parker</a> having asked to be excused from <span class='line-break'> </span>acting longer on the Committee on Finance, it was</p>
<p>Voted.  That the Committee on Finance for the ensuing <span class='line-break'> </span>year consist of Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B.A. Gould</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Geo. W. Crockett</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Catalogue'>Catalogue</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> having brought the matter of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Catalogue and <a href='/pages/subjects/59923' title='Dearborn, Nathaniel'>Mr Nath<sup>l</sup> Dearborn's</a> proposal to pub<span class='line-break'></span>lish the same, to the notice, of the Trustees it was <span class='line-break'> </span>ordered that the Secretary answer <a href='/pages/subjects/59923' title='Dearborn, Nathaniel'>Mr Dearborn</a> by letter<span class='line-break'> </span>informing him that so much progress has been made <span class='line-break'> </span>in publishing the map and catalogue, that it would <span class='line-break'> </span>be impracticable now to employ him in the business.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Newell'><a href='/pages/subjects/58794' title='Newell, Samuel R.'>Newell</a></span></p>
<p>Voted.  That the matter of settling the claim of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58794' title='Newell, Samuel R.'>Mr Newell</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a>, and as to whether he shall</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062136">
<h3><a name="page-1062136">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 143)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>143</p>
<p>be further employed by the Corporation be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Finance with full powers.</p>
<p>Adjourned.  A true record. Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts.<span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk. ss. <date when='1846-02-26'>February 26. A.D. 1846</date>. Then personally<span class='line-break'> </span>appeared <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>, and made oath that<span class='line-break'> </span>he would faithfully perform the duties of the Secre<span class='line-break'></span>tary of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn. Before me.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59927' title='Brooks, Benjamin F.'>Benjamin F. Brooks</a>       Justice of the Peace.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary. the Trustees met at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1845-04-25T12:00:00'>Saturday. April 25<sup>th</sup> 1846. at twelve o'clock.</date> Present<span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> and<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>. The <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Treasurer<!--Bond--></a> was also present.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Catalogue'>Catalogue</span></p>
<p>Voted. That there shall be inserted in the Cata<span class='line-break'></span>logue which is about to be issued, such litho<span class='line-break'></span>graphic views as the president may cause to be <span class='line-break'> </span>prepared.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Leave to construct tomb refused.'>Leave to construct tomb refused.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That <a href='/pages/subjects/59928' title='Farnham, Henry'>Mr Henry Farnham's</a> <del>for</del> request for<span class='line-break'> </span>a lot with the right of construction a tomb, be refused<span class='line-break'> </span>as incompatible with the standing regulation of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Form of deeds of lots.'>Form of deeds of lots.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That no deed of any lot shall contain any <span class='line-break'> </span>declaration of trust, without the special vote of the <span class='line-break'> </span>board therefor.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062137">
<h3><a name="page-1062137">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 144)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>144.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendant&apos;s Accounts'>Superintendant's Accounts</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Mr Crockett</a> from the Committee on Finance made a <span class='line-break'> </span>verbal report in relation to the accounts as kept by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendant, and also a plan for simplifying<span class='line-break'> </span>the keeping of the books at the Cemetery; thereupon</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt&apos;s Books.'>Sup<sup>t's</sup> Books.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That the Committee of finance be directed <span class='line-break'> </span>to procure a set of books in conformity with the plan<span class='line-break'> </span>recommended by them, and that they instruct the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendant to keep the accounts in said books.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 103. White.-'><a href='/pages/subjects/59931' title='Lot 103'>Lot 103</a>. White.-</span></p>
<p>Voted. That such one of the heirs of the late<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59932' title='White, Abijah'>Abijah White</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a> as may be designated<span class='line-break'> </span>by the unanimous written consent of the said heirs<span class='line-break'> </span>be designated to represent the lot owned by said <span class='line-break'> </span>White for the time being and to vote in the<span class='line-break'> </span>meetings of this Corporation.</p>
<p>The meeting then adjourned<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'>Trustees</span></p>
<p>A meeting of the Trustees having been called in the usual<span class='line-break'> </span>manner on notices issued by the Secretary to be held at<span class='line-break'> </span>the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esquire</a> <date when='1846-07-25T12:00:00'>July 25. 1846. at 12 o'clock</date> <span class='line-break'> </span>M. Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54916' title='Gray, John C.'>J.C. Gray</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>George W. Crockett</a><span class='line-break'> </span>were accordingly in attendance but no quorum being<span class='line-break'> </span>present the meeting was adjourned to <date when='1846-07-29T12:00:00'>Wednesday July 29<span class='line-break'> </span>1846. at 12 o'clock M.</date> at the same place.</p>
<p>A true record<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/59927' title='Brooks, Benjamin F.'>Benj<sup>n</sup> F. Brooks</a> Secretary pro tem.<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record ex relatione <a href='/pages/subjects/59927' title='Brooks, Benjamin F.'>B.F. Brooks</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>

<div id="page-1062138">
<h3><a name="page-1062138">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 145)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>145.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'>Trustees</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to adjournment ^<sup>and also in conformity with the usual notice from ^the Secretary^</sup> the Trustees met at the time and<span class='line-break'> </span>place specified above on <date when='1846-07-29T12:00:00'>the 29<sup>th</sup> day of July. 1846.</date> Present <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Jacob Bigelow</a>, Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>George W. Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trespass on Lot. 756.'>Trespass on <a href='/pages/subjects/59935' title='Lot 756'>Lot. 756</a>.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That the complaint of <a href='/pages/subjects/59936' title='Clary, Henry B.'>Henry <ins>B.</ins> Clary</a> for injury <span class='line-break'> </span>to the furniture of his lot be refered to <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> and<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54916' title='Gray, John C.'>Mr Gray</a> to investigate the matter with power, if they <span class='line-break'> </span>deem it expedient, to offer a reward not exceeding one<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred dollars for the detection of the offender.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gate Keeper. absence of.'>Gate Keeper. absence of.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That the Gate Keeper be allowed to attend<span class='line-break'> </span>Church on Sunday forenoons, and that the Superin<span class='line-break'></span>tendent be authorized to employ a substitute and to <span class='line-break'> </span>pay him a reasonable compensation for his services.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='salary of.'>salary of.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That the salary of the Gate Keeper be at the <span class='line-break'> </span>rate of <del>twelve</del> ^<sup>thirty</sup> dollars per month. /$30./</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Lot. 103. White.'> <a href='/pages/subjects/59931' title='Lot 103'>Lot. 103</a>. White.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That <a href='/pages/subjects/59937' title='White, William A.'>William A. White</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a> be <span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to represent the lot owned by the late<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59932' title='White, Abijah'>Abijah White</a>, and to vote in the meetings of this Cor<span class='line-break'></span>poration.</p>
<p>The meeting then adjourned.<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/59927' title='Brooks, Benjamin F.'>Benj<sup>n</sup> F. Brooks</a>-- Secretary pro tem.<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record ex relatione <a href='/pages/subjects/59927' title='Brooks, Benjamin F.'>B.F. Brooks</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner by the Secreta<span class='line-break'></span>ry a meeting of the Trustees was holden on <date when='1846-08-22T12:00:00'>the 22<sup>nd</sup> day <span class='line-break'> </span>of August 1846 _ at 12 o'clock, noon</date>, at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.<span class='line-break'> </span>P. Curtis</a>. Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54916' title='Gray, John C.'>Gray</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>. also the</p>

</div>

<div id="page-1062139">
<h3><a name="page-1062139">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 146)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>146.</p>
<p>Treasurer, <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Mr Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary pro tem'>Secretary pro tem</span></p>
<p>Voted. That <a href='/pages/subjects/59927' title='Brooks, Benjamin F.'>B.F. Brooks</a> be appointed Secretary pro tem.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gate Keeper. charges against.'>Gate Keeper. charges against.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54916' title='Gray, John C.'>Gray</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span>be a Committee to investigate the charges made by <a href='/pages/subjects/60358' title='Ward, William'>Mr Ward</a><span class='line-break'> </span>against <a href='/pages/subjects/58903' title='Hyde, Jonathan'><!--Hyde-->the Gate Keeper</a>, and to take into consideration<span class='line-break'> </span>what alterations, if any, should be made of the regulation<span class='line-break'> </span>respecting the admissions to the grounds and report at<span class='line-break'> </span>a future meeting</p>
<p>Voted. to adjourn.</p>
<p>A true record<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/59927' title='Brooks, Benjamin F.'>Benj<sup>n</sup> F. Brooks</a> Secretary pro tem.<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record, ex relatione <a href='/pages/subjects/59927' title='Brooks, Benjamin F.'>B.F. Brooks</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary, a meeting of the Trustees was holden on<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1846-10-02'>the 2<sup>nd</sup> day of October. 1846</date>. at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esquire</a><span class='line-break'> </span>at 12 o'clock. noon. present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>, Read,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a> and the Treasurer, <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Mr Bond</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='R. Martin&apos;s &apos;scenery of Mount Auburn-&apos; '><a href='/pages/subjects/59945' title='Martin, R.'>R. Martin's</a> 'scenery of Mount Auburn-' </span></p>
<p>Voted. That Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54916' title='Gray, John C.'>Gray</a> be a <span class='line-break'> </span>committee to take into consideration the proposal of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59945' title='Martin, R.'>R. Martin</a> to publish engravings of Mount Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>scenery and to report thereon.</p>
<p>Voted. To adjourn<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/59927' title='Brooks, Benjamin F.'>Benj<sup>n</sup> F. Brooks</a>-- Secretary pro tem.<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record, ex relatione <a href='/pages/subjects/59927' title='Brooks, Benjamin F.'>B.F. Brooks</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
