<div id="page-1062140">
<h3><a name="page-1062140">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 147)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>147.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner by the Sec<span class='line-break'></span>retary a meeting of the Trustees was holden on the <date when='1846-12-26T12:00:00'>26<sup>th</sup> day of Decem<span class='line-break'></span>ber 1846</date>, at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, at 12 o'clock noon. present, Messrs <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>, also<span class='line-break'> </span>the Treasurer, <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Mr Bond</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='R. Martin&apos;s publication.'><a href='/pages/subjects/59945' title='Martin, R.'>R. Martin's</a> publication.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> from the Committee appointed at the last <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting made a verbal statement to the meeting and in<span class='line-break'> </span>conclusion submitted the following report in writing<span class='line-break'> </span>" The Committe Report. That the subject be recommitted to<span class='line-break'> </span>" the same committee with authority to assist <a href='/pages/subjects/59945' title='Martin, R.'>Mr Martin</a><span class='line-break'> </span>" in the completion of his work with a sum not exceeding<span class='line-break'> </span>" five hundred dollars; for the committee</p>
<p>"<a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>."</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> having retired from the meeting, <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Mr Brimmer</a><span class='line-break'> </span>was unanimously called to preside. The subject of the above<span class='line-break'> </span>report and the proposed publication of engravings of Mt<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn Scenery, was again taken up and after considerable <span class='line-break'> </span>farther discussion, it was-</p>
<p>Voted. That the Trustees are not satisfied that they have<span class='line-break'> </span>authority to appropriate the funds of this Corporation to the<span class='line-break'> </span>purpose of the publication above mentioned.</p>
<p>Also. Voted. That the subject be recommitted to the same<span class='line-break'> </span>committee with instructions to assist <a href='/pages/subjects/59945' title='Martin, R.'>Mr Martin</a> so far as <span class='line-break'> </span>they can under this view of the powers vested in the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gate Keeper. charges against.'>Gate Keeper. charges against.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Mr Brimmer</a> from a Committee appointed <span class='line-break'> </span>on the <date when='1846-08-22'>22<sup>nd</sup> day of August last</date> submitted the fol<span class='line-break'></span>lowing report in writing which having been read<span class='line-break'> </span>was unanimously accepted.</p>
<p>The Committee appointed to enquire into the charges made<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062141">
<h3><a name="page-1062141">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 148)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>148.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Charges against Gate Keeper- Report on continued.-'> Charges against Gate Keeper- Report on continued.-</span></p>
<p>by <a href='/pages/subjects/60358' title='Ward, William'>W<sup>m</sup> Ward Esqr</a> against <a href='/pages/subjects/58903' title='Hyde, Jonathan'>Mr Hyde</a>, the gate keeper at Mt<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn, have had a hearing the parties &amp; beg leave to report<span class='line-break'> </span>That in relation to the first charge (the refusal to admit <a href='/pages/subjects/60358' title='Ward, William'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Ward's</a> carriage) <a href='/pages/subjects/60358' title='Ward, William'>Mr Ward</a> seemed to be aware that he was not<span class='line-break'> </span>entitled to enter the grounds with his carriage &amp; complained<span class='line-break'> </span>not so much of his exclusion, as of the manner in which<span class='line-break'> </span>it was done. It appeared in evidence that <a href='/pages/subjects/60358' title='Ward, William'>Mr Ward</a> rep<span class='line-break'></span>resented the hack as a carriage belonging to <a href='/pages/subjects/60364' title='Henshaw, Mr.'>Mr Henshaw</a><span class='line-break'> </span>but shew no ticket, &amp; on being refused entrance threatened<span class='line-break'> </span>that he "would make trouble" for <a href='/pages/subjects/58903' title='Hyde, Jonathan'>Mr Hyde</a> for present<span class='line-break'> </span>and past offences. <a href='/pages/subjects/60358' title='Ward, William'>Mr Ward</a> had no right to drive into <span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->gate</a> &amp; was very properly excluded. It is not improbable<span class='line-break'> </span>that <a href='/pages/subjects/58903' title='Hyde, Jonathan'>Mr Hyde</a> finding that an imposition was about<span class='line-break'> </span>to be practived upon him, and supposing that <a href='/pages/subjects/60358' title='Ward, William'>Mr Ward</a><span class='line-break'> </span>would order the carriage to be drive in, shut the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->gate</a><span class='line-break'> </span>with what appeared to <a href='/pages/subjects/60358' title='Ward, William'>Mr Ward</a> an "offensive allacrity," but<span class='line-break'> </span>it does not appear to your committee that it was done " in<span class='line-break'> </span>a manner rude cruel &amp; uncalled for." or that any blame<span class='line-break'> </span>attached to <a href='/pages/subjects/58903' title='Hyde, Jonathan'>Mr Hyde</a> on that occasion.</p>
<p>The next charge is in the opinion of your Com<sup>ee</sup> of a <span class='line-break'> </span>more serious <del>nature</del> character. <a href='/pages/subjects/60358' title='Ward, William'>Mr Ward</a> states that he had<span class='line-break'> </span>from time to time given the gate keeper money <ins> on leaving<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery.</ins> This <a href='/pages/subjects/58903' title='Hyde, Jonathan'>Mr Hyde</a> does not deny but says that<span class='line-break'> </span>not unfrequently money is thrown to him by persons leav<span class='line-break'></span>ing the grounds, but denies that he ever received money <span class='line-break'> </span>for admission. In the opinion of your Com<sup>ee</sup> the recieving <span class='line-break'> </span>of money at the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->gate</a> <ins>at any time,</ins> is highly improper &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>should be discontinued. <a href='/pages/subjects/60358' title='Ward, William'>Mr Ward</a> however is the last person<span class='line-break'> </span>who should complain "he does not come into Court with clean<span class='line-break'> </span>hands", he attempted a bribery and then complains that</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062142">
<h3><a name="page-1062142">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 149)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>149</p>
<p>it has not succeeded, &amp; that he did not succeed is an evi<span class='line-break'></span>dence of the honesty of the gate keeper. This practice your<span class='line-break'> </span>Com<sup>ee</sup> are of opinion should be discontinued and have<span class='line-break'> </span>recommended to <a href='/pages/subjects/58903' title='Hyde, Jonathan'>Mr Hyde</a> to pay over to <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Howe</a> any <span class='line-break'> </span>money so received, which recommendation your Com<sup>ee</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>propose should be confirmed by the Trustees. <a href='/pages/subjects/58903' title='Hyde, Jonathan'>Mr Hyde</a><span class='line-break'> </span>states that the money thrown to him by persons passing<span class='line-break'> </span>out amounts to about $10 per annum</p>
<p>The third chard vis. the refusal to allow the daugh<span class='line-break'></span>ters of <a href='/pages/subjects/60364' title='Henshaw, Mr.'>Mr Hinshaw</a> to carry in flowers to place upon<span class='line-break'> </span>the grave of their mother, does not appear to apply to<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58903' title='Hyde, Jonathan'>Mr Hyde</a>. If done at all, it must have been done by<span class='line-break'> </span>some one in the temorary custody of the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->gate</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/58903' title='Hyde, Jonathan'>Mr Hyde</a><span class='line-break'> </span>has no recollection of any such occurence. In conclu<span class='line-break'></span>sion your Com<sup>ee</sup> believe <a href='/pages/subjects/58903' title='Hyde, Jonathan'>Mr Hyde</a> though an excitable<span class='line-break'> </span>person &amp; too apt perhaps to take offence unnecessarily <span class='line-break'> </span>at the treatment he sometimes receives to be a faithful<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; honest keeper of the gate, and they ask to be dis<span class='line-break'></span>charged from <del>the</del> ^<sup>any</sup> further consideration of the charges<span class='line-break'> </span>against him.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Rules and Regulation to be Published-'>Rules and Regulation to be Published-</span></p>
<p>In relation to the Rules &amp; Regulation your Com<sup>ee</sup> have <span class='line-break'> </span>no alteration to propose, but they would recommend<span class='line-break'> </span>that they should be published with the signature<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Secretary in three of the newspapers printed<span class='line-break'> </span>in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, for the information of the Public.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Rail Road. Stateion.'>Rail Road. Stateion.</span></p>
<p>Your Com<sup>ee</sup> deem this a favorable opportunity to <span class='line-break'> </span>draw the attention of the Trustees to the Branch Rail<span class='line-break'> </span>Road now in process of construction to <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Your Com<sup>ee</sup> are informed that it is the intention of<span class='line-break'> </span>the proprietors to establish a station near the N</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062143">
<h3><a name="page-1062143">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 150)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>150</p>
<p>W. corner of the Cemetery and not far from the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->Gate</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>for the accomodation [sic] of the great concourse of visitors<span class='line-break'> </span>which it is anticipated will thus be brought to Mt<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn. It is to be feared that the grounds will be over<span class='line-break'></span>run by crowds of persons who will make it a resort<span class='line-break'> </span>for pleasure &amp; amusement &amp; thus disturb the sacred <span class='line-break'> </span>quiet of the place. You Com<sup>ee</sup> are not prepared, nor<span class='line-break'> </span>is it any part of their duty, to recommend any par<span class='line-break'></span>ticular course to be pursued by the Trustees, but they<span class='line-break'> </span>are satisfied that a serious injury will result from<span class='line-break'> </span>the establishment of a station so near the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>gate of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery</a>, which will require some decided action on<span class='line-break'> </span>the part of the Trustees or of the Proprietors.</p>
<p>for the Com<sup>ee</sup><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>M. Brimmer</a>. Chairman.</p>
<p>The above report having been accepted and the re<span class='line-break'></span>commendations contained therein approved the meet<span class='line-break'></span>ing adjourned.</p>
<p>A true record. Attest<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Sec'y.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'>Trustees</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner by the Sec<span class='line-break'></span>retary The Trustees met at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esquire</a>, 16<span class='line-break'> </span>Court Street at <date when='1847-01-22T12:00:00'>12 o'clock M. on the 22<sup>nd</sup> day of January A.D.<span class='line-break'> </span>1847.</date> Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Brimmer</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>and Read.</a> The Treasurer <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>G.W. Bond</a> was also in atten<span class='line-break'></span>dance.</p>
<p>The Treasurer's annual report having been submitted, and</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062144">
<h3><a name="page-1062144">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 151)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>151.</p>
<p>read to the meeting by <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->the Secretary</a>, and the state of the finances<span class='line-break'> </span>and investments having been discussed in connection therewith<span class='line-break'> </span>it was <b>Voted.</b> That the report of the Treasurer be accepted and<span class='line-break'> </span>that it be laid before the Proprietors at their annual meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statue of Mr. Justice Story Fund for.'><a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>Statue of Mr. Justice Story</a> Fund for.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> be authorized and directed to <span class='line-break'> </span>credit the fund of the subscribers for a <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>statue of the late<span class='line-break'> </span>Judge Story</a> with interest from the time it was paid in<span class='line-break'> </span>to his hands until invested.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Special Funds how invested.'>Special Funds how invested.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> credit "the Story fund," and<span class='line-break'> </span>all other special funds in the hands of the Trustees, with<span class='line-break'> </span>interest, commencing 60 days after the receipt of the <span class='line-break'> </span>same by <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a>, until the further order of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Board or until the same shall have been invested.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Purchase of Lands.'>Purchase of Lands.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a>, made a verbal report in his capacity <span class='line-break'> </span>as a committee on the purchase of adjoining lands<span class='line-break'> </span>for the use of the Cemetery, stating that it was not<span class='line-break'> </span>desirable at this time.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='R.Road Station'>R.Road Station</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Mr Brimmer</a> from <del>the</del> a special Committee sub<span class='line-break'></span>mitted the following Report.</p>
<p>The Committee to whom was referred the subject of R.<span class='line-break'> </span>R. Station near the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>gate of M<sup>t</sup> Auburn Cemetery</a> ask<span class='line-break'> </span>leave to <ins>report.</ins> That they have given the subject a care<span class='line-break'></span>ful consideration, &amp; find that the Legislature having<span class='line-break'> </span>given the <a href='/pages/subjects/90464' title='Watertown Branch Railroad'>Watertown Branch R. Road</a> leave to estab<span class='line-break'></span>lish a station near the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>gate of the Cemetery</a>, it is<span class='line-break'> </span>too late to prevent the erection of said station, and</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062145">
<h3><a name="page-1062145">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 152)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>152</p>
<p>it only remains for the Trustees of M<sup>t</sup> Auburn to take such <span class='line-break'> </span>measures in relation to admittance at the gate as the<span class='line-break'> </span>urgency of the case may hereafter render necessary.</p>
<p>From the Com<sup>ee</sup><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>M. Brimmer</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>. <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1847-01-20'>Jan<sup>y</sup> 20.<sup>th</sup> 1847</date>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted. To accept the foregoing report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Clearing up the grounds.'>Clearing up the grounds.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'><!--Howe-->the Superintendent</a> be directed to clear<span class='line-break'> </span>up the natural growth of brush wood at the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>under the direction of the Committee on Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Rubbish to be removed.'>Rubbish to be removed.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'><!--Howe-->the Superintendent</a> be directed to cause<span class='line-break'> </span>all rubbish to be removed from the grounds about lots<span class='line-break'> </span>improved, within a reasonable time, and to notify any<span class='line-break'> </span>proprietors neglecting to comply with this requisition<span class='line-break'> </span>that he shall remove the same at their expense if<span class='line-break'> </span>not done within ten days of such notice.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Enclosure of the Cemetery.'>Enclosure of the Cemetery.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> To refer it to the Committee on Lots to enquire<span class='line-break'> </span>into the subject of a more secure enclosure of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery and to report to a future meeting the cost of<span class='line-break'> </span>a <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>timber, stone and board fence</a> severally-</p>
<p>The Secretary gave notice of the time and <span class='line-break'> </span>place of the annual meeting and the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>adjourned.</p>
<p>A true record. Attest<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>, Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062146">
<h3><a name="page-1062146">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 153)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>153</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors. 1847'>Proprietors. 1847</span></p>
<p>Mount Auburn  Cemetery.   <span class='line-break'> </span>The annual meeting  of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of  Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn, will be held at the office  of the subscriber, in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, at<span class='line-break'> </span>No. 27 State Street on <date when='1847-02-01T16:00:00'>Monday the first day of February, 1847,<span class='line-break'> </span>at 4 o'clock P.M.</date> to choose trustees for the ensuing year, to<span class='line-break'> </span>hear the report of the Treasurer, and to act on any other<span class='line-break'> </span>business which may legally come before the said meet<span class='line-break'></span>ing.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>.  Secretary <span class='line-break'> </span>January 25<sup>th</sup>. 1847.</p>
<p>Pursuant to the  foregoing notice which was published in<span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/58551' title='Boston Daily Advertiser'>Boston Daily Advertiser</a>, a  newspaper printed  in  <span class='line-break'> </span>the  <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>City of Boston</a>, more than seven days in success<span class='line-break'></span>ion before the said time of meeting ( and which no<span class='line-break'></span>tice was also published in other newspapers in  <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>)<span class='line-break'> </span>the Proprietors of the  Cemetery of  Mount Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>met at the time and place therein designated. <span class='line-break'> </span>A quorum having  assembled the  President <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span>took the chair.</p>
<p>The Treasurer's annual report was then read and ac<span class='line-break'></span>-cepted.</p>
<p>The meeting then proceeded to the election of nine<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees by ballot. A committee having been appoint<span class='line-break'></span>ed to collect, count, and sort the votes reported that<span class='line-break'> </span>twenty three ballots in all were thrown each of which<span class='line-break'> </span>was for  <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Martin Brimmer</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>G.W. Crockett</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner by the Secre<span class='line-break'></span>tary, at <date when='1847-03-13T12:00:00'>12 o'clock on this thirteenth day of March A.D eighteen<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred and fouty seven</date> there were in attendance at the office<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esquire</a>, from the board of Trustees. Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>. No quorum being present the meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>adjourned to meet at the same place on <date when='1846-03-19T16:00:00'>Friday the 19<sup>th</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>instant at 4 o'clock P.M.</date></p>
<p>A true record. Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to adjournment and also to notices issued in the<span class='line-break'> </span>usual manner by the Secretary, the Trustees met at the office<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esquire</a> on the <date when='1846-03-19T16:00:00'>nineteenth day of March .A.D<span class='line-break'> </span>eighteen hundred and forty seven at four o'clock P.M.</date><span class='line-break'> </span>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. <span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>and Read.</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Officers elected'>Officers elected</span></p>
<p>The meeting having been called to order, proceed<del>ing</del>ed to<span class='line-break'> </span>ballot for President for the ensuing year, and <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob<span class='line-break'> </span>Bigelow</a> was unanimously elected.</p>
<p>The meeting then proceeded to ballot for Secretary for<span class='line-break'> </span>the ensuing year and <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> was unani<span class='line-break'></span>mously elected.</p>
<p>The meeting then proceeded to ballot for Treasurer for<span class='line-break'> </span>the ensuing year, and <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>George W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a> was unani<span class='line-break'></span>mously elected.</p>
<p>The meeting then proceeded to ballot for three persons<span class='line-break'> </span>to constitute the Committee on Lots for the ensuing <span class='line-break'> </span>year, and <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac<span class='line-break'> </span>Parker</a> were unanimously elected.</p>
<p>The Committee on Finance for the ensuing year</p>
</div>

<p>was filled by the unanimous election of Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Mr G. W. Crockett</a> was chosen Auditor of Accounts for the<span class='line-break'> </span>ensuing year</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer&apos;s salary.'>Treasurer's salary.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> laid before the meeting a letter from the<span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>G.W. Bond</a> in relation to his salary which <span class='line-break'> </span>was discussed and finally referred to a Committee of <span class='line-break'> </span>two consisting of Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> to communicate<span class='line-break'> </span>with <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Mr Bond</a> personally and to report at a future <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Police at the Cemetery.'>Police at the Cemetery.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted</b>. That <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Mr Gould</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a> be a committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>the subject of employing <a href='/pages/subjects/57081' title='Bird, Mr.'>Mr Bird</a> as a police officer offici<span class='line-break'></span>ally at the Cemetery.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fence.'><a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->Fence</a>.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a>, from the Committee on Lots made a <span class='line-break'> </span>verbal report in relation to the cost of a <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>stone, brick<span class='line-break'> </span>and timber fence</a> about the Cemetery; thereupon</p>
<p><b>Voted</b>. To refer it to the Committee on Lots to take such<span class='line-break'> </span>measures as they deem proper in relation to the con<span class='line-break'></span>struction of a <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>fence around the Cemetery</a> and that<span class='line-break'> </span>they be authorized to contract for the erection of the<span class='line-break'> </span>same.</p>
<p>Adjourned. A True record<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>

<p>159</p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts.<span class='line-break'> </span>Suffock ss. <date when='1847-03-20'>March 20<sup>th</sup> A.D. 1847</date>. Then personally<span class='line-break'> </span>appeared <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> and made oath that he<span class='line-break'> </span>would faithfully perfom the duties of the Secretary <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn.<span class='line-break'> </span>Before me.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59927' title='Brooks, Benjamin F.'>Benj<sup>m</sup> F Brooks</a> -- Justice of the Peace</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'>Trustees</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner by the Sec<span class='line-break'></span>retary the Trustees met at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esquire</a><span class='line-break'> </span>on the <date when='1840-08-06T12:00:00'>sixth day of August A.D. eighteen hundred and forty<span class='line-break'> </span>seven at twelve o'clock M.</date> Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P.<span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54916' title='Gray, John C.'>Gray</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>, and Read</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer&apos;s salary.'>Treasurer's salary.</span></p>
<p>The committee on the Treasurer's salary made a verbal<span class='line-break'> </span>report concluding with a recommendation that the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees make no change in the salary of the Treasurer,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the report was unanimously accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Bowditch Statue.'><a href='/pages/subjects/58802' title='Bowditch Statue'>Bowditch Statue</a>.</span></p>
<p><B>Voted</B>. That the Committee on Lots be authorized, in <span class='line-break'> </span>regard to the land to be sold to the Committee on the<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58802' title='Bowditch Statue'>Bowditch Statue</a>, to dispense with the choice money.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perpetual Repair of Lots in LAWRENCE Enclosure.'>Perpetual Repair of Lots in LAWRENCE Enclosure.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> read a communication from <a href='/pages/subjects/55000' title='Lawrence, Amos'>Amos Law<span class='line-break'></span>rence</a> and brothers asking how much they must pay<span class='line-break'> </span>to have the Lawrence Enclosure kept in perfect repair<span class='line-break'> </span>through all time, and thereupon, after a general <span class='line-break'> </span>discussion of the subject, <b>Voted.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->the Secretary</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>be instructed to inform the Messrs Lawrence that this <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation will assume the care of their enclosure as a <span class='line-break'> </span>charge in perpetuity, according to the form adopted <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Trustees <date when='1843-07-15'>July 15. <p><b>Voted</b> that upon receiving notice of a valid devise <span class='line-break'> </span>of said ot numbered two hundred and thirty three<span class='line-break'> </span>by virtue of which the title to the same shall re<span class='line-break'></span>vest in this Corporation, and upon the receipt at <span class='line-break'> </span>the same time and under the last will and testa<span class='line-break'></span>ment of the said <a href='/pages/subjects/53603' title='Williams, Elizabeth Watson'>Mistress Elizabeth Williams</a> of <span class='line-break'> </span>the sum of two thousand dollars, this Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>will accept the said devise and bequest and from<span class='line-break'> </span>and after that time keep the same in perpetual <span class='line-break'> </span>repair in its present condition forever</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustee chosen.'>Trustee chosen.</span></p>
<p>The Trustees then proceeded to the election of one person <span class='line-break'> </span>by ballot to fill the vacancy in the board of trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>caused by the death of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54915' title='Brimmer, Martin V.'>Hon. Martin Brimmer</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>The ballots having been collected counted and ex<span class='line-break'></span>amined were found to be all for the <a href='/pages/subjects/55013' title='Lyman, Theodore'>Honorable<span class='line-break'> </span>Theodore Lyman</a>, and he was accordingly announc<span class='line-break'></span>ed to be unanimously elected.</p>

<p>The application of <a href='/pages/subjects/60387' title='Oliver, Sarah H.'>Sarah H. Oliver</a> widow and ex- <span class='line-break'> </span>ecutrix of <a href='/pages/subjects/60388' title='Oliver, Henry J.'>Henry J. Oliver</a> late of <a href='/pages/subjects/60389' title='Brookline, MA'>Brookline</a>, or <a href='/pages/subjects/54347' title='Roxbury, MA'>Rox- <span class='line-break'> </span>bury</a>, was presented to the meeting. Said applica- <span class='line-break'> </span>tion set forth that said Henry died being the pro- <span class='line-break'> </span>prietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/60386' title='Lot 67'>lot 67</a>. on <a href='/pages/subjects/60390' title='Holly Path'>Holly Path</a>, but, having in<span class='line-break'> </span>his last will made no specific devise thereof,<span class='line-break'> </span>that said lot passed under the residuary clause<span class='line-break'> </span>which gave to the said Sarah the management<span class='line-break'> </span>during her life of such residuary property: <span class='line-break'> </span>she therefore requested the Trustees to designate<span class='line-break'> </span>her as the person entitled to represent said<span class='line-break'> </span>lot and to receive a ticket of admission into<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery - Thereupon <b>Voted.</b> that the re- <span class='line-break'> </span>quest be granted. and that <a href='/pages/subjects/60387' title='Oliver, Sarah H.'>Mrs Oliver</a> be desig- <span class='line-break'> </span>nated. and be entitled to a ticket, accordingly</p>

Martin Brimmer</a>, the <a href='/pages/subjects/55013' title='Lyman, Theodore'>Hon<span class='line-break'> </span>Theodore Lyman</a> heretofore elected having<span class='line-break'> </span>declined.</p>

<p>Mount Auburn Cemetery.<span class='line-break'> </span>The annual meeting of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn,<span class='line-break'> </span>will be held at the office of the subscriber, in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, at No 27 State Street,<span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1848-02-07T16:00:00'>Monday the seventh day of February, 1848, at 4 o'clock P.M.</date> to choose Trus- <span class='line-break'> </span>tees for the ensuing year, to hear the report of the Treasurer, and to<span class='line-break'> </span>act on any other business which may legally come before the<span class='line-break'> </span>said meeting.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1848-01-25'>January 25</date>.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>

<p>Pursuant to the foregoing notice which was published in The<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58551' title='Boston Daily Advertiser'>Boston Daily Advertiser</a>, a newspaper printed in the <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>City of<span class='line-break'> </span>Boston</a>, more than seven days in succession before the said<span class='line-break'> </span>time of meeting (and which notice was also published in other<span class='line-break'> </span>newspapers in said <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>) the Proprietors of the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn met at the time and place therein<span class='line-break'> </span>designated. A quorum having assembled the President, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a>, took the Chair</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> read an abstract of the proceedings at<span class='line-break'> </span>the last annual meeting.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->The Treasurer</a> then read his annual report, which<span class='line-break'> </span>was accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Election of.'>Trustees Election of.</span></p>
<p>The meeting then proceeded to the election of nine<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees by ballot.  A committe having been appointed<span class='line-break'> </span>to collect count and sort the votes, reported that nineteen<span class='line-break'> </span>ballots in all were thrown, each of which was for<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>George W. Crockett</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B. R. Curtis</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>J. J. Dixwell</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Benj. A. Gould</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54916' title='Gray, John C.'>John C. Gray</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a>.    The foregoing gentlemen<span class='line-break'> </span>were accordingly declared elected Trustees for the ensuing<span class='line-break'> </span>year. <p>The Treasurer reports the following abstract of Receipts and Expenditures<span class='line-break'> </span>for the year ending <date when='1847-12-31'>Dec 31 '47</date> He has received<span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>For sales of Lots</th> <th>19.359.34<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>" [For] " [sales] " [of] Cataloges</td> <td>59.25</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [For] Deeds credited to Expenses</td> <td>161.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [For] Income of Investments</td> <td>2024.80</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [For] " [Income] " [of] " [Investments]</td> <td>___</td> </tr> <tr><td>for Fund for Repairs</td> <td>142.50</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [For] Income rec<sup>d</sup> for <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>Story Statue</a></td> <td>130.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>There was in the Treasury 1<sup>st</sup> Jany.</td> <td><ins>4191.28</ins></td> <td>26068.12</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> He has paid as follows to wit _<span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>To sundry persons for expenses of which about</th> <th>___<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>$8000 was for <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->Fence</a></td> <td>11.910.20</td> </tr> <tr><td>To the Treasurer of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass. Horticultural</a></td> <td>___</td> </tr> <tr><td>Society for their proportion of sales</td> <td>4495.09</td> </tr> <tr><td>For 20 shares <a href='/pages/subjects/54867' title='Atlantic Bank'>Atlantic Bank</a></td> <td>1980.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [For] $3000 United States 6% Loan</td> <td>3190.68</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [For] 20 shares <a href='/pages/subjects/54867' title='Atlantic Bank'>Atlantic Bank</a> for subscribers</td> <td>___</td> </tr> <tr><td>to the <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>Story Statue</a>  $1980</td> <td>___</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [For] $2000 United States Loan 5% for <ins>do [subscribers] 1970.</ins></td> <td>3950.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>To <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Rufus Howe Sup't</a> on a/c.</td> <td>100.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [To] sundry parties who have purchased Lots</td> <td>___</td> </tr> <tr><td>amounts paid by them for interments in the <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>Public Lot</a></td> <td>40.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>Balance remaining in the Treasury</td> <td><ins>402.15.</ins></td> <td>26068.12</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> It will be seen by the annexed Trial Balance that there <span class='line-break'> </span>is invested and in the Treasury $31.982.15, independent of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trust Funds which are separately invested, showing an in<span class='line-break'></span>crease of investments, after paying about $8000- for <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->Fence</a><span class='line-break'> </span>of upwards of $5000. all of which is respectfully submitted<span class='line-break'> </span>(Signed) <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a>. Treasurer _<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>

This certifies that I have examined the Treasurer's account <span class='line-break'> </span>for the year past and find them well vouched and accurately cast that the<span class='line-break'> </span>balance in his hands is four hundred two &amp; 15/100 Dollars and that he <span class='line-break'> </span>exhibited to me the evidence of Stocks belonging to the Corpora<span class='line-break'></span>tion as appears by the preceding Trial Balance of his Books.</p>

<div id="page-1062161">
<h3><a name="page-1062161">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 168)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>168.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent&apos;s Report. 1847.'>Superintendent's Report. 1847.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'><!--Howe-->The Superintendant</a> [sic] reports the whole number of lots <span class='line-break'> </span>improved at Mount Auburn during the past year<span class='line-break'> </span>by being graded &amp;c. as <ins>one hundred and forty seven.</ins><span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>The whole number of tombs built.</th> <th><ins>six</ins><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>" [number] " [of] monuments erected,</td> <td><ins>thirty seven.</ins></td> </tr> <tr><td><del>"</del> " [number] " [of] lots fenced,</td> <td><ins>eighty eight.</ins></td> </tr> <tr><td>Whole " [number] " [of] interments</td> <td><ins>three thousand two hundred &amp; sixty <sup> eight</sup>.</ins></td> </tr> <tr><td>" [whole] " [number] this past year.</td> <td><ins> four hundred</ins> &amp; <ins> fifty five</ins></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary to the nine gentlemen elected Trustees at the an<span class='line-break'></span>nual meeting the board met in the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Cur<span class='line-break'></span>tis Esqr.</a> at <date when='1848-03-03T12:00:00'>12 o'clock M. on this third day of March A.D<span class='line-break'> </span>1848</date>. Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.<span class='line-break'> </span>P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>Dixwell</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B.A. Gould</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>I. Parker</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Officers election of:'>Officers election of:</span></p>
<p>The meeting having come to ^<sup>order_</sup> proceeded to ballot for <span class='line-break'> </span>a President for the ensuing year. <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Jacob Bigelow</a> was<span class='line-break'> </span>unanimously elected.</p>
<p>The Meeting then proceeded to ballot for a Secretary <span class='line-break'> </span>for the ensuing year. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> was unanimously <span class='line-break'> </span>elected.</p>
<p>The Meeting then proceeded to ballot for a Treasurer for the<span class='line-break'> </span>ensuing year. <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>George W. Bond</a> was unanimously elected.</p>
<p>The meeting then proceeded to ballot for three persons to<span class='line-break'> </span>constitute the committee on lots for the ensuing year, and<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>I. Parker</a> were unanimously <span class='line-break'> </span>elected.</p>
<p>The Committe on Finance for the ensuing year was <span class='line-break'> </span>filled by the unanimous election of Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>Dixwell</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062162">
<h3><a name="page-1062162">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 169)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>169</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Mr G.W. Crockett</a> was chosen Auditor of accounts for the <span class='line-break'> </span>ensuing year.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Mr Crockett</a> having retired from the meeting, and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr <span class='line-break'> </span>Read</a> having made his appearance, after a long <span class='line-break'> </span>discussion on the subject of recording plans &amp;c. it was,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors Plans'>Proprietors Plans</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> that the Secretary procure and Keep a Port Folio<span class='line-break'> </span>in which he shall insert such Plans as the Proprietors may<span class='line-break'> </span>respectively procure to be made of their Lots, such Plans<span class='line-break'> </span>to be drawn by the Surveyor of the Corporation, on paper of<span class='line-break'> </span>uniform size, which shall be furnished by the Corpora<span class='line-break'></span>tion, and none to be introduced into the Port Folio unless<span class='line-break'> </span>they shall be examined and approved in writing by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots or a majority of them, and to be<span class='line-break'> </span>at the proper expense of the Proprietors requiring them.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Surveyer.'>Surveyer.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/56692' title='Wadsworth, Alexander'>Alexander Wadsworth</a> be the Surveyor <span class='line-break'> </span>of this Corporation until the further order of this Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on Repairs'>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Repairs</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b>  That Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>, Read and</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>Dixwell</a> be a com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee to keep the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>, and all the constructions at<span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn belonging to this Corporation, in repair.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='ByLaws.'>ByLaws.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That the Secretary be requested, with the ad<span class='line-break'></span>vice of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis Esquire</a> to prepare and submit to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees a revised copy of the by laws and principal<span class='line-break'> </span>regulations.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chapel stained stones.'><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> stained stones.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> be authorized to experiment with<span class='line-break'> </span>reference to the removal of stains from the stone in the<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>, on account of this Corporation to an amount<span class='line-break'> </span>not exceeding one hundred dollars.</p>
<p>Adjourned<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record Attest<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> - Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062163">
<h3><a name="page-1062163">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 170)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>170</p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts.<span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk ss. <date when='1848-03-03'>March 3<sup>rd</sup>. A.D. 1848</date>. Then personally<span class='line-break'> </span>appeared <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>, and made oath that he<span class='line-break'> </span>would faithfully perform the duties of Secretary of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>Before me-</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/59927' title='Brooks, Benjamin F.'>Benj<sup>n</sup> F. Brooks</a>----Justice of the Peace</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary, the Trustees met on the <date when='1848-04-18T16:00:00'>eighteenth day of April<span class='line-break'> </span>A.D. 1848 at 4 o'clock P.M.</date> in the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> at Mount Au<span class='line-break'></span>burn; present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>and Read.</a> The <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Treasurer<!--Bond--></a> was also present.</p>
<p>In the absence of the President the <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Secretary<!--Parker--></a> called the<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting to order, and <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> was chosen chairman.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on Repairs'>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Repairs</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> To add one to the committee on repairs &amp;c. elected<span class='line-break'> </span>at the last meeting. <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Mr I. Parker</a> was added to the said<span class='line-break'> </span>committee in accordance with the preceding vote.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chapel furniture to be provided.'><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'>Chapel</a> furniture to be provided.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That the Committee on Repairs be instructed to<span class='line-break'> </span>furnish this house <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'>[the Chapel]<!--Bigelow--></a> in a suitable manner &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>either with iron or wooden seats as they, having full pow<span class='line-break'></span>ers, shall see fit; it being understood that they are to pro<span class='line-break'></span>vide also suitable books for the reading desk_ and also a <span class='line-break'> </span>pall &amp; other matters necessary for properly conducting fu<span class='line-break'></span>nerals if they shall deem it expedient.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fee for Transfer.'>Fee for Transfer.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That the Secretary be authorized to charge one<span class='line-break'> </span>dollar for recording deeds of transfer of any lot and cer<span class='line-break'></span>tifying the same, according to the standing custom here<span class='line-break'> </span>tofore.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062164">
<h3><a name="page-1062164">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 171)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>171</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Plans.'>Plans.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> reported that he had discharged the duty<span class='line-break'> </span>with which he was charged at the last meeting as to pro<span class='line-break'> </span>curing a Port Folio for plans.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fee for inserting Plans.'>Fee for inserting Plans.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted</b> That the Secretary be authorized to charge Pro<span class='line-break'></span>prietors who may see fit to have plans made and in<span class='line-break'></span>troduced into the Port Folio, ordered at the last meet<span class='line-break'></span>ing, one dollar for each Plan so made and introduc<span class='line-break'> </span>ed in full for his services in the matter.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fees for interments'>Fees for interments</span></p>
<p>The subject of fees for interments &amp;c. was referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee on Lots.</p>
<p>The subject of <a href='/pages/subjects/60648' title='Clark, E. P., Mr.'>Mr E.P. Clark's</a> lot and location was<span class='line-break'> </span>committed to <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr C.P. Curtis</a> and the <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Treasurer<!--Bond--></a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='C.E. Trott.'><a href='/pages/subjects/60649' title='Trott, C. E.'>C.E. Trott</a>.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/60649' title='Trott, C. E.'>C.E. Trott</a> may be permitted to select a <span class='line-break'> </span>lot in place of the one in front of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> now be<span class='line-break'></span>longing to him, which lot shall be fitted up by this<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation like the one he at present owns, and a <span class='line-break'> </span>deed thereof shall be delivered to him by the Treasurer<span class='line-break'> </span>on his giving a deed of his present lot to this Corpora<span class='line-break'></span>tion.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='New Public Lot.'>New <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>Public Lot</a>.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That the Superintendent lay out a lot of land<span class='line-break'> </span>one hundred feet wide on <a href='/pages/subjects/60651' title='Fir Avenue'>Fir Avenue</a>, between <a href='/pages/subjects/60652' title='Crocus Path'>Crocus<!--Path--></a><span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/60653' title='Mistletoe Path'>Mistletoe Paths</a> and extending Westerly to the <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->fence</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>to be appropriated to the purposes of a public lot.</p>
<p>Adjourned. A true record. Attest<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062165">
<h3><a name="page-1062165">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 172)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>172</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary the Trustees met on the <date when='1848-06-17T12:00:00'>seventeenth day of June<span class='line-break'> </span>A.D. 1848 at 12 o'clock M.</date> at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>; present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54916' title='Gray, John C.'>Gray</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>and Read.</a></p>
<p>The Secretary not being present <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Mr Isaac Parker</a> was<span class='line-break'> </span>chosen Secretary <ins>pro tem.</ins> <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a> was chosen<span class='line-break'> </span>Chairman. The record of the last meeting was read</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chapel'><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a> on behalf of the Committee on repairs and<span class='line-break'> </span>the furnishing of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> reported in part, that the<span class='line-break'> </span>platform and other preparations had be provided, the<span class='line-break'> </span>seats had been agreed upon and were in preparation, and<span class='line-break'> </span>that the plans were being prepared for the other articles, also<span class='line-break'> </span>that the roof had been repaired. It was stated that near the<span class='line-break'> </span>eaves but one course of slate had been put on where there<span class='line-break'> </span>should have been two, that this error had been corrected<span class='line-break'> </span>and that it was <ins>now</ins> believed that the roof was tight.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Deed to a Trustee authorized.'>Deed to a Trustee authorized.</span></p>
<p>On the application of <a href='/pages/subjects/60654' title='Sohier, Edward D.'>Edward D. Sohier Esq<sup>r</sup></a> who is the<span class='line-break'> </span>Executor of the will of <a href='/pages/subjects/60655' title='Blair, Phineas'>Phineas Blair</a> deceased, _ it appearing <span class='line-break'> </span>that the deceased requested said <a href='/pages/subjects/60654' title='Sohier, Edward D.'>Sohier</a> to inter his re<span class='line-break'></span>mains in the Cemetery of Mount Auburn and appropri<span class='line-break'></span>ated a sum of money, for that purpose. <b>Voted.</b> that the<span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer and Secretary be authorized to issue a deed<span class='line-break'> </span>to said <a href='/pages/subjects/60654' title='Sohier, Edward D.'>Sohier</a> as Trustee under the will of <a href='/pages/subjects/60655' title='Blair, Phineas'>Phineas <span class='line-break'> </span>Blair</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot. 758.'><a href='/pages/subjects/60656' title='Lot 758'>Lot. 758</a>.</span></p>
<p>The Committee on the application of <a href='/pages/subjects/60648' title='Clark, E. P., Mr.'>E.P. Clark</a> for the <span class='line-break'> </span>correction of an error in his deed by altering the word <span class='line-break'> </span><ins>Pilgrim</ins> to <ins>Snow-drop</ins> reported that the word <ins>Pilgrim</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>was inserted by mistake <a href='/pages/subjects/60648' title='Clark, E. P., Mr.'>Mr Clark's</a> lot not being on<span class='line-break'> </span>that path, but on <a href='/pages/subjects/57829' title='Snowdrop Path'><ins>Snow-drop</ins> path</a> - where upon <b>Ordered</b></p>
</div>
</div>

<div class="page-content">
<p>173</p>
<p>that the correction be made accordingly.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot. 313.'><a href='/pages/subjects/56311' title='Lot 313'>Lot. 313.</a></span></p>
<p><B><a href='/pages/subjects/60657' title='Story, Sarah'>Mrs Story</a></B>, widow and residuary legatee of the late<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Judge Story</a>, having made application that <a href='/pages/subjects/54842' title='Curtis, George T.'>George T. Curtis<span class='line-break'> </span>Esqr</a>, son in law of the deceased be authorized to repre<span class='line-break'></span>sent and receive the ticket for said Story's lot. <b>Ordered</b><span class='line-break'> </span>that a ticket on the lot of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Judge Story</a> be issued<span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/54842' title='Curtis, George T.'>George T. Curtis Esq<sup>r</sup></a> and that he be designated as<span class='line-break'> </span>the person to represent the same.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='New Receiving Tomb.'>New <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Receiving Tomb</a>.</span></p>
<p>A communication was read (from <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Howe</a> the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent) on the subject of providing a new <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>re<span class='line-break'></span>ceiving tomb or tombs</a> and the delays in removing <span class='line-break'> </span>bodies deposited therein, also in relation to the name<span class='line-break'> </span>and the fencing of the <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>new public lot</a>, and upon <span class='line-break'> </span>the subject of fees, ___ . thereupon</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='New Receiving Tomb'>New <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Receiving Tomb</a></span></p>
<p><b>Ordered.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'><!--Howe-->the Superintendent</a> construct a new<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Receiving tomb</a> or tombs under the direction of Messrs <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54916' title='Gray, John C.'>J.C. Gray</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B.A. Gould</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='How long bodies may remain in Receiving Tombs'>How long bodies may remain in <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Receiving Tombs</a></span></p>
<p><b>Ordered.</b> That all deposits made in the <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>receiv<span class='line-break'></span>ing tombs</a> between the first day of April and the <span class='line-break'> </span><del>fifteenth</del> ^<sup>first</sup> day of October shall be removed within<span class='line-break'> </span>two months and that all deposits made between <span class='line-break'> </span>the <del>fifteenth</del> ^<sup>first</sup> day of October and the first day of<span class='line-break'> </span>April be removed within four months and bonds <span class='line-break'> </span>taken accordingly.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Hedge to be planted on public lot.'>Hedge to be planted on <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>public lot</a>.</span></p>
<p><b>Ordered.</b> That the Committee on the construction <span class='line-break'> </span>of the new <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>receiving tombs</a> be authorized to cause<span class='line-break'> </span>a hedge to be planted about the <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>new public lot</a>.</p>
<p>The subject of a name for the <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>new public <span class='line-break'> </span>lot</a> was deferred for farther consideration.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fees for Interments.'>Fees for Interments.</span></p>
<p><b>Ordered.</b> That the subject of charges for in-</p>

</div>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fees for use of Chapel.'>Fees for use of <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>.</span></p>
<p>terments, and for the use of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>, and other<span class='line-break'> </span>questions connected therewith be referred to the last<span class='line-break'> </span>appointed committee. Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54916' title='Gray, John C.'>Gray</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Transfers of Lots. how to be recorded.'>Transfers of Lots. how to be recorded.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> stated that difficulties had arisen in re<span class='line-break'></span>gard to transfers and the recording of the same the<span class='line-break'> </span>blanks in the printed volumes of recorded deeds not be<span class='line-break'></span>ing sufficient for recording some transfers, thereupon</p>
<p><b>Ordered.</b> That the subject of recording transfers of lots<span class='line-break'> </span>be referred to Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>H.M. Parker</a> the<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary. with full power to procure new books of<span class='line-break'> </span>transfer if deemed expedient.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Rights of Way. to be altered'>Rights of Way. to be altered</span></p>
<p>A letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'>W.P. Winchester's</a> ^<sup>attorney <a href='/pages/subjects/60659' title='Sohier, William'>William Sohier Esquire</a></sup> on the subject of <span class='line-break'> </span>an alteration of the way lying adjacent to his es<span class='line-break'></span>tate and that of ___ <a href='/pages/subjects/54337' title='Stone, Mr.'><!--Mr-->Stone</a> was read; thereupon</p>
<p><b>Ordered.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->Secretary</a> be author<span class='line-break'></span>ized to release the rights of the Corporation in so <span class='line-break'> </span>much of said road as lies within the bounds of<span class='line-break'> </span>said <a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'>Winchester's</a> estate, on receiving from him <span class='line-break'> </span><b>See deed. p. 201 " [See] plan p. 204.</b><span class='line-break'> </span>a legal grant of a way over such other part of his<span class='line-break'> </span>land as is proposed by him in th<del>is</del>e ^<sup>said</sup> letter.</p>
<p>Adjourned.<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record. Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a> Secretary pro tem.<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record <ins> ex relatione</ins> <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. <p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary the Trustees met at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a><span class='line-break'> </span>at <date when='1849-01-02T13:00:00'>one o'clock P.M. on the first day of February A.<span class='line-break'> </span>D. 1849</date>: present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P.<span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Geo. W. Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>Dixwell</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>, Read:</a><span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Treasurer<!--Bond--></a> and the <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Superintendent<!--Howe--></a> were also in <span class='line-break'> </span>attendance.</p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That the annual meeting of the Proprietors of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery of Mount Auburn, be held at the office<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Clerk N<sup>o</sup> 46 Washington Street on <date when='1849-02-05T16:00:00'>Monday <span class='line-break'> </span>February 5<sup>th</sup> 1849 at 4 P.M.</date> conformably to notice <span class='line-break'> </span>already given.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->The Treasurer</a> presented his annual report, which<span class='line-break'> </span>was accepted and ordered to be recorded, and laid before<span class='line-break'> </span>the Proprietors at their annual meeting on Monday ^<sup>next</sup></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='George Cummings. New Lot.'><a href='/pages/subjects/60666' title='Cummings, George'>George Cummings</a>. New Lot.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/60666' title='Cummings, George'>Mr George Cummings</a> (who surrendered his<span class='line-break'> </span>lot to the Corporation to make way for the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> &amp;c)<span class='line-break'> </span>shall have from this Corporation a deed of the<span class='line-break'> </span>lot selected by him in place of his original lot,<span class='line-break'> </span>with all the same rights and privileges which he<span class='line-break'> </span>had in such original lot</p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That a letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/60667' title='Chadwick, Mr.'>Mr Chadwick</a> be re<span class='line-break'></span>ferred to the Committee on lots with full power to<span class='line-break'> </span>act in the matter which it relates to.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='New Receiving Tomb'>New <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Receiving Tomb</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Mr Gould</a> from the Committee on the construction <span class='line-break'> </span>of a new <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>receiving tomb</a> made a verbal report as to <span class='line-break'> </span>the same, which was accepted and the Com<sup>ee</sup> discharged.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='By Laws.-'>By Laws.-</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr C.P. Curtis</a> reported verbally that the<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary had prepared early in the last Spring a <span class='line-break'> </span>digest of the bye laws and principal regulations<span class='line-break'> </span></p>

<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> stated that the <a href='/pages/subjects/60661' title='Massachusetts Bible Society'>Bible Society</a> had<span class='line-break'> </span>had presented to the Corporation a large desk Bible<span class='line-break'> </span>for the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>. thereupon <B>Voted.</B> That the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn Cemetery return their thanks<span class='line-break'> </span>to the <a href='/pages/subjects/60661' title='Massachusetts Bible Society'>Massachusetts Bible Society</a> for their ap<span class='line-break'></span>propriate and acceptable gift.</p>
<p>The meeting then adjourned <ins>without day</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>A true record. Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> _ Secretary</p>
