<div id="page-1062171">
<h3><a name="page-1062171">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 178)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>178</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors. 1849.'>Proprietors. 1849.</span></p>
<p>Mount Auburn Cemetery.<span class='line-break'> </span>The Annual Meeting of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>will be held at the office of the subscriber, in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, at No. 46 Washing<span class='line-break'></span>ton street, on <date when='1849-02-05T16:00:00'>Monday the fifth day of February, 1849, at 4 o'clock<span class='line-break'> </span>P.M.</date>, to choose Trustees for the ensuing year, to hear the report<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Treasurer, and to act on any other business which may<span class='line-break'> </span>legally come before the said meeting.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary</p>
<p>Pursuant to the foregoing notice which was published in the <a href='/pages/subjects/58551' title='Boston Daily Advertiser'>Boston<span class='line-break'> </span>Daily Advertiser</a>, a newspaper printed in the <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>City of Boston</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>more than seven days in succession, before the said time of<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting (and which notice was also published in other news<span class='line-break'></span>papers in said <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>) The Proprietors of the Cemetery of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn met at the time and place therein<span class='line-break'> </span>designated. A quorum having assembled the President<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a>, took the chair.</p>
<p>The Treasurer's and the Superintendent's annual reports <span class='line-break'> </span>were presented read and ordered to be recorded. See page 177.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees elected.'>Trustees elected.</span></p>
<p>The meeting then proceeded to ballot for nine trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation for the ensuing year. Twenty six<span class='line-break'> </span>ballots were cast all of which were for, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, _<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>George W. Crockett</a> _ <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a> _ <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a> ___<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>J.J. Dixwell</a> _ <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B.A. Gould</a> _ <a href='/pages/subjects/54916' title='Gray, John C.'>John C. Gray</a> _ <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span>_ and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a>, and they are elected Trustees for<span class='line-break'> </span>the ensuing year.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> made a verbal report as to the doings<span class='line-break'> </span>of the past year and the present condition of the Corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees annual report to be made in writing'>Trustees annual report to be made in writing</span></p>
<p><b>Voted</b>. That the Trustees hereafter make an annual <span class='line-break'> </span>report to the Corporation in writing at the annual meeting,</p>
<p>Adjourned. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary. </p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062172">
<h3><a name="page-1062172">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 179)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>179</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent&apos;s Report. 1848.'>Superintendent's Report. 1848.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a>, <date when='1849-01-01'>Jan 1<sup>st</sup> 1849</date>.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>George W<sup>m</sup> Bond Esq.</a> Treasurer of the Mount Auburn Cem<span class='line-break'></span>etery corporation.</p>
<p>Dear Sir, the whole number of lots improved <span class='line-break'> </span>the past year by being sodded &amp;c is eighty five, whole<span class='line-break'> </span>number of tombs built seven.<span class='line-break'> </span>Whole number of monuments erected thirty one.<span class='line-break'> </span>Whole number of lots fenced with iron and hedges ^<sup>fifty</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>Whole number of interments the past year four<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred and sixteen.<span class='line-break'> </span>Whole number since my connection with the place<span class='line-break'> </span>two thousand four hundred and sixty.<span class='line-break'> </span>Total number of interments three thousand six<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred and eighty four.</p>
<p>Respectfully your servant<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Rufus Howe</a> Sup<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>met at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esquire</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> on <date when='1849-04-07T11:30:00'>the seventh<span class='line-break'> </span>day of April A.D. 1849</date>. Present <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>George W. Crockett</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a>. The hour of meeting was 11 1/2 A.M.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Officers. Election of.'>Officers. Election of.</span></p>
<p>The following officers were unanimously elected by ballot, for<span class='line-break'> </span>the ensuing year - <span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>-</th> <th>President<span class='line-break'></span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a> -</td> <td>Treasurer- </td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a></td> <td>Secretary. </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> Committee on lots. viz <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>The committee on finance for the year was filled by the unan<span class='line-break'></span>imous election of Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>Dixwell</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>G.W. Crockett</a> was elected Auditor of accounts for the ensuing year.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062173">
<h3><a name="page-1062173">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 180)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>180</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 473 as to the perpetual repair'><a href='/pages/subjects/60668' title='Lot 473'>Lot 473</a> as to the perpetual repair</span></p>
<p>A letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>Geo. H Kuhn</a> on behalf of the proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/60668' title='Lot 473'>lot<span class='line-break'> </span>no 473</a> . . was referred to the Committee on Lots with full<span class='line-break'> </span>powers to contract for keeping the same in perpetual repair.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots under the care of Corporation'>Lots under the care of Corporation</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b>  That the Treasurer keep the Superintendent constantly in<span class='line-break'></span>formed as to all lots which this Corporation have agreed <span class='line-break'> </span>or shall agree to keep in order - and that the list so fur<span class='line-break'></span>nished, state the sums paid as consideration for such <span class='line-break'> </span>agreement.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Removal of bodies from the Receiving Tombs'>Removal of bodies from the <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Receiving Tombs</a></span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b>  That <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->the Secretary</a> be requested to procure an accurate <span class='line-break'> </span>account of all bodies deposited in the <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>receiving tomb</a> either <span class='line-break'> </span>under Park Street Church or that within the grounds at Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn and notify all persons who have made such de<span class='line-break'></span>posits which have been suffered to remain there beyond <span class='line-break'> </span>the specified time that they must be removed within <span class='line-break'> </span>fifty days from this <date when='1849-04-07'>seventh day of April 1849</date>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Plans of alterations'>Plans of alterations</span></p>
<p><b>Ordered.</b>  That the <a href='/pages/subjects/56692' title='Wadsworth, Alexander'>Surveyor<!--Wadsworth--></a> make one or more plans as may <span class='line-break'> </span>be necessary to shew any changes in the following locations <span class='line-break'> </span>vis: in and about the <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>new public lot</a>:  of <a href='/pages/subjects/60691' title='Almond Path'>Almond<!--Path--></a> <del>and Ver<span class='line-break'></span>bana</del> Path<del>s</del>: of <a href='/pages/subjects/60669' title='Verbena Path'>Verbena Path</a>: of any lots, paths, or avenues <span class='line-break'> </span>in and about the present site of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>: of lot number</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots 104, 1279 - 1280. Lot 1173'><a href='/pages/subjects/60670' title='Lot 104'>Lots 104</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/74935' title='Lot 1279'><!--lot-->1279</a> - <a href='/pages/subjects/74936' title='Lot 1280'><!--lot-->1280</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/60672' title='Lot 1173'>Lot 1173</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/60670' title='Lot 104'><!--Lot-->104</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/58791' title='Central Avenue'>Central Avenue</a> in connection with <a href='/pages/subjects/74935' title='Lot 1279'>lots 1279</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/74936' title='Lot 1280'><!--lot-->1280</a>:<span class='line-break'> </span>also of <a href='/pages/subjects/60672' title='Lot 1173'>lot 1173</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/60651' title='Fir Avenue'>Fir Avenue</a>: and that such plans having<span class='line-break'> </span>been duly certified be inserted in the Book of Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>Plans.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots 903. 904.'><a href='/pages/subjects/72273' title='Lot 903'>Lots 903</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/62301' title='Lot 904'><!--lot-->904</a>.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That the Surveyor may make the large plan of<span class='line-break'> </span>the grounds exhibit <a href='/pages/subjects/72273' title='Lot 903'>lots 903</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/62301' title='Lot 904'><!--lot-->904</a> conformably to their present<span class='line-break'> </span>location.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots 56, 1311, and 1373'><a href='/pages/subjects/60674' title='Lot 56'>Lots 56</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/60675' title='Lot 1311'><!--Lot-->1311</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/60676' title='Lot 1373'><!--Lot-->1373</a></span></p>
<p>The subject of the locations of <a href='/pages/subjects/60675' title='Lot 1311'>lots 1311</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/60676' title='Lot 1373'><!--Lot-->1373</a> <del>was</del> connec<span class='line-break'></span>tion with <a href='/pages/subjects/60674' title='Lot 56'>lot 56</a> was referred to the Committee on Lots with <span class='line-break'> </span>full powers. Attest.   <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
<p>Adjourned to meet at Mount Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>on the 10<sup>th</sup> instant at 4 o'clock P.M.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062174">
<h3><a name="page-1062174">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 181)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>181</p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts. Suffolk ss. <date when='1849-04-07'>April 7. AD.1849</date><span class='line-break'> </span>Personally appeared <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> and made oath that he<span class='line-break'> </span>would faithfully perform the duties of Secretary of  the Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn<span class='line-break'></span>Before me, <a href='/pages/subjects/71739' title='Sewall, Samuel E.'>S.E. Sewall</a> Justice of the Peace</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>A meeting of the Trustees duly notified was holden at the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a><span class='line-break'> </span>in the Cemetery on the <date when='1849-05-10'>tenth day of May. A.D. 1849</date>. Present<span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>.  <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>.  <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>. The<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Treasurer<!--Bond--></a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Superintendent<!--Howe--></a> were also in attendance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot. 730. Representation of.'><a href='/pages/subjects/60678' title='Lot 730'>Lot. 730</a>. Representation of.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b>  That in accordance with the application of  <a href='/pages/subjects/74111' title='Russell, Samuel H.'>S.H. Rus<span class='line-break'></span>sell</a> eldest son of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/60680' title='Russell, N. P.'>N.P. Russell</a>  the said  <a href='/pages/subjects/74111' title='Russell, Samuel H.'>S.H. Russell</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>be designated for the time being to represent <a href='/pages/subjects/60678' title='Lot 730'>lot no. 730</a> in<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery, late the property of the said <a href='/pages/subjects/60680' title='Russell, N. P.'>N.P. Russell</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and to vote in the meetings of the Corporation, receiving<span class='line-break'> </span>a ticket of admission, in that capacity, until the farther<span class='line-break'> </span>order of this board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot. 13. Representation of.'><a href='/pages/subjects/60681' title='Lot 13'>Lot. 13</a>. Representation of.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b>  That in accordance with the application of  <a href='/pages/subjects/60682' title='Mead, Isaac H.'>Isaac<span class='line-break'> </span>H. Mead</a> son of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/60683' title='Mead, Isaac'>Isaac Mead</a>, the said  <a href='/pages/subjects/60682' title='Mead, Isaac H.'>Isaac H.<span class='line-break'> </span>Mead</a> be designated for the time being to represent<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60681' title='Lot 13'>lot no. 13</a> in the Cemetery, late the property of the<span class='line-break'> </span>said, <a href='/pages/subjects/60683' title='Mead, Isaac'>Isaac Mead</a>, and to vote in the meetings of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation, receiving a ticket of admission in that <span class='line-break'> </span>capacity, until the farther order of this Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Wooden Fence.'><a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>Wooden Fence</a>.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Howe</a> be furnished with a copy of<span class='line-break'> </span>the contract for the erection of  a <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>pale fence</a>, and that<span class='line-break'> </span>he be charged with the duty of seeing the same<span class='line-break'> </span>faithfully executed by the contractors with power to<span class='line-break'> </span>hire an assistant to aid him in the supervision of the same.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062175">
<h3><a name="page-1062175">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 182)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>182</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tremont House Lot.'><a href='/pages/subjects/57666' title='Tremont House'>Tremont House</a> Lot.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted</b>  That <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->the Secretary</a> be directed to address to the Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>of the <a href='/pages/subjects/57666' title='Tremont House'>Tremont House</a> a letter requesting them to remove or else<span class='line-break'> </span>so to reset and trim the hedge around their lot that the same<span class='line-break'> </span>may not be as now "an offensive, and improper object".<span class='line-break'> </span>also. Voted. That if the same shall not be properly or<span class='line-break'></span>dered within fifty days from this date that the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on lots be instructed to take such measures as they shall<span class='line-break'> </span>see fit, with full power and authority to remove the<span class='line-break'> </span>said hedge as "detrimental to the adjacent lots and ave<span class='line-break'></span>nues" and "inconvenient to passengers."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sale of certain lots restricted.'>Sale of certain lots restricted.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b>  That no lots shall be sold on the new ave<span class='line-break'></span>nue in the rear of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> until the farther order<span class='line-break'> </span>of this Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='St. John&apos;s Lot.'><a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>St. John's Lot</a>.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b>  That the new lot on <a href='/pages/subjects/60651' title='Fir Avenue'>Fir Avenue</a> appropriated<span class='line-break'> </span>by a vote of the Board on the <date when='1848-04-18'>18<sup>th</sup> day of April A.D<span class='line-break'> </span>1848</date> to single interments be named and hereafter<span class='line-break'> </span>known as  <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>"<u>Saint John's Lot</u>."</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='St. James&apos; Lot.'><a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>St. James' Lot</a>.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b>  That the lot on <a href='/pages/subjects/59584' title='Cypress Avenue'>Cypress Avenue</a> hitherto used<span class='line-break'> </span>and appropriated for single interments be named and<span class='line-break'> </span>hereafter known as <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>"<u>Saint James' Lot</u>."</a></p>
<p>Adjourned.  A true record. Attest <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>

(1787-1859)'>Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> were present<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Howe</a> was also in attendance.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Purchase of Land. J. F. Stone&apos;s proposition. '>Purchase of Land. <a href='/pages/subjects/60684' title='Stone, James F.'>J. F. Stone's</a> proposition. </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>. <date when='1849-08-04'>August 4<sup>th</sup>. 1849</date>.<span class='line-break'> </span>I hereby offer to the Trustees of Mount Auburn Cemetery, to ex<span class='line-break'></span>change a strip of land thirty feet wide and as long as their <span class='line-break'> </span>whole Southern boundary between their land and mine -<span class='line-break'> </span>for a piece of land owned by them, situated Southerly from <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn and bounded Easterly on the cross road <span class='line-break'> </span>and elsewhere on land of Stones<span class='line-break'> </span>(Signed) <a href='/pages/subjects/60684' title='Stone, James F.'>James F. Stone</a>.</p>
<p>After considerable discussion the proposition of <a href='/pages/subjects/60684' title='Stone, James F.'>Mr Stone</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>was unanimously rejected.</p>
<p>A Committee of two consisting of Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a><span class='line-break'> </span>was appointed with full powers to negotiate with <a href='/pages/subjects/60684' title='Stone, James F.'>Mr Stone</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>as to an exchange of the lands in question.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Wooden Fence.'><a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>Wooden Fence</a>.</span></p>
<p>A communication from <a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'>W.P. Winchester</a> in relation <span class='line-break'> </span>to the <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->fence</a> now erecting, was referred to a Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>consisting of <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Mr Gould</a> with full powers<span class='line-break'> </span>to act in the matter.</p>
<p><b><ins>Voted</ins></b>. That the contractors on the <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>wooden fence</a> be request<span class='line-break'></span>ed to stop the work on the Easterly side till farther orders.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a> were appointed a Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>with full powers to cancel in part or whole the contract <span class='line-break'> </span>for the <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>wooden fence</a>, as to the Easterly side of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>and also to dispose of any materials which may fall <span class='line-break'> </span>into the hands of the Corporation in making such <span class='line-break'> </span>arrangement as they judge necessary</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Purchase of Land'>Purchase of Land</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> was appointed a Committee of one <span class='line-break'> </span>with full authority to purchase land adjoining Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn if he thinks it expedient.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots 405. &amp; 603.'><a href='/pages/subjects/60685' title='Lot 405'>Lots 405</a>. &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/60686' title='Lot 603'><!--Lot-->603</a>.</span></p>
<p>A communication from <a href='/pages/subjects/60687' title='Hickling, Charles'>Charles Hickling</a> as to <span class='line-break'> </span>an exchange of lots, was referred to the Committee on</p>

<p>The committees on the exchange of lands and the modifi<span class='line-break'></span>cations of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->fence</a> made verbal reports, and the subjects were <span class='line-break'> </span>discussed at length, and without any formal action post<span class='line-break'></span>poned to the next meeting.</p>

Warren</a>, notifying the Corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>of a bequest of $100. on condition that the corporation keep<span class='line-break'> </span>in good order and repair forever his <a href='/pages/subjects/59940' title='Lot 1030'>lot no. 1030</a>. in <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery.  Thereupon Voted. That the legacy be de<span class='line-break'></span>clined, so far as it is accompanied by a condition by <span class='line-break'> </span>which this Corporation will be bound to keep the said<span class='line-break'> </span>lot in perpetual repair, but that this Corporation is now <span class='line-break'> </span>ready to receive the same in trust to apply the income <span class='line-break'> </span>thereof to the purpose named according to established</p>

<p>188</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors&apos; 1850'>Proprietors' 1850</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to the foregoing notice which was published in the <a href='/pages/subjects/58551' title='Boston Daily Advertiser'>Bos<span class='line-break'></span>ton Daily Advertiser</a>, a newspaper printed in the <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>City of Boston</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>more than seven days in succession before the said time of <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting, The Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn met <span class='line-break'> </span>met at the time and place designated in said notice.<span class='line-break'> </span>A quorum having assembled, the President <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span>took the chair.</p>
<p>The Treasurer's and Superintendent's reports were pre<span class='line-break'></span>sented read, and ordered to be recorded.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> submitted a written account of the <span class='line-break'> </span>doings of the Trustees for the previous year and of the <span class='line-break'> </span>present condition of the Cemetery, which was accepted <span class='line-break'> </span>and ordered to be placed upon the Society]]'s files.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees elected.'>Trustees elected.</span></p>
<p>The following named gentlemen were then unani<span class='line-break'></span>mously chosen by ballot to be trustees for the ensuing <span class='line-break'> </span>year. <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>George W. Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>J.J. Dixwell</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B.A. Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James <span class='line-break'> </span>Read</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mace Tisdale</a>.</p>
<p>A proposition from <a href='/pages/subjects/60702' title='James Munroe &amp; Co.'>James Munroe &amp; Co</a> to fur<span class='line-break'></span>nish catalogues for general distribution to the Corporators<span class='line-break'> </span>was discussed, and finally referred to the Trustees.</p>
<p>Adjourned.  A true record.<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> - Secretary</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent&apos;s Report 1850'>Superintendent's Report 1850</span></p>
<p>Mount Auburn Cemetery. <date when='1850-01-01'>January 1. 1850</date>.  <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W<sup>m</sup> Bond Esq</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer of the Cemetery Corporation,  Dear Sir, The whole num<span class='line-break'></span>ber of lots improved, the past year by being graded &amp;c. was <span class='line-break'> </span>one hundred and six,  Whole number of Lots fenced thirty five, whole<span class='line-break'> </span>number of tombs built five, whole number of monuments erected thirty, whole <span class='line-break'> </span>number of interments four thousand one hundred and ninety nine.<span class='line-break'> </span>Whole number the past year five hundred and fifteen.  Respectfully yours <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Rufus Howe</a>. Sup<sup>t</sup>.</p>
</div>
</div>

<p>Know all Men by these Presents --<span class='line-break'> </span>That the proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn, a corporation established by law in<span class='line-break'> </span>the county of Middlesex in the Commonwealth <span class='line-break'> </span>of Massachusetts. In Consideration of five<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred dollars to them paid by <a href='/pages/subjects/59752' title='Brasee, Morton P.'>Morton P.<span class='line-break'> </span>Brasee</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a> in said Middlesex.<span class='line-break'> </span>Housewright the receipt whereof is hereby ack<span class='line-break'></span>nowledged, do hereby remise, release and forever<span class='line-break'> </span>Quit=claim into the said <a href='/pages/subjects/59752' title='Brasee, Morton P.'>Morton P. Brasee</a> his<span class='line-break'> </span>heirs and assigned all our right title, <del>and</del> interest<span class='line-break'> </span>and estate in and to a certain parcel of land sit<span class='line-break'></span>uated in the southeasterly part of <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a> in<span class='line-break'> </span>said Middlesex with a dwelling house, and other<span class='line-break'> </span>buildings thereon, containing by survey nineteen a<span class='line-break'></span>cres and thirty five rods be the same more or<span class='line-break'> </span>less bounded southwesterly by <a href='/pages/subjects/59567' title='Charles River'>Charles River</a> about <span class='line-break'> </span>six hundred and seventeen feet. <p>At a legal meeting of the Trustees of the proprietors of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery of Mount Auburn holden <date when='1844-10-15'>Oct 15<sup>th</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>A.D. 1844</date> it was voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P Curtis Esq</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and the <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Secretary<!--Parker--></a> be a committee with power<span class='line-break'> </span>to complete the purchase from the heirs of the<span class='line-break'> </span>late <a href='/pages/subjects/59733' title='Stone, Moses'>Moses Stone</a> and with power to execute<span class='line-break'> </span>any such deeds in relation to the present interests<span class='line-break'> </span>of the corporation in the down estate of the late<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58907' title='Pomroy, Mrs.'>Mrs Pomeroy</a> as they shall deem proper.</p>

<p>Know all men by these Presents<span class='line-break'> </span>That The Proprietors of the Cemetery of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn, a Corporation Established by <span class='line-break'> </span>law in the county of Middlesex and Com=<span class='line-break'> </span>monwealth of Massachusetts, in Consideration <span class='line-break'> </span>of ten dollars to them paid by <a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'>William P.<span class='line-break'> </span>Winchester</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> in the County of <span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk and Commonwealth aforesaid,<span class='line-break'> </span>merchant, the receipt whereof is hereby<span class='line-break'> </span>acknowledged, do hereby give, grant, bar<span class='line-break'></span>gain, sell and convey unto the said<a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'> Win<span class='line-break'></span>chester</a> a certain parcel of land situate<s>d</s><span class='line-break'> </span>in the Southeasterly part of <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a> in <span class='line-break'> </span>said Middlesex, Containing by survey <span class='line-break'> </span>nineteen acres and thirty five rods<span class='line-break'> </span>be the same more or less, bounded south<span class='line-break'></span>westerly by <a href='/pages/subjects/59567' title='Charles River'>Charles River</a> about six hun<span class='line-break'></span>dred and seventeen feet _ Westerly by land<span class='line-break'> </span>now or formerly of the heirs of <a href='/pages/subjects/60714' title='Stone, Nathaniel'>Nathaniel <span class='line-break'> </span>Stone</a> from said river to a road three hun<span class='line-break'></span>dred and seventy six feet - northerly by <span class='line-break'> </span>said road about four hundred and fifty <span class='line-break'> </span>feet to a corner near a dwelling house<span class='line-break'> </span>standing on the premises: thence westerly<span class='line-break'> </span>again by a way or continuation of said <span class='line-break'> </span>road along the easterly side of Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn Cemetery nine hundred and <span class='line-break'> </span>sixty six feet _ thence northerly by <span class='line-break'> </span>land now or formerly of the heirs of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60715' title='Stone, Cornelius'>Cornelius Stone</a> two hundred and <span class='line-break'> </span></p>

<div id="page-1062194">
<h3><a name="page-1062194">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 201)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>201</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='DEED. Proprietors &amp;c to Wm P. Winchester.'><b>DEED.</b> Proprietors &amp;c to <a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'>W<sup>m</sup> P. Winchester</a>.</span></p>
<p>Know all men by these Presents that the<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors of the Cemetary of Mount Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>in consideration of a conveyance which <a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'>William<span class='line-break'> </span>P. Winchester</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> in the County of Suffolk,<span class='line-break'> </span>and Commonwealth of Massachusetts, Esquire, has<span class='line-break'> </span>this day made to them by deed of [even?] date and to <span class='line-break'> </span>be recorded herewith, and of one dollar to them<span class='line-break'> </span>paid by the said <a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'>Winchester</a>, the receipt whereof<span class='line-break'> </span>is hereby acknowledged, do hereby remise, release<span class='line-break'> </span>and forever quitclaim, unto the said <a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'>Winchester</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>all their right, title, interest, claim and es<span class='line-break'></span>tate in and to the triangular piece or parcel <span class='line-break'> </span>of land hereinafter described and in and to every<span class='line-break'> </span>right, easement and privilege which they have<span class='line-break'> </span>or may or can have in, upon and over the same <span class='line-break'> </span>or any part thereof.</p>
<p>Said parcel is situated in <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a> in <span class='line-break'> </span>the County of Middlesex, and is thus bounded<span class='line-break'> </span>and described, viz. Beginning on the Eastwardly<span class='line-break'> </span>side of a way leading from the lands of said <a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'>Win<span class='line-break'></span>chester</a> towards the Mount Auburn Cemetary <span class='line-break'> </span>at the Northeasterly corner of the piece or parcel<span class='line-break'> </span>of land described in the above mention con<span class='line-break'></span>veyance from said <a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'>Winchester</a> to said Corporation,<span class='line-break'> </span>thence running Southwesterly, and bounded<span class='line-break'> </span>Northwardly by the land described in the said<span class='line-break'> </span>conveyance about four hundred and twenty one<span class='line-break'> </span>feet to land of said <a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'>Winchester</a> on the Southwardly<span class='line-break'> </span>side of a town way leading from lands of said <a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'>Win<span class='line-break'></span>chester</a> towards ^<sup>towards</sup> Watertown Bridge, thence running<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062195">
<h3><a name="page-1062195">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 202)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>202</p>
<p>Eastwardly by land of said <a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'>Winchester</a> along the South<span class='line-break'></span>erly line of said way, about three hundred and twenty <span class='line-break'> </span>feet; thence turning by about a right angle and <span class='line-break'> </span>running Northerwardly on land of said <a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'>Winchester</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>by a broken line, across the Easterly end of said way,<span class='line-break'> </span>and by the Easterly line of the way hereinbefore<span class='line-break'> </span>first mentioned, leading towards the Mount Au<span class='line-break'></span>burn Cemetary [sic], about one hundred and eighty <span class='line-break'> </span>nine feet to the place begun at.</p>
<p>Or however otherwise the premises may be<span class='line-break'> </span>bounded measured or described.</p>
<p>It being the intention of the said Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>to extinguish all their rights, privileges, claims<span class='line-break'> </span>and easements in, upon and over the parcel of <span class='line-break'> </span>land herein described over which it has heretofore<span class='line-break'> </span>had and enjoyed the right of passage and re<span class='line-break'></span>passage.</p>
<p>And the said Corporation hereby consents <span class='line-break'> </span>that the said <a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'>Winchester</a> may at any time enclose<span class='line-break'> </span>said parcel of land within and as part of <span class='line-break'> </span>his Mansion House Estate, lying in <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>aforesaid.</p>
<p><b>To have and to hold</b> the premises to the <span class='line-break'> </span>said <a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'>Winchester</a> his heirs and assigns to his<span class='line-break'> </span>and their own use and benefit forever, and so <span class='line-break'> </span>that neither the said Corporation or any person<span class='line-break'> </span>or persons claiming from by the way to or under<span class='line-break'> </span>it shall have any right, title, interest, ^<sup>claim</sup> or estate<span class='line-break'> </span>therein. But without any warranty or the part<span class='line-break'> </span>of the said Corporation except by way of estoppel.</p>
</div>

<div id="page-1062197">
<h3><a name="page-1062197">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 204)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>204</p>
<p>The following is a true extract from the records<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees of the Proprietors of the Cemet<del>a</del>ery<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn at a meeting holden <date when='1848-06-17'>June<span class='line-break'> </span>17<sup>th</sup> A.D. 1848</date>.</p>
<p>A Letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'>W.P. Winchester's</a> attorney<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60659' title='Sohier, William'>W<sup>m</sup>illiam Sohier Esquire</a> on the subject of an alte<span class='line-break'></span>ration of the way lying adjacent to his estate <span class='line-break'> </span>and that of - <a href='/pages/subjects/54337' title='Stone, Mr.'><!--Mr-->Stone</a> was read; thereupon Or<span class='line-break'></span>dered, that the Treasurer and Secretary be au<span class='line-break'></span>thorized to release the rights of the Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>in so much of said road as lies within the<span class='line-break'> </span>bounds of said <a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'>Winchesters</a> estate, on receiving<span class='line-break'> </span>from him a legal grant of a way over such<span class='line-break'> </span>other part of his land as is proposed by him in<span class='line-break'> </span>th<del>is</del>e said said [sic] letter.</p>
<p>Attest<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary. <span class='line-break'> </span>A true copy of said deed acknowledgment and<span class='line-break'> </span>the vote endorsed upon the same<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> Secretary.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1848-05-11'>May 11<sup>th</sup> 1848</date>.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>D<sup>r</sup>. Sir.<span class='line-break'> </span>I send you herewith the Plan<span class='line-break'> </span>showing the alteration which <a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'>W<sup>m</sup> P. Winchester</a><span class='line-break'> </span>wishes to make in the road at <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a>. His<span class='line-break'> </span>object is to give a handsome sweep round the<span class='line-break'> </span>awkward corner shown on the Plan; to remove<span class='line-break'> </span>the old barn which now stands upon the site<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062198">
<h3><a name="page-1062198">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 204a)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><b>Copy of a Plan</b> marked<span class='line-break'> </span>"Scale, 40 Feet to an Inch.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, <date when='1848-05-09'>May 9<sup>th</sup> 1848</date>.<span class='line-break'> </span><b><a href='/pages/subjects/56692' title='Wadsworth, Alexander'>Alex. Wadsworth</a>, Surveyor. _</b>"<span class='line-break'> </span>See this volume Proprietor's records<span class='line-break'> </span>page 174. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> Secretary.</p>
<p>[Plan of the proposed alteration to the road]</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062199">
<h3><a name="page-1062199">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 205)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>205</p>
<p>of the proposed road, &amp; to inclose that part of the<span class='line-break'> </span>old road not included in the sweep in his own<span class='line-break'> </span>Estate. This it is needless to say can only be effec<span class='line-break'></span>ted at considerable expense, &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'>Mr. W.</a> wishes to ob<span class='line-break'></span>tain from the Prop.<sup>s</sup> of the Cemetery, a release of any<span class='line-break'> </span>rights they may have in the old road, upon his<span class='line-break'> </span>giving them equal rights in the new: &amp; as he<span class='line-break'> </span>thinks that this alteration in the road will<span class='line-break'> </span>be an actual benefit to the Prop.<sup>s</sup> &amp; their Estate, <span class='line-break'></span>he hopes to obtain their concurrence in his pro<span class='line-break'></span>ject.</p>
<p>Very Respectfully &amp; truly Y.<sup>rs</sup><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60659' title='Sohier, William'>W<sup>m</sup> Sohier</a> <span class='line-break'></span>P.S. <a href='/pages/subjects/57584' title='Winchester, William P.'>Mr. W.</a> has already purchased from the. "<a href='/pages/subjects/54337' title='Stone, Mr.'><!--Mr-->Stones</a>"<span class='line-break'> </span>the fee of the old &amp; new roads - &amp; the town of <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Water<span class='line-break'></span>town</a> I am told, have consented to the discontin<span class='line-break'></span>uance of the <ins>Town way</ins> = and I am also informed<span class='line-break'> </span>that the Prop.<sup>s</sup> have no rights to the particular <span class='line-break'> </span>road now laid out round the corner, but supply <span class='line-break'> </span>a general right of Passage. _<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
