<div id="page-1062201">
<h3><a name="page-1062201">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 207)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>207</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.'>Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner, the Trustees met <span class='line-break'> </span>at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a>. at <date when='1850-02-09T12:00:00'>12 o'clock. M. on the ninth day of <span class='line-break'> </span>February. A.D. 1850</date>. Present <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>J.J. Dixwell</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James <span class='line-break'> </span>Read</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Officers elected.'>Officers elected.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> in the Chair, the meeting proceeded to ballot for <span class='line-break'> </span>the following officers who were unanimously chosen, each balloting <span class='line-break'> </span>being distinct for each office.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, President.  <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a>, Treasurer. <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> - Secretary. <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a> - Committee on Lots.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>J.J. Dixwell</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B.A. Gould</a> were chosen Finance Committee.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Geo. W. Crockett</a> was chosen Auditor of Accounts.<span class='line-break'> </span>The President now appeared and took the chair.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Catalogue'>Catalogue</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> called attention to Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/60702' title='James Munroe &amp; Co.'>J. Munroe &amp; Co.'s</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>proposition for a catalogue for the Proprietors _ and the <span class='line-break'> </span>whole subject was referred to the Committee on Lots with <span class='line-break'> </span>full powers to make any arrangement they see fit for the <span class='line-break'> </span>publication of a catalogue.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Deed to an Executor.'>Deed to an Executor.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> stated to the meeting that <a href='/pages/subjects/60695' title='Brigham, William'>William Brig<span class='line-break'></span>ham</a> Executor of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/60696' title='Fuller, Abraham W.'>A.H. Fuller</a>, having been in<span class='line-break'></span>formed of the vote of the Trustees at their <del> last </del> meeting on <span class='line-break'> </span>the <date when='1849-01-25'>25<sup>th</sup> of January last</date>, had called upon him to make <span class='line-break'> </span>a deed to him, as Executor of the last will &amp;c of the said <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60696' title='Fuller, Abraham W.'>Fuller</a>, which being in direct violation of the By Law <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation, as declaring a trust or recognizing one <span class='line-break'> </span>in the said <a href='/pages/subjects/60695' title='Brigham, William'>Brigham</a>, he had declined to do so, and <span class='line-break'> </span>now by <a href='/pages/subjects/60695' title='Brigham, William'>Mr Brigham's</a> request laid the matter before <span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees. <del> After some chosen </del> Thereupon Voted, that the <span class='line-break'> </span><del> it </del> ^<sup>matter</sup> be referred to a Committee ^<sup>consisting</sup> of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>with full powers. Adjourned<span class='line-break'></span>A true record Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> _ Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062202">
<h3><a name="page-1062202">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 208)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>208</p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts. <span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk ss. <date when='1850-02-09'>February 9<sup>th</sup> A.D. 1850</date>. Then person<span class='line-break'></span>ally appeared <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> and made oath<span class='line-break'> </span>that he would faithfully perform the duties of <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary of the Proprietors of ^<sup>the Cemetery of</sup> Mount Auburn.<span class='line-break'> </span>Before me <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> Justice of the Peace</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. March 30. 1850'>Trustees. <date when='1850-03-30'>March 30. 1850</date></span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issue in the usual manner the Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>met at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a>, at <date when='1850-03-30T12:00:00'>12 o'clock M. on the <span class='line-break'> </span>thirtieth day of March A.D. 1850</date>. Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>Dixwell</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>, Read and </a><a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>. <span class='line-break'> </span>The <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Superintendent<!--Howe--></a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Treasurer<!--Bond--></a> were also in attendance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent his duties &amp;c.'>Superintendent his duties &amp;c.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> read a communication from <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Howe</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>in relation to his duties, compensation, &amp;c &amp;c. for services as <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent. The matter was discussed at large. <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Mr Parker</a> retired before any action was had.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Special provision for Mr Howe.'>Special provision for <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Howe</a>.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted.</u> That in consideration of the long and faithful ser<span class='line-break'></span>vices of <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Rufus Howe</a>, the present Superintendent, an annual <span class='line-break'> </span>grant of two hundred dollars (payable quarterly) be allowed <span class='line-break'> </span>to him in addition to his salary. the arrangement to con<span class='line-break'></span>tinue until the farther action of this board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent&apos;s house.'><a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>Superintendent's house</a>.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted.</u> That the whole subject of the <a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>superintendents <span class='line-break'> </span>house</a>, its location, size, repairing, building anew &amp;c &amp;c<span class='line-break'> </span>and the matter of his boarding laborers be referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to a committee of three consisting of Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>. Said committee to report at <span class='line-break'> </span>a future meeting of this board.</p>
<p>Adjourned. A true record<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>, Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062203">
<h3><a name="page-1062203">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 209)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>209</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees April 23. 1850.'>Trustees <date when='1850-04-23'>April 23. 1850</date>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees met at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a> on the<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1850-04-23'>23<sup>rd</sup> of April A.D. 1850.</date> Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P.<span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>Dixwell</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>, Read and </a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendents house. Repairs of.'><a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>Superintendents house</a>. Repairs of.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That the committee on lots be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>make such repairs and alteration of the <a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>superin<span class='line-break'></span>tendent's house</a> as they shall judge expedient.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proposal to obtain an additional act for the purchase of land.'>Proposal to obtain an additional act for the purchase of land.</span></p>
<p>Some discussion having arisen as to the right<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation to purchase real estate not<span class='line-break'> </span>actually adjoining the present enclosure of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> was appointed a <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee, with the assistance of the Secreta<span class='line-break'></span>ry, to procure the passage a new act en<span class='line-break'></span>larging the rights of the Corporation in <span class='line-break'> </span>this respect. Adjourned.</p>
<p>A true record. Attest _<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees'>Trustees</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner, the trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>met at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a>. <date when='1850-07-16'>on <del>on</del> the 16<sup>th</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>of July A.D. 1850</date>. Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>Dixwell</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent Complaint vs. him by J.T. Austin.'>Superintendent Complaint vs. him by <a href='/pages/subjects/60722' title='Austin, James T.'>J.T. Austin</a>.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> laid before the meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>two letters from the <a href='/pages/subjects/60722' title='Austin, James T.'>Hon. James T. Austin</a> alleging and charg<span class='line-break'></span>ing upon the <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Superintendent<!--Howe--></a> a gross dereliction of duty<span class='line-break'> </span>in not seasonably preparing a grave on his lot. The letters<span class='line-break'> </span>were referred to a Committee of three, vis <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> with instruction to inquire into the circumstances<span class='line-break'> </span>and to report at a future meeting. Adjourned.</p>
<p>A true record. Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062204">
<h3><a name="page-1062204">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 210)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>210</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. October 18. 1850.'>Trustees. <date when='1850-10-18'>October 18. 1850</date>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>met at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esquire</a> at <date when='1850-10-18T12:00:00'>12. M. on the 18<sup>th</sup> <span class='line-break'> </span>day of October, eighteen hundred and fifty</date>. Present Messrs<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>Dixwell</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trees to be trimmed _ underbrush to be removed.'>Trees to be trimmed _ underbrush to be removed.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted.</u> That <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> be requested to instruct <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Howe</a> to take farther measures to remove under brush<span class='line-break'> </span>and for the trimming of trees &amp;c. as may be necessary<span class='line-break'> </span>for the improvement of the grounds.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Safe.'>Safe.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted.</u> That <a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>J.J. Dixwell</a> be appointed a committee of <span class='line-break'> </span>one, with full powers to provide a suitable safe for the<span class='line-break'> </span>use of the Secretary in the preservation of his Records &amp;c</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Avenues to be finished off. '>Avenues to be finished off. </span></p>
<p><u>Voted.</u> That <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Howe</a> cause two or three of the principal <span class='line-break'> </span>avenues to be finished off in the most approved man<span class='line-break'></span>ner, under the advice of <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mr Tisdale</a>, keeping an account <span class='line-break'> </span>of the expense of doing so which shall be reported to this<span class='line-break'> </span>board. Adjourned.<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. January 30. 1851.'>Trustees. <date when='1851-01-30'>January 30. 1851</date>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>met at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esquire</a> at <date when='1851-01-30T12:00:00'>12 o'clock. M<span class='line-break'> </span>on the thirtieth day of January, eighteen hundred and<span class='line-break'> </span>fifty one</date>. Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>Dixwell</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jonn Preston&apos;s claim.'><a href='/pages/subjects/60723' title='Preston, Jonathan'>Jon<sup>n</sup> Preston's</a> claim.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted.</u> That Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B.A. Gould</a> be a <span class='line-break'> </span>committee to settle with <a href='/pages/subjects/60723' title='Preston, Jonathan'>Mr Jonathan Preston</a> in <span class='line-break'> </span>relation to his claim for compensation in overseeing<span class='line-break'> </span>repairs on the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>; it being the opinion of this board<span class='line-break'> </span>however, that one hundred dollars will be an ade<span class='line-break'></span>quate sum to compensate him fully.<span class='line-break'> </span>Adjourned to meet at <date when='1851-02-01T12:00:00'>12. M. on the 1<sup>st</sup> of February</date> at this plac[e]<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record. Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> Secretary. </p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062205">
<h3><a name="page-1062205">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 211)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>211</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. February 1. 1851.'>Trustees. <date when='1851-02-01'>February 1. 1851</date>.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>. <date when='1851-02-01T12:00:00'>February 1<sup>st</sup> 1851. 12 M.</date> The Trustees met pursuant to ad<span class='line-break'></span>journment, and without any formal action adjourned to meet <span class='line-break'> </span>at the office of the Secretary at <date when='1851-02-03T15:30:00'>3 1/2 P.M on Monday the 3<sup>rd</sup> inst.</date><span class='line-break'> </span>at which time and place were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>B.R.<span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>. The Treasurer's report for   <span class='line-break'> </span>the year ending <date when='1851-12-31'>December 31. 1850</date>. was presented, but not yet<span class='line-break'> </span>audited. Thereupon Voted. That the said reported be accep<span class='line-break'></span>ted, <del>when</del> it shall have been approved by the Auditor.</p>
<p>Adjourned, without day.<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors. 1851.'>Proprietors. 1851.</span></p>
<p>Mount Auburn Cemetery -<span class='line-break'> </span>The Annual Meeting of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn, will be held at the office of the subscriber<span class='line-break'> </span>in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, at No 46 Washington street on <date when='1851-02-03T16:00:00'>Monday, the<span class='line-break'> </span>third day of February A.D. 1851, at 4 o'clock P.M.</date> to<span class='line-break'> </span>choose Trustees for the ensuing year, to hear the report <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Treasurer, and to act on any other business which <span class='line-break'> </span>may legally come before the said meeting.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>. <date when='1851-01-09'>January 9. 1851.</date> <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p>Pursuant to the foregoing notice which was published <span class='line-break'> </span>in the <a href='/pages/subjects/58551' title='Boston Daily Advertiser'>Boston Daily Advertiser</a>, a newspaper printed in <span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>City of Boston</a>, more than seven days in succession<span class='line-break'> </span>before the said time of meeting, the Proprietors of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn met at the time and place<span class='line-break'> </span>designated in said notice. A quorum having assem<span class='line-break'></span>bled. the President, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a>, took the chair.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Reports.'>Annual Reports.</span><span class='line-break'> </span>[Treasurer's Report of the last year not recorded - See on file dated <date when='1850-12'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 1850</date>. <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J.C</a>. Sec<sup>y</sup>]</p>
<p>The Treasurer's report was presented, and read and<span class='line-break'> </span>ordered to be recorded when it shall have first been <span class='line-break'> </span>approved by the Auditor as ordered by the Trustees.</p>
<p>The Superintendt's report was presented and read<span class='line-break'> </span>[Treasurer's Rep<sup>t</sup> not recorded _ see on file dated <date when='1850-12'>Dec<sup>m</sup> 1850</date>. <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J.C</a>. Sec<sup>y</sup>.]</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062206">
<h3><a name="page-1062206">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 212)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>212</p>
<p>and ordered to be recorded.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report from the Trustees.'>Report from the Trustees.</span></p>
<p>The meeting then <s>proceded</s> listened to a statement<span class='line-break'> </span>by <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> of the doings of the Trustees for the<span class='line-break'> </span>past year and the present condition of the Corporation</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of Trustees.'>Election of Trustees.</span></p>
<p>The meeting then proceeded to the election of<span class='line-break'> </span>nine trustees by ballot. The following gentlemen<span class='line-break'> </span>were unanimously elected. receiving one hundred <span class='line-break'> </span>and sixteen ballots, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>George W. Crock<span class='line-break'></span>ett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>Benjamin R. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>J.J. Dixwell</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Benjamin A. Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mace Tisdale</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Timber Fence Bryant &amp; Blaisdell&apos;s Claim.'><a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>Timber Fence</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/56566' title='Bryant &amp; Blaisdell'>Bryant &amp; Blaisdell's</a> Claim.</span></p>
<p>A memorial from Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/56566' title='Bryant &amp; Blaisdell'>Bryant &amp; Blaisdell</a><span class='line-break'> </span>contractors for the erection of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>timber fence round<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery</a>, asking the Corporation to appoint a<span class='line-break'> </span>special committee to investigate and adjust their<span class='line-break'> </span>claims was presented and read. Several of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees stated that they had officially examined<span class='line-break'> </span>the matter, and thought the claims unreasonable.<span class='line-break'> </span>Doubts were expressed as to the power of the Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>to interfere with the action of the Trustees, and it<span class='line-break'> </span>was. <b>Voted</b>. That the memorial and whole matter <span class='line-break'> </span>be referred back to the Trustees.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Additional Act of Incorporation.'>Additional Act of Incorporation.</span></p>
<p>The Secretary, presented and read an Act of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Legislature of the Commonwealth passed <date when='1850-05-03'>May<span class='line-break'> </span>3. 1850</date>. entitled An Act in addition to an Act to in<span class='line-break'></span>corporate the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Special meeting to be called.'>Special meeting to be called.</span></p>
<p>Auburn. - Voted. That a special meeting of this <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation be called by the Secretary, to be held in <span class='line-break'> </span>this place at <date when='1851-02-12T16:00:00'>4 o'clock. P.M. on Wednesday the<span class='line-break'> </span>twelfth day of February. current</date>, to consider the ex<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062207">
<h3><a name="page-1062207">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 213)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>213</p>
<p>pediency of accepting said Act.</p>
<p>Adjourned without day. A true record. <span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>, Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendents Report'>Superintendents Report</span></p>
<p>Superintendents Annual Report.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a>. <date when='1851-01-01'>January 1. 1851</date><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Mr. George W. Bond</a>. Treasurer of the Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn Cemetery Corporation</p>
<p>Dear Sir, there has been ninety eight lots improved <span class='line-break'> </span>in the Cemetery the past year by being graded and <span class='line-break'> </span>sodded. Seventy two lots enclosed with iron fence <span class='line-break'> </span>and hedges, One tomb has been built. Thirty two <span class='line-break'> </span>monuments put up, Four hundred and forty eight <span class='line-break'> </span>interments made during the year.</p>
<p>Whole number of interments four thousand, six <span class='line-break'> </span>hundred and forty seven.</p>
<p>Respectfully your servant<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Rufus Howe</a>. Sup't.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors.  Special _ 1851.'>Proprietors.  Special _ 1851.</span></p>
<p>Mount Auburn Cemetery.<span class='line-break'> </span>A special meeting of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn, will be held on <date when='1851-02-12T16:00:00'>Wednesday, the twelth day of Feb<span class='line-break'></span>ruary A.D. 1851, at 4 o'clock. P.M.</date> at the office of the <span class='line-break'> </span>subscriber in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, at no. 46 Washington Street, to <span class='line-break'> </span>consider whether said Corporation will accept an act <span class='line-break'> </span>passed by the Legislature of Massachusetts <date when='1850-05-03'>May 3, 1850</date><span class='line-break'> </span>entitled "An Act in addition to an Act to incorporate the<span class='line-break'> </span>proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn."</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>, Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1851-02-04'>Feb. 4. 1851</date>.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062208">
<h3><a name="page-1062208">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 214)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><span class='line-break'> </span>214</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors. Special. 1851.'>Proprietors. Special. 1851.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to the foregoing notice which was published<span class='line-break'> </span>in the <a href='/pages/subjects/58551' title='Boston Daily Advertiser'>Boston Daily Advertiser</a> ^<sup> a newspaper printed in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> </sup> more than seven days<span class='line-break'> </span>in succession before the said time of meeting, the Pro<span class='line-break'></span>prietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn met at the<span class='line-break'> </span>time and place designated in said notice. A quo<span class='line-break'></span>rum having assembled the President <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span>took the chair.  The President stated the object of<span class='line-break'> </span>this special meeting, and called upon <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>the Secretary<!--Parker--></a><span class='line-break'> </span>to produce a certified copy of the Act referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>in the notice.  The Secretary did so, and read<span class='line-break'> </span>the same aloud.  The following is a copy -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Additional Act. Copy of'>Additional Act. Copy of</span></p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts.<span class='line-break'> </span>In the year one thousand eight hundred and fifty.</p>
<p>An Act in addition to "An Act<span class='line-break'> </span>to incorporate the proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn"</p>
<p>Be it enacted by the <a href='/pages/subjects/53209' title='Massachusetts Senate'>Senate</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/56337' title='Massachusetts House of Representitives'>House of<span class='line-break'> </span>Representatives</a> in General Court assembled,<span class='line-break'> </span>and by the authority of the same; as follows -</p>
<p>The corporation known as the Proprietors of the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn, may purchase and hold in fee sim- <span class='line-break'> </span>ple or otherwise, any real estate, or any interest in any<span class='line-break'> </span>real estate, situate and lying in the towns of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cam<span class='line-break'></span>bridge</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a>, in the County of Middlesex<span class='line-break'> </span>anything in the Act of this Legislature passed<span class='line-break'> </span>March thirty first A.D. eighteen hundred and thir<span class='line-break'></span>ty five entitled "An Act to incorporate the proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn" to the contrary<span class='line-break'> </span>notwithstanding; <ins> Provided always </ins>, that such real es<span class='line-break'></span>tate by the said corporation so purchased holden <span class='line-break'> </span>and possessed as aforesaid, under the provisions of</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062209">
<h3><a name="page-1062209">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 215)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>215</p>
<p>this act, shall not at any one time exceed one hun<span class='line-break'></span>dred acres in extent, in addition to whatever real es<span class='line-break'></span>tate the said corporation now holds, or is entitled<span class='line-break'> </span>to hold, by virtue of the act to which this act is <span class='line-break'> </span>in addition as aforesaid.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/56337' title='Massachusetts House of Representitives'>House of Representatives</a>, <date when='1850-05-02'>May 2. 1850</date>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Passed to be enacted.  <a href='/pages/subjects/53208' title='Kellogg, Ensign H.'>Ensign H. Kellogg</a> Speaker.</p>
<p>In <a href='/pages/subjects/53209' title='Massachusetts Senate'>Senate</a> <date when='1850-05-02'>May 2. 1850</date>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Passed to be enacted.  <a href='/pages/subjects/53210' title='Wilder, Marshall P.'>Marshall P. Wilder</a>, President.<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1850-05-03'>May 3. 1850</date>. Approved.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53211' title='Briggs, George N.'>Geo. N. Briggs</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary's office, <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a><span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1850-05-23'>May 23<sup>rd</sup> 1850</date></p>
<p>I certify the foregoing to be a true copy of the <span class='line-break'> </span>original act.</p>
<p>Seal  of State L.S. [round seal, words in center]</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53212' title='Tufts, William'>W<sup>m</sup> Tufts</a>. Deputy Secretary of }<span class='line-break'> </span>the Commonwealth  }<span class='line-break'> </span>on motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>J.J. Dixwell Esquire</a> -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Act. Accepted.'>Act. Accepted.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted</b> _ unanimously - That this Corporation do<span class='line-break'> </span>accept the Act passed by the Legislature of this Com<span class='line-break'></span>monwealth ^<sup><date when='1850-05-03'>May 3. 1850</date></sup> entitled "An Act in addition to an <span class='line-break'> </span>Act to incorporate the Proprietors of the Ceme<span class='line-break'></span>tery of Mount Auburn.".</p>
<p>The meeting then dissolved<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record.  Attest.  <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062210">
<h3><a name="page-1062210">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 216)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>216</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. February 15, 1851.'>Trustees. <date when='1851-02-15'>February 15, 1851</date>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>met at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esquire</a> on <date when='1851-02-15T12:00:00'>Friday the <del>four</del>fifth<span class='line-break'></span>teenth day of February A.D. 1851.  at 12 o'clock M.</date><span class='line-break'> </span>Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>Dixwell</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Officers election of'>Officers election of</span></p>
<p>The meeting at once proceeded to ballot for officers <span class='line-break'> </span>for the ensuing year.  The following gentlemen were <span class='line-break'> </span>unanimously elected by ballot to the several <span class='line-break'> </span>offices set against their names.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a> - President.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> - Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>George W. Bond</a> - Treasurer<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a>. Committee on Lots <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B.A. Gould</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>J.J. Dixwell</a> Committee on Finance<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>George W. Crockett</a>. Auditor of Accounts.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statue of J. Story.'><a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>Statue of J. Story</a>.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> read a letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/53238' title='Story, William W.'>W.W. Story Esqr</a> in<span class='line-break'> </span>relation to his contract for the <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>statue of his late father</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and after considerable conversation.</p>
<p>Voted.  That the Trustees are very desirous that the <span class='line-break'> </span>statue should be completed within the time specified<span class='line-break'> </span>in the contract, and they cannot consent to the exten<span class='line-break'></span>sion of the time.</p>
<p>Voted.  That the Trustees will be pleased to act in <span class='line-break'> </span>concert with <a href='/pages/subjects/53238' title='Story, William W.'>Mr. Story</a> respecting the substitution of <span class='line-break'> </span>American marble, if <a href='/pages/subjects/53238' title='Story, William W.'>Mr. Story</a> and the Trustees can <span class='line-break'> </span>be satisfied. respecting it, and the use of it will not <span class='line-break'> </span>occasion any delay</p>
<p>Voted.  That it is the wish of the Trustees that the <span class='line-break'> </span>full sized model should be made and exhibited <span class='line-break'> </span>to them with the least possible delay.  Adjourned<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record. Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p>Commonwealth of Massachusestts.</p>
<p>Suffolk ss.  <date when='1851-02-17'>February 17. A.D. 1851</date>.  Then personally appeared <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> and made oath that he would faithfully <span class='line-break'> </span>perform the duties of Secretary of the Proprietors of the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn.  Before me,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60747' title='Washburn, William R. P.'>W<sup>m</sup>. R. P. Washburn</a>    Justice of the Peace.<span class='line-break'> </span>April 11<sup>th</sup> 1851.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. April 11. 1851.'>Trustees. <date when='1851-04-11T12:00:00'>April 11. 1851</date>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notice issued in the usual manner the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees met at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis Esquire</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>Court street, <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, at 12 o'clock noon:  Present Mess<sup>rs</sup><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>I. Parker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a> &amp; <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>Dixwell</a> - <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Mr Gould</a> joined the meeting at 12.30-</p>
<p>the Secretary being absent, <a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>Mr Dixwell</a> was appoin<span class='line-break'></span>ted Secretary pro tempore.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Painting Fence'>Painting <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->Fence</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mr. Tisdale</a> was appointed a Committee with full <span class='line-break'> </span>powers to paint the <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->iron fence</a> on the roads, and <span class='line-break'> </span>to replace the wooden posts and rails, on the edge <span class='line-break'> </span>of the side-walk, near the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->gate</a>, with iron.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Repairs on the Chapel.'>Repairs on the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> brought before the board the present con<span class='line-break'></span>dition of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>, stating that it has always leak<span class='line-break'></span>ed, that the most skilful and faithful mechanics<span class='line-break'> </span>have been employed at great expense to repair the <span class='line-break'> </span>roof without remedying the difficulty; that Mess<sup>rs</sup><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60748' title='Washburn, Mr.'>Washburn</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/60749' title='Treadwell, Mr.'>Treadwell</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/60750' title='Standish, Mr.'>Standish</a> have examined<span class='line-break'> </span>the building with him, and find great defects <span class='line-break'> </span>in it, and that he has doubts of its safety.  The <span class='line-break'> </span>pinnacles are found to be hollow and admit <span class='line-break'> </span>the rain and the walls of the clere-story crack<span class='line-break'></span>ed, as if shaken by the wind, defects known from <span class='line-break'> </span>the time of its erection but compromised with  the<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<div class="page-content">
<p>218</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Repairs on the Chapel. Estimates.'>Repairs on the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>. Estimates.</span></p>
<p>contractors. - He has obtained from <a href='/pages/subjects/60750' title='Standish, Mr.'>Mr. Standish</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>the following approximate estimates, viz't:</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>For rebuilding the whole structure with the materials</th> <th>___<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>now in it</td> <td>$7000</td> </tr> <tr><td>rebuilding the clere-story</td> <td>3000</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [rebuilding]  the pinnacles</td> <td>1000</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> After discussion, the whole subject was postponed to <span class='line-break'> </span>a future meeting, to be holden this day fortnight, to<span class='line-break'> </span>enable the Trustees to visit the building, and inform <span class='line-break'> </span>themselves on the subject _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statue of J. Story.'><a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>Statue of J. Story</a>.</span></p>
<p>A letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/53238' title='Story, William W.'>W.W. Story Esquire</a>, dated <date when='1851-03-31'>March<span class='line-break'> </span>31<sup>d</sup> 1851</date> on the subject of the <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>statue of Judge Sto<span class='line-break'></span>ry</a> was read and considered _ and it was thereupon</p>
<p>Voted.  That <a href='/pages/subjects/53238' title='Story, William W.'>Mr. Story's</a> offer to resign the com<span class='line-break'></span>mission given to him, for making a <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>statue of Judge<span class='line-break'> </span>Story</a>, and to cancel the contract between him and <span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees, be and the same is accepted.</p>
<p>Voted.  That <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> Mess<sup>rs</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>I. Parker</a>, &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. <span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a> be a committee to confer with <a href='/pages/subjects/53238' title='Story, William W.'>Mr Story</a>, with <span class='line-break'> </span>full power to make a new contract with that <span class='line-break'> </span>gentleman, if possible, on such terms as they see<span class='line-break'> </span>fit.</p>
<p>Adjourned to meet at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis, Esq<sup>r</sup></a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>at <date when='1851-04-25'>12 o'clock noon of Friday 25<sup>=</sup> April inst.</date><span class='line-break'> </span>A true record  Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>J. J. Dixwell</a> Secretary pro tem<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record ex relatione <a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>J. J. Dixwell</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
</div>

<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner, the Trus<span class='line-break'></span>tees met at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a>, on the <date when='1851-06-25T13:00:00'>25<sup>th</sup> of June<span class='line-break'> </span>A.D. 1851, at 1 o'clock, PM</date> _.  Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crock<span class='line-break'></span>itt</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>Dixwell</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>, Read and </a><a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chapel. Repairs on.'><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>. Repairs on.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted _</b> That Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a> be a committee, <span class='line-break'> </span>with authority to cause two of the pinnacles of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->chapel</a><span class='line-break'> </span>to be taken down, and rebuilt under their superinten<span class='line-break'></span>dence, and to make all such other incidental repairs <span class='line-break'> </span>as shall be deemed by them expedient.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jona Preston&apos;s claim -'><a href='/pages/subjects/60723' title='Preston, Jonathan'>Jon<sup>a</sup> Preston's</a> claim -</span></p>
<p><b>Voted _</b>  That the committee on the subject of <a href='/pages/subjects/60723' title='Preston, Jonathan'>Mr Pres<span class='line-break'></span>ton's</a> claim  have full authority to settle with him on <span class='line-break'> </span>such terms as they deem proper and just.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Byrant &amp; Blaisdell&apos;s claim -'><a href='/pages/subjects/56566' title='Bryant &amp; Blaisdell'>Byrant &amp; Blaisdell's</a> claim -</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> be a committee with <span class='line-break'> </span>full powers to settle with Messrs. Bryant &amp; Blaisdell|Bryant &amp; Blaisdell]]<span class='line-break'> </span>as to their claims on account of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>timber fence</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Iron Fence painted'><a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->Iron Fence</a> painted</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mr. Tisdale</a> reported verbally that he had caused <span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>iron fence of the cemetery</a> to be painted in <del>[?]</del> a su<span class='line-break'></span>perior manner at the cost of $586.54 only.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. January 30. 1852.'>Trustees. <date when='1852-01-30'>January 30. 1852</date>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner -, a<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Trustees was holden on <date when='1852-01-30'>the 30<sup>th</sup> day of <span class='line-break'> </span>January A.D. 1852.</date>  Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'> &amp; Read. </a> No quorum _  Adjourned to <span class='line-break'> </span>meet at the Secretary's office at <date when='1852-02-02T15:30:00'>3 1/2 o'clock P.M <span class='line-break'> </span>on Monday February 2. 1852</date>.</p>
<p>A true record attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. February 2. 1852.'>Trustees. <date when='1852-02-02'>February 2. 1852</date>.</span></p>
<p>No quorum attended at the place and hour of <span class='line-break'> </span>adjournment  - and the meeting dissolved.<span class='line-break'> </span>A true record,  attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> Secretary -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors 1852.'>Proprietors 1852.</span></p>
<p>Mount Auburn Cemetery.</p>
<p>The annual meeting of the Proprietors of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn will be held at the office of the sub<span class='line-break'></span>scriber in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, at no 46 Washington Street on <date when='1852-02-02T16:00:00'>Monday <span class='line-break'> </span>the second day of February, 1852 _ at 4 o'clock P.M.</date> to <span class='line-break'> </span>choose Trustees for the ensuing year, to hear the re<span class='line-break'></span>port of the Treasurer; and to act on any other business<span class='line-break'> </span>which may legally come before the said meeting.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> _ Secretary.</p>
<p>Pursuant to the foregoing notice which was published in <span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/58551' title='Boston Daily Advertiser'>Boston Daily Advertiser</a>, a newspaper printed in the <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>City of Boston</a>, more than seven days in succession <span class='line-break'> </span>before the said time of meeting, the proprietors of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn met at the time and <span class='line-break'> </span>place therein designated.  A quorum having assembled<span class='line-break'> </span>the President <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> took the chair.</p>
<p>The Treasurer's report was presented, read and <span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1062215">
<h3><a name="page-1062215">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 221)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>221<span class='line-break'> </span>[The following is sideways in the left margin]<span class='line-break'> </span>on motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker, Esquire</a> voted. That the thanks<span class='line-break'> </span>of this Corporation be presented to the <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>Hon. B.R. Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span>for his long and faithful services as one of the <span class='line-break'> </span>board of Trustees -; also to <a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>J.J. Dixwell</a> Esqr for<span class='line-break'> </span>his services as member of the same board.<span class='line-break'> </span>[End of sideways text in the left margin]</p>
<p>accepted and referred to the Trustees.</p>
<p>The superintendent's report was also read and <span class='line-break'> </span>accepted.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> then made an oral report<span class='line-break'> </span>of the present condition of the Corporation and the<span class='line-break'> </span>doings of the Trustees during the past year.</p>
<p>The meeting then proceeded to the election <span class='line-break'> </span>of nine trustees by ballot. The following gentlemen <span class='line-break'> </span>were unanimously elected. Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>George W. Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Benjamin<span class='line-break'> </span>A. Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>George H. Kuhn</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Charles C. Little</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mace Tisdale</a></p>
<p>No further business coming before the <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation, the meeting dissolved.</p>
<p>A true record Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> --<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary --</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent&apos;s Report'>Superintendent's Report</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>George W. Bond. Esqr.</a> Treasurer of the Mount Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery Corporation. Dear Sir, There has been <span class='line-break'> </span>one hundred and twenty lots improved <s>during</s> the<span class='line-break'> </span>past year by being graded and sodded &amp;c. --<span class='line-break'> </span>one hundred and eight lots enclosed with iron <span class='line-break'> </span>fence and hedges -----------<span class='line-break'> </span>four tombs have been built and forty new monuments erected.<span class='line-break'> </span>four hundred and ninety four interments during<span class='line-break'> </span>the year --------<span class='line-break'> </span>Whole number of interments five thousand one hun<span class='line-break'></span>dred and forty ----------<span class='line-break'> </span>Average number of interments for year from the com<span class='line-break'></span>mencement of the Cemetery two hundred and fifty.</p>
<p>Very respectfully submitted.<span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn. <date when='1851-12-31'>December 31. 1851</date> <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Rufus Howe</a>. Sup't -</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1062216">
<h3><a name="page-1062216">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 222)</a></h3>

<div id="page-1062218">
<h3><a name="page-1062218">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 224)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>224</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees February 7. 1852.'>Trustees <date when='1852-02-07'>February 7. 1852</date>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>met at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a>. on the <date when='1852-02-07T12:00:00'>7<sup>th</sup> day of Feb<span class='line-break'></span>reary ^<sup>A.D. 1852</sup> at 12 o'clock M.</date>  Presents Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>, Little,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>, and Read</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Officers. election of'>Officers. election of</span></p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.<span class='line-break'> </span>The meeting at once proceeded to ballot for officers for the <span class='line-break'> </span>ensuing year.  The following named gentlemen were seve<span class='line-break'></span>rally elected by ballot to the several offices set against<span class='line-break'> </span>their names.</p>
<p>President.  <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer. <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots. <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>" [Committee]  " [on] Finance. <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B.A. Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Charles C. Little</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Auditor of accounts. <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>George W. Crockett</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report on repairs of the Chapel.'>Report on repairs of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a>; from the committee on the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->chapel</a>, made<span class='line-break'> </span>an oral report, that an experiment had been made<span class='line-break'> </span>which it was thought would prove effectual to remedy<span class='line-break'> </span>the leaks, but that it could not be certainly known <span class='line-break'> </span>until tested by driving storms.  The subject was recom<span class='line-break'></span>mitted to the same gentlemen.  Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jona Preston&apos;s Claim.'><a href='/pages/subjects/60723' title='Preston, Jonathan'>Jon<sup>a</sup> Preston's</a> Claim.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>, from the committee on <a href='/pages/subjects/60723' title='Preston, Jonathan'>Jonathan Pres<span class='line-break'></span>ton's</a> claim, reported that they had settled with him in<span class='line-break'> </span>full by the payment of four hundred dollars.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Bryants &amp; Blaisdell&apos;s Claim.'><a href='/pages/subjects/56566' title='Bryant &amp; Blaisdell'>Bryants &amp; Blaisdell's</a> Claim.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>, from the commiteee on <a href='/pages/subjects/56566' title='Bryant &amp; Blaisdell'>Bryant and <span class='line-break'> </span>Blaisdell's</a> claim, reported that it was still under dis<span class='line-break'></span>cussion, but that no definite step had been taken in <span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062219">
<h3><a name="page-1062219">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 225)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>225</p>
<p>the matter.  The subject was recommitted to Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>and Read.</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Iron Safe. for use of the Secretary _'>Iron Safe. for use of the Secretary _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> reported the purchase of a large<span class='line-break'> </span>safe by a committee of one, <a href='/pages/subjects/60422' title='Dixwell, John J.'>J.J. Dixwell</a>, for the preservation <span class='line-break'> </span>of his records.  It is in his office, at 46 Washington St,<span class='line-break'> </span>The safe was stated to be one of Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/60757' title='Edwards &amp; Holman'>Edwards &amp; Hol<span class='line-break'></span>man's</a> make - styled  Improved Salamander Safe.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> suggested doubts of its sufficiency to with<span class='line-break'></span>stand fire, and the subject was recommitted to the <span class='line-break'> </span>President and Secretary for examination on this front.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='S. Newall&apos;s Claim.'><a href='/pages/subjects/58794' title='Newell, Samuel R.'>S. Newall's</a> Claim.</span></p>
<p>A letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/58794' title='Newell, Samuel R.'>Mr Samuel Newell</a> was read, asking <span class='line-break'> </span>the gift of a lot in the Cemetery, in consideration of <span class='line-break'> </span>his long continued services in making up the ac<span class='line-break'></span>counts at the Cemetery.  Doubts were expressed, and <span class='line-break'> </span>the whole matter was referred to a committee con<span class='line-break'></span>sisting of Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a> with full powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='E.W. Williams Legacy. Petition from her Executor.'><a href='/pages/subjects/53603' title='Williams, Elizabeth Watson'>E.W. Williams</a> Legacy. Petition from her Executor.</span></p>
<p>A petition from <a href='/pages/subjects/60759' title='Watson, D., Jr.'>D. Watson Jr.</a> Executor of <a href='/pages/subjects/53603' title='Williams, Elizabeth Watson'>Eliza<span class='line-break'></span>beth Watson Williams'</a> last will, was presented. It <span class='line-break'> </span>was accompanied by affidavits and other papers <span class='line-break'> </span>showing that the testatrix had determined to re<span class='line-break'></span>duce a legacy in her will, to this Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>from $2000 to $1000. to secure the perpetual <span class='line-break'> </span>repair of her <a href='/pages/subjects/60760' title='Lot 1697'>lot number 1697</a>, on <a href='/pages/subjects/59904' title='Spruce Avenue'>Spruce <span class='line-break'> </span>Avenue</a>.  The sum of $2000. had formerly been <span class='line-break'> </span>fixed by the trustees, at her own request, for another <span class='line-break'> </span>lot, <a href='/pages/subjects/60375' title='Lot 233'>no. 233</a> -- on <a href='/pages/subjects/60001' title='Walnut Avenue'>Walnut Avenue</a>. (see p.160.1 of<span class='line-break'> </span>these records,) and she had transferred the be-</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062220">
<h3><a name="page-1062220">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 226)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>226</p>
<p>quest to another <a href='/pages/subjects/60760' title='Lot 1697'>lot no. 1697</a>. by a codicil.  She had <span class='line-break'> </span>applied to the Secretary to have the sum reduced<span class='line-break'> </span>to $1000, and made an appointment to alter her<span class='line-break'> </span>will on a certain day in September last, on which <span class='line-break'> </span>day she died of apoplexy.  The subject was re<span class='line-break'></span>ferred to <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>the Secretary<!--Parker--></a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stated meetings _ of the Trustees.'>Stated meetings _ of the Trustees.</span></p>
<p>That hereafter a stated meeting of this ^<sup>Board</sup> be holden<span class='line-break'> </span>at this place, at 12 o'clock M. on the first Tues<span class='line-break'></span>day of every month.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 983. Representative of.'><a href='/pages/subjects/60761' title='Lot 983'>Lot 983</a>. Representative of.</span></p>
<p>That in accordance with the application of <a href='/pages/subjects/60762' title='Silsby, George E.'>George <span class='line-break'> </span>E. Silsby</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/60763' title='Bradford, MA'>Bradford</a>, the only son of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/60764' title='Silsby, Enoch'>Enoch <span class='line-break'> </span>Silsby</a>, proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/60761' title='Lot 983'>lot no. 983</a>. in the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60765' title='Proctor, Emma S.'>Mrs Emma S. Proctor</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/54347' title='Roxbury, MA'>Roxbury</a>, the only daugh<span class='line-break'></span>ter resident near Mount Auburn, be designated for<span class='line-break'> </span>the time being to represent said lot, and vote at<span class='line-break'> </span>the meetings of the Corporation, receiving a ticket <span class='line-break'> </span>of admission in that capacity, until the further <span class='line-break'> </span>action of this board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot. 651. Representative of.'><a href='/pages/subjects/60766' title='Lot 651'>Lot. 651</a>. Representative of.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted</b>. That in accordance with the application of <span class='line-break'> </span>the children and heirs of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/60767' title='Faxon, William'>William Fax<span class='line-break'></span>on</a>, proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/60766' title='Lot 651'>lot no 651</a>, in the Cemetery, <a href='/pages/subjects/60768' title='Caldwell, Charlotte N.'>Mrs.<span class='line-break'> </span>Charlotte N. Caldwell</a>, wife of <a href='/pages/subjects/60769' title='Caldwell, William'>William Caldwell</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the oldest daughter of said Faxon, be desig<span class='line-break'> </span>nated for the time being to represent said lot,<span class='line-break'> </span>and vote at the meetings of the Corporation, re<span class='line-break'></span>ceiving a ticket of admission in that capacity, un<span class='line-break'></span>til the further action of this board.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062221">
<h3><a name="page-1062221">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 227)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>227</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 123. Representative of.'><a href='/pages/subjects/60770' title='Lot 123'>Lot 123</a>. Representative of.</span></p>
<p>Voted.  That in accordance with the application of <span class='line-break'> </span>the heirs of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/60771' title='McLellan, Isaac'>Isaac McLellan</a>, proprietor of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60770' title='Lot 123'>lot no 123</a>. in the Cemetery, <a href='/pages/subjects/60772' title='McLellan, William H.'>William H. McLellan</a><span class='line-break'> </span>the oldest representative of the family residing in <span class='line-break'> </span>this city, be designated for the time being to repre<span class='line-break'></span>sent said lot, and vote at the meetings of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation, receiving a ticket of admission in that <span class='line-break'> </span>capacity, until the further action of this board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot. 306. Representative of'><a href='/pages/subjects/60773' title='Lot 306'>Lot. 306</a>. Representative of</span></p>
<p>Voted.  That in accordance with the application <span class='line-break'> </span>of the heirs of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/60774' title='Doane, L. B.'>L.B. Doane</a>, proprietor <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/60773' title='Lot 306'>lot no. 306</a> in the Cemetery, <a href='/pages/subjects/60775' title='Doane, George'>George Doane</a><span class='line-break'> </span>the oldest son resident in this vicinity be desig<span class='line-break'></span>nated for the time being to represent said lot<span class='line-break'> </span>and vote at the meetings of this corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>receiving a ticket of admission in that capac<span class='line-break'></span>ity, until the further action of this board.</p>
<p>Adjourned. A true record -<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest.  <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts.<span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk ss. <date when='1852-02-07'>Feb. 7<sup>th</sup> A.D 1852.</date>  Then personally<span class='line-break'> </span>appeared <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>, and made oath<span class='line-break'> </span>that he would faithfully perform the duties<span class='line-break'> </span>of Secretary of the Proprietors of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn. -- Before me --<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> Justice of the Peace.</p>
</div>
</div>
