<div id="page-1062222">
<h3><a name="page-1062222">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 228)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>228</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. March 2. 1852.'>Trustees. <date when='1852-03-02'>March 2. 1852</date>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner the<span class='line-break'> </span>regular monthly meeting of the Trustees was held at<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr C.P. Curtis</a> office, on <date when='1852-03-02T12:00:00'>Tuesday, March 2<sup>nd</sup> at 12 M.</date><span class='line-break'> </span>Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'> and <span class='line-break'> </span>Read.</a></p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='E.W. Williams Legacy.'><a href='/pages/subjects/53603' title='Williams, Elizabeth Watson'>E.W. Williams</a> Legacy.</span></p>
<p>The committee on the petition of <a href='/pages/subjects/60759' title='Watson, D., Jr.'>D. Watson Jr.</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Executor of the will of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/53603' title='Williams, Elizabeth Watson'>Elizabeth W. Williams</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>(see p.225). reported the following preamble and votes as <span class='line-break'> </span>proper to be adopted under the circumstances.</p>
<p>Whereas it<span class='line-break'> </span>has been made to appear to this Board that <a href='/pages/subjects/53603' title='Williams, Elizabeth Watson'>Mrs Elizabeth<span class='line-break'> </span>W Williams</a> at the time of her death was about to reduce <span class='line-break'> </span>a legacy in her will to this Corporation, from two thousand <span class='line-break'> </span>to one thousand dollars, wishing this Corportion in con<span class='line-break'></span>sideration of the latter sum to accept a devise of her<span class='line-break'> </span>lot, <a href='/pages/subjects/60760' title='Lot 1697'>number 1697</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/59904' title='Spruce Avenue'>Spruce Avenue</a>, and contract to <span class='line-break'> </span>keep the same in  perpetual repair in its present con<span class='line-break'></span>dition as mentioned in her will: and whereas in the <span class='line-break'> </span>opinion of this board the sum of one thousand dol<span class='line-break'></span>lars is amply sufficient for the purposes there named.</p>
<p><b>Voted.</b>  That upon receiving notice of a valid devise<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/53603' title='Williams, Elizabeth Watson'>lot numbered 1697</a>, by which the title to the same <span class='line-break'> </span>shall revest in this corporation, and upon the receipt<span class='line-break'> </span>at the same time of the sum of one thousand dol<span class='line-break'> </span>lars from the Executor of <a href='/pages/subjects/53603' title='Williams, Elizabeth Watson'>Mistress Elizabeth W. Williams</a><span class='line-break'> </span>last will and testament this Corporation will accept<span class='line-break'> </span>in said devise and the bequest of one thousand dollars <span class='line-break'> </span>and from and after that time keep the said lot in <span class='line-break'> </span>good repair in its present condition forever: <u>provided</u><span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062223">
<h3><a name="page-1062223">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 229)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>229</p>
<p><u>always,</u> that the Executor shall at the same time release <span class='line-break'> </span>any claim which he may have in any way upon this <span class='line-break'> </span>corporation by virtue of a vote passed by the Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1847-08-06'>August 6<sup>th</sup> 1847</date> (see p. 160-161) with regard to <a href='/pages/subjects/60375' title='Lot 233'>lot number<span class='line-break'></span>ed 233</a>, which <a href='/pages/subjects/53603' title='Williams, Elizabeth Watson'>Mrs Williams</a>, his testatrix, then owned.</p>
<p><b>Voted.</b>  That upon receiving such notice, and release <span class='line-break'> </span>together with the sum of one thousand dollars the <span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer and Secretary be authorized, to execute a re<span class='line-break'></span>lease in the name and behalf of this Corporation to <span class='line-break'> </span>the said Executor <s>in full</s> of any further claim upon <span class='line-break'> </span>the estate of the same testatrix</p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>, the report was <span class='line-break'> </span>accepted and the votes as reported unanimously adop<span class='line-break'></span>ted by the Trustees.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Judge Curtis&apos;- Reply from -'><a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>Judge Curtis'</a>- Reply from -</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->The Secretary</a> read a letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/58532' title='Curtis, Benjamin R.'>Judge<span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a> in reply to the vote passed by the Proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1852-02-02'>February 2<sup>nd</sup> 1852</date> on the occasion of his resignation,<span class='line-break'> </span>which reply was ordered to be put in file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stained Window of the Chapel. injuries to.'>Stained Window of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>. injuries to.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> stated that the round pane <span class='line-break'> </span>in the head of the principal window of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>on the Northern end, or Chancel window, had been <span class='line-break'> </span>destroyed in a recent storm, and it was unanimous <span class='line-break'> </span>ly <u>Voted</u>, that the President be a committee with <span class='line-break'> </span>full powers, to cause the same to be replaced.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustee Process. in the matter of Bryant &amp; Blaisdell&apos;s Claim.'>Trustee Process. in the matter of <a href='/pages/subjects/56566' title='Bryant &amp; Blaisdell'>Bryant &amp; Blaisdell's</a> Claim.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> gave notice of a Trustee <span class='line-break'> </span>process, served on the Corporation, thereupon it was <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted.  That this Corporation having been summoned as a <span class='line-break'> </span>trustee in a suit by the <a href='/pages/subjects/61467' title='Boston Gas Light Company'>Boston Gas Light Company</a> vs. <a href='/pages/subjects/56566' title='Bryant &amp; Blaisdell'>Bryant<span class='line-break'> </span>and Blaisdell</a>, the Secretary be appointed the Attorney of <span class='line-break'> </span>this Corporation to appear and file an answer in its behalf.</p>
<p>Adjourned.  A true record. Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>, Sec'y.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062224">
<h3><a name="page-1062224">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 230)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>230</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. April 2. 1852.'>Trustees. <date when='1852-04-02'>April 2. 1852</date>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner the regular <span class='line-break'> </span>monthly meeting of the Trustees was held at the<span class='line-break'> </span>office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a>. on <date when='185-04-06T12:00:00'>Tuesday April 6<sup>th</sup> at 12. M. AD. 1852</date><span class='line-break'> </span>Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>, Little,</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>.</p>
<p>No quorum. Adjourned.</p>
<p>A true Record. Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. May 4. 1852.'>Trustees. <date when='1852-05-04'>May 4. 1852</date>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant notices issued in the usual manner the regular <span class='line-break'> </span>monthly meeting of the Trustees was held at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P.<span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis Esqr.</a> on <date when='1852-05-04T12:00:00'>Tuesday. May 4<sup>th</sup> at 12. M. A.D. 1852</date></p>
<p>Present, Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>, Read and</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Removal of a tree.'>Removal of a tree.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That the Committee on Lots examine the position &amp;c of an<span class='line-break'> </span>Elm Tree, said to be intruding on <del>Elm</del>^<a href='/pages/subjects/58791' title='Central Avenue'><sup>Central</sup> Avenue</a>, between the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->gate</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and the <a href='/pages/subjects/58802' title='Bowditch Statue'>Bowditch statue</a>, and, if they shall deem it proper, cause<span class='line-break'> </span>the same to be removed.   -Adjourned</p>
<p>A true record. Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees June 1. 1852.'>Trustees <date when='1852-06-01'>June 1. 1852</date>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner, the regular month<span class='line-break'></span>ly meeting of the Trustees was held at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a><span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1852-06-01T12:00:00'>Tuesday June 1. 1852. at 12 M. A.D. 1852</date></p>
<p>Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curits</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>Kuhn</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>. The record or the last meeting was read &amp; approved</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='S. Newell&apos;s Claim. Rejected.'><a href='/pages/subjects/58794' title='Newell, Samuel R.'>S. Newell's</a> Claim. Rejected.</span></p>
<p>The Committee to whom was referred the letter of <a href='/pages/subjects/58794' title='Newell, Samuel R.'>Sam<span class='line-break'></span>uel Newell</a> dated <date when='1852-01-20'>January 20<sup>th</sup> 1852</date> (see page 225) requesting the gift<span class='line-break'> </span>of a lot, reported another letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/58794' title='Newell, Samuel R.'>Mr Newell</a> dated <date when='1852-05-06'>May 6.<span class='line-break'> </span>1852</date>, with the following additional report in writing, vis<span class='line-break'> </span>"That the Trustees ought not to comply with his request and<span class='line-break'> </span>that he have leave to withdraw." Thereupon it was</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062225">
<h3><a name="page-1062225">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 231)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>231</p>
<p>Voted. That the forgoing report be accepted and that the<span class='line-break'> </span>said <a href='/pages/subjects/58794' title='Newell, Samuel R.'>Newell</a> have leave to withdraw.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Signal Bell. near gate.'>Signal Bell. near <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->gate</a>.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> by request of <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'><!--Howe-->the Superintendent</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>made a statement as to the apparent necessity for a <span class='line-break'> </span>signal bell to be placed near the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->gate</a>. The objects stated<span class='line-break'> </span>were to have a bell which could be heard throughout <span class='line-break'> </span>the grounds, for giving concerted signals to workmen,<span class='line-break'> </span>ringing visitors out at sundown, and the like, the<span class='line-break'> </span>present bell at the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->gate</a> to be used only in summon<span class='line-break'></span>ing the gate keeper.</p>
<p>Thereupon it was<span class='line-break'> </span><b>Voted.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Mr Gould</a> be a committee of one to con<span class='line-break'></span>sider the <del>matter of</del> the expediency of putting up a bell<span class='line-break'> </span>near the entrance ^<sup>to the Cemetery</sup> with full powers to carry the project<span class='line-break'> </span>into effect, if he shall see fit to do so.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tower. Plans &amp; estimates'><a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>Tower</a>. Plans &amp; estimates</span></p>
<p>After some remarks by <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> on the <span class='line-break'> </span>subject of the contemplated improvements a the Ceme<span class='line-break'></span>tery, the erection of a <a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>tower</a>, coming next in order ac<span class='line-break'></span>cording to the original scheme it was<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted. That the President, with Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a> be <span class='line-break'> </span>a Committee of three to prepare plans and estimates for<span class='line-break'> </span>a <a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>tower</a> at Mount Auburn, to report hereafter in writing.</p>
<p>A large number of the Trustees having with<span class='line-break'></span>drawn <del>there for</del> <sup>and</sup> no quorum being present, the meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>adjourned.</p>
<p>A true record. Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Clerk.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062226">
<h3><a name="page-1062226">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 232)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>232</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. July 6. 1852.'>Trustees. <date when='1852-07-06'>July 6. 1852</date>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner the<span class='line-break'> </span>regular monthly meeting of the Trustees was holden at<span class='line-break'> </span>the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a> on <date when='1852-07-06T12:00:00'>Tuesday July 6. at 12. M. AD 185(2)</date></p>
<p>Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>Kuhn</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><s><!--Charles-->Little</s></a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>. The record of the last meeting was ^<sup>read and</sup> approved</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tower Model &amp; Plans'><a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>Tower</a> Model &amp; Plans</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> exhibited a model and plans<span class='line-break'> </span>for a <a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>tower</a>, which the Committee, appointed at the last<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting, had caused to be prepared, and recommended<span class='line-break'> </span>for adoption. After a particular examination of the <span class='line-break'> </span>plans &amp;c. and full explanation from the committee, ac<span class='line-break'></span>companied with estimates of the cost in granite:-<span class='line-break'> </span>It was, on motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Mr Crockett</a>,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tower, and Committee &amp; build.'><a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>Tower</a>, and Committee &amp; build.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That the Plan and model now presented be<span class='line-break'> </span>adopted by this board.<span class='line-break'> </span>on motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>, it was.</p>
<p>Voted. That Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>, Little,</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a> be a <span class='line-break'> </span>committee with full powers to go on and erect the <a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>tower</a><span class='line-break'> </span>now adopted, in granite.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot. 679. Ticket to Proprietors brother granted'><a href='/pages/subjects/61470' title='Lot 679'>Lot. 679</a>. Ticket to Proprietors brother granted</span></p>
<p>A written application from <a href='/pages/subjects/61471' title='Billings, W. G., Mr.'>Mr W.G. Billings</a> was<span class='line-break'> </span>presented, asking that ^<sup>inasmuch</sup> as <a href='/pages/subjects/61472' title='Furness, James T.'>James T. Furness</a> proprietor of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61470' title='Lot 679'>lot 679</a>, resides in <a href='/pages/subjects/64806' title='Philadelphia, PA'>Philadelphia</a>, the privilege of admission<span class='line-break'> </span>in his right might be allowed to his brother <a href='/pages/subjects/61473' title='Furness, George J.'>George J.<span class='line-break'> </span>Furness</a>, who resides in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, and a ticket issued to <span class='line-break'> </span>him</p>
<p>Voted. That this request be granted, and that a ticket be <span class='line-break'> </span>issued accordingly by <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->the Secretary</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Families of Proprietors. Gate Keeper authorized to admit. --- every member of.'>Families of Proprietors. Gate Keeper authorized to admit. --- every member of.</span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>, it was <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted. That the gate keeper have authority to ad<span class='line-break'></span>mit every person into the Cemetery, who applies alleg<span class='line-break'></span>ing themselves to be a proprietor or of the family of a</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062227">
<h3><a name="page-1062227">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 233)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>233</p>
<p>proprietors, and making it known to the gate keeper.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Well House. Plans of.'><a href='/pages/subjects/61326' title='Well House Gazebo'>Well House</a>. Plans of.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mr Tisdale</a> presented drawings &amp; a plan <span class='line-break'> </span>for a pump and <a href='/pages/subjects/61320' title='pump house'>pump house</a> to be constructed<span class='line-break'> </span>near the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->gate</a> within the grounds of the Corporation,<span class='line-break'> </span>and it was Voted. that the same be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee. who have the subject of constructing the <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>tower</a>, in charge, with full powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tree removed.'>Tree removed.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> from the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>lots, reported that the tree mentioned in the vote passed<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1852-05-04'>May 4<sup>th</sup>. 1852.</date> should be removed.</p>
<p>Adjourned. A true record Attest<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Aug 3. 1852.'>Trustees <date when='1852-08-03'>Aug 3. 1852</date>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to the notices issued in the usual manner the regu<span class='line-break'></span>lar monthly meeting of the Trustees was holden at the office<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a> on <date when='1852-08-03T12:00:00'>Tuesday August 3<sup>rd</sup> 1852 at 12. N. </date><span class='line-break'> </span>Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>. Little and</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>.</p>
<p>The Record of the last meeting was read and approved</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sign Boards'>Sign Boards</span></p>
<p>At the suggestion of <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> it was,<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted; That <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mr Tisdale</a> be a committee to see that<span class='line-break'> </span>good and sufficient sign boards, with names, be placed<span class='line-break'> </span>at the corners of all the avenues &amp; paths, where they are <span class='line-break'> </span>now deficient.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Drain. from___Meadow Pond'>Drain. from___<a href='/pages/subjects/57593' title='Auburn Lake'>Meadow Pond</a></span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Mr Little</a> it was<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted. That <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> be a committee with authority <span class='line-break'> </span>to put in order the end of the drain which opens into<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/57593' title='Auburn Lake'>Meadow Pond</a> near <a href='/pages/subjects/60336' title='Willow Avenue'>Willow Avenue</a>.</p>
<p>At the suggestion of <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, it was<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted. That <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'><!--Howe-->the Superintendent</a> be instructed to</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062228">
<h3><a name="page-1062228">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 234)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>234</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Grounds to be cleared up.'>Grounds to be cleared up.</span></p>
<p>cause all brush and weeds to be mown this month, in <span class='line-break'> </span>all parts of the Cemetery, where it has not been done al<span class='line-break'></span>ready, and to employ sufficient hands for that pur<span class='line-break'></span>pose.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Story Contract'><a href='/pages/subjects/53238' title='Story, William W.'>Story</a> Contract</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, from the Committee appointed <date when='1851-04-11'>April 11<sup>th</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>1851</date> (see p. 218.) reported an agreement between the Proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery, and <a href='/pages/subjects/53238' title='Story, William W.'>Mr William W. Story</a>, dated <date when='1851-10-11'>October<span class='line-break'> </span>11. 1851</date>. which was read approved and accepted.</p>
<p>Adjourned, A true record.<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Sept.r 7. 1852'>Trustees <date when='1852-09-07'>Sept.<sup>r</sup> 7. 1852</date></span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner, the regu<span class='line-break'></span>lar monthly meeting of the Trustees was holden on <date when='1852-09-07T12:00:00'>Tuesday<span class='line-break'> </span>September 7<sup>th</sup> 1852.</date> at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a>. at 12. M.<span class='line-break'> </span>Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>Kuhn</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> and <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>.</p>
<p>The Record of the last meeting was read and approved<span class='line-break'> </span>Several partial reports were made orally.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 691. Isaac Ross&apos; Legacy.'><a href='/pages/subjects/61474' title='Lot 691'>Lot 691</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/61475' title='Ross, Isaac'>Isaac Ross'</a> Legacy.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> read a petition from the Executor of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61475' title='Ross, Isaac'>Isaac Ross</a>, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/61474' title='Lot 691'>lot no. 691</a>. in reference<span class='line-break'> </span>to a proportionate abatement of a legacy for the care of<span class='line-break'> </span>said lot. there being not enough assetts [sic] to pay all lega<span class='line-break'></span>cies in full. ______ Laid on the table.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 406. Perpetual Repair of it.'><a href='/pages/subjects/61476' title='Lot 406'>Lot 406</a>. Perpetual Repair of it.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> read a communication from <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'><!--Howe-->the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent</a>, touching. the perpetual repair of <a href='/pages/subjects/61476' title='Lot 406'>lot<span class='line-break'> </span>no. 406</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/58525' title='Thaxter, Levi'>Levi Thaxter</a>, owner offering the sum of $400.<span class='line-break'> </span>for such a contract. -- Laid on the table.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stated Meetings of Trustees.'>Stated Meetings of Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That the monthly meetings of this <del>Corpo</del> Board<span class='line-break'> </span>until further orders, be holden at 11 1/2 o clock. A.M.</p>
<p>Adjourned. Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062229">
<h3><a name="page-1062229">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 235)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>235</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. October 5. 1852.'> Trustees. <date when='1852-10-05'>October 5. 1852</date>.</span></p>
<p>At the monthly meeting of Trustees on <date when='1852-10-05'>Tuesday October<span class='line-break'> </span>5. 1852.</date> there were in attendance Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>, no quorum. Adjourned... Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Sec'y.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. Nov 2nd 1852.'> Trustees. <date when='1852-11-02'>Nov 2<sup>nd</sup> 1852</date>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner, the regular<span class='line-break'> </span>monthly meeting of the Trustees was holden on <date when='1852-11-02T11:30:00'>Tuesday<span class='line-break'> </span>November 2<sup>nd</sup> 1852</date>. at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a> at 11 1/2<span class='line-break'> </span>o'clock A.M. Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>Kuhn</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>, Little,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>, Read and</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>.</p>
<p>The Record of the last two meetings was read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot. 691. conveyed to the Corporation with a Donation for the care of it.'><a href='/pages/subjects/61474' title='Lot 691'>Lot. 691</a>. conveyed to the Corporation with a Donation for the care of it.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> presented an instrument giving the<span class='line-break'> </span>sum of one hundred dollars to this Corporation in<span class='line-break'> </span>trust for the care of <a href='/pages/subjects/61474' title='Lot 691'>lot numbered 691</a>, and also a <span class='line-break'> </span>deed of said lot to this Corporation, from the Executor<span class='line-break'> </span>and residuary devisee of <a href='/pages/subjects/61475' title='Ross, Isaac'>Isaac Ross</a> late proprietor.<span class='line-break'> </span>thereupon <ins>Voted. </ins> that this Corporation accept the said<span class='line-break'> </span>donation and conveyance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 406. Perpetual Repair of it.'><a href='/pages/subjects/61476' title='Lot 406'>Lot 406</a>. Perpetual Repair of it.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That when the application of <a href='/pages/subjects/58525' title='Thaxter, Levi'>Levi Thaxter</a> of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a>, this Corporation will contract to keep his<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61476' title='Lot 406'>lot no. 406</a>. in the Cemetery, in perpetual repair upon<span class='line-break'> </span>the present payment to its Treasurer of the sum of<span class='line-break'> </span>four hundred dollars, it being understood that said<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58525' title='Thaxter, Levi'>Thaxter</a> has expressed the desire to keep said lot in<span class='line-break'> </span>repair during his own life, and that the liability of <span class='line-break'> </span>this corporation therefor commences at the time of his<span class='line-break'> </span>death, and that this Corporation is to be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>by the contract to prohibit interments in said lot<span class='line-break'> </span>other than of the children and grandchildren of the<span class='line-break'> </span>said <a href='/pages/subjects/58525' title='Thaxter, Levi'>Levi Thaxter</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062230">
<h3><a name="page-1062230">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 236)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>236</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots 37- &amp; 290- Perpetual Repair of.'><a href='/pages/subjects/61477' title='Lot 37'>Lots 37-</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/61478' title='Lot 290'><!--Lot-->290-</a> Perpetual Repair of.</span></p>
<p>A communication from <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Howe</a>, the Superin<span class='line-break'></span>tendent, in relation to the condition of <a href='/pages/subjects/61477' title='Lot 37'>lots nos 37</a> and<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61478' title='Lot 290'><!--Lot-->290</a> was read, and <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> stated that the<span class='line-break'> </span>owners Messrs. <a href='/pages/subjects/59967' title='Carnes, N. G.'>N. G. Carnes</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/61479' title='Carnes, Francis'>Francis Carnes</a> wished<span class='line-break'> </span>to contract for their perpetual. repair. The subject<span class='line-break'> </span>of fixing the amount was referred to <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr C.P.<span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a>, with full powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 1917. Division of. into two Lots.'><a href='/pages/subjects/61480' title='Lot 1917'>Lot 1917</a>. Division of. into two Lots.</span></p>
<p>A communication in writing from <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Howe</a> <del>was also read</del> in relation to <a href='/pages/subjects/61480' title='Lot 1917'>lot no 1917</a><span class='line-break'> </span>containing 600 square feet was also read. It made<span class='line-break'> </span>known the desire of the owners to have two per<span class='line-break'></span>sons admitted. to full corporate rights in virtue of<span class='line-break'> </span>said lot, and offered to pay twenty dollars to <span class='line-break'> </span>obtain a second ticket. It was suggested that the proper<span class='line-break'> </span>course would be to reconvey the whole to the Corporation and<span class='line-break'> </span>receive two deeds as of separate lots of 300 feet each. The<span class='line-break'> </span>whole subject was referred to the Committee on Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>with full powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary. &apos;his Safe.'>Secretary. 'his Safe.</span></p>
<p>The Committee who had in charge the subject of the<span class='line-break'> </span>corporation safe reported in writing, and their report<span class='line-break'> </span>was accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='New Tickets in place of those lost.'>New Tickets in place of those lost.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That the Secretary be authorized to issue<span class='line-break'> </span>tickets to proprietors to replace lost tickets in all cases<span class='line-break'> </span>where he is satisfied that there is occasion for it without<span class='line-break'> </span>requiring a written application.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 584. Representative of'><a href='/pages/subjects/59721' title='Lot 584'>Lot 584</a>. Representative of</span></p>
<p>Voted. That in accordance with the application of<span class='line-break'> </span>some of the heirs of <a href='/pages/subjects/59722' title='French, Samuel'>Samuel French</a>, proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/59721' title='Lot 584'>lot no.<span class='line-break'> </span>584</a>, deceased <a href='/pages/subjects/61482' title='Calrow, William H., Mrs.'>Mrs William H. Calrow</a>, one of their number<span class='line-break'> </span>be designated for the time being to represent said lot in the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation, voting at its meetings, and receiving a ticket</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062231">
<h3><a name="page-1062231">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 237)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>237</p>
<p>of admission until the further action of this board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary his power to issue pro tempore Tickets to Representatives. of Deceased Proprietors.'>Secretary his power to issue pro tempore Tickets to Representatives. of Deceased Proprietors.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That the Secretary may in all cases where <span class='line-break'> </span>he is satisfied by written petition to the Trustees, that the <span class='line-break'> </span>heirs or devisees in common of any lot have agreed<span class='line-break'> </span>upon any one to represent the same, issue the ticket<span class='line-break'> </span>for such lot to this person designated in such petition<span class='line-break'> </span>as representative of such lot to remain good until <span class='line-break'> </span>the further action of this board.  The petition however,<span class='line-break'> </span>shall be presented to the trustees with notice of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Secretarys action, at the next meeting of  the <span class='line-break'> </span>board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer Finance Com. authorized to make loans.'><s>Treasurer</s> Finance Com. authorized to make loans.</span></p>
<p>In consequence of a verbal communication from <span class='line-break'> </span>the Treasurer it was Voted _ That the finance committee <span class='line-break'> </span>be authorized, to loan the funds now lying idle in the <span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer's hands on notes with good collateral se<span class='line-break'></span>curity.</p>
<p>Adjourned.  A true record -<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Dec 7th 1852.'>Trustees. <date when='1852-12-07'>Dec 7<sup>th</sup> 1852</date>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner, a <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Trustees was holden at the office of Mr<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, (as usual on the first Tuesday of each<span class='line-break'> </span>month) <date when='1852-12-07T11:30:00'>at 11 1/2 o'clock A.M. on this 7<sup>th</sup> day of De<span class='line-break'></span>cember. A.D. 1852</date> -- Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>Kuhn</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a></p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and<span class='line-break'> </span>approved.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> reported that by authority of<span class='line-break'> </span>the vote passed <date when='1852-11-02'>November 2<sup>nd</sup> 1852</date>, he had, upon</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062232">
<h3><a name="page-1062232">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 238)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>238</p>
<p>the petition of the children &amp; joint devisees of the <span class='line-break'> </span>late <a href='/pages/subjects/58451' title='Tuckerman, Joseph'>Rev. Dr. Tuckerman</a> issued a ticket to <a href='/pages/subjects/61483' title='Becker, Sarah C.'>Mrs<span class='line-break'> </span>Sarah C. Becker</a> on the <date when='1852-11-18'>18<sup>th</sup> of November last</date>.  His <span class='line-break'> </span>action was approved, and it was also</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 222. Representative  of.'><a href='/pages/subjects/61484' title='Lot 222'>Lot 222</a>. Representative  of.</span></p>
<p>Voted, that in accordance with the petition of the <span class='line-break'> </span>children and joint devisees of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/58451' title='Tuckerman, Joseph'>Joseph Tuckerman<span class='line-break'> </span>D.D.</a> proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/61484' title='Lot 222'>lot no. 222</a> in the Cemetery, <a href='/pages/subjects/61483' title='Becker, Sarah C.'>Mrs<span class='line-break'> </span>Sarah C. Becker</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a>, who is the nearest <span class='line-break'> </span>resident of the joint proprietors, be designated for <span class='line-break'> </span>the time being to represent said lot and vote at <span class='line-break'> </span>the meetings of this Corporation receiving a ticket <span class='line-break'> </span>of admission in that capacity until the further <span class='line-break'> </span>action of this board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 406. Perpetual Repair of.'><a href='/pages/subjects/61476' title='Lot 406'>Lot 406</a>. Perpetual Repair of.</span></p>
<p>In accordance with the request of <a href='/pages/subjects/58525' title='Thaxter, Levi'>Mr Levi <span class='line-break'> </span>Thaxter</a>, the vote passed at the last meeting was <span class='line-break'> </span>amended so as to read thus.</p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That upon the application of <a href='/pages/subjects/58525' title='Thaxter, Levi'>Levi Thaxter</a>  of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a>, this Corporation will contract to keep his <a href='/pages/subjects/61476' title='Lot 406'>lot <span class='line-break'> </span>no 406</a>. in the Cemetery in perpetual repair upon the <span class='line-break'> </span>present payment to its Treasurer of the sum of four <span class='line-break'> </span>hundred dollars; it being understood that the said <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58525' title='Thaxter, Levi'>Thaxter</a> has expressed the desire to keep said lot in <span class='line-break'> </span>repair duirng his own life, and that the liability of this <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation therefor commences at the time of his death<span class='line-break'> </span>and that this Corporation is to be authorized by the <span class='line-break'> </span>contract to prohibit interments in said lot other than <span class='line-break'> </span>of the said <a href='/pages/subjects/58525' title='Thaxter, Levi'>Thaxter</a>, himself, ^<sup>and the inmates of his family</sup> and his children and <span class='line-break'> </span>grandchildren and the ^<sup>immediate</sup> inmates of their several fam<span class='line-break'></span>ilies.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062233">
<h3><a name="page-1062233">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 239)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>239</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 758. Plan to be altered.'><a href='/pages/subjects/60656' title='Lot 758'>Lot 758</a>. Plan to be altered.</span></p>
<p>A letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Howe</a>, made it known that it <span class='line-break'> </span>appeared from an examination of the ground plan <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery that number 758, had been used <span class='line-break'> </span>twice.  Thereupon Voted - That the surveyor be au<span class='line-break'></span>thorized to erase one, and substitute another, ap<span class='line-break'></span>proved by the Committee on lots, to be in unison with <span class='line-break'> </span>the deeds.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='J H Monroe [sic] &amp; A. Stewart petition for purchase of small Lots to be paid for in labor - without choice money'><a href='/pages/subjects/61538' title='Munroe, John H.'>J H Monroe</a> [sic] &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/61539' title='Stewart, Andrew'>A. Stewart</a> petition for purchase of small Lots to be paid for in labor - without choice money</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Howe</a>'s letter also preferred the request <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/61538' title='Munroe, John H.'>John H. Munroe</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/61539' title='Stewart, Andrew'>Andrew Stewart</a>, two men <span class='line-break'> </span>who have been in the employ of the Corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>for the last four years, and who have selected<span class='line-break'> </span>each a remnant lot of 110 or 120 square feet  each<span class='line-break'> </span>and both of whom have buried children, that <span class='line-break'> </span>they may be exempted from the payment<span class='line-break'> </span>of choice money for said lots, and may pay for <span class='line-break'> </span>them in labor.  Voted, that this application <span class='line-break'> </span>be referred to the Committee on Lots with full <span class='line-break'> </span>powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots. 1080. &amp; 1081. Perpetual Repair of.'><a href='/pages/subjects/70103' title='Lot 1080'>Lots. 1080</a>. &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/70104' title='Lot 1081'><!--lot-->1081</a>. Perpetual Repair of.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mr Tisdale</a> presented a communication <span class='line-break'> </span>from himself and <a href='/pages/subjects/62033' title='Hewins, Simmon K.'>Mr S. K. Hewins</a>, the proprie<span class='line-break'></span>tors of <a href='/pages/subjects/70103' title='Lot 1080'>lots 1080</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/70104' title='Lot 1081'><!--lot-->1081</a>  particularly describing those <span class='line-break'> </span>lots and the adjoining land owned by them, and <span class='line-break'> </span>asking the Trustees to fix a sum to be immediately paid <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Treasurer, in consideration of which the said lots <span class='line-break'> </span>and grounds shall be forever kept, preserved, orna<span class='line-break'></span>mented and repaired in the manner set forth in <span class='line-break'> </span>said communication, so that they may be forever <span class='line-break'> </span>secured in their good condition _ Referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots.</p>
<p>Adjourned. A true record  Attest, <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062234">
<h3><a name="page-1062234">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 240)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>240</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. January 4th. 1853.'>Trustees. <date when='1853-01-04'>January 4<sup>th</sup>. 1853</date>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner a <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Trustees was holden on the <date when='1853-01-04T11:30:00'>first Tuesday <span class='line-break'> </span>of January A.D. 1853.  January 4<sup>th</sup> at 11 1/2 A.M.</date> at the office <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis Esq<sup>r</sup>.</a></p>
<p>Present. Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>&amp; Read.</a><span class='line-break'> </span>The Record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 1917, Divided into two lots.'><a href='/pages/subjects/61480' title='Lot 1917'>Lot 1917</a>, Divided into two lots.</span></p>
<p>The Committee on Lots reported in writing that <a href='/pages/subjects/61480' title='Lot 1917'>Lot no. <span class='line-break'> </span>1917</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/61278' title='Sorrel Path'>Sorrel Path</a> may be divided into two lots of 300<span class='line-break'> </span>square feet each, one to retain that number, and one to re<span class='line-break'></span>ceive a new number: that to effect this the present owner <span class='line-break'> </span>may transfer to the Corporation, and receive two new<span class='line-break'> </span>deeds accordingly on the payment of $20. choice money:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Munroe and Stewart&apos;s Petition Granted'><a href='/pages/subjects/61538' title='Munroe, John H.'>Munroe</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/61539' title='Stewart, Andrew'>Stewart's</a> Petition Granted</span></p>
<p>Also that the request of <a href='/pages/subjects/61538' title='Munroe, John H.'>J<sup>no</sup>. H. Munroe</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/61539' title='Stewart, Andrew'>And.<span class='line-break'> </span>Stewart</a>, laborers in the Cemetery, preferred at the last <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting be granted:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots 1080 and 1081 The Perpetual Repair of.'><a href='/pages/subjects/70103' title='Lot 1080'>Lots 1080</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/70104' title='Lot 1081'><!--lot-->1081</a> The Perpetual Repair of.</span></p>
<p>Also that they had agreed to contract with Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tis<span class='line-break'></span>dale</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/62033' title='Hewins, Simmon K.'>Hewins</a> to take charge of their lots &amp;c according <span class='line-break'> </span>to their letter dated Dec. 8. 1852 upon the payment of the <span class='line-break'> </span>sum of $1500. to the Treasurer.</p>
<p>The report was read, and accepted.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> laid before the board a draft of a for<span class='line-break'></span>mal contract between Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/62033' title='Hewins, Simmon K.'>Hewins</a> and the <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation, prepared by their Solicitor, which was read aloud<span class='line-break'> </span>to the meeting, and after some discussion it was</p>
<p>Voted.  That this Corporation will contract with Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a> &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62033' title='Hewins, Simmon K.'>Hewins</a> for the perpetual care of their lots and ornamental grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>and the adjacent paths, with the structures, trees, shrubs &amp;c in the <span class='line-break'> </span>form of an instrument this day  presented to the Trustees, and <span class='line-break'> </span>that the Treasurer be authorized to execute said instrument on <span class='line-break'> </span>behalf of this corporation, affixing thereto its Corporate Seal, <u>providing</u></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062235">
<h3><a name="page-1062235">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 241)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>241</p>
<p>that they shall first file with the Secretary a new plan com<span class='line-break'></span>prising all the lots paths &amp;c mentionted in that contract.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Deeds to Tisdale &amp; Hewins'>Deeds to <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/62033' title='Hewins, Simmon K.'>Hewins</a></span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b>  That the offices of the Corporation be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>convey to <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mace Tisdale</a> or <a href='/pages/subjects/62033' title='Hewins, Simmon K.'>L. K. Hewins</a> any portion of the land <span class='line-break'> </span>described in said instrument and not already conveyed<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot. 855.'><a href='/pages/subjects/61543' title='Lot 855'>Lot. 855</a>.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> stated that the Executors of <a href='/pages/subjects/61544' title='Gray, Samuel C.'>Samuel C. Gray</a>, de<span class='line-break'></span>ceased, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/61543' title='Lot 855'>lot no. 855</a>. had left with him a deed <span class='line-break'> </span>conveying said lot to two trustees named therein, and asked<span class='line-break'> </span>instructions as to the recording it or issuing a ticket for the <span class='line-break'> </span>same to the trustees.  He was advised to return it to the</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='No Transfers in trust to be recorded.'>No Transfers in trust to be recorded.</span></p>
<p>Executors, with the information that this Corporation takes<span class='line-break'> </span>no notice of conveyances of lots in trust.</p>
<p>Adjourned.  A true record.  Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. February 5th. 1853.'>Trustees. <date when='1853-02-05'>February 5<sup>th</sup>. 1853</date>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner, a meeting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was holden on <date when='1853-02-05'>Saturday the 5<sup>th</sup> day of February. A.D. 1853.</date><span class='line-break'> </span>Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>Kuhn</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>, Little,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>.</p>
<p>The records of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tree be removed'>Tree be removed</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That the large decaying sycamore tree on the Northly <span class='line-break'> </span>side of Mount Auburn Cemetery and near the Easterly ter<span class='line-break'></span>mination of the outside railing be removed.</p>
<p>The Treasurers report not being ready to be laid before the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees the meeting dissolved.  A true record.  <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Sec'y -</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062236">
<h3><a name="page-1062236">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 242)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>242</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors. 1853.'>Proprietors. 1853.</span></p>
<p>Mount Auburn Cemetery.</p>
<p>The annual meeting of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>will be held at the office of the subscriber, in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, at no. 46 Wash<span class='line-break'></span>ington Street, <date when='1853-02-07T16:00:00'>on Monday, the seventh day of February 1853. at 4 o'clock <span class='line-break'> </span>P.M.</date> to choose Trustees for the ensuing year, to hear the report of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer, and to act on any others business which may legally come <span class='line-break'> </span>before the said meeting.   <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>, Secretary.  <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>. <date when='1853-01-20'>Jan. 20. 1853.</date></p>
<p>Pursuant to the foregoing notice, which was <span class='line-break'> </span>published in the <a href='/pages/subjects/58551' title='Boston Daily Advertiser'>Boston Daily Advertiser</a>, a newspaper printed <span class='line-break'> </span>in the <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>City of Boston</a>, more than seven days in succession before <span class='line-break'> </span>the said time of the meeting, the Proprietors of the Cemetary of Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn met at the time and place therein designated.  A <span class='line-break'> </span>quorum having assembled, the President, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. J. Bigelow</a> took <span class='line-break'> </span>the chair.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Reports'>Annual Reports</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> proceeded to read a written report from <span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees, of the present condition of the Cemetary, and of <span class='line-break'> </span>what had been done, and contracted for, during the past year, <span class='line-break'> </span>as well as a historical account of the various improvements &amp;c.</p>
<p>Thereupon, Voted, unanimously, that the President <span class='line-break'> </span>be requested to prepare his report for publication, and <span class='line-break'> </span>that it be printed in a neat form and distributed among <span class='line-break'> </span>the Proprietors, by the Secretary, or under his direction.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->The Treasurer</a> read his report, but stated that by reason <span class='line-break'> </span>of the inattention of the officers of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass. Horticultural Society</a> to <span class='line-break'> </span>their appointments, he had not been able to procure it to be audited <span class='line-break'> </span>in season for this meeting.</p>
<p>Thereupon <b>Voted.</b> that the Treasurer's report be referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to this Corporation's Auditor of accounts, and if passed by him that <span class='line-break'> </span>it be entered at large upon the records.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062237">
<h3><a name="page-1062237">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 243)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>243</p>
<p>The superintendent's report was then read and<span class='line-break'> </span>accepted, and orderd to be recorded.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of Trustees'>Election of Trustees</span></p>
<p>The meeting then proceeded to the election of<span class='line-break'> </span>nine trustees for the ensuing year, by ballot. The following <span class='line-break'> </span>gentlement were unanimously elected. viz <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>George W. Crockett</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Benjamin A. Gould</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>George H. Kuhn</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Charles C. Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James<span class='line-break'> </span>Read</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mace Tisdale</a>.</p>
<p>The meeting then adjourned, without day, <span class='line-break'> </span>A true record. Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p>Superintendents Report.<span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn <date when='1852-12-31'>Dec 31. 1852</date></p>
<p>To <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>George W<sup>m</sup> Bond, Esqr.</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer of the Mount Auburn Cemetery Corporation.<span class='line-break'> </span>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Agreeably to former practices, and in accordance with <span class='line-break'> </span>instructions derived from the Trustees, it becomes my duty to <span class='line-break'> </span>make the following Report:-</p>
<p>There have been ninety lots improved during the <span class='line-break'> </span>past year, by being graded sodded &amp;c.</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Lots inclosed with iron fence and hedges ---</th> <th>104<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>Tombs built,  none.</td> <td>___</td> </tr> <tr><td>Monuments erected. ___</td> <td>45 </td> </tr> <tr><td>Interments during the year ___</td> <td>439.</td> </tr> <tr><td>Whole number of interments in Mount Auburn since its commencement. ___</td> <td>5,580</td> </tr> <tr><td>Whole number of lots surveyed. ___</td> <td>2,069</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> Very respectfully submitted.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Rufus Howe</a>, Sup't.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062238">
<h3><a name="page-1062238">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 244)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>244</p>

<div id="page-1062240">
<h3><a name="page-1062240">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 246)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>246</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. March 1st 1853.'>Trustees. <date when='1853-03-01'>March 1<sup>st</sup> 1853</date>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner the Trus<span class='line-break'></span>tees met at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis Esqr</a> on the <date when='1853-03-01T11:30:00'>first day of March <span class='line-break'> </span>A.D. 1853.  at 11 1/2 o'clock. A.M.</date>  Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crock<span class='line-break'></span>ett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>, Little,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of Officers.'>Election of Officers.</span></p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.<span class='line-break'> </span>The meeting at once proceeded to ballot for officers for the en<span class='line-break'></span>suing year.  The following named gentlemen were severally <span class='line-break'> </span>elected by ballot to the several offices set against their names</p>
<p>President - <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary - <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer - <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots -  <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>J. Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>I. Parker</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>" [Committee]  " [on]  Finance - <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B.A. Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>C.C. Little</a> -<span class='line-break'> </span>Auditor of Accounts - <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mace Tisdale</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Adjourned - A true record.<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> Secretary -</p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts.<span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk ss. <date when='1853-03-16'>March 16, A.D. 1853</date>. Then personally appeared<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> and made oath that he would faithfully <span class='line-break'> </span>discharge the duties of Secretary of the Proprietors of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn -- Before me --<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61548' title='Bishop, Joel P.'>Joel P. Bishop</a>, Justice of the Peace.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees April 5. 1853.'>Trustees <date when='1853-04-05'>April 5. 1853</date>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued as usual the Trustees met on <date when='1853-04-05T11:30:00'>Tuesday <span class='line-break'> </span>April 5. 1853 at 11 1/2 o 'clock.  A.M.</date> Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>.  No quorum. Adjourned.<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
