<div id="page-1062241">
<h3><a name="page-1062241">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 247)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>247</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees May 3. 1853.'>Trustees <date when='1853-05-03'>May 3. 1853</date>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to notices issued in the usual manner, the Trustees met <span class='line-break'> </span>at the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a> on <date when='1853-05-03T11:30:00'>Tuesday May 3. at 11 1/2 o'clock A.M. </date><span class='line-break'> </span>Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>, Read,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>Kuhn</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ponds. draining &amp; Cleansing.'>Ponds. draining &amp; Cleansing.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> made an oral report on the construction<span class='line-break'> </span>of a drain from <a href='/pages/subjects/57671' title='Forest Pond'>Forest<!--pond--></a> into <a href='/pages/subjects/57593' title='Auburn Lake'>Meadow Pond</a>, and that the <span class='line-break'> </span>latter pond had been in a great degree cleansed by <span class='line-break'> </span>the removal of the mud. (written report afterwards place on file)</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='No Gate. nearer to the Fitchburg R R Branch Station.'>No Gate. nearer to the <a href='/pages/subjects/57590' title='Fitchburg Railroad'>Fitchburg R R</a> Branch Station.</span></p>
<p>A communication from the superintendent of the <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/57590' title='Fitchburg Railroad'>Fitchburg Rail Road</a> was read, requesting that a gate<span class='line-break'> </span>may be opened nearer to the Station House of the <a href='/pages/subjects/90464' title='Watertown Branch Railroad'>Watertown<span class='line-break'> </span>Branch Rail Road</a> at Mount Auburn.  Voted, that the <span class='line-break'> </span>petitioner have leave to withdraw.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chapel repairs of.'><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> repairs of.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That the Committee on <a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>the tower</a> be instructed <span class='line-break'> </span>to make inquiries and report to the trustees on the ex<span class='line-break'></span>pediency of removing and replacing such portions of <span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> as are found to be defective in material <span class='line-break'> </span>or construction.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tomb lot applied for'>Tomb lot applied for</span></p>
<p>An application from <a href='/pages/subjects/61550' title='Tracy, Frederick W.'>Frederick W. Tracy</a> for leave <span class='line-break'> </span>to build an underground tomb or catacombs on the <span class='line-break'> </span>extreme Southern side, between <a href='/pages/subjects/60001' title='Walnut Avenue'>Walnut<!--Ave--></a> and the <span class='line-break'> </span>outer avenue, was referred to the Committee on Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>with full powers to act within the present laws and <span class='line-break'> </span>regulations of the Cemetery.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Paving of Gutters.'>Paving of Gutters.</span></p>
<p>The Committee on <a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>the tower</a>, were also ordered <span class='line-break'> </span>to take in charge the subject of paving gutters on the <span class='line-break'> </span>avenues or paths.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sec.y to issue tickets to Joint Purchasers -'>Sec.y to issue tickets to Joint Purchasers -</span></p>
<p>Voted.  That the Secretary be authorized to issue more <span class='line-break'> </span>than one ticket, upon one lot, where he is satisfied that <span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062242">
<h3><a name="page-1062242">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 248)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>248</p>
<p>two persons are joint<s>ly</s> purchasers of a lot in fact, though<span class='line-break'> </span>the title is in the name of one only, as required by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Charter and standing rules of the Corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 1408.'><a href='/pages/subjects/61551' title='Lot 1408'>Lot 1408</a>.</span></p>
<p>One the written petitions of <a href='/pages/subjects/53604' title='Burgess, James M.'>James M Burgess</a> and<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53605' title='Burgess, Deborah'>Deborah Burgess</a>, it was Voted. That the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>accept the surrender of a deed of <a href='/pages/subjects/61551' title='Lot 1408'>lot no. 1408</a>. dated<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1847-07-17'>July 17, 1847</date>, to <a href='/pages/subjects/61552' title='Burgess, William G.'>William G. Burgess</a>, that being the<span class='line-break'> </span>name of a person then deceased, and that said<span class='line-break'> </span>deed be canceled, and that <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> and<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->Secretary</a> issue a new deed of said lot to the<span class='line-break'> </span>said <a href='/pages/subjects/53605' title='Burgess, Deborah'>Deborah Burgess</a> as prayed for in said petition.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ticket to Parish Treasurer. Lot 103.'>Ticket to Parish Treasurer. <a href='/pages/subjects/59931' title='Lot 103'>Lot 103</a>.</span></p>
<p>The petition of <a href='/pages/subjects/60201' title='Packard, Sylvanus'>S. Packard</a> in relation to <a href='/pages/subjects/59931' title='Lot 103'>lot no 103</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>that a ticket, may issue to the Treasurer, and his successors<span class='line-break'> </span>of the <a href='/pages/subjects/61553' title='Second Society of Universalists'>Second Society of Universalists</a> in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, and that<span class='line-break'> </span>the lot be represented by him, was referred to <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac<span class='line-break'> </span>Parker</a> with full powers. Said lot is owned by that <a href='/pages/subjects/61553' title='Second Society of Universalists'><!--Universalists-->Society</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 1424. Representative of.'><a href='/pages/subjects/61555' title='Lot 1424'>Lot 1424</a>. Representative of.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That in accordance with the application of the<span class='line-break'> </span>children and heirs of <a href='/pages/subjects/61556' title='Rice, Nathan'>Nathan Rice</a>, deceased, late proprie<span class='line-break'></span>tor of <a href='/pages/subjects/61555' title='Lot 1424'>lot no 1424</a> in the Cemetery, <a href='/pages/subjects/61557' title='Rice, Nathan P.'>Nathan P. Rice</a>, the<span class='line-break'> </span>oldest son, now residing in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, be designated for<span class='line-break'> </span>the time being to represent said lot, and vote at the<span class='line-break'> </span>meetings of this Corporation, receiving a ticket of admiss<span class='line-break'></span>ion in that capacity, until the further action of this board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendents workmen not to be called from regular duties.'>Superintendents workmen not to be called from regular duties.</span></p>
<p>A letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'><!--Howe-->the Superintendent</a> was read, request<span class='line-break'></span>ing that the men under his charge should^<sup>not</sup> be called<span class='line-break'> </span>away from the regular round of duties under his direc<span class='line-break'></span>tion to work upon the operations prosecuted un connection<span class='line-break'> </span>with the so called <a href='/pages/subjects/61326' title='Well House Gazebo'>well house</a>, near the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->gate</a>.</p>
<p>Voted that his request be granted, And by common<span class='line-break'> </span>consent, agree that <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Howe</a>'s letter be referred to the</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062243">
<h3><a name="page-1062243">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 249)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>249</p>
<p>next meeting, and that such meeting be holden at the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery.</p>
<p>Adjourned to meet at the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>Gate of the Cemetery</a> on<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1853-05-05T15:30:00'>Thursday the 5th inst. at 3 1/2 o'clock. P.M.</date></p>
<p>A true record attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>, Secretary.</p>
<p>At the time &amp; place of adjournment - <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and the Secretary were the only persons present.</p>
<p>Adjournment to meet at the Secretary's office on<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1853-05-10T11:30:00'>Tuesday, May 10. 1853 at 11 1/2 AM-</date></p>
<p>Attest_ <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>H.M. Parker</a> Secretary</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees May 10. 1853.'>Trustees <date when='1853-05-10'>May 10. 1853</date>.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to adjournment the Trustees met at the Secretary's<span class='line-break'> </span>office on <date when='1853-05-10T11:30:00'>Tuesday May 10.</date> Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>,<span class='line-break'> </span>Little,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>Kuhn</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Bowditch Statue'><a href='/pages/subjects/58802' title='Bowditch Statue'>Bowditch Statue</a></span></p>
<p>Voted that a Committee of one be appointed to cause<span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/58802' title='Bowditch Statue'>Statue of Dr Bowditch</a> to be repaired by stopping the<span class='line-break'> </span>holes and painting the whole of a bronze color, and that<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> be that Committee.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Grading near the Well House.'>Grading near the <a href='/pages/subjects/61326' title='Well House Gazebo'>Well House</a>.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Mr Little</a> be a Com<span class='line-break'></span>emittee to complete the grading in the vicinity of the<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61326' title='Well House Gazebo'>well house</a>.</p>
<p>Adjourned. Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M Parker</a>, Secretary_</p>
<p>At the monthly meeting <date when='1853-06-07'>June 7<sup>th</sup></date> duly notifies there were present<span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crocket</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>â€”No quorumâ€”</p>
<p>Adjourned. Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062244">
<h3><a name="page-1062244">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 250)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>250</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. July 5. 1853.'>Trustees. <date when='1853-07-05'>July 5. 1853</date>.</span></p>
<p>At the monthly meeting <date when='1853-07-05'>July 5<sup>th</sup></date> duly notified, there were <span class='line-break'> </span>present only Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>, Little &amp;</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a><span class='line-break'> </span>no quorum.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> as a Committee on the <a href='/pages/subjects/58802' title='Bowditch Statue'>Bowditch Statue</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>reported in writing.  His report was accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gate Keeper complaints against; authorized to admit without passes'>Gate Keeper complaints against; authorized to admit without passes</span></p>
<p>A letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/58356' title='Bartlett, Levi'>Mr Levi Bartlett</a> to one of the Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>was read.  It complains of the course of the gate keeper.<span class='line-break'> </span>This led to a general consideration of the subject of visitors<span class='line-break'> </span>to the cemetery, with &amp; without tickets &amp; passes.  It was,<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted.  That /subject to the notification &amp; confirmation of <span class='line-break'> </span>the board/  the gate keeper be <sup>permitted</sup>  <s>instructed</s> to admit <span class='line-break'> </span>persons of respectable appearance and demeanor to <span class='line-break'> </span>ride into the Cemetery, without tickets or permits until <span class='line-break'> </span>further orders.</p>
<p>Adjourned.  Attest.  <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees August 2. 1853'>Trustees <date when='1853-08-02'>August 2. 1853</date></span></p>
<p>At the monthly meeting, duly called, and holden <date when='1853-08-02'>August <span class='line-break'> </span>2<sup>nd</sup></date> there were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>Kuhn</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>, Read and</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gate Keeper has authority.'>Gate Keeper has authority.</span></p>
<p>Voted.  To confirm the vote passed at the last meeting.</p>
<p>Adjourned.  Attest.  <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees September 6. 1853.'> Trustees <date when='1853-09-06'>September 6. 1853</date>.</span></p>
<p>At the monthly meeting duly called and holden <date when='1853-09-06'>September 6. 1853.</date><span class='line-break'> </span>there were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>Kuhn</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>, <span class='line-break'> </span>Little and</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The president</a> made a statement of the estimated cost <span class='line-break'> </span>of rebuilding the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->chapel</a> in a thorough manner.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chapel the rebuilding of.'><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'>Chapel</a> the rebuilding of.</span></p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B. A. Gould Esqr</a> it was unanimously <span class='line-break'> </span><b>Voted.</b>  That it is expedient that the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'>Chapel at Mount Auburn</a><span class='line-break'> </span>be taken down for the purpose of rebuilding it in a more </p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062245">
<h3><a name="page-1062245">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 251)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>251</p>
<p>safe and substantial manner</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Committee to rebuild the Chapel'>Committee to rebuild the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a></span></p>
<p>And upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>G. H. Kuhn Esqr</a> it as unanimously <span class='line-break'> </span><b>Voted.</b>  That the subject of taking down and rebuilding the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>be referred to Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>, (they being the <span class='line-break'> </span>same persons who constitute the Committee on the <a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>Tower</a>,) with<span class='line-break'> </span>full powers to take such steps as they shall see fit, to carry <span class='line-break'> </span>these measures into effect.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Thomas Dowse Lot Fund for the repair of.'><a href='/pages/subjects/62002' title='Dowse, Thomas'>Thomas Dowse</a> Lot Fund for the repair of.</span></p>
<p>A letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'><!--Howe-->the Superintendent</a> in relation to a pro<span class='line-break'></span>posed donation for the care of <s>the</s> lot owned by <a href='/pages/subjects/62002' title='Dowse, Thomas'>Thomas Dowse</a><span class='line-break'> </span>was read, and it was,</p>
<p><b>Voted.</b>  That the Trustees accept <a href='/pages/subjects/62002' title='Dowse, Thomas'>Mr Dowse's</a> proposition for paying <span class='line-break'> </span>five hundred dollars in Cash and giving his note for two hundred <span class='line-break'> </span>and fifty dollars, payable the <date when='1854-01-01'>first of January next</date>.  This is not <span class='line-break'> </span>to constitute a guaranty for the perpetual repair of same lot<span class='line-break'> </span>but only to apply the interest, according to the established rules.</p>
<p>After some remarks on the subject of passes for <span class='line-break'> </span>visitors at the Cemetery it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary Authorized to issue passes. to hotels. &amp;c.'>Secretary Authorized to issue passes. to hotels. &amp;c.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b>  That <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->the Secretary</a> may prepare and issue, to the prin<span class='line-break'></span>cipal hotels and other proper persons cards of admission to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery to be surrendered at the Gate, and returned to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Secretary to be re issued as occasion may require.  And<span class='line-break'> </span>such passes may be given to residents as well as stran<span class='line-break'></span>gers.</p>
<p>Adjourned.  Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary </p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062246">
<h3><a name="page-1062246">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 252)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>252</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. October. 1853.'>Trustees. <date when='1853-10'>October. 1853</date>.</span></p>
<p>At the regular monthly meeting of the Trustees holden <date when='1853-10'>October.<span class='line-break'> </span>1853.</date> Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>Kuhn</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Admission  to Cemetery on Sundays - by Trustees'>Admission  to Cemetery on Sundays - by Trustees</span></p>
<p>Voted.  That any person may be admitted into the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>on Sundays with a special permit from a Trustee.</p>
<p>Adjourned.  Attest.  <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Novembr 1. 1853.'>Trustees <date when='1853-11-01'>Novemb<sup>r</sup> 1. 1853</date>.</span></p>
<p>At the regular monthly meeting of the Trustees holden <date when='1853-11-01'>November 1<sup>st</sup></date><span class='line-break'> </span>Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>Kuhn</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>, Little<span class='line-break'> </span>and</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Bond</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a>.</p>
<p>Record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Maple Avenue changed in line of '><a href='/pages/subjects/58080' title='Maple Avenue'>Maple Avenue</a> change<s>d</s> in line of </span></p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>, were appointed a Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee to view and report on any change required to be made<span class='line-break'> </span>in <a href='/pages/subjects/58080' title='Maple Avenue'>Maple Avenue</a>.</p>
<p>Adjourned. Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. December 6. 1853.'>Trustees. <date when='1853-12-06'>December 6. 1853</date>.</span></p>
<p>At the regular monthly meeting of the trustees holden <date when='1853-12-06'>Dec. 6<sup>th</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>1853</date>. Present, Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>, Little,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Bond</a>, the  Treasurer.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='B.F. Wyeth elected Gatekeeper.'><a href='/pages/subjects/62093' title='Wyeth, Benjamin F.'>B.F. Wyeth</a> elected Gatekeeper.</span></p>
<p>Various applications for the office of gate keeper at the Ceme<span class='line-break'></span>tery were considered, and subsequently the Trustees on motion of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Mr Parker</a> proceeded to ballot for a gate keeper.  Six ballots were <span class='line-break'> </span>thrown all of which were for <a href='/pages/subjects/62093' title='Wyeth, Benjamin F.'>B. F. Wyeth</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> was ordered to notify <a href='/pages/subjects/62093' title='Wyeth, Benjamin F.'>Mr Wyeth</a> of his election.</p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> were appointed a Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>to confer with <a href='/pages/subjects/62093' title='Wyeth, Benjamin F.'>Mr Wyeth</a> and fix his duties.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Maple Avenue. change in line of. '><a href='/pages/subjects/58080' title='Maple Avenue'>Maple Avenue</a>. change in line of. </span></p>
<p>The Committee on <a href='/pages/subjects/58080' title='Maple Avenue'>Maple Avenue</a> reported orally and it was <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted.  That <a href='/pages/subjects/58080' title='Maple Avenue'>Maple Avenue</a> be extended, in a line parallel with <span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>Eastern fence</a>, and distant about nine feet therefrom along</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062247">
<h3><a name="page-1062247">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 253)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>253</p>
<p>the whole length of that <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->fence</a>, or so far as the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>this subject think proper, and where the present avenue va<span class='line-break'></span>ries from that line, that it be discontinued, and that said<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58080' title='Maple Avenue'>Maple Avenue</a>, from the two points of junction with <a href='/pages/subjects/61222' title='Lime Avenue'>Lime<!--Ave--></a><span class='line-break'> </span>being so discontinued, a new path be substituted for the<span class='line-break'> </span>curve between those points; and that the plan be altered <span class='line-break'> </span>accordingly.</p>
<p>Letters from <a href='/pages/subjects/62004' title='Welch, Francis'>Francis Welch</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/62005' title='Ballard, Joseph'>Joseph Ballard</a> were <span class='line-break'> </span>read, which gave the assent of those gentlemen as proprie<span class='line-break'></span>tors of lots on <a href='/pages/subjects/61222' title='Lime Avenue'>Lime<!--Ave--></a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/58080' title='Maple Avenue'>Maple Avenues</a> to the above<span class='line-break'> </span>alteration</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='New Book and Catalogue of the Cemetery.'>New Book and Catalogue of the Cemetery.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->the Secretary</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/56692' title='Wadsworth, Alexander'>Mr <span class='line-break'> </span>Wadsworth</a>, the Surveyor, be a Committee to prepare<span class='line-break'> </span>and print a new Book of the Cemetery, with a plan <span class='line-break'> </span>and Catalogue.</p>
<p>Adjourned, Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees January 3, 1854'>Trustees <date when='1854-01-03'>January 3, 1854</date></span></p>
<p>At the regular monthly meeting, <date when='1854-0103'>January 3<sup>rd</sup> 1854</date>, there <span class='line-break'> </span>were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>Kuhn</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Bond</a> the Treasurer, also <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The president</a> made a report on the original plan <span class='line-break'> </span>of introducing statuary into the Cemetery, thereupon</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statuary for Chapel.'>Statuary for <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That a Committee of three of when <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the president</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>shall be the chairman be appointed to consider the report<span class='line-break'> </span>on statuary made this day, and report at a future meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees upon the general subject of introducing <span class='line-break'> </span>statuary into the Cemetery at the expense of the Corpora<span class='line-break'></span>tion.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Isaac Parker records his dissenting vote.'> <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a> records his dissenting vote.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Mr Parker</a> requested that his vote dissenting from<span class='line-break'> </span>the foregoing vote of the majority should be entered in</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062248">
<h3><a name="page-1062248">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 254)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>254</p>
<p>the records.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Committee on Statuary.'>Committee on Statuary.</span></p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> were appointed to complete the<span class='line-break'> </span>said Committee.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chapel Rebuilding of &amp; Extension.'><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> Rebuilding of &amp; Extension.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That the building Committee be authorized to ex<span class='line-break'></span>tend the length of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> as they shall see fit.</p>
<p>. . . Adjourned without day.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>, Secretary -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees February 4. 1854'>Trustees <date when='1854-02-04'>February 4. 1854</date></span></p>
<p>At the special ____ meeting of the Trustees holden on <date when='1854-02-04'>Satur<span class='line-break'></span>day the fourth day of February A.D. 1854</date>, there were present Messrs<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Tisdale</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>Kuhn</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='E.W. Williams Legacy. '><a href='/pages/subjects/53603' title='Williams, Elizabeth Watson'>E.W. Williams</a> Legacy. </span></p>
<p>Voted. That in as much as <a href='/pages/subjects/60759' title='Watson, D., Jr.'>D. Watson</a> for Executor of the last will<span class='line-break'> </span>of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/53603' title='Williams, Elizabeth Watson'>Elizabeth W. Williams</a> has failed to comply with the<span class='line-break'> </span>provisions and conditions of the votes in relation to a certain lega<span class='line-break'></span>cy in said will passed <date when='1852-03-02'>March 2. 1852</date>, that the authority there<span class='line-break'> </span>given to the Secretary and Treasurer be and the same is here <span class='line-break'> </span>by revoked [for vote see p. 228.]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary to collect Whole amount.'>Secretary to collect Whole amount.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->the Secretary</a> be instructed to collect from the said<span class='line-break'> </span>Executor the full amount of the legacy with interest.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Kirkland monument. repair of.'><a href='/pages/subjects/60407' title='Kirkland, John Thornton'>Kirkland</a> monument. repair of.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->The Treasurer</a> reported that the fund for the repair of<span class='line-break'> </span>the monument to <a href='/pages/subjects/60407' title='Kirkland, John Thornton'>President Kirkland</a>, which was originally only<span class='line-break'> </span>$72 had lain in his hands in interest until it amounted to<span class='line-break'> </span>$113. which with $13 received for the same purpose from and<span class='line-break'> </span>through <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a>. now amounted to $126 Thereupon<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted. That <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> place the said sum of $126 to <span class='line-break'> </span>the credit of lot no ___, in the trust fund for care of lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accounts of the Trust Funds.'>Accounts of the Trust Funds.</span></p>
<p>On suggestion from various individuals the subject of the <span class='line-break'> </span>trust funds for the care of lots, and the manner of keep<span class='line-break'></span>ing the accounts of the same, was referred to <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Mr Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062249">
<h3><a name="page-1062249">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 255)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>255</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 202. New Deed of.'><a href='/pages/subjects/62007' title='Lot 202'>Lot 202</a>. New Deed of.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> read a letter from the ^<sup>attorney of the</sup> widow of the late<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58343' title='Farrar, John'>John Farrar</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62008' title='Farrar, Eliza'>Mrs. Eliza Farrar</a>, from which it appeared that <span class='line-break'> </span>she was by his will the devisee of <a href='/pages/subjects/62007' title='Lot 202'>lot number 202</a>. in the Ceme<span class='line-break'></span>tery, but the deed of the same from the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Socie<span class='line-break'></span>ty</a> to said <a href='/pages/subjects/62008' title='Farrar, Eliza'>Farrar</a>, found among his papers, has no seal<span class='line-break'> </span>upon it. <s>The record however states that it was sold</s>. It <span class='line-break'> </span>was Voted. That a new deed of said lot to <a href='/pages/subjects/62008' title='Farrar, Eliza'>Mrs Eliza<span class='line-break'> </span>Farrar</a> be issued by this Corporation.</p>
<p>The Treasurer's report was submitted to the meet<span class='line-break'></span>ing, and ordered to be presented at the annual meeting to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Proprietors.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer authorized to sell stocks.'>Treasurer authorized to sell stocks.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b>  That <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a>, under the advice of the finance<span class='line-break'> </span>committee, be authorized to sell stocks sufficient to meet<span class='line-break'> </span>the liabilities of this Corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stated Meetings of Trustees.'>Stated Meetings of Trustees.</span></p>
<p>Voted. That the first meeting of the new board of trustees be <span class='line-break'> </span>holden on <date when='1854-01-13T12:00:00'>Monday the 13th inst. at 12 o'clock M.</date> and the same <span class='line-break'> </span>hour of the first Monday of each month, be the time for the monthly meetings.<span class='line-break'> </span><small>Adjourned. Attest.  <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>H. M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</small></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors. 1854.'>Proprietors. 1854.</span></p>
<p>Mount Auburn Cemetery.</p>
<p>The Annual Meeting of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn, will be held at the office of the subscriber <span class='line-break'> </span>in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> at no. 46 Washington Street on <date when='1854-02-06T16:00:00'>Monday the <span class='line-break'> </span>sixth day of February. 1854 at 4 o'clock P.M.</date> to choose<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees for the ensuing year, to hear the report of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer and to act on any other business which may <span class='line-break'> </span>legally come before the meeting.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> January 1854</p>
<p>Pursuant to the foregoing notice,<span class='line-break'> </span>which was published in the <a href='/pages/subjects/58551' title='Boston Daily Advertiser'>Boston Daily Advertiser</a> a  newspaper<span class='line-break'> </span>printed in the <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>City of Boston</a> more than seven days in success-</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062250">
<h3><a name="page-1062250">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 256)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>256</p>
<p>ion before the said time of meeting, the Proprietors of the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn met at the time and place therein designated<span class='line-break'> </span>A quorum having assembled, the President <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. J. Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span>took the chair.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Reports.'>Annual Reports.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->The treasurer</a> presented and read his own annual <span class='line-break'> </span>report, and that of <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'><!--Howe-->the Superintendent</a>, and it was unanimously <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted, that the same be printed and sent by mail to each <span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a>, on behalf of the Trustees, made an <span class='line-break'> </span>oral statement of the condition and prospects of the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>the improvements of the past year, and those now in contem<span class='line-break'></span>plation of the Trustees, or in progress.  Some general dis<span class='line-break'></span>cussion followed, after which the meeting proceeded to the <span class='line-break'> </span>election of nine trustees for the ensuing year, by ballot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees elected'>Trustees elected</span></p>
<p>The Committee appointed to collect, count and <span class='line-break'> </span>sort the votes reported that the whole number of ballots <span class='line-break'> </span>thrown was seventy three (many of which were by proxies)<span class='line-break'> </span>necessary to an election thirty seven. Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bige<span class='line-break'></span>low</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>George W. Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Benjamin <span class='line-break'> </span>A. Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>George H. Kuhn</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Charles C. Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac<span class='line-break'> </span>Parker</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a> had each seventy three votes <span class='line-break'> </span>and were elected.  <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Isaiah Bangs</a> had sixty-two votes and <span class='line-break'> </span>was elected.  <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mace Tisdale</a> had eleven votes and was not<span class='line-break'> </span>elected.</p>
<p>After some further discussion as to the general interests <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation, there being no further business before the <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting  the Proprietors adjourned, without day.<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<div id="page-1062253">
<h3><a name="page-1062253">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 259)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>259</p>

<p>The annexed Schedule shows the available property <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation to be.<span class='line-break'> </span>The outstanding liabilities are<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Massachusetts Horticultural Society</a> for <span class='line-break'> </span>their proportion of sales the past year<span class='line-break'> </span>Balance due <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>R. Howe</a> Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>Amount uninvested for <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>Story Statue</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Balance due for the <a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>tower</a>. say</p>
<p>Number of lots sold the last year 186<span class='line-break'> </span>besides which there have been selected but<span class='line-break'> </span>not yet paid for lots amounting in value to about<span class='line-break'> </span>which amount will sum be available.</p>
<p>Mount Auburn <date when='1853-12-31'>Dec 31. 1853.</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond. Esqr.</a></p>
<p>Treasurer of the Mount Auburn Cemetery Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>Dear Sir - It is made a part of my duty to report<span class='line-break'> </span>to you at the close of each year the number of lots improved<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp;c. I therefore submit the following report.</p>
<p>Lots improved during the year by being graded sodded &amp;c one hundred and forty five<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots enclosed with iron fence and hedges   one hundred and twenty<span class='line-break'> </span>six tombs built.<span class='line-break'> </span>Sixty monuments erected.<span class='line-break'> </span>Number of interments during the year five hundred and seventy eight<span class='line-break'> </span>Whole number of interments from the opening of the Cemetery, six thousand <span class='line-break'> </span>one hundred and fifty eight. Respectfully your Serv.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Rufus Howe</a>. Suptr.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1062255">
<h3><a name="page-1062255">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 261)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>261</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. February 13. 1854.'>Trustees. <date when='1854-02-13'>February 13. 1854</date>.</span></p>
<p>At a special meeting of the Trustees holden in conformity with <span class='line-break'> </span>an order of the last board, of which I gave due notice to<span class='line-break'> </span>all the Trustees for the current year, all of the members<span class='line-break'> </span>were present.     The record of the last meeting was read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Officers elected.'>Officers elected.</span></p>
<p>The following officers were unanimously elected by ballot.</p>
<p>President. <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer. <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots. <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>J. Bigelow</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a>.</p>
<p>The following officers were also elected.<span class='line-break'> </span>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Finances <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B.A. Gould</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>C.C. Little</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Auditor. <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Isaiah Bangs</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gate Keeper&apos;s duties.'>Gate Keeper's duties.</span></p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a> were appointed a Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee to confer with <a href='/pages/subjects/62093' title='Wyeth, Benjamin F.'>Mr Wyeth</a>, the Gate Keeper, and<span class='line-break'> </span>fix his duties.  -</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>Mr Kuhn</a> here retired from the meeting.</p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a> were appointed<span class='line-break'> </span>as a committee on the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>, and the taking down<span class='line-break'> </span>and rebuilding of the same.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statuary.'>Statuary.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The Presiden</a>t, from the Committee on Statuary<span class='line-break'> </span>made a written report, which was postponed for considera<span class='line-break'></span>tion until the next meeting, the Secretary in the mean<span class='line-break'> </span>time to furnish each trustee with a copy of the same.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Committees to have same powers.'>Committees to have same powers.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That the building and ^<sup>all</sup> other Committees shall have<span class='line-break'> </span>the same powers conferred on them which have been<span class='line-break'> </span>conferred on the same Committees in previous years.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accounts of the Trust Fund. how kept.'>Accounts of the Trust Fund. how kept.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Mr Parker</a> from the Committee on the subject of <span class='line-break'> </span>the fund for the care of lots reported orally, and upon<span class='line-break'> </span>his motion the following votes were passed</p>
<p><b>Voted.</b>That <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a>, under the direction of the<span class='line-break'> </span>same committee, be authorized to separate from the<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062256">
<h3><a name="page-1062256">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 262)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>262</p>
<p>general funds of this Corporation all monies received on<span class='line-break'> </span>trust for the care of lots, which shall henceforth consti<span class='line-break'></span>tute a separate fund for the execution of such trusts.</p>
<p><b>Voted</b> That in books to be opened for this purpose each<span class='line-break'> </span>lot concerned shall be credited ^<sup>with the principal sum given on a/c of these</sup> &amp; interest at the rate of <span class='line-break'> </span>5 1/2 percent per annum from the time at which the<span class='line-break'> </span>money for the care of the same was actually received<span class='line-break'> </span>to the close of the last financial year; and that in <span class='line-break'> </span>future rateable propositions of the net income ^<sup>of the separate fund</sup> less one<span class='line-break'> </span>half percent, be carried to the credit of each lot, and<span class='line-break'> </span>that proper entries shall be made in such books ac<span class='line-break'></span>cordingly.</p>
<p>Adjourned without day--<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary -</p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts.<span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk ss. <date when='1854-02-14'>February 14. A.D. 1854.</date></p>
<p>Then personally appeared <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> and<span class='line-break'> </span>made oath that he would faithfully discharge the<span class='line-break'> </span>duties of Secretary of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn for the ensuing year, &amp; so long as he<span class='line-break'> </span>shall continue in office. Attest.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/60747' title='Washburn, William R. P.'>W<sup>m</sup> R. P. Washburn</a> Justice of the Peace.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062257">
<h3><a name="page-1062257">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 263)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>263</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. March 7. 1854.'>Trustees. <date when='1854-03-07'>March 7. 1854</date>.</span></p>
<p>The first monthly meeting of the Trustees was holden on <date when='1854-03-07'>the 7<sup>th</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>day of March A.D. 1854</date>. Present Messrs. <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>Kuhn</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>, Little and</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Transfers to two grantees not to be recorded.'>Transfers to two grantees not to be recorded.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->The Secretary</a> presented a deed of <a href='/pages/subjects/60686' title='Lot 603'>lot no 603</a>. from<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62086' title='Black, William'>William Black</a> to two grantees, and the request of the<span class='line-break'> </span>grantees that it might be recorded, he having declined to<span class='line-break'> </span>record it, as the charter does not contemplate two tenants<span class='line-break'> </span>of one lot except by inheritances or devise, lots being indi<span class='line-break'></span>visible [See Section 8<sup>th</sup> of the Charter] Such has been the uniform<span class='line-break'> </span>usage of the Secretary, but the grantees in this deed refuse to<span class='line-break'> </span>acquiesce in it without first appealing to the Trustees -</p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->the Secretary</a> be instructed to adhere to the<span class='line-break'> </span>existing usage.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statuary.'>Statuary.</span></p>
<p>The Report of the Committee on Statuary was taken up<span class='line-break'> </span>and considered <u>seriatim</u> and thereupon it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Price of Lots increased.'>Price of Lots increased.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That the price of lots of 300 square feet in future<span class='line-break'> </span>be one hundred and fifty dollars, without any additional pay<span class='line-break'></span>ment for the right of choice.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tomb Lots may be sold.'>Tomb Lots may be sold.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That Lots for tombs properly secured against<span class='line-break'> </span>nuisance may be sold for two hundred dollars for 300<span class='line-break'> </span>square feet; subject to the approval of the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>lots, both as to the location of the lots and the mode of<span class='line-break'> </span>construction of the tombs.</p>
<p><del>A letter for</del> The remainder of the report was postponed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mr Howe tenders his resignation'><a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Howe</a> tenders his resignation</span></p>
<p>A letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Howe</a>, the Superintendent, was read<span class='line-break'> </span>tendering his resignation to take effect on or after <date when='1854-04-01'>April 1<sup>st</sup></date><span class='line-break'> </span>as the trustees should direct. Referred to a Committee of<span class='line-break'> </span>two consisting of Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a>.</p>
<p>The same letter suggested the payment of the</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062258">
<h3><a name="page-1062258">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 264)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>264</p>
<p>salary of the late gate keeper, <a href='/pages/subjects/58903' title='Hyde, Jonathan'>Mr Hyde</a>, less to January 1<sup>st</sup> to<span class='line-break'> </span>his daughter - <a href='/pages/subjects/58903' title='Hyde, Jonathan'>Mr Hyde</a> having died in November last.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salary of Mr. Hyde late Gate keeper.'>Salary of <a href='/pages/subjects/58903' title='Hyde, Jonathan'>Mr. Hyde</a> late Gate keeper.</span></p>
<p><b>Voted. </b> That the amount due to <a href='/pages/subjects/58903' title='Hyde, Jonathan'>Mr Hyde</a> at the time<span class='line-break'> </span>of his death be paid to his administrator, and the balance of<span class='line-break'> </span>the salary for the quarter when which he had entered, (be<span class='line-break'></span>ginning October 1<sup>st</sup>) be paid to his daughter.</p>
<p>Adjourner to meet at the same place in two weeks<span class='line-break'> </span>from this day at 12 M.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. March 20. 1854.'> Trustees. <date when='1854-03-20'>March 20. 1854</date>.</span></p>
<p>The Trustees met pursuant to adjournment <date when='1854-03-20T12:00:00'>at 12 M. March 20<sup>th</sup></date><span class='line-break'> </span>Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Mr Parker</a>, presented the following report in writing</p>
<p>Report.</p>
<p>The Committee when the duties and compensation of the<span class='line-break'> </span>gate keeper. Report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gate keeper&apos;s duties &amp; compensation'>Gate keeper's duties &amp; compensation</span></p>
<p>That it be his duty to attend the gate from sun<span class='line-break'></span>rise to sunset, every day in the week, personally, except that<span class='line-break'> </span>in the forenoon of the Sabbath he may substitute another<span class='line-break'> </span>person, approved by the superintendent, at his own expense,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that he be paid for that service a salary of four<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred dollars per annum payable quarterly.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent&apos;s clerk'>Superintendent's clerk</span></p>
<p>The Committee recommend that <a href='/pages/subjects/62093' title='Wyeth, Benjamin F.'>Benjamin<span class='line-break'> </span>F. Wyeth</a> be appointed Clerk to the Superintendent and<span class='line-break'> </span>be required, to keep the books and do all the duties as such re<span class='line-break'></span>quired by the superintendent or indicated by him and<span class='line-break'> </span>under his direction, and that for such service he receive<span class='line-break'> </span>an annual salary of two hundred and fifty dollars per an<span class='line-break'></span>num payable quarterly.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062259">
<h3><a name="page-1062259">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 265)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>265</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gate keeper&apos;s duties.'>Gate keeper's duties.</span></p>
<p>That all the duties be performed except as spe<span class='line-break'></span>cifically stated above under the direction of the superin<span class='line-break'></span>tendent who may require of him the performance of<span class='line-break'> </span>any other duties not incompatible with the foregoing</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a>}<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Isaiah Bangs</a>} Committee.</p>
<p><date when='1854-03-16'>March 16. 1854.</date></p>
<p><b>Voted</b> That the foregoing report be accepted, and <span class='line-break'> </span>the proposed regulations therein set forth be adopted.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Mr Bangs</a> submitted the following report in writing.</p>
<p>The Committee appointed to confer with <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Howe</a> on<span class='line-break'> </span>the subject of his letter to the Trustees resigning the office<span class='line-break'> </span>of superintendent, also to consider the expediency of build<span class='line-break'> </span>a <a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>house for the superintendent</a>, have attended to the duty<span class='line-break'> </span>assigned them and submit the following report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mr Howe&apos;s resignation withdrawn'><a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Howe</a>'s resignation withdrawn</span><span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='his salary and compensation'>his salary and compensation</span></p>
<p>They have conferred with <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Howe</a> and he has<span class='line-break'> </span>consented to withdraw his letter of resignation and<span class='line-break'> </span>continues to discharge the duties of superintendent occu<span class='line-break'></span>pying the same house and enjoying the same privileges<span class='line-break'> </span>as heretofore, with a salary of eight hundred dollars<span class='line-break'> </span>$800. per year - subject however to such additional con<span class='line-break'></span>sideration as the Trustees at the termination of the<span class='line-break'> </span>year may consider just in consequence of the increased<span class='line-break'> </span>cost of boarding the men.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent&apos;s house.'><a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>Superintendent's house</a>.</span></p>
<p>And that the Trustees proceed as soon as practica<span class='line-break'></span>ble to build a house for the superintendent's use on<span class='line-break'> </span>the lot of land belonging to the Corporation adjoin<span class='line-break'></span>ing Mt Auburn. All which is respectfully submitted.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1854-03-20'>March 20, 1854</date><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a>}<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Isaiah Bangs</a>} Committee-</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062260">
<h3><a name="page-1062260">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 266)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>266</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Howes Salary -'><a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Howes</a> Salary -</span></p>
<p><b> Voted,-</b> That the foregoing report be accepted, and that so much<span class='line-break'> </span>of it as relates to <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Howe</a> be adopted and carried into effect.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent&apos;s house. plans for'><a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>Superintendent's house</a>. plans for</span></p>
<p><b> Voted,-</b> That so much of it as relates to the building of a house<span class='line-break'> </span>for the superintendent be adopted, and that the same com<span class='line-break'></span>mittes report plans and estimates to this Board accord<span class='line-break'></span>ingly.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Price of lots.'>Price of lots.</span></p>
<p><b> Voted</b>  That the price of land for lots of greater or<span class='line-break'> </span>lesser dimensions than 300 square feet excepting tomb<span class='line-break'> </span>lots, shall be 50 cents per foot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot. 1917. to be divided &amp; constitute two lots.'><a href='/pages/subjects/61480' title='Lot 1917'>Lot. 1917</a>. to be divided &amp; constitute two lots.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> read a letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/62088' title='Hook, Elias'>Elias Hook</a><span class='line-break'> </span>the proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/61480' title='Lot 1917'>lot no. 1917</a> containing 600 square feet con<span class='line-break'></span>taining a request that he may be allowed to surren<span class='line-break'></span>der this deed of said lot and after reconveying it<span class='line-break'> </span>to receive deeds of the same in two lots, one to him<span class='line-break'></span>self- on to <a href='/pages/subjects/62089' title='Clapp, Frederick'>Frederick Clapp</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>. Voted that<span class='line-break'> </span>the request of <a href='/pages/subjects/62088' title='Hook, Elias'>Mr Hook</a> be complied with and that<span class='line-break'> </span>the offices of his corporation be authorized to execute<span class='line-break'> </span>such new deeds. <a href='/pages/subjects/62088' title='Hook, Elias'>Mr Hook </a>paying twenty dollars ad<span class='line-break'></span>ditional and all incidental expenses.</p>
<p>Adjourned. A true record - Attest.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary --</p>
<p>The Regular monthly meeting of the Trustees was holden at the<span class='line-break'> </span>office of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a>. <date when='1854-04-03'>April 3<sup>rd</sup> 1854</date>. Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>and Little.</a></p>
<p>The Record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Estate of  C. Stone&apos;s heirs '> Estate of  <a href='/pages/subjects/60715' title='Stone, Cornelius'>C. Stone's</a> heirs </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> read a letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/62092' title='Dana, John B.'>J. B. Dana Esq<sup>r</sup></a><span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a>, addressed to <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Mr Little</a> as one of the Trustees and<span class='line-break'> </span>offering to sell the estate adjoining Mt. Auburn known as the</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062261">
<h3><a name="page-1062261">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 267)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>267</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' offered to the Corporation '> offered to the Corporation </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>Stone Farm</a>, to this Corporation on certain terms named therein.</p>
<p>After due consideration it was unanimously</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Voted. '> Voted. </span> That it is expedient for this Corporation to purchase<span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>Stone estate</a>, now owned and offered to this Board by<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62092' title='Dana, John B.'>J.B. Dana Esqr</a>, and adjoining Mount Auburn on the<span class='line-break'> </span>Southerly side, containing about sixteen acres more or less,<span class='line-break'> </span>with the buildings thereon; and that <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> with<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Messrs Little</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a> be a committee with full<span class='line-break'> </span>powers to carry this vote into effect.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Watriss&apos; estate - '> Watriss' estate - </span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Voted. '> Voted. </span> also. That the same Committee be<span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to negotiate for, and purchase if they think<span class='line-break'> </span>it expedient a piece of land adjoining Mount Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>on the Westerly side, and now or late belonging to<span class='line-break'> </span>one <a href='/pages/subjects/58521' title='Watriss, William'>Watriss</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' T. Bulfinch&apos;s petition. '> <a href='/pages/subjects/62097' title='Bulfinch, Thomas'>T. Bulfinch's</a> petition. </span></p>
<p>A letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/62097' title='Bulfinch, Thomas'>Thomas Bulfinch Esqr</a> was<span class='line-break'> </span>read, asking leave to purchase a lot in the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>at the old rates. The letter stated the death of his father<span class='line-break'> </span>during the last winter, and that the <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>City of Boston</a> had<span class='line-break'> </span>allowed the body to be temporarily deposited in the<span class='line-break'> </span>family tomb under the Stone Chapel to be removed<span class='line-break'> </span>as soon as conveniences allowed a burial place to<span class='line-break'> </span>be procured elsewhere. Visiting Mount Auburn with<span class='line-break'> </span>that view about the <date when='1854-03-18'>18<sup>th</sup> of March last</date>. <a href='/pages/subjects/62097' title='Bulfinch, Thomas'>Mr Bulfinch</a><span class='line-break'> </span>learned that the price of lots had been raised.</p>
<p>Thereupon <span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Voted '> Voted </span> That the application of <a href='/pages/subjects/62097' title='Bulfinch, Thomas'>Thomas<span class='line-break'> </span>Bulfinch Esqr</a> for liberty to purchase a lot at the old<span class='line-break'> </span>price, does not come within the rules laid down as to<span class='line-break'> </span>the prices of lots.</p>
<p>Adjourned without day - <span class='line-break'> </span>A true record - Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062262">
<h3><a name="page-1062262">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 268)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>268</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. April 22. 1854.'>Trustees. <date when='1854-04-22'>April 22. 1854</date>.</span></p>
<p>At a special meeting of the Trustees holden <date when='1854-04-22'>April 22<sup>nd</sup> 1854</date> there were <span class='line-break'> </span>present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>Kuhn</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>, Little,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Parker</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>and <span class='line-break'> </span>Read.</a>  The record of the last meeting was read &amp; approved.</p>
<p>A letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/62092' title='Dana, John B.'>J. B. Dana Esqr</a> was read stating the terms of the <span class='line-break'> </span>sale of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>Stone Farm</a> to this Corporation, as follows.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Estate C. Stone&apos;s heirs. J. B. DANA LETTER Proposition'>Estate <a href='/pages/subjects/60715' title='Stone, Cornelius'>C. Stone's</a> heirs. <a href='/pages/subjects/62092' title='Dana, John B.'>J. B. DANA LETTER</a> Proposition</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a>, <date when='1854-04-17'>April 17. 1854</date></p>
<p>To Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> &amp; al.<span class='line-break'> </span>Com<sup>ee</sup> of Mt Auburn.</p>
<p>Gent.  I am ready to execute and deliver a <span class='line-break'> </span>deed of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>Stone estate</a>, (which has been prepared by <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Mr Parker</a>) ac<span class='line-break'></span>cording to agreement.  I was obliged to give them verbal per<span class='line-break'></span>mission to occupy the buildings until the <date when='1854-06-15'>15<sup>th</sup> of June next</date>,<span class='line-break'> </span>and remove some small apple trees from the nursery (not <span class='line-break'> </span>worth much.) With this incumbrance (if it may be called such)<span class='line-break'> </span>I am ready to give you possession on the receipt of the follow<span class='line-break'></span>ing Viz</p>

Auburn</td> <td>___</td> <td><u> 2.500</u></td> </tr> <tr><td>The am<sup>t</sup> of the purchase per agreement.</td> <td>___</td> <td><u>$24.120</u></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> Please have a certified copy of the vote of the Trustees authorizing the mortgage <span class='line-break'> </span>on same sheet of paper with the votes. [13.8 Rods]</td> <td>420.31</td> </tr> <tr><td>Buildings per agreement</td> <td><u>3.700.</u></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><u>24.120.</u></td> </tr> </tbody> </table></p>

<div id="page-1062263">
<h3><a name="page-1062263">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 269)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>269</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Mortgage DEED. of Stone Estate. '> Mortgage DEED. of <a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>Stone Estate</a>. </span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Voted. '> Voted. </span> That <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->Secretary</a> be authorized to execute<span class='line-break'> </span>acknowledge and deliver in behalf of this Corporation, a deed of<span class='line-break'> </span>mortgage when the <a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>Stone estate</a> in <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a>, purchased of <a href='/pages/subjects/62092' title='Dana, John B.'>J. B.<span class='line-break'> </span>Dana Esqr.</a> &amp; in part payment for the same, to secure the<span class='line-break'> </span>payment of the notes of this Corporation not exceeding $15.620, to<span class='line-break'> </span>be named therein, payable to said <a href='/pages/subjects/62092' title='Dana, John B.'>Dana</a> or order at such<span class='line-break'> </span>times and on such terms as agreed upon with said <a href='/pages/subjects/62092' title='Dana, John B.'>Dana</a><span class='line-break'> </span>not exceeding two years from <date when='1854-04-17'>17 April 1854</date>, affixing the seal<span class='line-break'> </span>of this Corporation to said deed. Said notes to be signed<span class='line-break'> </span>by <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> only, and notes and mortgage to bear date<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1854-04-17'>April 17, 1854</date>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Treasurer to sell stocks. '> Treasurer to sell stocks. </span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Voted. '> Voted. </span> That <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a>, under the advice of the Finance<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee be authorized to sell stocks sufficient to make up<span class='line-break'> </span>with the cash now on hand, a sum large enough to meet<span class='line-break'> </span>the cash payment to be made for the <a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>Stone estate</a>, just pur<span class='line-break'></span>chased; or if the finance committee prefer to borrow the sum<span class='line-break'> </span>wanted for this purpose in anticipation of the revenue, to <span class='line-break'> </span>give proper notes or receipts for the same on behalf of this<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation not exceeding three thousand dollars.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Mortgage assumed. '> Mortgage assumed. </span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Voted. '> Voted. </span> That this Corporation accedes to the terms of purchase<span class='line-break'> </span>for the <a href='/pages/subjects/59753' title='Stone Estate'>Stone estate</a>, stated in the letter of <a href='/pages/subjects/62092' title='Dana, John B.'>J.B. Dana</a>, and as<span class='line-break'></span>sumes the payment of the outstanding mortgage from <a href='/pages/subjects/62098' title='Stone, William A.'>William<span class='line-break'> </span>A. Stone</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/62102' title='Allen, Harriet J.'>Mrs ____ Allen</a>, guardian of <a href='/pages/subjects/62100' title='Allen, J. M.'>J. M. Allen</a> for the <span class='line-break'> </span>payment of twenty five hundred dollars.</p>
<p>Adjourned without day - A true record - <span class='line-break'> </span>Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary - <span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
