<div id="page-1062264">
<h3><a name="page-1062264">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 270)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>270</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Proprietors to John B. Dana. '> Proprietors to <a href='/pages/subjects/62092' title='Dana, John B.'>John B. Dana</a>. </span></p>
<p>Know all men by these Presents, that the Proprietors of the Cemetery of<span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn, a Corporation established by law, in consideration of<span class='line-break'> </span>the payment of fifteen thousand six hundred and twenty dollars by<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62092' title='Dana, John B.'>John B. Dana</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a> in the County of Middlesex and Com<span class='line-break'></span>monwealth of Massachusetts, the receipt of which ^<sup> Said Corporation doth</sup> <del>is</del> hereby acknowledge<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp;c hereby give grant bargain sell and convey unto the said <a href='/pages/subjects/62092' title='Dana, John B.'>Dana</a> a<span class='line-break'> </span>tract of land with the buildings thereon lying in <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a> in said<span class='line-break'> </span>County of Middlesex, and containing sixteen acres one rood and thirteen<span class='line-break'> </span>and eight tenths of a Rod, and bounded and measuring as fol<span class='line-break'></span>lows, viz: beginning at the most South Westerly corner thereof on land<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/58540' title='Stone, David'>David Stone</a>, and on a street ^<sup>said</sup> to be called Grove Street, and run<span class='line-break'></span>ning in an Easterly direction and bounding on said street seven<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred and thirty one feet to the point marked "d" on the Plan<span class='line-break'> </span>hereinafter named, being the corner of other land of said Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>then turning and running in a Northerly direction, bounding on said<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation's other land seven hundred and thirty and a half feet<span class='line-break'> </span>to the point marked "c" on said Plan; then turning and running <span class='line-break'> </span>Easterly. still bounding on other land of said Corporation, three hun<span class='line-break'></span>dred and eighty eight feet to said street, there sometimes known as<span class='line-break'> </span>"Coolidge Avenue" at the point marked "f" on said Plan, then turning<span class='line-break'> </span>and running in a North Easterly direction and bounding on said street<span class='line-break'> </span>one hundred and two feet to the corner of still another tract of land<span class='line-break'> </span>belonging to said Corporation at the point - marked "g" on said plan;<span class='line-break'> </span>then turning and running in a Westerly direction, and bounding<span class='line-break'> </span>on the last named tract of land of said Corporation one thousand<span class='line-break'> </span>three hundred and eighty nine feet and nine inches to land of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58540' title='Stone, David'>David Stone</a> at the point marked "a" on said plan; then turning<span class='line-break'> </span>and running in a Southerly direction and bounding in said land<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/58540' title='Stone, David'>David Stone</a>, eight hundred and fifty three feet to said street,<span class='line-break'> </span>at the point marked "e" on said Plan, which is the point begun at</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062265">
<h3><a name="page-1062265">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 271)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>271</p>
<p>With all the rights privileges and appurtenances thereunto belonging or<span class='line-break'> </span>appertaining. The granted premises are the same laid down on a <span class='line-break'> </span>"Plan of land in <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a> Mass. belonging to Heirs of <a href='/pages/subjects/60715' title='Stone, Cornelius'>Cornelius Stone</a><span class='line-break'> </span>From the office of <a href='/pages/subjects/62101' title='Mason, W. A.'>W. A. Mason</a>. Surveyor. <a href='/pages/subjects/64864' title='Cambridgeport, MA'>Cambridge Port. Mass.</a> <date when='1854-03-15'>March 15<sup>th</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>1854</date>. Drawn to a scale of 50 ft to an inch X." And being the same<span class='line-break'> </span>premises which were conveyed to said Corporation by said <a href='/pages/subjects/62092' title='Dana, John B.'>Dana</a> <del>of..</del> by deed<span class='line-break'> </span>of even date herewith. The granted premises are subject to a mortgage<span class='line-break'> </span>made by one <a href='/pages/subjects/62098' title='Stone, William A.'>William A Stone</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/62102' title='Allen, Harriet J.'>Harriet J. Allen</a>. Guardian, dated<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1852-10-01'>October 1<sup>st</sup> A.D 1852</date> to secure the payment of the sum of twenty five<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred dollars in three years from said date, with interest semi<span class='line-break'> </span>annually, which mortgage and sum the said Corporation have<span class='line-break'> </span>agreed to pay and discharge including interest thereon from the<span class='line-break'> </span>date of this deed, as the same falls due. Said mortgage is recorded<span class='line-break'> </span>with Middlesex deeds at Book 638. Folio 17. <span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' To Have and to Hold '> To Have and to Hold </span><span class='line-break'> </span>the above granted premises to him the said <a href='/pages/subjects/62092' title='Dana, John B.'>John B. Dana</a> his heirs<span class='line-break'> </span>and assigns to their own use and behoof forever. . And the said<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation doth hereby covenant to and with the said <a href='/pages/subjects/62092' title='Dana, John B.'>John B.<span class='line-break'> </span>Dana</a> his heirs and assigns that said Corporation is seized in<span class='line-break'> </span>fee simple of the above granted premises, that they are free from<span class='line-break'> </span>all incumbrances excepting the mortgage above mentioned which<span class='line-break'> </span>said Corporation assumes and is to pay, that said Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>has good right to sell and convey the same to said <a href='/pages/subjects/62092' title='Dana, John B.'>Dana</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and his heirs and assigns ^<sup>as</sup> aforesaid, and that said Corpora<span class='line-break'></span>tion will warrant and defend the same to said <a href='/pages/subjects/62092' title='Dana, John B.'>Dana</a> and<span class='line-break'> </span>his heirs and assigns forever against the lawful claims and<span class='line-break'> </span>demands of all persons. <span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Provided. nevertheless. '> Provided. nevertheless. </span> and this convey<span class='line-break'></span>ance is made upon the express condition that if said Corpora<span class='line-break'></span>tion shall pay the full sum of fifteen thousand six hundred and<span class='line-break'> </span>twenty dollars as follows to wit. six thousand eight hundred and<span class='line-break'> </span>thirty three dollars in two years from the date of these presents, four<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1062266">
<h3><a name="page-1062266">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 272)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>272</p>
<p>thousand five hundred and fifty five dollars in two years from the<span class='line-break'> </span>same date, two thousand seven hundred and thirty two dollars<span class='line-break'> </span>also in two years from the same date <del> with interest </del> and fifteen<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred dollars also in two years from the same date with in<span class='line-break'></span>terest on all said sums payable semiannually; or if a special<span class='line-break'> </span>demand shall have been made for the payment of any one or<span class='line-break'> </span>more of said sums at any time before the expiration of said<span class='line-break'> </span>term of two years, then if said Corporation shall pay the ^<sup>sum or</sup> sums<span class='line-break'> </span>so demanded in six months from the date of such demand,<span class='line-break'> </span>with interest till paid; or it ^<sup>the</sup> said Corporation shall (having first<span class='line-break'> </span>given six months notice in advance of its intention so to do) pay<span class='line-break'> </span>any one or more of said sums of money, before the expiration<span class='line-break'> </span>of said term of two years; then this mortgage (the said sum of <span class='line-break'> </span>fifteen thousand six hundred and twenty dollars being paid in <span class='line-break'> </span>full in any of the ways aforesaid) as also four promissory notes<span class='line-break'> </span><del> of even date herewith </del> signed by the Treasurer of said Corporation,<span class='line-break'> </span>whereby for value received said Corporation promises to pay the said<span class='line-break'> </span>sums and interest at the times aforesaid, with the right given and <span class='line-break'> </span>reserved on the one part to demand and collect, and in the other<span class='line-break'> </span>part to pay said notes, after six months notice in anticipation, as<span class='line-break'> </span>above particularly set forth in relation to said sums of money,<span class='line-break'> </span>shall all be wholly void, but otherwise shall stand and remain in<span class='line-break'> </span>full force and effect. And if less than the whole number and gross<span class='line-break'> </span>amount of said notes shall be so paid, then this mortgage shall<span class='line-break'> </span>be, as to such sums and notes as remain unpaid in full force<span class='line-break'> </span>and effect, but the notes and sums so paid shall be no further<span class='line-break'> </span>a lien upon the estate. Interest in all cases to be computed at six<span class='line-break'> </span>percent. Said notes are of even date herewith. And provided<span class='line-break'> </span>further, that until some default in the non payment of prin<span class='line-break'></span>cipal or interest as aforesaid, or other default as herein provided,</p>
</div>
</div>

'> In Witness whereof. </span> the said Corporation hath<span class='line-break'> </span>caused its common seal to be affixed to these presents, and the<span class='line-break'> </span>same to be signed by its Treasurer and countersigned by its<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary, both thereto duly authorized, on this seventeenth day<span class='line-break'> </span>of April. A.D. eighteen hundred and fifty four.</p>

A.D. 1854</date> -- <span class='line-break'> </span>Then personally appeared <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>George W. Bond</a>. Secretary. and acknowledged the foregoing instrument by them<span class='line-break'> </span>officially subscribes, to be the free act and deed of the Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. May 1. 1854. '> Trustees. <date when='1854-05-01'>May 1. 1854</date>. </span></p>
<p>At the regular monthly meeting holden <date when='1854-05-01'>May 1<sup>st</sup> 1854</date> - there were<span class='line-break'> </span>present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>Kuhn</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>. No quorum.</p>
<p>Adjourned without day.<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary --</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. June 5. 1854. '> Trustees. <date when='1854-06-05'>June 5. 1854</date>. </span></p>
<p>At the regular monthly meeting holden <date when='1854-06-05'>June 5 1854</date>, there were<span class='line-break'> </span>present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>. No quorum.</p>
<p>Adjourned without day<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. July 3. 1854. '> Trustees. <date when=''>July 3. 1854</date>. </span></p>
<p>At the regular monthly meeting holden <date when='1854-07-03'>July 3. 1854</date> there were<span class='line-break'> </span>presents Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> reported as the assignment of a policy<span class='line-break'> </span>of insurances on the house upon the <a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>Stone Farm</a>. Thereupon</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Insurance of Farm House. '> Insurance of Farm House. </span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Mr Little</a> be a committee of one with full<span class='line-break'> </span>powers to attend to this subject and procure insurance<span class='line-break'> </span>and to make arrangements for the ^<sup>use and</sup> occupation of the<span class='line-break'> </span>house during the remainder of the present year.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Plan of Stone Estate. bought of J.B. Dana '> Plan of <a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>Stone Estate</a>. bought of <a href='/pages/subjects/62092' title='Dana, John B.'>J.B. Dana</a> </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->The Secretary</a> stated that <a href='/pages/subjects/62092' title='Dana, John B.'>J.B. Dana Esqr</a> had<span class='line-break'> </span>proposed to the Trustees to take the plan of the<span class='line-break'> </span>farm recently purchased, which was made for him <span class='line-break'> </span>at an expense of more than ten dollars by <a href='/pages/subjects/62101' title='Mason, W. A.'>W.A. Mason</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Surveyor -, and that the trustees should pay that sum to<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a> for services rendered by said <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span>to said <a href='/pages/subjects/62092' title='Dana, John B.'>Dana</a> in drawing deeds &amp;c of the premises.</p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That the Plan be received and that <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Mr Parker</a><span class='line-break'> </span>^<sup>said</sup> bill of ten dollars against <a href='/pages/subjects/62092' title='Dana, John B.'>Mr J.B. Dana</a> be paid by this<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation. [NB. This Plan is recorded in Middlesex Registry]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Grade of Coolidge. Avenue. '> Grade of <a href='/pages/subjects/62104' title='Coolidge Avenue'>Coolidge. Avenue</a>. </span></p>
<p>A communication from the Chairman of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee of City Council of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a> on the</p>

<div class="page-content">
<p>275</p>
<p>subject of that City's Cemetery was read. It requested<span class='line-break'> </span>leave to change the grade of <a href='/pages/subjects/62104' title='Coolidge Avenue'>Coolidge Avenue</a> to<span class='line-break'> </span>improve the access to that Cemetery;</p>
<p>Voted. That said application be referred to <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Bangs</a>, as a committee of one with full powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Story Statue. '> <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>Story Statue</a>. </span></p>
<p>A letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/53238' title='Story, William W.'>W. W. Story Esqr</a>, in relation to the<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>statue of Judge Story</a>, his father, addressed to <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P.<span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis Esqr.</a> was read and referred to <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trees in the Cemetery. '> Trees in the Cemetery. </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> stated that during a recent tour<span class='line-break'> </span>he had visited most of the celebrated cemeteries in<span class='line-break'> </span>this country, many of which were far superior to<span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn ^ <sup>in this respect</sup> viz; that in Mt. Auburn, the origi<span class='line-break'></span>nal forest has, since the Cemetery was opened, be<span class='line-break'></span>come so dense as to prevent or impede vegeta<span class='line-break'></span>tion, injure monuments, prevent many of<span class='line-break'> </span>them from being seen to advantage, and the<span class='line-break'> </span>like. In other cemeteries trees are kept trimmed<span class='line-break'> </span>high, and not allowed to grow so near to<span class='line-break'> </span>each other, and proper vistas are opened.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Committee to trim &amp; remove Trees '> Committee to trim &amp; remove Trees </span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> with Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a>, be a special committee of three on<span class='line-break'> </span>trimming the trees at the Cemetery, with full<span class='line-break'> </span>powers to act in the premises, and to cause<span class='line-break'> </span>such of the trees to be removed as they shall<span class='line-break'> </span>think fit.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Watering Streets '> Watering Streets </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62105' title='Ross, Mr.'>Mr Ross</a> petition on the subject of watering the<span class='line-break'> </span>street near Mt Auburn was referred to <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Mr Bangs</a><span class='line-break'> </span>as a Committee of one with full powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Extension of Indian Ridge Path asked for '> Extension of <a href='/pages/subjects/54338' title='Indian Ridge Path'>Indian Ridge Path</a> asked for </span></p>
<p>A petition of sundry proprietors in relation<span class='line-break'> </span>to a proposed way from <a href='/pages/subjects/60336' title='Willow Avenue'>Willow Avenue</a> to<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>

<div class="page-content">
<p>276</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54338' title='Indian Ridge Path'>Indian Ridge Path</a>, (and in favor it,) was referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>and Little,</a> with instructions to ex<span class='line-break'></span>amine and report what ought to be done on the <span class='line-break'> </span>subject.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' H.M. Hayes&apos; Legacy. '> <a href='/pages/subjects/62106' title='Hayes, Hercules M.'>H.M. Hayes'</a> Legacy. </span></p>
<p>A letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/62107' title='Watts, P. V.'>P.V. Watts</a> Ex'or with a copy of a <span class='line-break'> </span>clause from the will of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/62106' title='Hayes, Hercules M.'>Hercules M. Hayes</a><span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York</a> giving one thousand dollars to this<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation on certain trusts was referred to <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis<span class='line-break'> </span>Esquire</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Lot 1714. Representative of. '> <a href='/pages/subjects/62108' title='Lot 1714'>Lot 1714</a>. Representative of. </span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That in accordance with the application<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/62109' title='How, Isaac W.'>Isaac W. How</a> on behalf of the heirs of the late<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62110' title='How, Eliza P.'>Eliza P. How</a>, deceased, proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/62108' title='Lot 1714'>lot no. 1714</a><span class='line-break'> </span>on <a href='/pages/subjects/57829' title='Snowdrop Path'>Snow drop path</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/62112' title='How, Hall J.'>Hall J. How</a> be designated to<span class='line-break'> </span>for the time being to represent - said lot and vote<span class='line-break'> </span>at the meetings of this Corporation, receiving a ticket<span class='line-break'> </span>of admission in that capacity until the further ac<span class='line-break'></span>tion of this board.</p>
<p>Adjourned without day.<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. August 7. 1854 '> Trustees. <date when='1854-08-07'>August 7. 1854</date> </span></p>
<p>At the regular monthly meeting holden <date when='1854-08-07'>August 7. 1854</date> there<span class='line-break'> </span>were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>Kuhn</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Parker</a>.</p>
<p>The Record of the last meeting was read and ap<span class='line-break'></span>proved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Story Statue. '> <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>Story Statue</a>. </span></p>
<p>The following letter form <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esqr</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/53238' title='Story, William W.'>W.W.<span class='line-break'> </span>Story</a> on the subject of the <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>Story Statue</a> was read and ordered<span class='line-break'> </span>to be recorded [See below <sub> p. 279. </sub>]. It was also <ins> Voted </ins> That <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the Presi<span class='line-break'></span>dent</a> be requested to correspond with <a href='/pages/subjects/53238' title='Story, William W.'>Mr Story</a> on the sub-</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1062271">
<h3><a name="page-1062271">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 277)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>277</p>
<p>ject of a pedestal for the <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'><!--Story-->Statue</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Coolidge Avenue. graded. '> <a href='/pages/subjects/62104' title='Coolidge Avenue'>Coolidge Avenue</a>. graded. </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Mr Bangs</a> from the Committee on the petition<span class='line-break'> </span>of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>City of Cambridge</a> as to the grading of <a href='/pages/subjects/62104' title='Coolidge Avenue'>"Coolidge<span class='line-break'> </span>Avenue"</a> (so called) reported verbally, that the change<span class='line-break'> </span>requested had been made under his direction, but<span class='line-break'> </span>further changes were desired on the Avenue nearer<span class='line-break'> </span>to the main road, all of which could be made<span class='line-break'> </span>by persons interested without charge to this Corporation.<span class='line-break'> </span>Thereupon <b>Voted.</b> That this Corporation will permit the<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>City of Cambridge</a> to further grade the road between<span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>Cemetery fence</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/60716' title='Coolidge, Mr. [landowner]'>Mr Coolidge's</a> line, <sup>the work to be</sup> subject<span class='line-break'> </span>to the approval of <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Mr Bangs</a> as a Committee.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Watering Streets. allowance for. '> Watering Streets. allowance for. </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Mr Bangs</a> also reported verbally in refer<span class='line-break'></span>ence to <a href='/pages/subjects/62105' title='Ross, Mr.'>Mr Ross</a> petition for an allowance for water<span class='line-break'></span>ing the street near the Cemetery, which report was<span class='line-break'> </span>discussed and it was finally <b>Voted.</b>That <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Bangs</a> be instructed to pay ten dollars on be<span class='line-break'></span>half of this Corporation for said purpose for<span class='line-break'> </span>the present year.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Messrs Little</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a> from a Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on the subject, reported in writing as follows.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Indian Ridge Path and Willow Avenue.'><a href='/pages/subjects/54338' title='Indian Ridge Path'>Indian Ridge Path</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/60336' title='Willow Avenue'>Willow Avenue</a>.</span></p>
<p>"The committee appointed to consider and<span class='line-break'> </span>report upon the petition of <a href='/pages/subjects/62114' title='Dennis, W. W.'>W.W. Dennis</a> and others<span class='line-break'> </span>that a carriage way be opened across <a href='/pages/subjects/54338' title='Indian Ridge Path'>Indian Ridge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Path to connect <a href='/pages/subjects/60336' title='Willow Avenue'>Willow</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/61222' title='Lime Avenue'>Lime Avenue</a>, have<span class='line-break'> </span>attended to that duty and report the impracticability<span class='line-break'> </span>of complying with the prayer of the petitioners in con<span class='line-break'></span>sequence of the laying out of the grounds in that<span class='line-break'> </span>vicinity leaving only space for a six foot path. that<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61249' title='Osier Path'>Osier Path</a>, already graded from <a href='/pages/subjects/60336' title='Willow Avenue'>Willow</a> to Indian</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062272">
<h3><a name="page-1062272">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 278)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>278</p>
<p>Ridge be immediately graded to <a href='/pages/subjects/61222' title='Lime Avenue'>Lime<!--Ave--></a>, this par<span class='line-break'></span>tially complying with the prayer of the petitioners<span class='line-break'> </span>and that in laying out lots in future on the<span class='line-break'> </span>East side of <a href='/pages/subjects/54338' title='Indian Ridge Path'>Indian Ridge</a> reference should<span class='line-break'> </span>be had to an avenue to be laid out to<span class='line-break'> </span>connect with <a href='/pages/subjects/60336' title='Willow Avenue'>Willow<!--Ave--></a> commencing at some point<span class='line-break'> </span>East of <a href='/pages/subjects/25006758' title='Spurzheim, Johann Gaspar'>Spurzheim monument</a>."</p>
<p>Which report was accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Insurance. '> Insurance. </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Mr Little</a> reported verbally, that he had pro<span class='line-break'></span>vided for the Continuance of the existing insurance<span class='line-break'> </span>on the house recently purchased of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54337' title='Stone, Mr.'>Stone family</a>;<span class='line-break'> </span>and that no action was necessary as to the occupancy<span class='line-break'> </span>of said house during the present year. On <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Mr Little's</a><span class='line-break'> </span>motion it was Voted. That <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to sign such deposit note as may be necessary to<span class='line-break'> </span>complete the transfer of such insurance policy.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Avenues in New Purchase '> Avenues in New Purchase </span></p>
<p>The Committee on the purchase of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>Stone<span class='line-break'> </span>farm</a> were authorized to make or cause to be made<span class='line-break'> </span>a plan for laying out the main avenues through<span class='line-break'> </span>said land, Said Committee consists of Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Purchase of other lands '> Purchase of other lands </span></p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Parker</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a> were appointed<span class='line-break'> </span>a Committee on the subject of purchasing lands lying next<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Cemetery on the Westerly side to report at the next<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Statuary for Chapel '> Statuary for <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> made a report on the subject of<span class='line-break'> </span>the purchasing Statuary to be placed in the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> and it<span class='line-break'> </span>was <ins> moved</ins>. That the sum of fifteen thousand dollars<span class='line-break'> </span>be appropriated for the purchase of three marble statues<span class='line-break'> </span>to be prepared and executed under contracts to be made<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062273">
<h3><a name="page-1062273">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 279)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>279</p>
<p>with proper artists, said statues to be those of persons dis<span class='line-break'></span>tinguished in American History.</p>
<p>After some discussion this subject was specially <span class='line-break'> </span>assigned for action at the next meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Lot 417. '> <a href='/pages/subjects/62117' title='Lot 417'>Lot 417</a>. </span></p>
<p>A letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/62120' title='Curtis, George'>Mr <!--George-->Curtis</a> on the subject for a contract<span class='line-break'> </span>for the perpetual repair of <a href='/pages/subjects/62117' title='Lot 417'>lot no. 417</a> - belonging to <a href='/pages/subjects/62118' title='Fearing, W. J.'>W. J<span class='line-break'> </span>Fearing</a> was read and referred to the Committee on lots</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' T.J. Lee&apos;s Petition '> <a href='/pages/subjects/62119' title='Lee, Thomas J.'>T.J. Lee's</a> Petition </span></p>
<p>A letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/62119' title='Lee, Thomas J.'>Thos. J. Lee</a> on the subject of the<span class='line-break'> </span>price of lots. Spoken for last year, was referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots with full powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Lilac Path '> <a href='/pages/subjects/61220' title='Lilac Path'>Lilac Path</a> </span></p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a> were appointed a Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee of two with full powers to make a change in<span class='line-break'> </span>the location of <a href='/pages/subjects/61220' title='Lilac Path'>Lilac Path</a></p>
<p>Adjourned without day - <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' LETTER. C.P. Curtis to W W. Story. '> LETTER. <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/53238' title='Story, William W.'>W W. Story</a>. </span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' -- Copy of letter -- '> -- Copy of letter -- </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53238' title='Story, William W.'>W.W. Story Esqr</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54374' title='Paris, France'>Paris</a>. <span class='line-break'> </span>Dear Sir -</p>
<p>I have your<span class='line-break'> </span>letter of <date when='1854-05-25'>May 25</date> &amp; have communicated it to the Trustees of Mt<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn. They are pleased to learn that your <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>statue of Mr Justice Story</a><span class='line-break'> </span>is so nearly finished. By the tenor of your and their contract of<span class='line-break'> </span>Oct. 1851. the statue is to be delivered at the door of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a><span class='line-break'> </span>in 3 years from <date when='1851-10-01'>1 Oct 1851</date> -- I am instructed to mention this<span class='line-break'> </span>inasmuch as you state the hope that you may find a vessel<span class='line-break'> </span>[so?] that the statue may arrive in <ins> <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> </ins> in <ins> November </ins><span class='line-break'> </span>next. In regard to a pedestal the Trustees desire me<span class='line-break'> </span>to thank you for your offer to procure one -- but they will<span class='line-break'> </span>attend to it themselves. The President thinks a suitable<span class='line-break'> </span>pedestal can be made here as reasonably as in Italy.</p>
<p>I beg you to present my respects to <a href='/pages/subjects/60657' title='Story, Sarah'>Mrs Story</a> and to<span class='line-break'> </span>believe yours faithfully? -- <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1854-07-11'>July 11. 1854</date>.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062274">
<h3><a name="page-1062274">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 280)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>280</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. Septr 4. 1854 '> Trustees. <date when='1854-09-04'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 4. 1854</date> </span></p>
<p>At the regular monthly meeting holden <date when='1854-09-04'>September 4. 1854</date><span class='line-break'> </span>there were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Crockett</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>and Read.</a></p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' T J Lee&apos;s Petition. '> <a href='/pages/subjects/62119' title='Lee, Thomas J.'>T J Lee's</a> Petition. </span></p>
<p>The Committee on the petition of <a href='/pages/subjects/62119' title='Lee, Thomas J.'>Thos. J Lee</a>, presented<span class='line-break'> </span>at the last meeting, reported in writing that they had granted<span class='line-break'> </span>the prayer of the petition. Report accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Lot 417. '> <a href='/pages/subjects/62117' title='Lot 417'>Lot 417</a>. </span></p>
<p>The Committee, to whom was referred the letter of <a href='/pages/subjects/62120' title='Curtis, George'>George<span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a> on behalf of the heirs of <a href='/pages/subjects/62118' title='Fearing, W. J.'>W. J. Fearing</a> as to the perpetu<span class='line-break'></span>al repair of <a href='/pages/subjects/62117' title='Lot 417'>lot no 417</a>. reported in writing "that in<span class='line-break'> </span>their opinion it will be expedient to undertake the<span class='line-break'> </span>care of said lot, if now closed and no further inter<span class='line-break'></span>ments made therein, for the sum of three hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars." Report accepted, and Voted that this<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation will contract on those terms to keep the<span class='line-break'> </span>lot in perpetual repair.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Purchase of more land. '> Purchase of more land. </span></p>
<p>The Committee appointed to consider the subject<span class='line-break'> </span>of the purchase of more land adjoining the Cemetery on the<span class='line-break'> </span>West, reported in writing that they were unanimously of<span class='line-break'> </span>opinion that it was inexpedient to make the purchase.<span class='line-break'> </span>The Report was accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Lawn Avenue '> <a href='/pages/subjects/55287' title='Lawn Avenue'>Lawn Avenue</a> </span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That the new avenue in the rear of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a><span class='line-break'> </span>be called <a href='/pages/subjects/55287' title='Lawn Avenue'>Lawn Avenue</a>, and that the land thereabouts<span class='line-break'> </span>be laid out as per plan by <a href='/pages/subjects/56692' title='Wadsworth, Alexander'>Mr Wadsworth</a> now presented<span class='line-break'> </span>to the trustees.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Tombs construction  of '> Tombs construction  of </span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That no tomb shall hereafter be constructed in<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery, in which the door, or any part of it, or<span class='line-break'> </span>any part of the structure shall be less than two feet below<span class='line-break'> </span>the surface of the earth.; and all tombs built shall be sub<span class='line-break'> </span>ject to the provisions of the vote passed <date when='1854-03-07'>March 7. 1854</date>. p. 263.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062275">
<h3><a name="page-1062275">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 281)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>281</p>
<p>and shall be in all parts covered with earth to the depth at<span class='line-break'> </span>least of two feet.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Proposed Sale to J Richardson '> Proposed Sale to <a href='/pages/subjects/60332' title='Richardson, Jeffrey'>J Richardson</a> </span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That in conformity with the request of <a href='/pages/subjects/60332' title='Richardson, Jeffrey'>Jeffrey Rich<span class='line-break'></span>ardson</a> and friends, this Corporation will sell to them five<span class='line-break'> </span>to seven lots on or near <a href='/pages/subjects/55287' title='Lawn Avenue'>Lawn Avenue</a> at the rate<span class='line-break'> </span>of two hundred and fifty dollars for the same number of<span class='line-break'> </span>feet if the privilege of constructing tombs therein be granted.<span class='line-break'> </span>Such privilege may be granted to them subject to the<span class='line-break'> </span>terms of the last vote and the one therein referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>as passed <date when='1854-3-07'>March 7. 1854</date> [p. 263.] and to the approval of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on lots as therein provided.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Statuary in Chapel. '> Statuary in <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>. </span></p>
<p>The motion made at the last meeting on the subject<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Statuary for the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> was taken up and discussed<span class='line-break'> </span>and finally it was Voted. That the sum of the fifteen thous<span class='line-break'></span>and dollars be appropriated for the purchase of three<span class='line-break'> </span>marble statues, to be prepared and executed under<span class='line-break'> </span>contracts to be made with proper artists; said statues<span class='line-break'> </span>to be those of persons distinguished in American<span class='line-break'> </span>History. But this vote is subject to the following<span class='line-break'> </span>conditions viz: <ins> first, </ins> that it shall be approved in writing<span class='line-break'> </span>by five at least of this board of trustees; and <ins> second, </ins>,<span class='line-break'> </span>that the professional opinions of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis Esqr</a> and the<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary, on the subject of the legality of this appropriation<span class='line-break'> </span>by this board, shall be taken in writing and found<span class='line-break'> </span>to sustain the legality of such appropriation.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Mr Crockett</a> requested that his name should be<span class='line-break'> </span>recorded as given against the passage of the last note.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Iron Settees&apos; '> Iron Settees' </span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That the payment of the sum of one<span class='line-break'> </span>and ninety five dollars for iron settees, purchased</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062276">
<h3><a name="page-1062276">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 282)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>282</p>
<p>by <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> and placed in the Cemetery be approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Lot 376. '> <a href='/pages/subjects/62123' title='Lot 376'>Lot 376</a>. </span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/58383' title='Crockett, George W.'>Mr Crockett</a> be a committee of one to<span class='line-break'> </span>confer with <a href='/pages/subjects/60944' title='Pierce, Mr.'>Mr Pierce</a> about the condition of a tomb<span class='line-break'> </span>on <a href='/pages/subjects/62123' title='Lot 376'>lot no 376</a>. near <a href='/pages/subjects/57671' title='Forest Pond'>Forest Pond</a>, owned by said <a href='/pages/subjects/60944' title='Pierce, Mr.'>Pierce</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Pyrola Path Bellwort Path'><a href='/pages/subjects/60005' title='Pyrola Path'>Pyrola Path</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/61130' title='Bellwort Path'>Bellwort Path</a></span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Mr Bangs</a>. <ins>Voted.</ins> That a committee of<span class='line-break'> </span>three be appointed with authority to extend <a href='/pages/subjects/60005' title='Pyrola Path'>Pyrola<span class='line-break'> </span>Path</a> from <a href='/pages/subjects/61244' title='Orange Path'>Orange<!--Path--></a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/60001' title='Walnut Avenue'>Walnut Avenue</a>; also <a href='/pages/subjects/61130' title='Bellwort Path'>Bellwort<span class='line-break'> </span>Path</a> from <a href='/pages/subjects/61244' title='Orange Path'>Orange<!--Path--></a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/60001' title='Walnut Avenue'>Walnut Avenue</a>.</p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> were appointed to<span class='line-break'> </span>constitute said committee.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Well near Yarrow Path '> Well near <a href='/pages/subjects/61304' title='Yarrow Path'>Yarrow Path</a> </span></p>
<p><b>Also Voted.</b> That the same committee consider the<span class='line-break'> </span>expediency of constructing a well with a pump on <a href='/pages/subjects/59904' title='Spruce Avenue'>Spruce<span class='line-break'> </span>Avenue</a> near where <a href='/pages/subjects/61304' title='Yarrow Path'>Yarrow Path</a> intersects it.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Privies near Gate '> Privies near Gate </span></p>
<p><b>Also Voted.</b> That the same committee consider<span class='line-break'> </span>the expediency of erecting privies near <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->the Gate</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Side Gate. '> Side Gate. </span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Mr Bangs</a> be a committee of one<span class='line-break'> </span>with power to take such steps as he shall see fit<span class='line-break'> </span>to prevent improper entrances into the Cemetery at the<span class='line-break'> </span>side gate.</p>
<p>Adjourned. A true record.<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. Oct . 2. 1854. '> Trustees. <date when='1854-10-02'>Oct . 2. 1854</date>. </span></p>
<p>At the regular monthly meeting of the Trustees holden <date when='1854-10-02'>October 2. 1854</date><span class='line-break'> </span>there were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>, Little and</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span><small>The Secretary being absent, and engaged in court. <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>G. W. Bond</a> was chosen Secretary <ins> pro tem. </ins></small></p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Statuary '> Statuary </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'><!--Paker-->the Secretary</a> presented to the board their opinion that the Trus<span class='line-break'></span>tees are lawfully authorized to appropriate monies for the purchase of comemora<span class='line-break'></span>tive statues for the embellishment of the Cemetery, whereupon it was voted<span class='line-break'> </span>that the same be entered at length in the records of the Board.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> communicated to the trustees a letter to himself from</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062277">
<h3><a name="page-1062277">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 283)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>283</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Story Statue. '> <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>Story Statue</a>. </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53238' title='Story, William W.'>W.W. Story Esqr</a> on the subject of his <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>statue of Mr Justice Story</a> which<span class='line-break'> </span>is stated to be ready for shipment. It was then <b>Voted.</b> that <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> be<span class='line-break'> </span>a committee with full powers to agree with <a href='/pages/subjects/53238' title='Story, William W.'>Mr Story</a> as to extending the time<span class='line-break'> </span>of the importation of said statue and also as to the disposition of it on its<span class='line-break'> </span>arrival for public exhibition, provided that the final acceptance of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Statue be reserved to the Trustees.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Lawn Avenue. '> <a href='/pages/subjects/55287' title='Lawn Avenue'>Lawn Avenue</a>. </span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That the recorded vote of the last meeting in relation to<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/55287' title='Lawn Avenue'>Lawn Avenue</a> be amended by striking out the words "to them five to<span class='line-break'> </span>seven" <del> lots </del> so that the authority may be given thereby to sell all lots<span class='line-break'> </span>on or near <a href='/pages/subjects/55287' title='Lawn Avenue'>Lawn avenue</a>, at the rates mentioned in that vote.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Pyrola Path. '> <a href='/pages/subjects/60005' title='Pyrola Path'>Pyrola Path</a>. </span></p>
<p>The Committee on extending <a href='/pages/subjects/60005' title='Pyrola Path'>Pyrola Path</a>, - reported that it was<span class='line-break'> </span>expedient; - and in favor of the extension. Accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Well near Yarrow Path '> Well near <a href='/pages/subjects/61304' title='Yarrow Path'>Yarrow Path</a> </span></p>
<p>The Committee on the proposed well &amp;c. on <a href='/pages/subjects/59904' title='Spruce Avenue'>Spruce Avenue</a>, near<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61304' title='Yarrow Path'>Yarrow Path</a>, reported that it was expedient, and that the Corpora<span class='line-break'></span>tion will subscribe twenty five dollars, if lot owners will subscribe<span class='line-break'> </span>the rest of the requisite sum for this purpose. - Report accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and vote passed in conformity therewith</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Privies near Gate. '> Privies near Gate. </span></p>
<p>The same Committee, to whom the subject was referred, also<span class='line-break'> </span>reported that it was inexpedient to erect privies near <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->the Gate</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Nuisances in the grounds. '> Nuisances in the grounds. </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Mr Bangs</a> was appointed a Committee to have all nuisan<span class='line-break'></span>ces removed forthwith at the expense of the Corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Stone Farm. '> <a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>Stone Farm</a>. </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Messrs Little</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a> were appointed a Committee to<span class='line-break'> </span>decide what shall be done with the <a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>Stone Farm</a> to report at<span class='line-break'> </span>a future meeting</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Assistant Superintendent '> Assistant Superintendent </span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Mr Bangs</a> be a committee of one to confer<span class='line-break'> </span>with <a href='/pages/subjects/58929' title='Howe, Rufus'>Mr Howe</a> on the propriety of appointing an assistant to the<span class='line-break'> </span>superintendent, and to report to this Board.</p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That when this meeting adjourns it shall be<span class='line-break'> </span>to meet at this place on this day week at 12 M.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Fountain Path '> <a href='/pages/subjects/57847' title='Fountain Path'>Fountain Path</a> </span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That a new path be made around Meadow<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1062278">
<h3><a name="page-1062278">Trustees Records, Vol. 1, 1835 (page 284)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>284</p>
<p>Pond to be called <a href='/pages/subjects/57847' title='Fountain Path'>Fountain Path</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Paving. '> Paving. </span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> be a committee to cause the<span class='line-break'> </span>avenues on <a href='/pages/subjects/61236' title='Mountain Avenue'>Mountain Avenue</a> and between that and<span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>tower</a> to be paved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Ornamental Shrubs. '> Ornamental Shrubs. </span></p>
<p><b>Voted.</b> That <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> be a committee with<span class='line-break'> </span>authority to expend a sum not exceeding three hun<span class='line-break'></span>dred dollars for the introduction of ornamental shrubs<span class='line-break'> </span>into Mount Auburn.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Statuary '> Statuary </span></p>
<p>The vote passed at the last meeting on the<span class='line-break'> </span>subject of statuary received the approval of certain<span class='line-break'> </span>trustees in writing as follows. "On the above named<span class='line-break'> </span>conditions, the subscribers trustees of Mount Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery, approve the appropriation of fifteen<span class='line-break'> </span>thousand dollars as above specified, for the above<span class='line-break'> </span>named objects." (Signed) <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James<span class='line-break'> </span>Read</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Isaiah Bangs</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B.A. Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P.<span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Charles C. Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54775' title='Kuhn, George H.'>George H. Kuhn</a> -- <span class='line-break'> </span>Seven in all - The foregoing certificate was an<span class='line-break'></span>nexed to a certified copy of the vote.</p>
<p>Adjourned. A true record Attest<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a> Secretary Pro. tem.</p>
<p>A true record ex relative <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>G. W. Bond</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Henry M. Parker</a>. Secretary.</p>
</div>
